description:
Absolutely the best place for fresh, fast, and delicious food in the area.  I honestly have to stop myself from grabbing something whenever I walk by, it's that good.

Firstly, you must try the frozen Greek yogurt with olive oil and flaky sea salt.  The yogurt is thick and creamy, but doesn't leave you feeling heavy, as it's yogurt.  It's got a slight tang to it, but not as much as traditional frozen yogurt.  The olive oil and salt beautifully complement the frozen yogurt, and it's a fresh, delightful combination.  What I also appreciate is that they give you enough olive oil and sea salt so that every bite has a bit of each.  I've never tried any of their other flavors of frozen yogurt, but honestly I don't need to as this one is so good.

The rest of the menu is also delicious!  I always get either the chicken or pork salad.  They're really fresh, wonderfully flavored, and will leave you feeling very satiated because they're full of so many good mix-ins.  If you've got a bigger party, you can also order one of their full rotisserie chickens, which you see roasting at the back of the restaurant and are really juicy.

Even though there's usually a line outside, it goes quickly.  I've never waited more than ~10 minutes to order, and the food usually comes out just as fast.  I've always gotten food to go, so I'm not sure how difficult it is to find seating, as the place isn't too large.  But there's a big plaza right down the block, so you shouldn't have too much of an issue finding a place nearby.  Definitely come to Souvla if you're in the area.  The food is so delicious and fresh and everything's reasonably priced.  Make sure to get the frozen Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt!
author: Kelsey P.

description:
The pork sandwich was surprisingly delicious! I generally expect greek sandwiches to all taste the same but this one was very flavorful and the pork was well cooked and  tender. Would definitely recommend this.

The line gets long and its hard to find a seat but its easy to do take-out and eat on a bench at the park nearby.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Out of all the Mediterranean restaurants I've been to, I think I enjoy the bowls of Souvla the most! Given your choice of protein, the diced meat is served on a bed of delicious kale lightly marinated in olive oil. The bowl is bursting with flavor, from the onions, feta cheese crumbles, and hearty cherry tomatoes. Sometimes, Mediterranean cuisine can be too oily, but Souvla's dishes are light and filling! The meat is actually cooked in front of you in an oven! I could tell that the owners went for the "contemporary kitchen" layout, featuring light wood shelving, minimalist décor, and small pots of plants. Overall, there is a clean, modern look to the restaurant, making it a trendy place to eat. 

Unfortunately, I would not recommend the iced tea. It comes in a bottle, tastes like artificial tea with preservatives, and is quite pricey. Along with that, the other drawback would be the small, cramped space that leads to competitive seating. It will definitely be tricky to fit a big group here... This is not a comfortable "sit and dine" restaurant, since there are basically only bar counter top seating and other high table seats on hard, metallic seats. Even though there are some benches in the park nearby to eat, I think the restaurant could make more efforts incentivizing people to take their time in the restaurant, socialize with friends, and have some drinks over good food. Also, there are not a lot of options on the menu, so Souvla would not be a stop for those cosmopolitan foodies searching for exquisite, complex food.
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
Souvla is an upgraded fast food Greek restaurant. They offer either a wrap or salad with your choice of meat. They have a few sides like fries and a Greek frozen yogurt. 

I normally get the pita wrap, but this time I got the salad. It was nicely dressed and came with a good portion of meat. For $15 it was a decent deal. The meats are slow cooked but could be more tender. You won't find your typical ground spit gyro meat here. 

They get busy at night and on the weekend, so be prepared to take it to go. Large groups or families are not advised.
author: Alan H.

description:
SOUvLa, you are the SOUL and very definition of San Francisco Greek-American casual comfort fare, and you never fail to disappoint. You are consistent and reliable - the constant in the sometimes hectic SF city life.  One of the remarkable places that sway me to say YES to haYES valley meet ups with friends on the weekend - when I'd rather be a couch potato and see what's new on uber eats. 

Things I like about Souvla -

(1) Keeping things simple, and in doing so delivering high quality at no sacrifice to efficiency.  I like that the menu is simple.  

Four proteins. Chicken. Lamb. Pork. Veg. 

Two styles. Wrap or salad. 

And honestly, you can't go wrong with any combination. My favorites? Chicken salad and Veg wrap. 

(A) The Chicken Salad: Rarely do I eat salads, but love that this salad does not seem to be a salad, rather a more complex meal. It is not overly drenched in sauce, but a flavor burst of thoughtful ingredients - the herby fennel, with the citrus bust from naval orange, and the tartness of the pickled red onion, which complements the creamy feta cheese - all carefully tossed in "granch" dressing. 

(B) The Vegetable Wrap: I love the warm pita bread hugging the roasted white sweet potato like a comforting blanket around a most delicate angel skinned white potato baby, drizzled with garlic yogurt, sprinkled with the savory kalamanta olive, with the nutty aroma and crunch from the roasted walnut, on top which the pickled red onion, crisp pea shoots and mizithra cheese sit so delicately. 

(C) Juicy Potatoes and Greek Fries: I love the potato sides at Souvla, whether roasted or fried. It always compliments the main dish so well - and is fun to share. The juicy potatoes are so moist and tender - picking up the beautiful juices of the rotisserie drippings and oregano. The Greek fries are cooked to a perfect crisp, with every bite flavored with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley and mizithra cheese. Yum. 

(2) But my absolute favorite part? The creamy, rich Greek yogurt soft serve. 

I absolutely love the glorious Baklava Crumbles and honey syrup Greek yogurt. It is essentially a deconstructed warm, just out-of-the over baklava sitting on top creamy Greek soft serve yogurt that is rich and buttery to a fault. All drizzled in honey syrup to add that sticky honeyed element. It is hands down my favorite Greek frozen yogurt in the city. 

Souvla, I am souvlucky to have you in my life!
author: Vivienne K.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to get a salad in SF! They dress it really well and there are different meat options to choose from. The Chicken is probably my favorite out of the three, but the Pork and Lamb are also really good! They also have a Vegetarian option. 

All the meats are spit-fired and go really nice with the dressings and toppings, but sometimes there are pieces of meat that are dry and over cooked. I don't always get the Greek Fries but they are a great side to share! I recommend getting one of the sauces with the fries, I like the Garlic Sauce. 

The portion sizes here are great but if you have room after your salad or sandwich/wrap, they have great Frozen Greek Yogurt. I've had the one with Baklava Crumbles and Honey and it was really good, not too sweet with just the right amount of tartness!
author: Michael L.

description:
This review is just for the baklava soft serve! I saw chef Melissa King post this on her Instagram and I knew I had to try it. And holy smokes, was it delicious! The frozen Greek yogurt was still a little too sweet for my liking but it was tart enough to contrast the sticky sweetness of the baklava bits. I wish the baklava crumbles had a higher nut to pastry ratio but it was still yummmmmyyyyy!

All in all, an interesting concept that is pretty well-executed. There are a couple minor things they could improve on (see above), but it's definitely well worth a try!
author: Samantha O.

description:
if there was a Souvla close to where I go to school I would literally eat there every day until my loans tell me otherwise. I have not had a pita wrap with such a unique, fresh, flavorful chicken filling in it EVER. The citrus pairing with the oils and the chicken is a genius combo so props to the sous chef! The meat is SO moist. It's hard to do a chicken pita wrap well unless you douse it with some creamy sauce. There was a slight drizzle of a yogurt based sauce on the wrap but the natural flavors of all the ingredients in the wrap shone through. The side salad is simple and fresh and great if you're looking for a healthier option but honestly the wrap is a 10/10 health wise if you're not training to be a bikini model. 

The place is worth the lunch line and the hype! Interior is super cute too--white and beach blue themed, just like Santorini. They even serve coffee in Greek cups. Authenticity with a modern twist, just to be adored. I would love to return to try the other menu items!!!
author: Shirley S.

description:
I love Souvla and their salads. Whenever I'm craving a salad, Souvla is my go to. I got here about 45 minutes before closing time and it was surprising still packed. The menu is super simple and opted for the chicken salad and the pork shoulder salad. Note: you can also get these options in a sandwich form too (it's a little cheaper, but the salad is a lot less messier to eat)

Both salads came out super quick. The chicken salad never disappoints me! The chicken is flavorful and juicy af and goes well with the rest of the salad ingredients. Favorite part is definitely the mandarin oranges! The pork shoulder salad was really good too, although I did find a pork a little on the dry side .. don't think I would get the pork shoulder salad again though. 

Highly recommend Souvla if you're in the area and want something light to eat.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
I think this may be 3 stars more because of all the hype and it was a bit of a disappointment. If I hadn't been expecting angels singing and unicorns grazing it may have been better. Don't get me wrong, the food is good. It's fresh, made with care and pretty tasty, but it wasn't as over the top as I was expecting.

The side salad was nice, fresh, very healthy and well dressed. Roasted potatoes in chicken fat were luxurious and well cooked. The lamb souvlaki pita was just ok. Not much flavor, but it was fresh. Wished it was also a bit bigger with more meat. It's a great space, fits the fast casual moniker, but I wouldn't line up for 30 minutes to eat here like the lines sometimes are on the weekends.
author: David L.

description:
Souvla knows how to do fast-casual dining right! You will be a-d-d-i-c-t-e-d to their rotisserie roast chicken. Mix that in with some greens, radish, onions, oranges, and a sprinkle of cheese, and top everything some a lite yogurt dressing...boom! A delicious salad that doesn't leave you unfulfilled and sad.

The plain frozen yogurt, in my humble opinion, is to die for. Seriously. Just enough tartness and just enough sweetness for you to crave it again and again. I'm not a toppings person, but I'm sure the other options taste just as amazing. I'm writing this as I'm licking my yogurt spoon clean. YUM.
author: Claire W.

description:
Finally made it out to one of the locations after hearing so many good things. Came here on a Sunday night with 3 friends at about 8:30pm and it was still poppin'! We were able to snag a table as people were leaving. The food came out fast (~10 minutes) despite there being so many people. 

I ordered the veggie salad bowl ($13) that came with sweet potato. In retrospect, I probably should have gotten a meat on it because it felt like it was missing something, but the sweet potato chunks were huge and super tasty. However, the olives on the salad were waaay too salty and overpowered the rest of it. I also wished they added more veggies or filling into the salad such as tomatoes and cucumber. 

My friends all got wraps- one chicken, one pork, one lamb ($12 each). They all agreed that their meat was a bit dry, especially the lamb, but the sauce (yogurt based) helped to moisten it up. They said the pita was soft and the flavor of the sauce was not overwhelming. They put mandarin oranges in the chicken one, which was a great combo (maybe I'll try that one next time!).

We OF COURSE had to get the fro-yo after our meal. We got the baklava + honey, cretan wild flower honey, and by suggestion of the server- Greek Olive Oil + Sea Salt ($5 each). The baklava one was by far the best, the perfect amount of sweet paired with the sharp tangy-ness of the greek yogurt was perfect. I couldn't taste/see the honey syrup, but I didn't mind because the baklava was already sweet enough. I could honestly just eat the greek yogurt plain! The honey one was also good, but the Olive Oil and Sea Salt was the least favorite. Not sure how to explain it, but it tastes exactly how it sounds. There was just so much oil at the bottom of the cup and the overwhelming salt did not pair well with the greek yogurt for us. Love love love the greek yogurt, but would not recommend the olive oil +sea salt mix. 

I will definitely be back again!
author: April L.

description:
Souvla is a perfect definition of a hip restaurant in San Francisco. They have simple menu, service is quick, and food is AMAZING. 
To be fair, it is not authentic Greek food however you still get the craving fixed with a twist. 

Salad portion is huuuuge, and you get more dressing than a sandwich does. If you are a Foodie that likes extra sauces, I highly recommend for a salad bowl rather than a sandwich.
author: Jina C.

description:
Solid place for fast Greek pita sandwiches and salads with spit fired meats in a central location in Hayes Valley. The interior decor is quite appealing and has a lot of communal and bar seating. I would recommend coming a bit earlier to beat the rush.

You can choose from Pork (Snake River Farms Pork Shoulder), Chicken (Mary's Free Range Chicken), Lamb (Superior Farms Lamb Leg), and Veg (Roasted White Sweet Potato) as a sandwich or salad. Prices range from $12-15 depending on the combination you get. Given that it's Hayes Valley and the meat is delicious and fresh, the prices are reasonable. Apparently their Frozen Green Yogurt is pretty popular here too.

I've always gone with the Mary's Free Range Chicken Salad. The olive oil dressing is amazing. I always ask for the dressing on the side since they do seem to put in a lot.

Would highly recommend!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Souvla has been on my try list for a while, and I finally got a chance to go. I went with a dear friend and got there before the lunch crowd. You order at the front, get a number and seat yourself. I asked if I should order the Greek yogurt now or later and they told me now, I could always hand the cashier the receipt after our meal to get our Greek Yogurt. 

I ordered:

Chicken Sandwich (Mary's Free Ranch Chicken, "Granch" dressing, Fennel, Navel Orange, Pickled Red Onion, Pea Shoots, Mizithra Cheese: I really enjoyed my sandwich, there was a lot of shredded chicken and I loved the texture and flavors of the pickled red onion and navel orange with the chicken. I wish there was a little bit more Granch dressing - I should have poured some of the Granch dip I got with my fries in the sandwich.

Greek Fries with "Granch" Greek Yogurt: Fries were crispy and went well with the Granch dressing.

Greek yogurt with Baklava crumbles and honey sryup: WOW. I loved this. This is by far my favorite, the tangy yogurt and honey syrup went really well together. And the Baklava crumbles made this dessert even more delicious. 

A great place for a casual meal and good food. Highly recommended!
author: Nette T.

description:
Order first and pay at the front. They will bring the food to you afterwards.

I had the Mediterranean chicken sandwich, which I thought was decent. On the blander side even with hot sauce. Chicken was a bit too dry. Quick for grab and go. Nothing special tbh. 

This place has a good amount of seating, but difficult to find during Saturday for dinner. We ended up sitting outside, which was a bit chilly in the summer.
author: Edward W.

description:
Just thinking about what I'm gonna write is making me want to eat here again. Right now. Plus it's lunch break so this would be PERFECT. And it's also pretty hot over here so some Greek frozen yogurt would be the most perfect ending to my imaginary encore Souvla lunch. 

We came here for a late lunch and I am glad it was a little late because I'm sure at a prime hour, this place is hard to get a seat. Super cute space with seating outside and inside. The outside tables were already occupied but the inside was so cute so I was glad to sit on the tall tables with the high stools inside the restaurant. 

When we walked in, we were greeted by the owner and right away, my son spocks out the frozen greek yogurt machine. The owner was so nice, he gave my little monster a small sample which of course, being the ice cream-yogurt-soft serve-anything frozen dairy-monster that I am, I had to take a lick of that. I almost wanted to just order and eat that before actual lunch!

Luckily the menu is not very large which is good for me because I am probably the most indecisive person everrrrr. We decided on the chicken and the lamb dishes which were both delicious. I am not a lamb eater but this was hands down the best lamb dish I have ever eaten. The lamb was tender and soft and very tasty. It was served with harissa-spiked yogurt, cucumbers, radish, red onions, and feta cheese. The chicken was also good with a different type of dressing, fennel, orange, red onion, pea shoots, and a mizithra cheese. Different flavors but both DELICIOUS. Both were wrapped in delicious pita. We also ordered the greek fries which were yummy and tasty. 

Of course you know we HAD to get some of the REAL GREEK frozen yogurt for dessert. We had it with the baklava crumbles and ohhhhhh, you have to get this if you like baklava like I do. Don't get me wrong, this frozen yogurt tastes wonderful by itself. It was tart which is hands down my favorite yogurt flavor. Plus, it was REAL GREEK frozen yogurt so how can you go wrong?

If you love Greek food like I do, or just love frozen yogurt like I do, give this place a try if you're in the area!
author: Jen M.

description:
Came here for take out after having awful sushi around the corner. I got the chicken salad and my sister got the lamb sandwich. Both really yummy (well she said it was).

My only qualm is I found huge chicken bones in my salad... I didn't notice til biting down into one super hard which sucked. I'm glad the food is fresh but you guys need to be careful!!! If I would have swallowed it there'd be serious problems. 

But the food was good and fast and did the job.
author: Hayley G.

description:
Quite the popular place for all locations. Souvla can build up quite the line, but it moves reasonably quick. I usually grab the frozen yogurt with baclava if I want to get out quickly. The fries come out hot and crispy; if you're carrying it out, make sure to open the box so it doesn't get soggy. For the main entree, I got the chicken gyro and appreciated the navel oranges. Overall, it was tasty and light.

My friends are in love with the place, which I don't fully get lol.
author: James N.

description:
Amazing food but the service is going downhill so much that it's a dealbreaker. 

Souvla is one of a growing breed of restaurants that's trying to tackle the difficulty of hiring for the service industry (due to the high living costs in SF) by having an order at the counter and self service concept. They have runners but no servers. 

They'll bring your food out to you but you'll figure out things like water on your own. 

Which should make it great for delivery and I must go here at least a couple of times a week. 

The food is always really fresh and high quality. I love the chicken salad. The portion sizes always seem to vary a little bit, more meat in the evenings, but I love the speed of take out. 

Most recent experience was just rudeness. I normally check if my order is ready before I get the notification on my phone because they sometimes take a while to put it into Square. The woman looked at me when I asked if my order was ready and said you ordered 4 minutes ago like cmon. Definitely true but Souvla has been known to get orders ready in minutes during peak periods and hey, it was just a question.  

Waited a while longer and my order came out but they didn't record it in square and there was no one handling deliveries so I looked over to see if that order was mine or if I should walk around and come back, the guy manning the counter came over immediately and gave me a hard time saying dude you don't do that. What? Order here every week, expecting to pick up my order while it's still fresh? Or hope that the fact it's actually ready will be recorded in Square properly so I don't have to check at the counter when I come in if it is. 

Souvla I love your 5 star food but your 0 star service means it's not going to work out. See ya
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Just ok. The salad is the best option as the sandwich was dry and they charge for extra sauce. But what really gets me is that the environment is not inviting and service needs to learn a thing or two about how they treat paying customers. For to-go orders, they should clearly state that seats are for dine-in customers only and to-go patrons should wait outside. As I sat (the restaurant wasn't overly crowded and had other open seats) the cashier stopped the line and came over and said that seats are for customers only. Customers only he kept on saying. Umm...I just ordered my meal (which was over $20 btw) and I am not a paying customer? Way to go. 

I would not wait in line for their food or come back any time soon. Sorry Souvla.
author: Angela D.

description:
This restaurant is the best thing that has happened to SF's fast casual scene in the last decade. Before I moved to Portland, I was dining here once a week. 

Order at the counter, get your number + your bevvy, and grab a seat.

Dine-In
All locations are clean and modern and open and bright. I absolutely love that vibe when eating this kind of food.

Take-Out
I've gotten Souvla delivered more times than I can count and every single time it was almost as good as dining in. It's the perfect kind of food you want delivered when you are trying to stay healthy(ish) but you're too lazy to leave the house and you need something filling and delicious. 

Menu
Honestly, there isn't a single item I've had that I didn't love. 

My go-to is the lamb sandwich. I'm not one to get lamb over pork, BUT at Souvla IT ME. All meats are delicious, but their lamb is superior indeed. The sandwich is perfectly-sized to fill my tummy, but I don't feel over-stuffed if I eat the whole thing in one sitting. Impressive portioning IMO.

The salads are SUBSTANTIAL and I can never finish mine when I go that route, which I appreciate because it's not bad leftover either.

The greek fries are really just YUM. Add a side of Granch (Greek Ranch) and you will have yourself a perfect little side. 

The wine options are delish, but I usually go for the Greek cherry soda because it's a sugar bomb that I can't resist - like a Greek Jarritos if you will.

The BEST thing Souvla has to offer is their greek froyo. 
__
Pro Tip: Get the froyo with Baklava crumbs on top AND olive oil + flaky sea salt and don't look back.
author: Taylor S.

description: Souvla is amazingggg. I love it, I can't wait for them to open one in the marina! I love both the chicken and the lamb, I usually get either one of those in a salad, sometimes with fries, sometimes not. It's super good and filling, and not overly expensive. Definitely a good deal, and so so delicious. I wish I could eat it more often.
author: Jenna G.

description:
I thought the food here  was great! Both my friend and I got the vegetarian salads and they were super filling! Of course, I had to try the fries and those also didn't disappoint. 

This is a great spot to Come if you want a relatively short meal and something on the healthier side to fill you up. 

I also recommend trying their Greek yogurt with baklava!
author: Liza H.

description:
Whenever someone asks me for a restaurant recommendation  I ALWAYS recommend Souvla. They're salads and sandwiches are delicious and filling. I probably eat Souvla 2-3 times a month. 

Souvla is the perfect ambiance for a date (casual yet romantic lighting) or to meet up with friends. The food is beyond delicious and they offer alcohol and amazing frozen greek yogurt.

The pricing is pretty decent (typical SF pricing) and the food is VERY filling. When looking at the menu, you pick your protein (chicken, lamb, veggie, etc) then you decide if you want it as a salad or sandwich. The sandwich is wrapped in a yummy warm pita bread and the salad serving is large enough to save some for lunch the next day or if you're very hungry it is super filling. 

They pair chicken with yummy fresh oranges and lamb with crips radishes. My favorite is the chicken salad and the lamb sandwich. The chicken is moist and juicy and you can even buy a full chicken when there. There is typically a line outside of the door but it moves quick, the Hayes location is somewhat small and can be hard to find seating but the park is nearby.

I'm also a huge fan of the fries and typically get my salad or sandwich "greek style"--- which means they stuff a handful of fries onto my salad or into my sandwich for a small fee more. 

Don't forget to try the Baklava frozen greek yogurt!

Try Souvla, you won't regret it.
author: Joanna M.

description:
It is all about the salads. Don't let anyone else tell you otherwise.

Another tip - the Souvla hot sauce is great. Add fries to your salad also.

Not at all a fan of the wraps. Granted, I had just come back from Greece and was craving Greek food. I came here when they opened in 2014 and  was very disappointed in the wraps. They were dry and bland. I did try the frozen greek yogurt with sea salt which I enjoyed at the time. Since then, I haven't liked the yogurt, maybe because they put too much sea salt. I also found the baklava overwhelmingly sweet.

Back to the salads, they are special. Obviously salads are best fresh, but Souvla salads are one of the few that travel well and is good the next day. I've ordered Souvla through Caviar for work lunches and dinners, because really, there aren't many salad options when you're ordering for dinner. I typically get the chicken or pork salad and add fries. Occasionally, I'll ask for the lamb salad and sub out the lamb for chicken or pork.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Overrated chain, IMO. Salad dressing is SO HEAVY and the food is actually pretty expensive for being not that great and it being a seat-yourself establishment. 

I think the best part about Souvla is their frozen Greek yogurt -- would recommend if you decide to go to a Souvla location. It is like the tart original flavor of froyo but thicker and more delicious. I got the one with crushed baklava on top with honey drizzle. YUMMY!!
author: RachEl L.

description:
Incredible service, good food, and just a relaxed ambiance. 

I've been to this place a few times, because I love walking up and down Hayes Valley. No matter how long the line is, they bring out food so quick and their staff is so kind! Their lamb and pork dishes are really good, but I really come here for their greek yogurt. A++ to the ones with Baklava as well as the olive oil and sea salt. Their fries are amazing too!! I recommend the garlic sauce. 

I'll be back soon to have a nice dinner with some wine to accompany. Love ya, Souvla!
author: Julia T.

description:
So Souvla has been on my bookmarks list for quite some time.  Long line as others have mentioned but they seem to do a great job of getting their items out quickly. My order was to go and I felt like I didn't have to wait too long. 

American Homestead Pork Shoulder Salad $12 
minted greek yogurt, cherry tomato, pickled red onion, cucumber, feta cheese

As others have mentioned this is absolutely delicious and vaults up to the upper tier of my SF salad rankings below and no surprise really since I've heard about this place a lot. 

I like the generous amounts of cherry tomatoes they put (I like tomatoes a lot) since some places skimp on them and Feta always makes it BETTA...

Just a great place and I look forward to trying other items. 

I like Healthy Foods...occasionally ...lol. For the past year or so I workout multiple times everyday so I typically try to eat at least one Salad a day. Often times I bring my own salad for lunch but sometimes I venture out in the city for some healthy greens.  

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the Salad Spots in the City. They are all pretty good this is just my take.

Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places

author: Rod M.

description:
One of my fave go to fast casual spots in sf. They make healthy taste good. 

Chicken sandwich or salad is amazing with the Greek fries. Order at the counter and sit in the park nearby or get delivery as it's a bit small and usually busy.
author: Daniela J.

description:
First time review, been many times. 
~Food~  
Chicken Salad: Chicken was moist and flavorful. You can tell they put thought into the salad itself because it has such a great combo of ingredients including mandarin oranges, sprouts, crumbly cheese. You're not just tasting chicken and leafs. It's a whole flavor dance on your tongue. 
Fries: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Even cuts (aka no over-fried tiny pieces at the bottom of the cup) and didn't even need a dipping sauce. 
Wildflower Honey Greek Froyo: If you like tangy and tart true-froyo like me, this is your jam. There are not many places that do true froyo with the yogurt taste anymore and I will come here just for this. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and doesn't distract too much from the tart flavor. 
Baklava Greek Froyo: Similar to the honey one but with added texture of the bakalva (which is like honey soaked granola) If you like your froyo with more texture, flavor, sweetness, this is your cup. 

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
$14 Chicken Salad: If you're going to get the salad with sides/desserts, definitely share or you won't have room after the salad! A good tasting and filing portion.
$5 Fries: Don't let the small cup fool you, there are a lot of fries for one order.
$5 Greek Froyo: Tasty and worth it. 

~Atmosphere/Service~
There's not a lot of seating but the space is bright and airy. People tend to filter through the seating pretty quickly. If weather permits, I recommend sitting on the green right across street. The staff was amazing and very accommodating. If you order froyo, they'll bring it to you after your food.
Don't get scared by the line, it moves relatively quickly.
author: Lily L.

description:
I felt stressed here! 

I placed my usual order of side salad with lamb and Greek fries and tried to find seating inside since it was cold and windy out. There was none to be had. All the counter seats, stools by the wall and the small cramped space by the window was quickly taken by others who haven't even ordered yet. There's no waiting area so a bunch of us who did to go orders kinda just stood in the middle of the dining room waiting for our food while servers and other diners passed by on the way to the kitchen and bathroom. 

I got my order after 15 minutes and my fries were not even piping hot. That's disappointing! As I was leaving, I saw a homeless guy swipe a bunch of napkins from the diners who were sitting outside. 

Terribly crowded, in the middle of a super busy pedestrian sidewalk and homeless people just within an arm's length of your $15 lamb salad. No thanks!!!
author: Janice C.

description:
Food here is awesome and the frozen greek yogurt, YUMMMMMM! I got the lamb sandwich and it was a great choice. Great flavor and just the right amount to be full, but not overly so. Still had enough room for some dessert! 

Honestly, the downside to this place is the size. It was super chaotic trying to find a place to sit. There was kind of a line, but then people came out of nowhere and swiped a table. If you're there at peak time, be prepared. Also, because of the size, coming with a big group could be a challenge. 

Food was good, staff was nice, next time I'd just get my meal to go from the start and avoid the stress of finding a place to sit.
author: Anna D.

description: Greek fries are a MUST! Fries are crispy brown on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside. Very flavorful from the garlic and feta cheese. Pork shoulder sandwich was juicy and moist. There was a lot of meat packed in that wrap. Vegetable salad had massive sweet potato slices. Never had a sweet potato in my salad, but paired well with the kale. It was a lot of food but at least it was healthy. Next time I will come back for the greek yogurt.
author: Ronald M.

description:
I love love love souvla.

I wish I could eat this for three square meals

It is always so fresh and crunchy and fragrant. Whether you get the pork shoulder, lamb, or chicken, you will be happy.

Make sure to always add fries and if you have room after their hefty entree helping, get the baklava for dessert.
author: Briana L.

description:
This place is so hipster it hurts but the lamb gyro wrap was really good (you can taste the freshness of the lamb and all the ingredients that goes into it). Also ordered the frozen Greek Yogurt with olive oil and sea salt and the Greek iced tea and those were good as well.  

Come early (or late) since the line gets really long.  The restaurant itself is nice with a community table, counters and tables for 2 or 4. Overall, sad to say but the prices are in line with what you'd expect to pay right now in SF even for a quick, casual meal - with tax and tip, the lamb, yogurt and ice tea was about $30.  I would recommend this place if you have an itch for some lamb gyro.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is the best Greek "fast food" spot in the city!  I got the Mary's Free Range Chicken and my husband opted for the Superior Farms Lamb Leg--we both got the "sandwich" (which is more like a wrap). Both sandwiches were SO GOOD! Chicken was full of flavor and not at all dry. Lamb was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. We also shared the Greek Fries, which was flavorful and crispy. 

We went to the Hayes St. location, which gets crazy busy during lunch time. Service is wonderful--friendly staff and food comes out quickly. The restaurant is small with a few tall tables and a communal table. We noticed that most people take their food to go and head over to the nearby park. To avoid a long wait, it's best to arrive as soon as they open. Definitely worth the wait though!
author: Khristine A.

description: Overrated. Overpriced. Long lines. Limited seating. Food isn't bad but you'll end up spending as much as a regular restaurant. We accidentally forgot to tell them no cheese and they wanted to charged us for another salad because they already prepared it. Why can't they give that one to someone else? If you really want to eat here order online ahead of time and pick it up
author: Jonathan L.

description:
A cute, very Bay Area - esque Mediterranean restaurant. I came to the Hayes Valley location, since I was meeting some college friends here, but I believe there are other locations throughout SF. 

Here's what we ordered: 

Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup - the tanginess and creaminess of the greek yogurt goes so well with the crispy filo layers of the baklava crumbles and the sweet and sticky honey syrup. I can see why people would come for this dessert alone, esp on a relatively warm SF afternoon like when I was there. 

Greek Fries - salty, crunchy, fried potato deliciousness - what more could you honestly ask for? They top theirs with some olive oil, lemon juice, and cheese that makes for an extra salty and acidic punch that helps to make it an interesting french fry to snack on. 

Roasted White Sweet Potato - this is a great vegetarian dish that has all your classic Mediterranean flavors in a light, refreshing summer-y dish. 

There was a little bit of a wait at this location, mainly because this location doesn't have much seating. They do have some indoor and outdoor seating, but as with most downtown restaurants, there just isn't a lot of chairs, so if you want to - take it to go and enjoy it while sitting in the lawn/park area right across the street.
author: Erica K.

description:
YOU WILL NOT FIND BASIC TASTING MEDITERRANEAN FOOD HERE - Wow, full of flavors, textures and spices.
I had the Veg sandwich and I was thoroughly surprised with how much different it was, delicious sweet potato paired well with fresh olives, cheese, onions and other veggies. 
Highly recommend!
author: Kevin M.

description: So I was actually really impressed with Souvla. I walked in with my friend on a Saturday night and it was packed. We were able to find seats after we ordered luckily. After I ordered the gyro I immediately noticed that almost everyone in the restaurant had ordered the salad haha. Retrospect is 20/20. The gyro was great though. I loved that it had fresh sprouts and mandarin oranges in it. I ended up just opening it to eat it with a fork to avoid the heaviness of the pita bread. We also had the garlic fries which were great crispy fries. For dessert we had the Greek yogurt. The yogurt itself was great, but the toppings kinda messed it up. It had A LOT of sea salt on it. Like way too much. And it was topped with olive oil which seemed bizarre. When I first saw it I thought it was honey but nope.. olive oil . My friend and I basically didn't eat any of it soooo yah. Sometimes less is more. Overall it was a great spot I would come back to and recommend.
author: Monica K.

description: If you're a gyro fanatic, then you need to give Souvla a try. This is definitely my favorite gyro spot. I ordered the lamb gyro with fries. The lamb is slow roasted in house and is amazingly tender. I love the pita here as well. Just a heads up, this place is typically busy so it may be difficult to find a table, especially if you're with a larger group. The food comes out fairly fast as well!
author: Wilton F.

description:
Every time I've been here, there's always been a line out the door, and it's for a good reason.

If you're here with another person, I highly suggest that one stays in line while the other goes and hunts down a table.

Souvla's menu is simple - choose your protein and whether you'd like it in a wrap or salad. I always get their pork salad. My s/o got the lamb wrap once and mentioned that it was a bit dry, so either ask for more sauce or just get a bowl of meat with veg! 

Their fries are also a must order. They're always fresh and hot. No dipping sauce needed, although you can ask for ketchup. I've seen some customers order fries on top of their salads and inside of their wraps, as well! If you're not a big eater, you'd easily be able to split the salad along with some fries. 

As for drinks, their white wine is delish. There's also self serve water near the register.

I've never tried their yogurt, but the flavors all look heavenly. One day, I'll have to pass up Salt & Straw and try the greek yogurt at Souvla instead!
author: Shirley H.

description:
Souvla has solid food, it's one of my favorite places to eat.  The line moves along quickly and the customer service is super friendly and helpful.  I like the outdoor patio in the back with the hanging lights, it's nice to eat out there on a sunny day.  Everything I've had has been delicious.  I like the lamb salad with fries, but the chicken is also excellent.

YUMZ
author: Lyn C.

description:
Great combination of flavors, ingredients, and colors. I got the chicken salad which was full of flavor and texture. Their kale was so soft and the chicken was juicy and tender. I never like having fruits in my salad though so I had to pick out the oranges (which were really good on its own). Besides that and the slightly too salty sauce, I enjoyed eating my salad very much. It was super filling, large, and not terribly priced ~$13-15. 

The space, however, was tiny. On a warmer day, I would have opted to eat out in the park or at their standing tables outside but not when it's 40 degrees outside. Expectedly, the place was very crowded when I went and we had to pounce on the first available space after ordering. If you order a yogurt, you can pick it up later as long as you keep your receipt. (They are a pay and take a number type place). 

I also got the baklava greek yogurt ($5) and it was delicious. Unsure why the baklava was so jam-like; it felt mostly like hardened honey and was pretty sweet. The yogurt itself was smooth, sweet, and slightly sour which paired well with the drizzled honey (not as much with the baklava which was slightly overpowering). I tried the olive oil/sea salt one and it was pretty unique as well.

Overall a solid place that I would frequent more if I lived nearby.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
I had a former coworker who got this in her regular dinner time rotation, but I never had the chance to check it out with her. On a quiet night in the office, I was thinking of her and missing her usual choice of restaurants, so I decided to check it out. 

I got the lamb salad and a Greek yogurt froyo. The lamb salad, while on the pricier side of things, was also on the heftier side of things. The lamb was moist and of the stringy variety, which isn't really my thing, but I still appreciated how it seemed to show up in every bite in large chunks. The flavor of sometimes strong ingredients (like pickled red onions and beets) were moderated by the yogurt dressing. Not the lightest salad, but it won't weigh you down too much. 3.75/5.

As an ice cream lover, many people had told me to check out the froyo here. It's light, with a brightness from the yogurt. The baklava and honey were warm and provided some texture (not really my thing, but I know that other people like it).  I would have preferred more ice cream and less baklava, but to each their own. 4/5.

A 3.6 for me.
--

Literally the next day, we get this as a group order for lunch, so here I am checking out the chicken salad with yams, in addition to the yams.

The chicken was a little bit dry, but just as with the lamb, they were generous with the portion size. Good chicken flavor. The mitzrah cheese adds a little more texture but not really any flavor to the salad. 3.5/5 on the chicken salad. The yams are straight out of a health food lover's dream-- just straight yams, well done. Those roasted potatoes are SO salty, but boy would I get them again. So velvety there isn't really any texture to them. 3.75/5 on the potatoes.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Souvla reminds me of the Mediterranean goodness of Zankou Chicken in LA except in a fast casual dining experience that is quintessentially the Bay.

Not knowing much about Souvla, I came to Souvla with no expectations.  As a fan of Zankou Chicken in LA, I never thought I could find something similar up here in the Bay.  However, consider myself a convert!  For all their meats, they have the option of making it into a sandwich or salad.  Considering the price, I was a little worried, but the size of the portions for both the salad ($13-15) and sandwich ($12-14) are pretty big.  

Plus, this is not your typical standard Mediterranean fare.  They combine their meats with nice mix of brightly colored veggies and cheese to make for an overall satisfying bite.  I thoroughly enjoyed my chicken, but I was not really impressed with the lamb.  However, they were good and solid bites that left me wanting to come back.

What really made me fall for this place was their frozen Greek yogurt.  As a big fan of froyo, I had high expectations for it.  The yogurt not only met my expectations but exceeded them!  It has the slight sour taste one expects from Greek yogurt and also not super sweet.  However, paired with Baklava crumble, which brings a nice crunchy sweetness, one bite from it was just amazing!

While the lines were pretty long, the line does seem to move pretty fast.  If you are wanting to sit down in the restaurant, there is limited seating.  However, with the nearby park, you could easily order to go and walk on over.

Overall, Souvla does Mediterranean food with a nice modern twist that is worth trying out if you are in the SF area!
author: Patrick S.

description:
I am one of the few people in San Francisco that is not about the Souvla hype. I hate fennel so their salad is not my jam. The shredded chicken is dry and the pork is too fatty. I just can't win here...

But you know what wins here? Their fat, crispy fries. If I didn't mind waiting in the (ridiculous) long line and turning into a mochi ball, I'd eat the fries from here all day, err day.

Fortunately, that mochi ball look is not for me.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
So I've always wanted to go to Souvla but being a pescatarian there isn't great options here. I finally went with a friend couple nights ago who convinced me the vegetarian option was good too. I ordered the vegetarian salad which was kale, roasted sweet potatoes, pea sprouts, mizithra cheese, kalamata olives. It wasn't bad for a salad, and the sweet potatoes (aka the veg equivalent of a protein) was a generous helping. But for as much as people love Souvla's meat options, I am disappointed that the veg option is pretty basic, nothing special. Especially in a city like SF where vegetarian food standards are so high. Maybe some protein - like chickpeas would be good - it is a Greek spot after all.
We also split the Greek frozen yogurt with the baklava topping - really good froyo (not too sour or sweet) and the baklava was decent considering it is Greek ;)
author: Farrah N.

description: This place was hopping on a Wednesday night but I think it's hopping every night. We waited in line and placed our orders. We got the pork wrap and a lamb salad, one honey yogurt, one baklava yogurt, french fries and juicy potatoes. I was slightly disappointed with my lamb as it was dry and tough. The pork was good. The french fries were phenomenal. We got the garlic sauce to go with it. The juicy potatoes were good. But the fries were the bomb. Go with that if you have to choose. The yogurts were really good too. I guess I'd have to come back and try the lamb again.
author: mei s.

description:
Pork and chicken wraps are super tasty here! Sauce is delicious, and everything just comes together in a wonderful symphony. (The first time I had Souvla, I may or may not have shed tears of joy as I took my first few bites.) Souvla is my go-to because I know it won't disappoint. There are many locations throughout the city!  

I absolutely love their frozen Greek yogurt, and I always opt for the one with baklava topping! (The olive oil with salt one is a bit too salty for me LOL) 

The line is also usually always out the door, but it moves quickly, and food comes out pretty quickly as well.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Farmhouse farmfresh fabulous. 

Wandered in for lunch and had an excellent experience. This is the place to go for that perfect combo of great fresh food, ease and comfort, and a great place for a conversation. 

Fresh salads and salady flatbread sandwiches with rotisserie chicken, lamb, pork shoulder or sweet potatoes. Dressed and garnished beautifully. 

Community tables as well as stool height tables for two. The place is buzzing but not hectic feeling. 

Order at counter and sit for five mins until your food arrives. 

PS-- I saw someone with a bottle of rosé and don't know if they BYO'd or bought at Souvla, but THAT would make this six stars for sure.
author: Lanny B.

description: Great place for lunch even with the huge crowd. They have a really simple menu which leads to delicious food and quick service. Our group showed up around 11:45 on a weekday. While the line was out the door, we ordered and sat down within 15 minutes. I ordered the lamb wrap which was delicious and flavorful. My coworker ordered the fries which were pretty meh for the price.
author: Wilson T.

description:
Came here on a weekend and it was busy but not wait in like for an hour busy and while the seating was limited we got a seat pretty quickly.  We ordered the lamb sandwich, Greek fries and the baklava frozen yogurt.  We didn't have to wait for anything (ordering, seating or food) so that was definitely a plus.  We sat down only for several minutes and our food came to our table.

The lamb sandwich was okay although a bit dry.  The Greek fries were good and crunchy.  The baklava frozen yogurt was awesome and if I'm in the area again I would go alone just for that.  All the portions were good and the prices were meh, okay for SF.  Probably wouldn't visit again because the sandwich but they might have had an off day so I would definitely recommend it only if you're in the area and can't decide what to get.
author: Alexander C.

description:
Popular place but expensive since it's about $10 just for the wrap itself. If you want fries it's 5 just for the fries and plus 5 for desert.

I got the veggie wrap or something. Surprised it had sweet potatoes as the main filling. Strange at first but I highly enjoyed it after a few bites. 

Though the food is good but for the price you can find con. Parable for less money. But at least you'll want to try it out at least once. If you have income to spend on above pricing then go for it. It is good.
author: David S.

description:
Souvla. For someone who has not been, how can I explain it? Uhmm... what to expect: constant lines, $15 salads, amazing frozen Greek yogurt, solid interior design. 

I've been to several of the locations across SF and they really don't vary much. While each layout is different, they are very clearly a chain with their recipes and layouts down to a science. The Hayes location has the counter right at the front so the line always spills out onto the street and the rotisserie is visible on the back wall. There's limited seating and a lot of it is semi-communal so it's not a place I'd suggest going to for an early date. Sadly, many new Tinder couples don't agree. 

Anyway, the food: the salads are great. The frozen Greek yogurt is to die for. The wraps are meh, and as for the sides, I've only had the juicy potatoes but they are quite good.
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
It hurts me to give this place one star because I truly enjoy their food and drinks a lot and I've always recommended it to family and friends--it's in a good area, fantastic food, and I never had an issue with their service...until today.

I was a group of three and first to finish ordering so I looked for a place to comfortable seat our group. There weren't any four-tops available--not a problem as this happens at a lot of places in SF. The communal table had space so I had a seat. By the time our third person finished ordering a four-top opened up and she invited us to move. I grabbed our numbers first since they were the closest thing in my reach and put them on the new table. But then a female customer that was STILL IN LINE steps up to us and said that was her table when there was no evidence it had been saved. Not a purse. Not a coat. No number. NOTHING to indicate it had been taken and I already put our number stands down. 

We didn't want to argue so we let it go and were going back to our spots at the communal table. It wasn't that big of a deal. Sure we were a little miffed that someone could act that way, but you have to pick your battles. Mind you, I've been to Souvla a dozen times and I get how their process works. Order first, sit after. Not everyone abides by that but I always do. That's the fair and right way to do things. 

But then as we were moving back, the cashier (With a very distinct hairstyle. Not to name names.) purposely came over to the communal table to reprimand us in front of everyone at the restaurant. She antagonized us saying that if we were going to sit at the communal table we have to keep our numbers with us and we can't keep them at a separate table. She was completely did not even know the truth of the situation and judged us for what happened, then blasted us in front of all the other diners, especially the other diners at the communal table. Talk about awkward!!! I had to correct her and tell her that we were trying to move tables; it honestly wasn't even an issue as it was solved between us and the other customer.

Except now some small incident that should've been harmless between some diners has completely soured my experience at the establishment. I felt insulted and looked down upon by the employee and preemptively judged by our race and assuming we were trying to cause problems with the operation when it was sincerely not the case. She didn't even apologize for the miscommunication. During the rest of our meal I felt SO UNCOMFORTABLE around the other communal table diners and the atmosphere was incredibly uninviting. 

At first I thought I was just sensitive to the situation, but talking to my friends afterward, they also felt the same uncomfortable hostility. I work at a 5-star hotel--I know when service is poor and this was it. I definitely regret spending $40 of my hard earned money there and I feel even more sorry to my friend who had never been to Souvla and was excited to try it on her first visit to SF because of my recommendation. I regrettably won't be back and I certainly won't be recommending this place to anyone anymore.

EDIT: Looking at the other reviews I see that another Asian customer felt antagonized as well. Sad to hear Souvla is racist.
author: Alison M.

description:
Be not discouraged, the line goes by fast.

Game plan:
- Order the sweet potato salad (maybe with a side of chicken or lamb). The sandwich version is phenom as well. 
- Baklava crumbles Greek yogurt (hold for pick-up post salad).
- Scope seating area and snag a spot, pronto. 
- Savor the meal with gusto. 

Conclusion:
- Happy belly, happy heart.
author: Camille E.

description:
I was told this is Michelle Obama's favorite restaurant. So I definitely had to come check it out ! 

It's a Greek salad place and I got the chicken salad and Greek yogurt with baklava. Since the line is generally pretty long, you want to order everything at once and then tell them you want the ice cream later. Then the host will give you a ticket to claim your ice cream when you're ready. 

The salad was big and plentiful and you can add fries on top. Talk about a dream come true?! I was unable to finish my salad and ended up taking some of it home. I was quite surprised that it had so much kale. Generally I would never order a salad with kale because it's really bitter, but this one was actually pretty good. There's also a ton of shredded chicken in the salad, yay for protein! 

If you're adventurous, go with the frozen Greek yogurt with salt and olive oil but don't bite into it because all you'll get is salt. That was my biggest mistake and ended up not liking it. I enjoyed the baklava one because it's much sweeter and easy to eat.
author: Chi L.

description:
Today I had the lamb sandwich and the roasted potatoes. The food was fantastic, well presented, and came in a timely manner.

However, the service left something to be desired. I heard that someone cancelled their order and a different staff member was swearing right in front of the register, which was a little uncomfortable. I'm not sure if that event effected the mood the cashier, but that's not my problem. The cashier didn't seem like she wanted to answer my questions about the menu, and I felt like I was rushed through the ordering process. I get that it's busy, but it's not like I'm ordering fast food and the amount that I'm paying is (or should have been) reflective of that. The cashier starts unnecessarily explaining to my friends and I that our numbers have to be at the table we're sitting at (even though we were all still standing and haven't settled down yet). Definitely felt like she was acting like we didn't understand simple seating or dining etiquette  (maybe because we're Asian), which is pretty insulting. Don't think I will be coming back, there are other Mediterranean options that have better service.
author: Tracy T.

description: Souvla is a great place for modern Greek food. The place is quite busy but worth it. I like that i can order my food (including a ticket for my greek yogurt) and eat comfortably, then pick up my fresh frozen yogurt afterwards. I got the pork salad which was good and generous amount. However I recommend the sandwhich since it was hot and more gyro like than a salad is. Both were great. The best was the frozen greek yogurt with baklava!! Great baklava and delicious sour greek yogurt. I will definitely go back and try their other greek yogurts!
author: Christine A.

description:
So one of my best friends claims she could bathe in Souvla salads she loves them so much. I had to see what all the hype was about and see if I too could find that much happiness in a salad. We ordered delivery on a weeknight. I went with the veggie salad- added white sweet potatoes-Greek style. Greek style is when they add French fries on top of your salad  because fries are the new healthy... salad was good but the potatoes and fries made it a little too potatoey and soggy. Mainly my fault for ordering but I was not as impressed as I thought I would be. Also tried out the honey baklava Greek yogurt. Strong flavor but still very good. Overall, I would suggest going to the restaurant to eat your food instead of delivery because it just isn't the same. Hopefully your Souvla experience will be more batheing-worthy than mine bath

Take two: ordered Souvla again and this time I was well prepared for what to order. I went ahead and ordered the veggie salad again which comes with white sweet potatoes. Skipped the onions and olives, with dressing on the side. No Greek style either (fries on top). I added my own blueberries and avocado  + chia seeds. Top notch creation right there. Souvla is growing on me, but it's not quite bathe-worthy yet!
author: Kara N.

description:
all of a sudden transformed from good vibe to stuck up. the staff is not friendly and show no love or interest in customer service. we understand they have a female staff who treats asians poorly but now all of them are no different. 

my 9 year old wanted to order his own yogurt and they would not even take his order. all they wanted was to skipping him and went with other customer in their stuck up faces. and no they saw my kid , he is not that much shorter than the female staff at the cashier.

I cannot say we will stop coming here because we come here at least 3 times a week for dinner. 

but if you want to enjoy and have a good time here , especially if you are asian, watch out !
author: Wai C.

description:
We came at night after dinner to try their greek frozen yogurt and at first bite, my friend and I were fans! You can order the frozen yogurt at the counter, where you can get the frozen yogurt to-go style and eat it in the store or take it with you. They offer a variety of flavors and toppings, but my friend and I went for the Baklava and sour cherry flavor. 

The baklava literally tasted like a chewy caramel cookie and it paired well with the creamy, tangy greek yogurt. I ordered the sour cherry and it was delicious, making the yogurt taste like a Jolly Rancher. Their yogurts are around $5, but they give a good portion in a small coffee cup. 

I didn't get a chance to try their other foods, but I would definitely want to come back to try their gyros, fries, and salads!
author: Sandra S.

description:
The food at Souvla is pretty good but the greek frozen yogurt is even better. Most of their bowls have some yogurt in it along with lots of veggies and your choice of meat. It's a very nice blend of the different food groups. 

The frozen yogurt though is on another level. The texture, flavor, and sweetness-level is much better than other froyo places (maybe because this is made with Greek yogurt?). They have a variety of toppings and I can't wait to try all of them. I got the sea salt and olive oil, which added a nice flavor to the yogurt. Be sure to spread out the sea salt though! When they add it on top, it's pretty concentrated, so my first bite was quite salty. 

The only downside about this place is the size. I came here on a Wednesday evening and it was packed! The line moved pretty quickly but we had to wait quite a bit for a table and it was very crammed. The employees constantly had to tell me to move my chair so they can carry ingredients from the back.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I read about this place from multiple SF Gate articles. Michelle Obama has visited or at least tried and is a fan of the food. It's the most popular Lyft-ed place in SF. And it's inexpensive but delicious fast food. Anyways we visited a couple of times in the last few months. This last time was after a nearby concert. They're open till 10 on weekdays so it's nice to find someplace open late-ish. The line was out the door but moved quickly. Food came out pretty quickly too. I have tried the chicken wrap during the first visit as well as the lamb wrap this most recent time. I'm not a huge fan of the chicken - it was white meat and a little dry (guess me being Asian, I like the dark meat). I had a bit of my bf's lamb during the first visit and it was good so I got it the second time and the lamb was dry and not as flavorful as I remember. Disappointed again. My bf got the pork shoulder wrap and I liked the bite I had of that. Skeptical to go again bc what if it's a disappointment again. For sides, we have tried the potatoes (concept sounds good but I found out it super oily and gross with not as much flavor as I thought) and the fries. I remember the fries being really good during the first visit but this time they were just ok. Barely any cheese, no parsley and could not taste the olive oil or lemon. 
I really want to like this place but they have not been very consistent. Next time I may just come back for the baklava Greek yogurt dessert.
author: Alison W.

description:
You can never go wrong with any of the Salads or Gyros here. The staff here is attentive, service is quick, and the food is healthy and delicious!

My favorite food items are the Chicken Salad and Pork Shoulder Gyro. Both dishes come with plenty of food and the salads usually last me about 2 meals. Very filling indeed!

I also recently discovered the Olive Oil Greek Yogurt and oh my goodness, it is absolutely AMAZING! It's the perfect balance of savory and sweet, yet so refreshing for a warm summer day. I literally have to order it every time I visit Soulva now. It's so addicting and great for sharing with another person!
author: MyTien P.

description:
I'm usually not a big fan of Mediterranean food, but this place was really good and extremely crowded. The store is small and you seat yourself after ordering at the counter. It is kind of difficult getting a seat for 4 people, especially because each party leaves an empty seat in between other parties on the counter.
I got the pork sandwich and it's like a wrap. It had pork, cheese, cucumbers, and tomatoes. The veggies tasted fresh and really made the sandwich taste better. The sandwich also didn't seem that big, but I was stuffed after finishing it! I also got the garlic fries which had no garlic flavor what so ever, but it tasted sooo good with the greek yogurt dip that was given to us. I would definitely get the fries again, but probably just regular fries. Lastly, I tried the greek frozen yogurt and it was so good! Tasted like tarte froyo with some extra flavor from the syrup, baklava, or olive oil.
author: Lauren L.

description: It's very good Chicken Gyro Sandwich and the lemon soda also was pretty good but I wish they would sell chicken plates only for those that don't care for carbs.   Price is on the high side for a sandwich and soda ($17) but you can taste the quality rotisserie chicken in the wrappers.
author: Truman W.

description: I tried the lamb wrap and it was just okay. The meat was on the drier side and the wrap is overall just bland; barely any yogurt sauce or feta cheese. I was dousing it with hot sauce to make up for lack of flavor, but even the hot sauce was underwhelming. I expected more, considering the raving reviews and the quality of the ingredients they use (locally sourced). The fries are pretty good though! They've got more flavor than the sandwiches!
author: Lexi R.

description: Hip, trendy, young, Greek place in Hayes Valley.  I always get the chicken salad.  Love it!  The meat is so flavorful and tender.  The Greek fries with the harissa sauce is not to be missed. The Greek frozen yogurt is so tangy.  I can't describe the oil and salt on the yogurt, I said I didn't care for it, yet I ate it all, and still crave it.
author: Aine R.

description:
Highly overrated in my opinion. 
I got the greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles and the veg sandwich. The sandwich was so dry and bland. The filling is basically just a sweet potato and some olives. There was no flavor whatsoever. The frozen yogurt was decent. I didn't like it at first, but it grew on me. It is very tart and the only sweetness comes from the topping. I would go back to try the olive oil option. I tried one of my friends' greek fries and that was the clear winner of the meal. There is only 1 bathroom so be prepared for a 20 minute wait if you need to go. There wasn't any open seating at about 5pm on a Saturday so we ate at the park area outside the restaurant.
author: Shilpa Y.

description:
Favorite fast-casual place for salads. I only get their chicken salad (didn't love the lamb and used to get the pork, but recently discovered their chicken salad is way, way better because the pork is usually kind of dry). Find the sandwiches to also be on the drier side (have only tried the pork). Their froyo is pretty good and servings are large. Will usually get the sea salt & olive oil combo as the other combos are too sweet for me. 

Lines can get pretty long during lunch hour. Have definitely ordered online, while waiting in person on a long ass line, and ended up cutting my wait time in half
author: Emily L.

description: Delicious eats! Split the lamb salad and a side of Greek fries for two people. Also, the beer is pretty good as well. And for the price, a great value!
author: Vladi Z.

description: My hands still smell like lamb and I'm really not upset about it. Got the lamb sandwich which is basically like a souvlaki (souvla...souvlaki...connecting the dots....). It was $14 which I guess is okay. Very quick service even though the line was out the door. Very tasty delicious tender meat. Next time I go I must get the fries which look thick cut, seasoned and divine. Happy to sit in the window and people watch.
author: Daisy K.

description:
I skipped brekkie and went straight to lunch instead. 

We ordered:

- Mary's free-range chicken salad ($13) = fresh fennel, pea shoots, navel orange, and their pickled onions. Great salad to share or eat it as a lunch meal. 

- Lamb Sandwich ($10) = I like gyro and this was satisfying and filling. 

- Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava = drizzle with honey was quite a happy ending to my meal. 

Love this light and tasty lunch. Don't mind the line, it goes by quickly and the staff was very efficient. 

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
It didn't blow me away but it was solid. Their meats are definitely what they do well - which is good because that's how they market themselves. 

Both the chicken and the lamb wraps were quite good - lots of meat and interesting things paired with them. As usual, could have used more sauce. Nice pita. 

I was underwhelmed by the fries. There was nothing wrong them. They were crispy and hot but the menu made it sound like they would have special Greek flavor and they just tasted like fries. 

Side salad was standard Greek salad - I enjoyed that they added kale. 

They clearly are also know for their frozen Greek yogurt. I'm not a frozen yogurt fan, but my friend got one and I tried it and it was definitely unique- I can see how it would be popular. 

Very busy at lunch, but it's counter service and they move it along pretty quickly so not a problem.
author: Sarah C.

description:
So delicious. Stopped in here for great inexpensive food and was not disappointed. I had the sweet potato vegetarian sandwich and it was better than expected. I'm not usually one for olives but it was the perfect addition in this sandwich. The hot sauce had a nice flavor too! Super fast and excellent service. 

My brother got the frozen yogurt with baklava which was a nice combo of sour and sweet. Not quite my thing but it was not bad at all. Next time I would try the sour cherry sauce. 

Thanks for a delicious meal!
author: James B.

description:
Very good fast casual eating experience. Enjoyed my French fries. Maybe the best French fries I've had in a while. The sandwich was ok. A little in the dry side, but the bread was delicious and I liked the inclusion of what I think was orange or some other citrus. 

Place looked very clean and well maintained. Staff was knowledgeable and able to answer my questions without hesitation. 

1 star off for using premade harissa and having harissa blend hot sauce that tastes like tapatio. Besides that, would eat here again.
author: Eric L.

description: Be prepared for the long line! Stopped by around 8pm on a Tuesday night and the line was out the door. It's a small place completely packed for both indoor and outdoor seatings. I ordered a lamb sandwich and a side of Greek fries and it actually didn't take that long to get my food. The food however was ok, definitely as not great as it's hyped up to be.
author: Adeleine T.

description:
I have been to Souvla a couple of times now and it is definitely delicious food. They also have Greek wine and beer!

I ordered the Greek white wine to have with my lunch which was the lamb sandwich. I have had the salad before and it is really very good as well, not just a crappy salad, this is one salad I have actually enjoyed. The lamb was really tender and very flavorful, the sandwiches are a decent size, I couldn't finish it. The hot sauce is really good also, in case you are into spicy like I am. 

One of my friends that I was with ordered the Greek yogurt with the baklava pieces on top and omg, it was so good. The sweet baklava pairs so well with the tangy Greek yogurt, definitely not to miss if you can fit it into your meal.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Souvla's been on my radar forever, but the long lines scared me away. What if it wasn't as delicious as the hype made it to be?! Given the amount of praise Souvla gets, it definitely wouldn't have been difficult for it to be over-talked. However, I'm happy to report that Souvla did not disappoint.

Given the lines, get here early if you want to eat here, as it definitely fills up. I came at around 530 pm on a Monday because I was super hungry! There was only one table free, so I quickly ordered and snagged it. There weren't too many people in line, so my chicken salad and fries came quickly.

This salad. is. the. bomb. It tastes amazing and is super refreshing. Your taste buds and body will thank you for giving it yummy nutrients. No lie. And, if you thought it couldn't get any better, it's also super filling! I devoured my meal like a savage.

While my experience was pretty great, I gotta emphasize again that it's all a matter of timing! Fast forward 30 minutes and there was a line out the door. It stayed that way for the next hour, when we finally vacated. There was never an empty table, and in fact, there were people waiting around for tables for at least 20 minutes. Luckily, it seems like with long lines it takes longer for the food to come out, allowing people enough time to hope for an empty table before their food is served.
author: Angela C.

description: Excellent food. Ordered the pork shoulder salad while my girlfriend ordered the chicken salad. The salad was surprisingly filling with dinosaur kale and a number of different picked vegetables with greek yogurt dressing. They did NOT skimp on the meat. There was literally a piece of pork in every bite, which is pretty impressive. I also ordered the olive oil and sea salt frozen greek yogurt, which was surprisingly good. It tasted similar to the brittle caramel/butterscotch that covers kettle corn.
author: Chris Y.

description:
So glad we finally got to eat here! They do their own chicken rotisserie and the meat is very tender and tasty. Selection of meats are pork, lamb,
Chicken and there is a vegetarian option of white sweet potato. You can order either sandwiches or salads. We had the chicken and lamb sandwiches which were both delicious! Good sized portions and conducive to sharing. There are some sides too. I heard the fries are good. Wide selection of drinks. They have soft serve Greek yogurt which I need to try next time when I save room for dessert. Sandwich prices average $13. Good friendly service and clean interior.
author: Lucy L.

description:
A friend introduced me to this place yesterday and it was a great find for me. It is a bright and airy yet small restaurant. We got there around noon and we're promptly seated. You order at the register, take a number and sit at any table you find open. 

We ordered their salads which comes in a generous portions. The price was very reasonable. The food was tasty, my chicken salad was well prepared with lots of kale and chicken. Loved it. Did not try any drinks, but couldn't help notice the number of people ordering the frozen yogurt and looking so happy about it. Must try that next time I come back.

By the time we were leaving there was a line waiting for a table. Always a good sign.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
First time I visited was with friends. It was on a Saturday evening and it was a bit busy, but we still were able to find seating easily. We all had the Lamb salad and it was amazing. It is a big portion salad with a good amount of the choice of protein. I also had the Greek yogurt with ho eye and baklava. 

Second time I went was on a Sunday it was very easy to find seating and not busy at all. I got the Lamb salad and my boyfriend got the rotisserie chicken salad, both were delicious. This time we had the Greek yogurt with honey and baklava & the olive and salt, both yogurts were delicious but my favorite is the honey and baklava! 

Great place for a casual lunch/ dinner.
author: Natalia F.

description:
The wait was about 5 minutes to order on a Saturday afternoon. The place was packed. 

Order at the counter, get a number, and then find a table.  When you walk in, you can see the chickens on the rotisserie in the back. 

The menu is straight forward for the main items: pork shoulder, Mary's free range chicken, lamb, or a sweet potato vegetarian option. You can get it in a pita or as a salad.  I got the salad with chicken - I asked for dressing on the side, but the leaves were already well wilted by the warm chicken fat. There was a good amount of oil/fat at the bottom of the salad, but it was a solid salad between the warm chicken, pickled onions, shaved fennel, cheese, and kale.

They do have beer and wine (limited, but it's all Greek!) They also have frozen Greek yogurt and some other things like Greek fries and avgolemono (it's been a while since I've seen that on a menu).

Food came out pretty quickly.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
I've been to the Divisadero location and fell in love with their fries and yogurt.  After visiting the Hayes Valley location for their fries and yogurt, the only difference here is the crowd.  This place was super packed but spaces usually open up so you kind of have to be aggressive and go get what you want.  

After dinner at a nearby restaurant, we wanted dessert but ended up getting fries too because even though we were full, good food won't stop us from eating.  Plus I love fries so I'll always save room for dessert and fries.

Service was quick, quality of food was on point
author: Linda N.

description:
I've been dreaming of Souvla ever since I went while visiting San Fran last month. After a recommendation from a close friend who lives in the Bay area, my sister and I ended up at this location at primo time on a Friday evening and still had the best time. 

Seating/space is limited in this small shop but the line moves quickly and if you can't find a seat, take it to go and hit the park nearby!

I like the concept here of a super simple menu starting you with four options (pork, chicken, lamb or veggie) and the choice of on pita or on salad. Sides are a la carte and wine is just red, rose, white, or bubbles. They also featured a greek beer and a few sodas. I love not having to stand there and act like I know the wines on the list while ultimately choosing the second least expensive option. So rose it was!  

Both my sister and I got salads so I can't speak for the pita but they looked awesome. I think the salads are the way to go though. This bowl was jam packed with kale, veggies, pork for me, pickled onion, feta, cucumber and so much yummy yogurt sauce. Piled on the kale, it didn't feel too guilty! 

I was so full after this meal that I couldn't quite swing the frozen greek yogurt but after seeing people with cups of this the rest of the weekend, I really wish I had made room. 

We lucked out and scored a bar spot right in front of the rotating poultry. The noise level was really manageable for how packed they were! I highly suggest a visit here and am already ready to return.
author: Anne Louise B.

description:
Everything taste just so right and I loved loved loved loved the juicy potatoes 
I defiantly come back again when I come to city
author: Negin H.

description:
Souvla is a solid quick eat in Hayes Valley for a weeknight dinner or a casual weekend dinner. It gets crowded sometimes, but you can order ahead through Caviar and pick up.
I always opt for the chicken salad (add fries on top!) it's steep for a salad, but a perfect two mealer if you have a smaller appetite.
The baklava frozen yogurt is one of my favorite desserts in the city. The frozen yogurt is creamy and delicious, and the crumbled baklava provides a hit a sweetness that's not too overwhelming.
I've tried the sea salt and olive oil option too, and once you get past the first few super olive-oily bites it's quite delicious.
author: Michelle L.

description: Always a long line, so I was excited to go with a Greek friend to check what the rave is about. Food taste is good, if you imagine the food is not Greek. The gyro wrap was far too modified to a hipster Californian style taste and lacked the authenticity of Greek food. Salad-based bowl was kale...Greece does not use kale...they won't even know what kale is! Maybe I'm just too purist...
author: Yukiko W.
