description: Loooove this place in Hayes Valley! Now I see why it's so busy! Although it's busy and packed the wait is not long at all. Their pita sandwiches here are amazing. Packed with so much flavor! I got the chicken and my bf got the lamb. Both were so delicious! We also got the garlic fries! Amazing! We also got the baklava froyo with honey for dessert. Everything was so delish here! Def will be back!
author: Rissa K.

description:
I've tried to stroll past Souvla countless times only to encounter hordes of people overflowing onto the sidewalk. This makes for lots of weaving and dodging among folks who are either oblivious to the congestion that they're causing, or, worse yet, feel entitled to block the flow of pedestrian traffic. 

So I decided to see what the buzz was about with a friend while he was in town. If anything, he's even more of a well-traveled foodie than I am, as he lives in Europe and has spent significant time in Greece, among other places. So he knows a thing or two about what constitutes good, authentic Greek fare. 

We were both underwhelmed by what we got - a lamb salad for me, a wrap for him. It was all somewhat decent in a Greek Chipotle sort of way, but not knock-your-socks-off incredible. If anything, the lamb in my salad was rather rubbery and flavorless, and the whole thing was just a slog to get through when, normally, I'd be chowing down greedily if I was really enjoying it.

If there were any good points, the guy ringing orders up was friendly, and we got our orders very quickly after paying for our orders and picking up numbers to display at our table. But is it really worth the long wait? We both said no. Even if you really dig this place, you can order online so as to save yourself the time in line. 

I hate to be a hater, but I'd have to say that there are so many other worthy places to eat in bustling Hayes Valley. If you're doubting my observations, check out Ed U.'s always-authoritative review which generally corroborates mine.
author: Vincent L.

description: (Insert heart eyes emoji) - literally my face when I took my first bite of the frozen Greek yogurt. Olive oil adds the perfect touch. Asked for light on the salt. The interior is very cute and has plenty of seating (came during lunch hours).
author: Tammy C.

description: So good! Came on a Saturday night and was able to get a table because service is quick! Order at the counter and take a seat! I got the chicken salad and it was so good! Filled with kale, mitzithra cheese, chicken, and mandarin slices. Filling and satisfying. My bf got the lamb gyro and it was delish! The bread was insane and the lamb was phenomenal. Get a side of fries with harissa spiked yogurt dipping sauce...you'll thank me later! You have to end the night with some Frozen Greek yogurt! I got the baklava one and it was supreme! I would definitely visit again!
author: Melissa Z.

description:
The food is amazing! Very fresh. It's also nice to not be overwhelmed by options. I got the vegetarian salad, which tasted delicious! My friend got the steak wrap which she loved. She said the bread was really good. 

I highly recommend getting your order to go, as the line gets really long around meal times. They make ordering online really easy, and you can pay online as well. This allows you to skip the line when you show up. They prepare the food really quickly, so if you order online make sure that you aren't too far away. 

There is some seating in the restaurant, but it fills up really quickly. It's nice to order the food to go and then take it to the park that's nearby.
author: Amara C.

description: I am a tough customer...and all my experiences with Souvla have been overwhelmingly positive. What a scrumptious, healthy, place with with fantastic service. Thank you, Souvla!
author: Jaclyn G.

description:
Best mediterranean food in the city hands down. Most staff were pretty amazing- great customer service. Food makes you want to come back for more. They are so generous on portion sizes this place is better than hayes loc for sure. Not as crowded and more generous on portions. 
However, I wasn't always satisifed when I ordered online. They forgot my dressings on the side and it was clearly stated in the order. But food is very good and always satisfying- can't rate them below 5 stars
author: Lauren K.

description: I got the vegetarian salad bowl which was really filling since it was loaded with roasted sweet potatoes.  It was filling. Taste is okay.  My hubby got the lamb salad bowl which he loved.  We also got fries and the avgolemono soup which is good.  For dessert, we got the frozen yogurt soft serve with honey and baklava, sooo good and a nice way to end a meal.  Good service.  There's always a long line so better go during off peak hours or early dinner.
author: Abby Q.

description:
Love Souvla! Delicious, healthy Greek food and casual but cute ambiance. Tried it for the first time tonight and I already know it's going to become one of my go-to places. It reminds me of the Greek version of Spinnerie, also one of my go-to dinner spots. You order before seating yourself - there's plenty of seating that's first come, first serve. There's a large communal table as well as a lot of bar seating inside. There's both indoor and outdoor seating. Entrees will run you between $10-$14 and sides are $4-$6. Pricing depends on the meat you choose( lamb, pork, chicken, veg) and whether you choose a sandwich (gyro) or salad. 

I had the chicken kale salad, which was delicious. Fresh rotisserie style chicken, great mix of lacinato kale and greens, grated cheese, greek dressing and onions. Huge portions. I also ordered a lemon chicken rice soup which was delicious, but definitely not necessary given how large the salad was. 

Last but not least, they have an amazing Greek frozen yogurt with different toppings. I tried the cinnamon crumble today but will definitely be back to try the sour cherry!
author: Sally C.

description:
Food 5/5. Service 5/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 4/5.

Always busy, always good. Souvla is a small shop in the city that has a small menu of pita wraps, salads, soups, and yogurt. They focus on a few items, and perfect them. 

The minute you enter the restaurant, your immediate attention is the rotisserie chicken display in the back. Their chicken is roasted fresh each day continuously throughout the day. Their other meats aren't on display but I would assume it's just the same. I always go for the chicken wrap or salad which are both filling. The chicken salad is a dollar more but has more meat and lies on a big bed of kale salad. 

The main attraction though has to be the baklava frozen yogurt. The yogurt comes with a huge amount of baklava on perfectly tart Greek yogurt ice cream. The mixture between the two is perfect with the overall dessert the perfect amount of sweetness. 

Overall, Souvla is an amazing place for lunch or dinner even though it's always so packed. 

Tips - get your wraps and yogurt to go and seat in the benches in the park to eat.
author: Brian N.

description:
I hadn't been to Souvla in a year and a half, and was super excited to go back for a recent lunch meeting. I'm a huge fan of the quality of their products and it's simple, yet efficient concept. 

This time around I was introduced to lovely off menu salad combo which I didn't know was possible. It was half chicken and half lamb, then added the "Greek Style" which is a pile of fries on top. Yum! After all, everything is better with french fries, right? The salad was amazingly tasty and I wolfed the whole thing down in about 15 minutes. Whoops :)

Try this combo if you haven't already. Solid 5 stars.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Definitely recommend the salads here. I always get the lamb salad, the portions are huge and the quality is really good. I always have leftovers that are easily split into another meal the next day or later the same day. Plus the cherry greek yogurt is delicious! One is enough to share between two people in my opinion. Or the greek yogurt is just a good snack. Fries are good too.

The space is interesting with tables of four along one wall, bar seating on the other, one really long table in the middle plus a few outdoor seats. Service is super friendly!
author: Mimi T.

description:
I'm honestly not sure why by 7:00 there was a long line out of the door. Maybe I am losing my SF palate or I ordered the wrong thing? Apparently the yogurt, which I didn't sample, is to die for. I wouldn't die any time soon for my ingestion.

There were only four main dishes on the menu and none of them were SOUVLA-aki...I guess that's what happens when you assume things.

Anyway, I was hoping for a broader menu since I ADORE Greek food and don't have ANY decent options near where I live. I ordered the lamb and it was chewy. Not flavorless, but definitely not flavorful. 

I'd have to sum up my dining experience as, "I'm hungry and paid money for it so I'll definitely eat it." 

A great sauce may have taken it over the border from mediocre to pretty damn good. But alas, I was too hungry to find the needed fixes and once done, I was very "meh" about the entire experience. I'm not really inspired to try it again (except maybe the yogurt) since there are so many better food options in the area.
author: Tanya W.

description:
Rotating meat goodness on flat bread.  Anything else you want to know?  OK

The food is good.  It comes out quick.  They load everything coming out of the kitchen with punches of flavors, but nothing overwhelming.  I liked my wrap with lamb.  

You can order online and skip any line.
author: Neil W.

description:
4.5 stars

I'm shocked I've never been to Souvla. Finally had the opportunity one late Sat afternoon. We stopped by around 4:30 pm and there was still a line albeit very short. We ordered the lamb salad, chicken salad, Greek beer, white wine and yogurt with sea salt and olive oil. I love that you can pay for the yogurt ahead of time and get it after you finish your meal. It was a bit pricey for lunch but after i took a bite of my salad, I understood why. The ingredients are really fresh and they provide a generous portion of salad and the meat. Everything tasted very fresh and overall the meal was filling. I was surprised by the quality of the white wine - it was very fragrant and perfect for a summer day in SF. We were able to snag seats outside and people watch - lots of fun watching all walks of life enjoy Souvla. Lastly, the Greek yogurt is to die for!!! It is the perfect combination of sea salt and olive oil, down to the last bite. Can't wait to come back and try the fries as well as other flavors for the yogurt.
author: Yin H.

description: Got the lamb sandwich with Greek fries for lunch. It tasted decent even though the meat was extremely dry. Seemed like the meat was from yesterday and they fried it up. Fries itself were pretty good. They're crispy and thick. About 1 cm diagonal. The toppings on the fries did not add much.
author: Mitchell N.

description: The lamb sandwich is soooo good. The salad with lamb is also amazing. There's not much more to say. Love it!!!
author: Anastasia I.

description:
Ever looking for a good refreshing salad that is healthy + flavorful, SOUVLA is definitely the way to go. This is my go to spot for salads when i'm craving for something "healthy" and tasty. The portion is huge and they put ample amounts of meat into the salad. You will feel stuffed when you come out- in a good way.  I like to usually get the salad with pork shoulder.

Their menu is quite simple, they have 3 types of main meat that can be made to a wrap or salad.  If you come with a friend, you may want to get a wrap cut in half and a salad split in half. Don't be shy because they are very nice with their service. They will help you split it into 2 bowls and plates.

They have cheap Rose with generous pouring for those who may want to grab a drink while enjoying their meal. Even though the price is cheap, it don't mean that it tastes bad. It's actually quite refreshing and tasty!
author: christina m.

description:
April 2018 Update: 
One staff member was mean last time. He chastised me for ordering my lamb salad in a to-go container if I was going to sit and eat. I am only able to eat 1/2 a salad each time and always always always take home the 2nd half. I told him this, and he responded saying the containers are part of a program where they don't want the containers to be left in the streets, and then walked off (what?!). The frustrating part was that he disregarded my reason. Not to mention, they had plenty of seating when I was there so it wasn't a space issue. So disappointed as I've been a loyal customer. Still a big fan of the food.

Old Review:
Just adore this restaurant. Food is filling, fresh, and healthy. Quality and service are consistently great. Atmosphere is bright, chic, and super clean.

My favorites are the lamb salad, all the Greek yogurts, and the Greek sodas.

Perfect for lunch or a quick dinner. You order at the counter, grab your own seat, they bring the food out to you. 

During lunch and dinner, seats fill up very quickly and there may be a wait to sit (5-20 min).
author: Michelle B.

description: Thoughtfully done, quickly served, full of flavor Greek food! The staff here was working really hard together (always a welcome sight) and the vibe was super fun. Wasn't sure how the kids would do, but they were welcomed right in and given special attention during our meal. Thanks, Souvla, Yiayia was impressed!!
author: Paul H.

description:
Good spot for a quick lunch or dinner. Very lean menu with prom, chicken and vegetarian options.
I wasn't crazy about the potato option and that's the only vegetarian thing in the menu so not the biggest fan...

For vegetarian/vegan friends - based on the available options:

Vegetarian friendliness - 3
Vegan friendliness - 2
author: Sevda G.

description:
Looking for a lunch place near Symphony Hall, we decided to give Souvlaki a try. It was bookmarked after turning up near the top of a year end list of the most requested restaurant destinations by Uber and Lyft riders.

Seating is communal with long shared tables. Don't come here to discuss trade secrets or your sex life.

The menu is remarkably simple:
1 - pick one of chicken, pork, lamb or vegetable. 
2 - salad or rolled sandwich?
3 - beverage
4 - artisan frozen yogurt (this is SF)

We had two vegetable salads. No complaints there.
Good mix of fresh ingredients, with marinated roast potato slices giving something to chew on.

Haute, it's not. But a good healthy lunch for less than $12.
author: David L.

description: I loved about of half of the lamb pita with those wonderful pickled cucumbers and onions.  The sauce was amazing.  The lamb was generous and delicious.  Family ate the other half.  Next time I want the same with some extra sauce.  Wish there was one in the Richmond.
author: Tj A.

description:
I just instantly love this restaurant after I walk into this place. The staffs are super nice and helpful. I have tried the chicken salad and the lamb sandwich, and the Greek olive olive and sea salt yogurt. Personally, I love the chicken salad more than the lamb sandwich, and the yogurt is amazing!!!!
Definitely would come back again!
author: Gloria Y.

description:
Small seating space, but bless we grabbed a table (4 people) around 1. First off, it's in a nice, hipster looking area. Lots of nice shops to look at and explore.

I've been meaning to try this place ever since my friends continued to rave about it...then I heard Michelle Obama had this catered on her flight? Sold. 

The simple menu makes everything easier. Easier to order everything at least! Ok, we just got 3 wraps (veg-white sweet potato, pork shoulder, and chicken), 2 salads (chicken and lamb), Greek fries, and sparkling water. All that plus tip just under $100. Yeah, this place is on the pricier side; would recommend getting the wrap over the salad ($1 cheaper), it's a better deal and probably more satisfying.

The chicken was forgettable. Loved the white sweet potato but I'm not an olive person so it only slightly ruined the taste. The lamb and pork shoulder were so good. Would r command the pork shoulder wrap!! Fries were just slightly better than your average garlic fries. Decent lunch spot for the wraps.
author: Lilian K.

description:
Shout out to my CA friend, Hayley B., for introducing me to this place while we were in SF for job training! Disclaimer: I've only tried their frozen greek yogurt for dessert after lunch but it was REALLY GOOD frozen greek yogurt.

The frozen greek yogurt comes in 4 different topping variations: 1) Sour cherry, 2) Olive Oil, 3) Baklava & 4) Honey. I got their frozen greek yogurt with baklava and it's probably one of my top favorite frozen treats I've had yet. The yogurt was more on the rich and creamy side with the perfect amount of sweetness and tartness. The baklava had a nice flaky and buttery texture to it. But what impressed me the most was the baklava's flavor. The combination of spices (it reminded me of cinnamon, cardamom and maybe nutmeg) that they used shocked my tastebuds and was an excellent addition to my frozen greek yogurt.

The place itself is pretty casual and gets packed real fast. Can't wait to come back to try out their food though because their gyros and fries looked super good that I regret not making lunch plans here in the first place.
author: Hillary S.

description: They did a super job with the little space they have. The restaurant is decorated clean with a modern Mediterranean feel.  It  has a pleasant atmosphere despite the tight seating. I thought I'd be wowed by the food but honestly it was just ok. The gyro sandwiches are wrapped in what seems to be a  home made thick pita bread . That sounds like it should be super good but the bread was too thick and had no flavor to it so it only added bulk and unfortunately added to the  dryness of the sandwich . We got one of each the chicken and the lamb sandwich . Both were super dry, begging for moisture which was not achieved from the scant sauce which was added in the middle of the gyro.  There just wasn't much flavor going on in the chicken gyro so I felt like I had to douse it with salt and pepper. They add orange slices to it which Also doesn't do much . The potatoes and the fries were excellent. It was a bummer we could not find any ketchup for the fries anywhere . There was only hot sauce on the tables which did not  complement anything .  The yogurt dessert was good but did not wow us. Overall it was just ok and pretty pricy -$58 for 2 sandwiches, 1 fry, 1 order potatoes, 2 yogurts, 1 ice tea and 1 bottled water . That's a bit steep for a seat yourself quick eat.  If you're ever in the South Bay, hit up "Nick the Greek" for a great tasting gyro meal - it is still my go to for tasty quick Greek food.
author: Connie K.

description: Great place to hang out for lunch with friends . The fries and the chicken wrap was delicious with the garlic sauce on the side . The lamb gyro bowl was amazing too
author: Namrah S.

description:
Very simple menu of 4 items available in sandwich or salad form. I ordered the chicken salad to go. The mix of ingredients was just amazing and added lots of flavour...from the chicken and the dressing to the vegetables and the pieces of orange. Although I would say it was a bit too oily for my taste.

If it's your first time, the greek yogurt and baklava is a must try!
author: Rafic K.

description:
This is the BEST Mediterranean food I've had in the US period. Beats even the most authentic home cooked meals! My brother said it was the closest food he's tasted that compared to overseas.

Atmosphere: crowded! Sunday at 3:30 there's a line out the door! The line takes a while, but once you order it only takes 5-10 minutes for the food to come out. Tip: order a Greek yogurt with baklava while you wait! You won't regret it! 

Greek yogurt with baklava: absolutely the creamiest tart ice cream I've ever had. It's tartness is perfectly balanced by the sweet crispy baklava. It's a match made by heaven. We loved it so much, we came back an hour later for a second one!

Pork shoulder sandwich: extremely juicy! A little greasy for my taste, but never the less delicious! It comes packed with so much meat! It's a big portion and depending on how hungry you are can be shared between two people.

Lamb sandwich: also juicy and delicious! Comes with chunky meat instead of thing strips like many other Mediterranean places. Less greasy in my opinion too!

Fries: even their fries are delicious! Every bite is perfectly crisp on the outside but still soft on the inside. I can't quite explain it but they were the best fries I've ever had.

Overall:
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 5
Taste: 5

Definitely worth the wait! Had to give five stars for the food experience on its own!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Yummm this place is bomb! There's always a line but it goes by pretty quick. You order at the cashier and they give you a number. As for seating, it's first come first serve. It's a cute spot and I definitely dig the vibe there too. The food comes out pretty quick so it's not that long of a wait. 

You can't go wrong either salad or pita but my favorite is the lamb!! So good and the fries. There's list of wine too that pairs well with it. I'll come back here again forsure.
author: Jenn L.

description: Olive oil and sea salt. Could eat 365 days a year.
author: Morgyn T.

description:
Baklava Greek yogurt dessert- that's where it's at! 

Swung in on a random late Sunday afternoon and this place was packed! 

We lucked out and snagged the last two open bar seats and shared the dessert. It was smooth and creamy with the Apple pie flavored topping that was perfect with every bite. 

Can't comment on the rest of their menu but glad I got a chance to try the dessert. I'll have to come back for dinner for a more thorough review.
author: Mandi W.

description: I've tried both their sandwiches and salad bowls and have been impressed with their short menu but really great flavors. It's my healthy choice when I don't want to eat fried dishes. Their sandwich bread is really soft and flavorful. I've usually had the chicken option but I've tasted all and they are great! It's a small restaurant. Very busy most of the time. They have a small outdoor seating.
author: Julia J.

description:
The yummiest salads, Greek fries and Greek yogurt. The staff is always really friendly and happy.
Filipe is the man ! The manager is always really out going as well but I've forgotten his name. 
Best service available with quick, yummy and inexpensive bites. 6 Stars if I could.
author: Lynn H.

description:
Never thought I would enjoy ALL the ingredients in a pre-determined salad as I do with Souvla's chicken salad. The entire thing is a perfect combination of flavor burst in your mouth: 
* Sweet from the oranges
* Savory from the wonderfully seasoned chicken
* Sour kick from the pickled onions 
* Fresh from the kale and other salad mix
* Creamy from the dressing 

The entire thing is delectable and fresh. The oranges have never been sour, always sweet. The kale is never too tough or chewy. The chicken is out of this world. Always so hearty and generous. I love slathering it on a bed of greens. 

Love getting their fries as well. All about balance right? 

Top it off with any of their Greek yogurts. My favorites are the honey and the baklava.

The line is always long, so think about getting it delivered. Still tastes great!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Souvla is one of my go-to spots for salad. I went to this location once for a dinner and my health conscious side fell in love with the food. The biggest issue I had was the lack of seating since the restaurant is small, but now that my lazy self can just get the food delivered on Caviar that's not an issue anymore!

My regular order on Caviar is the date-night meal. You get a choice of two meals, plus an order of fries, and a bottle of wine. Side note - I did the math, you don't get anything cheaper by ordering this package it's just an easy order for those lazy nights you don't want to cook and need a glass (or bottle) of wine. 

My usual order:
- Chicken Salad - love the fresh oranges
- Lamb Salad 
(you can make any of these into a gyro wrap - it's the same toppings)
- Greek Fries are delish
- Bottle of Rose

I also highly recommend their frozen greek yogurt..SO good! Ordered by preference:
- Wildflower honey
- Baklava crumble (it's a bit sweet)
- Olive oil and sea salt
author: Kathy L.

description:
Souvla offers food that doesn't make me feel guilty when I eat it.

Opa +'s!
+ Options are simple and so is the food. The wraps and salads come with different meat choices.
+ Taste. Overall it feels healthy and light which is sometimes the better way to go when you are shopping in Hayes.
+ Speed. They move fast. Be ready with your order and be on the lookout for a place to sit.
+ Greek fries. I have to call it out because they are really good. Not quite like the potatoes I had in Greece but on par.
+ Fro-yo with baklava. Really a nice ending to already a fairly healthy meal.

Ooph -'s!
- Long lines. Unfortunately this plan attracts a crowd even at odd hours. Who eats lunch at 2pm on a Saturday? Apparently everyone.

Souvla serves simple and quality food. It's a nice stop if you don't mind the wait and need to recharge for more shopping on Hayes.
author: Yiven C.

description: Great place to grab lunch and people watch. Great ingredients and bread is delicious!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Souvla is the typical restaurant you'd find in Hayes Valley. Super cute, small, quaint, with a huge line out the door. 

They have great salads, sandwiches, and meats. Nothing feels TOO heavy which is amazing! If ordering for one, their portions are usually too large to order multiple dishes (IE, french fries + salad), and I rarely am able to finish the salad alone. 

I like ordering salads "Greek style" where they will put a few extra fries on top! Leg lamb salad is my favorite, but even the pork shoulder + sweet potato is also delicious!

In term so yogurts, I'm a big of the baklava greek yogurt (another very popular one is the olive oil + sea salt) which IMO blends too many flavors together. I studied abroad in Greek for a summer, and have been hard pressed to find greek yogurt comparable to ones in Athens, but this one certainly hits the mark!

Rating 4/5 because while I will always be a return customer / huge fan, seating is hard to come by and while the food is delicious, its nothing truly to "blow you away".
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Omg I love this place! Delicious salads, reasonably priced. I loved doing pick up here. So easy to order online and they have so many custom options for your salad. It was ready so quickly! I got the chicken salad with fries on top, which was an excellent decision. It was like having delicious croutons - they were even good when they got cold and soggy after a while. Generous portion, I didn't even snack the rest of the night and I wasn't hungry when I woke up. 
I did order the $4 iced tea and I didn't like it. Overpriced and too sweet for me. It's bottled so maybe it would be better poured into a glass with ice. 
Definitely will be returning for the convenience and taste and I'm already worried I'm going to spend too much money here.
author: Emma B.

description: Love Souvla. Fast service, great, healthy food. If your not into healthy they have soft serve, fries, baklava. Haven't had anything here I didn't like.
author: Matthew S.

description: I've been looking forward to going here after reading about it in the paper (yes, an actual old school newspaper).  I had bookmarked it so when we were in the city it was easy to find.  The food is good.   Limited menu of pork, chicken, lamb, or veggie in a sandwich or a salad.  I noticed that most people were having the salad, so I went with it.  Lots of kale, with pea sprouts, radishes, and of course the lamb.  Tasted really fresh.  Meat wasn't as full of flavor as more authentic Mediterranean places.  Ambience is loud.  Not a lot of places to sit so a lot of take outs.  Good if you're in the area but so many other places to try.
author: Ronny T.

description:
I've been wanting to try Souvla since I moved to SF 6 months ago, and I was honestly disappointed. I think the recurring theme here was not enough flavor - the yogurt dipping sauces for the fries (harissa-spices and granch) tasted like plain Greek yogurt, the veg sandwich mostly consisted of thick slices of unspiced potato. 

I really loved the atmosphere of Souvla - they've really nailed the fast casual concept and their ingredients are incredibly fresh. I hope they make some updates to their recipes in the future because I really want to go back and try the frozen Greek yogurt (baklava crumbles and honey, I'm looking at you).
author: Krishna P.

description:
Omg, the frozen yogurt is freaking amazing. We literally drove from Cupertino two days in a row to eat this yogurt (and to go to the Away store down the street). I like every single flavor they have! Super tart and milky, good large portion size, overall just an amazing dessert. 

We also ordered fries and a lamb pita wrap. The meat was well seasoned and not dry, fries were well seasoned as well and piping hot! 

My only complaint is that parking is super difficult in this area and that this restaurant was packed on both Saturday and Sunday. 

So much love for this restaurant!
author: Angela J.

description:
Every time I pass by this place, there's a line out the door. Being the impatient, hangry woman I am, I don't like waiting in lines for food. So here I go, dragging my mom to come have an early dinner with me on a late Tuesday afternoon, and lo and behold! No line! 
Our two chicken gyro-type "sandwiches" and Greek fries came out in less than 5 minutes. The chicken sandwich tasted like a gyro from a more American perspective. If you're looking for the typical chicken kabob-type gyro that has tomatoes, lettuce, and lots of yogurt sauce, it's not what you'll get from Souvla. But despite that, I really enjoyed this unexpected gyro, with its oranges and radishes and all. The pita bread used was also great.
We ordered Greek Fries as well and I don't know about y'all, but for some reason, Mediterranean places make the best fries, and this is no exception. Just get them; they will complete your meal.
And of course we had to try the frozen Greek yogurt! I love baklava, so I could've used some more baklava in it, but that's just me being greedy. The yogurt itself was refreshing, tangy like your favorite 2% original Fage yogurt cup, and after having it, you will never wanna go back to that self-serve froyo again. 

Souvla is wonderful spot in beautiful Hayes Valley if you want a quick, quality bite!
author: M L.

description: This place is terrific.  I went for the chicken sandwich (really a wrap), which was fabulous.  I also tried my friend's Greek fries, also excellent.  Really would like to come back and try the other sandwiches, as well as the desserts.  We ordered our food to go and it came out within 5-10 minutes, though this was not at a peak hour (around 2:15pm).
author: Kirsten P.

description:
Frozen yogurt w/ olive and sea salt. Get it. With extra olive oil. Actually just ask for a cup of olive oil....or maybe that's just me. 

Be prepared to wait, or head in a little earlier than the normal lunch/dinner rush and you should be okay. It's not big, and you order at the counter and then take a number to a table so you're SOL if you can't find a place to sit. That being said, this restaurant model is my favorite. It's casual without being thoughtless, the menu is well edited, and they serve wine and beer to pair with the deliiiiicious food. It's the neighborhood standby you crave. 

I ordered the chicken wrap which I actually did think was somewhat dry, but I like to drench my food in all provided condiments and hot sauces available to me. The chicken was plentiful and fresh however, no skimpy portions here. The ingredients are fresh, salads inventive, you can't go wrong.
author: Lauren M.

description:
food tastes really good but this is for bad customer service at the Hayes location. I got salads for takeout today and not only the cashier was rude to me and rolled his eyes at me multiple times and started talking to the next customer in line when i was not even done he did not asked whether I want my dressing on the salad or on side and when I got home the salad was dry. Honestly the salads here are good for dressing but who wants to pay 13 dollars for a dry salad? I had bought two too. 
second complain: the lady who was preparing my froyos asked me something and since the restaurant was so loud I did not her therefore I just guessed and said what toppings I want and she just yelled at me "do you want lids?"
it wasn't a pleasant experience tbh. I don't understand why they were not nice.
author: Helia S.

description:
I'm on a 4 star rating binge... this place is a solid spot for someone who doesn't get this type of food very often, read: a Midwesterner who eats the same stuff over and over again.  

The fries come out piping hot, be ware or happy, your choice.  

I had the lamb... good flavor, great toppings and a few dip and sauce options. 

I had the beer, which i hadn't had before.  Pretty good, nothing amazing or standout, but it wasn't bad.  

Clean interior and friendly service.  Need a quick, safe place to eat at a reasonable SF price?   Here is the spot.
author: Cory S.

description:
This is a fav spot that friends and I like to go to after service with it being only a 5 min walk from our church. The location is great as it's located along Hayes Valley, and so there's plenty of other options of food and shopping as well. And if Souvla is crowded, there's an outdoor hangout area in Hayes where you can take your food..hopefully with good weather :) If you're looking for a fine-fast Greek restaurant, this is your place! The Hayes Valley location is always pretty crowded, but this Sunday we went wasn't too bad. 

I usually order the chicken or lamb salad, but decided to try the vegetarian salad this time around as I wasn't in a meaty mood that day. The vegetarian salad was really good! It comes with roasted sweet potato, garlic yogurt, chopped kalamata olives, toasted walnuts, pickled red onions, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese. The seasoning was fanastic as usual.. And if you're not a salad person, you can have it sandwich style. I would also suggest ordering their greek fries which is seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, and mizithra cheese. Their fries are delicious, seasoned so well, and also goes really well with sprinking the fries on the salad ;D
author: Jackie C.

description: The vegetable sandwich is the perfect balance of sweet and savory! Service was quick, and seats tend to churn quickly even if they're full when you arrive. They also are kind enough to give you dessert later so your Greek yogurt doesn't melt.
author: Lisa L.

description: Adorable place with unique food. I had the chicken sandwich with the "granch" dressing, cheese, and orange. It was a very interesting combination with the awesome rotisserie chicken. But surprisingly this odd combo worked. They also have hot sauce at the tables which is really good. My friend tried the Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava pieces - I snagged a bite and it was delicious. The tartness of the yogurt with the sweetness of the pieces was a perfect bite, leaving the palate guessing. Definitely a cool spot to check out!
author: Allie P.

description:
Here is a haiku for Souvla:

It's a gassy mess
Feel the Souvla aftermath 
Open the window
author: Ce L.

description: The chicken is very dry and bland flavors, the only saving grace is the yoghurt dessert
author: Ekana K.

description:
Greek meets hipster?
Or something like that. 

A pricey meal for a quick lunch, but it was pretty good. I got the chicken gyro and my partner and I shared the fries. Fries were tasty and crispy. Everything is incredibly fresh, beautifully presented and unique. We thought the pork was okay, but the chicken gyro was yummy. It had slices of orange or some sort of orange citrus fruit in it. We had to add some of the hot sauce for some extra flavor. The portion sizes are deceivingly huge. 

I can totally understand why people like this place, but for me it didn't impress. Definitely worth a try and it may be your jam even though it wasn't mine.
author: Priti K.

description: This place is really great! I got a lamb salad, potatoes, and Greek fries and I was blown away. The food was fresh, well prepared, and genuinely delicious. The Greek fries were a cant miss, will definitely be coming back!
author: Abe M.

description:
TLDR - Overhyped and a little pricey, but a good spot if you're looking for a yummy, healthy meal

If you're looking for a healthy meal, Souvla's salads definitely do the trick. They're tasty and have plenty of protein to fill you up. It's just unfortunate that it costs more to be healthy. The salads are $1 more than the wraps, although my friend said the salads have more protein than the wraps so maybe it's justified. Protein options are pork, chicken or lamb, or sweet potato for veggie.

* CHICKEN SALAD ($14) - 4/5
["granch" dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese]
Decently sized kale salad with a good portion of moist, pulled chicken. The orange and pickled red onion brightened up the salad, and the granch dressing was creamy and tangy but kind of heavy so I'm glad I got it on the side. 

* FRIES ($4) - 3.5/5
[olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, mizithra cheese]
Eat these while they're fresh and warm! They're crisp on the outside, airy and moist on the inside. I would've liked more lemon juice and parsley though. It's disappointing that you have to pay an extra $1 for dipping sauce, but I suppose you can ask for you salad/wrap dressing on the side and use it for the fries as well.

Overall Souvla serves a pretty good salad but I do feel like the place is overhyped. I probably wouldn't come back very often since $14 is pretty steep for a salad I felt like I could have made at home. I do want to try their popular frozen greek yogurt though.
author: Jessie L.

description: Legit downloaded yelp just to write this review. I have never experienced something so amazing before in my life. I ordered the pork sandwich and after taking my first bite I teared up a little. I had mouthgasms running through every tastebud in my mouth. The tears rolled down my face. My girlfriend looked at me like I was crazy but I didn't care. This sandwich has forever changed my life. 11/10 would eat again.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Always delicious, super healthy and clean.
 All the Staff are nice and always helpful. Delivery is fast and high quality. I always order the whole chicken for my parties. Just remember for whole chicken you need to order it around noon and pick it up around 6. Again high quality, super healthy.and good price. I hope they don't raise the price. There is always a line but it goes fast. Also it definitely worth the wait. I eat Souvla once a week and I love it.
Highly recommended.
author: Hani G.

description: If the line that is constantly out the door doesn't tell you how good this place is then idk what will. Food is pretty good chicken and lamb were a little dry but  not to the point it wasn't edible. If you're trying to choose between the fries and oven roasted potatoes go fries!! The fries with the garlic dipping sauce are  Also I like that they have hot sauce at the table already it was so good I even put it on my salad haha.
author: Diane L.

description: Beautiful space and delicious, fresh food.  We wanted to try everything on the menu.  Highly recommend the salad with pork, as well as any of the wraps.  The fries looked amazing - we went with the potatoes, which were great.  Gorgeous outdoor seating as well.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The weeknight line out the door at Souvla caused me to walk by before circling back.  This was a place I'd wanted to try for a long time and why not let that time be now?  Smart choice, as that line is where you place your order and I learned that it moves quickly.  

Souvla's simple concept is killing it right now.  With 3 SF locations they're on the tip of becoming that thing that yelpers hate, a "chain'", but actually they're the type of chain I welcome.  I was quite happy with my salad made with free range chicken, pickled red onions, pea shoots, and more ($13), and their frozen Greek yogurt ($4-$5) with assorted intriguing toppings is a perfect inexpensive dessert.    

The concept here is straightforward, with chicken, lamb, pork, and vegetables being offered in (lavash) sandwich or salad format, all in the $10-$14 range.  The menu sources the origins of the proteins so you're not just staring down at "pork" but rather, "American Homestead Pork Shoulder".  It's the sort of virtuous menu which gives the impression you're getting fresh, responsibly sourced products.  The whole place, especially with the crowds it attracts, feels very "now".

Souvla's formula is one that several other small, local chains are offering.  Though completely different, the price point and service model call to mind The Grove and Blue Barn Gourmet, both local small chain enterprises.  Of the 3, I liked Souvla the best as result of their style, their menu, and their food.  

Did I like everything?  My dining partner ordered his salad with a protein of Superior Farms Lamb Leg which I tasted and didn't at all care for.  It took him until midway through his meal to reach the same conclusion.  Neither of us would again order the lamb.  

Souvla is a vibrant hive of activity.  I'd happily return for another salad (this time off-menu "Greek-style" which translates into "topped with fries") and frozen Greek yogurt.
author: Tracey A.

description: I love love this place!!! It took me half an hour walk just to find it. It's the best salad I have ever tasted here in San Francisco - super fresh, delicious Mediterranean  salad. The combination of all the veggies  + the salad dressing is very satisfying !!! Great place to hang out with friends . I will definitely go back soon and try their dessert.
author: Loraine C.

description:
The chicken salad is easily my favorite salad of all time. And the Greek yogurt with either baklava or olive oil and sea salt is the stuff of dreams. 

Order via Caviar if you're worried about time. You can still dine in the restaurant.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I was dying to try this place when I first found it on Yelp. It's only a few blocks down from my apartment which is really great. I got the chicken gyro sandwich and my boyfriend, the lamb. Both sandwiches were very delicious. We also got a side of Greek fries. Honestly, we could've shared one sandwich because the sandwiches were so large!

I really like the idea that you can get any of the sandwich options but turn it into a salad. Of course on my first go, I HAD to get the sandwich but next time I will try the salad. I also love that they service beer and wine.

The place is really small and always has a ton of people so it was great to go for lunch. They also sell frozen Greek yogurt with a few different toppings. The topping options are: Baklava pieces, tart cherries or olive oil with salt. I was way too full the first time but one night we stopped by after dinner for dessert. I got the Froyo with baklava and my boyfriend the olive oil w/salt. Mine was definitely the winning choice. I don't even normally like baklava but this dessert was SO satisfying. The olive oil and salt wasn't layered so all the salt was all on top which kind of blew your palette away. I've had ice cream with olive oil and salt before and it was damn delicious so  I think with a little tweaking it could be really good.

Definitely recommend!
author: Katlyn H.

description:
I live in SF & 1st time here. They have 3 locations. 
I was excited to try it. It was so delicious and staff is so friendly and efficient. Open seating. Lunch time rush but  I still got  a seat right away. My food came fast. I ordered pork sandwich $12, Greek fries $4. and Greek beer. $6. If you want extra sauces for fries they are available for $1. Extra. 
I would definitely recommend this place.
author: v v.

description:
I over-order every time I come here and don't regret it. 

MUST TRY:
lamb/pork sandwich
lamb/pork salad
veggie salad (the sweet potatoes complement so well with the olive pieces)
bottle of rosé (very affordable & delicious)
Greek fries 
frozen yogurt (I like mine plain because it's sweet as is. I feel like the cherry sauce, baklava, and/or honey makes it too sweet).

I do not enjoy their chicken here. It's a bit too dry. I do like coming to this location but the one on Divisadero is bit more spacious.
author: Jenn H.

description:
First time here this past Sunday! Ordered the lamb sandwich, chicken sandwich, pork salad, lemon chicken soup and fries. Best item was the pork salad. Great taste and fresh ingredients. Soup was good and also the fries. I wish the fries had just a little more cheese though. Unfortunately, both sandwiches were very dry. I took one bite of the lamb sandwich and completely lost interest 
:( The bread AND meat were D.R.Y.
author: E E.

description:
Zorba would be proud!

OK, I know! Anthony Quinn was not Greek! He was actually born in Chihuahua, Mexico, but that is besides the point! The food that they serve you at Soulva may not be "authentic" Greek food you would find in some family owned Greek restaurant on some Greek Island, but it sure tastes good! I was there for a quick lunch and had their Superior Farms Lamb Leg Salad and boy did I enjoy it! I would've loved to try one of their Frozen Greek Yogurts too, but I ran out of time. If you are in Hayes Valley and hungry, you should consider Soulva. The food is good.
author: Afshin A.

description:
I came to Souvla on two separate occasions. 

The first time a friend introduced me here for weekday lunch. There was a line but wait was less than 10 minutes. 

I had the rotisserie chicken salad and I have to say, it's one of my favorite salads of all times! I never had fruit in my salad that I actually liked, but this was different. Orange slices paired with chicken created a nice acidity with some sweetness. The salad comprised of kale, pickles, and feta cheese (I think?). Seating was hard to find, so we ate at a nearby park. A little pricey for a salad though. 

The second time I came with 5 other friends. My boyfriend and I tried the pork shoulder wrap and fries with garlic greek yogurt. The pork wrap was meh as it was wrapped in a really dry pita. Even the veggies and sauce couldn't make up for it :P

The fries on the other hand were marvelous but the star was that garlic dip! It was so rich and creamy it felt like I was heavy cream + sour cream. Dip your hot fries in it and you won't regret it ;) 

I sampled the baklava and honey frozen greek yogurt from friends and it was delicious as well! The greek yogurt was different than what I expected as it was tart and mildly salty. The baklava and honey complemented it really well though. 

In summary, the chicken salad, baklava/honey greek yogurt, and the fries WITH garlic yogurt dip is the way to go.
author: Alice L.

description:
This was the perfect meal to have after a wine happy hour. The place was absolutely packed at 930pm on a Thursday night. I got the Veg sandwich, my friend got the chicken sandwich, and we split Greek fries. The sandwiches were awesome, especially the chicken one. The fries were addictive too. I expected them to be overloaded with toppings but they were not at all. 

Don't expect to get seated here. We were lucky to find a little seat outside right before we got our food but a lot of people were eating standing up or took away elsewhere. Highly recommend!
author: Grace A.

description:
What a cute, trendy, and tasty Greek gem in Hayes Valley!  

Don't be fooled by the small menu (mainly consists of wraps or salads, froyo, and drinks)- these dishes pack a lot of flavors.  

The chicken salad option (with granch dressing, fennel, pickled red onion, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese) was very tasty- there was a good balance between the amount of chicken and greens.  Granch dressing was a bit rich for me, but the salad was very filling and satisfying.  We've also ordered the fries on the side- very flavorful (especially with the cheese sprinkled on top) and we were looking at the bottom of the cone getting the scraps by the end; it was that good.  My friend had ordered the lamb bowl, which was also tasty though the lamb was a bit chewy.

If you can only get one thing from Souvla, it is the baklava frozen yogurt-  this is one of the best froyos I've had in the city so far.  Love the contrast of the tart froyo with the super sweet baklava and honey topping- the baklava is rather sweet on its own.  My friend and I shared this after our salads- it might be a bit much to each alone after a meal.

FYI, being a smaller restaurant, most likely you will have to wait for a table and there will be times where you might have to share your table with someone else.  Service otherwise was super quick, in fact so quick that our food was prepared before we got a table!  Luckily, they held on to it and gave us a hot fresh batch of fries when we were finally able to sit down (we waited 10 min on a Thursday night at 8pm).  

If you are looking for a quick, trendy, Greek place to eat, I highly recommend trying out Souvla!
author: Audrey H.

description: My favorite place all I have to say is go there once and u will keep returning. Olive oil and salt Greek yogurt and the veg salad are my favorites. I literally crave this place. If ur in the city divisidero and hays in San Fran
author: Lika G.

description:
I tried Souvla for my first time last summer and was not very impressed with the food. I got the lamb sandwich and dined-in. The lamb from the sandwich wasn't for me - I don't know if they were having an off day, as the lamb is quite frequently raved about, but for me it was dry and almost too gamey for me to enjoy. I gave leftovers to a friend.

However, I recently ordered Souvla via Caviar for dinner because I was craving a salad. I can't tell you how many times I've walked by and seen people devouring such yummy looking salads, so I figured I'd give it another shot. I'm really glad I did. 

I ordered the chicken salad in addition to a cup of the frozen yogurt drizzled with sour cherry topping (had trouble deciding between that and baklava crumble). It was the perfect meal and I ate all of it. Like, every single morsel. 

The salad was super fresh, the pieces of chicken were plentiful and moist, the orange in the salad was such a complementary flavor to the savory chicken and tangy feta. I really enjoyed it. Then, I ate my frozen yogurt, which I had stored in the freezer while I was eating my salad. For me, I know a food is either really good or really bad when I put it in my mouth and squeal. Thank goodness it was the former. The yogurt is so light and the consistency is perfect - soft and creamy without being runny at all. The sour cherry topping is something that I will definitely get again - perfect amount of sweetness and tartness when paired with the yogurt. 

Now I crave this meal on the regular. Will be back soon. Thank you, Souvla!
author: Krista H.

description:
I ordered takeout before they closed on a Thursday night expecting them to be annoyed because they close in 5 minutes, but instead I was surprised by the long line that went outside the door. Apparently they have this amazing frozen yogurt. By the way, it was the first day again where it is sprinkling in San Francisco and people were still waiting so I think I need to go back and try it.

I ordered the "Superior Farms Lamb Leg" Sandwich ($13) It was good. I wouldn't say the most amazing mostly because the lamb was much chewier than other places I have gone to with falafel type sandwiches. This could have also been because it wasn't fresh. The sauce was amazing, and combined with their hot sauce it was way better.

My boyfriend ordered the "Mary's Free-Range Chicken Sandwich" ($12) I took a bite and thought it was verrryyy good. The chicken was somewhat shredded, and it was soft, and combined with the sauce.. yum! Also his sandwich came with fries inside of them, and that definitely added to the goodness of it. (I also just love fries sooo)

We also ordered a side of Greek fries with their sauce ($4 + $1). Pretty solid. Again, they weren't fresh so I'm sure they're better than what I experienced.

This is definitely a place I would go to again. I would love to explore their menu a little more too!
author: Kassie E.

description:
This is a cute little spot in the mission. I read so much about the Greek Fries, that I finally headed over to try them and wasn't disappointed! 

For $5 you get a decent quantity of french fries, that are uniquely seasoned. For an additional $1 you can get any of the three dipping sauces- I got the "granch" which was refreshing and went well with the fries.
author: Sonia D.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Breakfast pita sandwich- mostly egg and rice. Too much carb-on-carb. There was also shredded chicken, but it tasted kind of dry and didn't taste much like rotisserie chicken.

Lamb salad- lots of fresh veggies, good amount of lamb. 

Baklava crumble frozen yogurt- yum! A cup of perfectly tart frozen yogurt topped with baklava crumbles and honey.
author: Alice T.

description:
Time: Lunch
Ordering: did online ordering while walking 10mins to get there. 3 wraps were ready upon arrival. 
Food:  review only for lamb Gyro.
 quality pita, quality veggies and great hot sauce
3 stars because the meat was not organic and overpriced. Another overhyped restaurant on Yelp.
author: Neil R.

description: The hype here is heavy, the reality is good but nothing spectacular. Got the popular chicken salad and fries, was into it but left kinda disappointed with how highly I have heard of it. I've had similar plates that were less expensive but better tasting. I'd come back with a friend but wouldn't hand-pick this place.
author: Cody J.

description:
I can't get enough Souvla! I've tried all of their salad options and like that they all are slightly different - the pork and chicken are probably my favorites. The juicy potatoes are crazy good, as is the frozen yogurt - baklava for a classic Greek flavor, olive oil and salt for something slightly different.

Yes, this location is on the smaller side and I've often had to wait for a table, but I've never been stranded long and always have been able to find something before my food arrives. 

Plus they are on Caviar! Perfect meal for when you have a crazy day and need something yummy delivered.
author: Holly L.

description:
Souvla makes the best salad I've ever reluctantly put into my mouth.

Probably because it's covered in a generous amount of yummy roasted lamb bits and yogurt sauce.

If you're in the area, Souvla's a great option if you feel like grabbing a healthy (or at least healthy-feeling) soup, salad, or sandwich.  Not anything super revolutionary, but fresh solid Mediterranean flavors.  I had the lamb, but the chicken fire-roasting in the back looked very tempting.  Each choice of protein comes with its own combination of salad toppings, but they'll switch out the proteins at your request.

Frozen yogurt is also really good and relatively guilt free (again, can't speak for it actually being healthy, but "yogurt" sounds good for you right?).  The baklava topping was a bit pasty for my taste, I was expecting some of the flakiness of the puff pastry to be preserved.  Will try the olive oil and sea salt next time.

Tips and Tricks
-If you eat outside, be prepared for random people coming up to you asking what you're eating or if it's good.  Real live yelp reviews required
-Always get dessert!
-Actually gets really packed at dinner after 6
author: Jessica L.

description:
Really irked by how an employee treated us when we came to eat. Brought a friend from LA because I love Souvla and knew she would too. 

We ordered to-go because all the seats were jam packed and couldn't find a spot. After we ordered, spots outside opened up and we sat outside. The employee who came outside gave us our food and glared at us "didn't you guys take this to go??" Like he didn't want us eating outside or eating here at all because we ordered to go. I quickly said, "oh we are going to eat a little and leave." Then he doesn't say anything and stormily cleans up the dishes beside us. 

I'm bothered by this because we felt uncomfortable and uneasy like we weren't allowed to dine on premise. We would have said "dining here" if there had been spots open. We sat for two minutes and left to eat in the park. 

I LOVE the food don't get me wrong, but it's Friday and I just wanted to enjoy a day with my friend. His unwelcoming attitude bothered us for the rest of the day.
author: Emily F.

description: Love the salad! Greek yogurt is a must order!!!!! In here, you can have not only healthy but also yummy food!
author: Fu-Feng W.

description: My husband and I heard about this place. We were in the area over the weekend and tried its salad. There was a line but it was very fast. I ordered chicken salad and my husband got lamb salad. To our surprise they were not as good as we expected. The salad size was reasonable with a variety of vegetables. The downside was the dressing. It was too greasy and unhealthy for us. We preferred that the dressing was not mixed and came aside the salad. The chicken was greasy too and didn't taste good. Overall, the food was not very special and still expensive.
author: Niousha V.

description: Great quality! Stopped in from dc with some friends and came here for a quick bite and it's surprised me with more. Great atmosphere, lighting (I'm huge on lighting lol) and AMAZING food. Had the lamb salad and my friends all agreed their dishes were great. Along with the wine
author: Mitch R.

description:
I think the other location is a bit more spacious. The taste and quality is equally excellent. The food comes out fairly quickly and portions are more than sufficient for a meal.

Definitely recommend.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Best salad to ever exist. I always get the chicken salad with light dressing and always leave a happy customer :)

PLEASE OPEN A LOCATION DOWNTOWN!!!! This would shine amidst the average salad options we have over here
author: Laura D.

description: Simple menus are the best! Souvla is on the main strip in Hayes valley offering fast and fresh food. They have a few protein options which you can get in either a sandwich or salad. I went with chicken salad and it was scrumptious! Portions are generous so it is pretty filling. I also tried the Greek chicken soup which was great.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
I love this place. I've been on multiple occassions - on a weekday for lunch, on a weekend for dinner, just dessert - through busy crowds and less busy times, and this place is consistently delicious and filling. 

Things I've tried before:
MAINS:
- Pork salad ($12) - The pork salad has your traditional greek flavors- the tomato, onion, and feta are rich and flavorful - making this a hearty salad guaranteed to fill you up. 5/5
- Chicken salad ($13)- The chicken salad is a little bit lighter flavor wise- probably because the dressing and cheese are less intense and the citrus helps cut some of the richness- but still filling for sure! 5/5
- Lamb salad- I don't even like lamb much, but I've tried it before, and the meat is good quality.

Have yet to try a sandwich here, but heard that they are really delicious and filling.Portions are generous here, and they do not skimp on the meat- the $ you're paying is worth it. Getting it in a to-go box is a good move though salads can get kind of soggy after so don't wait too long to finish it later. 

--
DESSERT: I LOVE THEIR FROYO (and it's so reasonably priced!) 

Olive oil +salt ($4) - I had it here the first time I came to Souvla, and it's hard for me to order anything else - it's my absolute favorite. It's a sort of savory sweetness- the salt actually brings out the natural sweetness of the oil and yogurt. 5/5 - would recommend you try it once even if you think it sounds weird. 

The baklava one and sour cherry ones are good too - I actually didn't love the baklava as much as I thought I would - overpowers the yogurt itself a little bit in my opinion. Sour cherry is solid, but not super memorable compared to the Olive oil haha.

Also if you're getting froyo in addition to your dinner, you can ask them to make it on the spot after so your froyo doesn't melt while you are waiting around.
author: Kristie M.

description:
What I like the most about here is that the menu isn't all over the place. They do a few things and they do it well. 
You can choose from pork, chicken, lamb, and veggies and have it as either a wrap or a salad. The salad usually costs a dollar more than the wrap.  My facorite is the chicken salad which comes on a huge bed of kale. It's surprising how large and filling the salad is, especially for the price. I would say the salad is tastier and a better value than what you would find at more salad-specific stores. The chicken wrap is good as well. It is more filling because of the pita, but also a bit greasy. 
The fries here are AMAZING. Perfectly crunchy and seasoned and there are a lot of them too. For another dollar you can ask for a dipping sauce. Harissa mayo is very good. 
Drink-wise they have a large selection of beer, wine, and nonalcoholic drinks. I wanted something and the cashier told me that the cherry soda is quite sweet so I went with the Greek iced tea which came out of a bottle (they don't brew it themselves). It tasted like an herbal Arnold Palmer kinda. Not bad but nothing to write home about. 
The only gripe I have about this place is how long the line can get on weekends, but I guess that's a testament to how good this place is.  All in all Silva has great food at a great value in a great location. What more can you ask for?
author: Amy X.

description: Cashier girl is horrendous bad attitude and bad service please hire people who want to work
author: John N.

description: Nice healthy Mediterranean food. Not salty or fatty. Portions are pretty big. They have a nice patio in the back.
author: Dao C.

description:
Okay, I really wanna give this 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up only bc the yogurt dessert is that good. 

But let me tell you about my real issue with Souvla. Listen, I've been here a handful of times. I know this is a personal problem, but seriously, they're catering to an eclectic SF crowd. It's Mediterranean food and they don't have a single seafood item on their menu?! Not even fish?! 

If I wanted to be a full on vegetarian, I would. But I'm not. I eat seafood. So I really, really wish they had some sort of a fish dish here. It's my only ask. I've had the veggie bowl and the veggie wrap and I'm not a huge fan. 

BUTTTT I have had their baklava Greek yogurt dessert. Omgggg. Heart. It. Seriously, it's that good. I only come here now for the desserts now. I'm still on strike over their non-seafood friendly menu. Other than that, lines get crazy. It's always packed. But somehow the line always moves pretty quick and there's always miraculously a spot to sit, even when you thought there'd be no chance. 4 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place never disappoint. Food always the same. Fresh and tasty. The yogurt always something to look forward to after.
author: raimundo t.

description: Was walking around SF on a hot day after a night out, and I think this greek frozen yogurt saved my life. It's thick and cold with a not-too-sweet taste (still enough to replenish your blood sugar ), so you can actually eat the whole cup without feeling weighed down. The baklava crumbles on top were just enough for some added authentic flare. Can't go wrong here- so refreshing.
author: Bella W.

description: Smells heavenly, love their chicken but find the lamb to be a little gamy the past few times I've gone.
author: Joshua Z.

description:
5 stars for the greek frozen yogurt alone - please do yourself a favor by doing so! Healthy and delicious, you can't go wrong. 

Like all locations, Souvla is consistently good but never blows me away with the food itself. I've had the wraps and salads and while everything is very fresh and the meat is tasty, it isn't super inspiring. However, it is consistent, healthy and clean so I find myself coming back from time to time. 

For food, I prefer any of the salads to the wraps. The wraps are relatively small with not too many ingredients.
author: Claudia C.

description: This place is fabulous. Food is amazing and customer service is excellent. If you want to stop by for lunch during the week give yourself extra time since it's always busiest during lunch hour. Even if you have to wait it's totally worth it. I recommend adding the chicken to the vegetarian salad. And, don't leave without trying the dessert.
author: Isela F.

description:
I absolutely love this place. My staples are the "sandwiches" (gyros) and the frozen yogurt.

The chicken gyros and lamb gyros both have a great mix of vegetables, sauce, but the real star is the meat - it's consistently tender and flavorful, and the portion is generous. When I'm in the mood for frozen yogurt, I get the yogurt with Cretan honey. It's absolutely incredible and I've never had a froyo quite like it.
author: Vaibhav M.

description:
Some of the highest quality fast casual I've had in San Francisco.  They have a pretty simple menu with lamb, chicken or pork in a sandwich or salad form; they really focus on doing those things well.  Limited seating so hopefully luck is on your side, but at least there is a nearby park to eat at if you must take your food to go.  

Lamb Sandwich: In San Francisco, my biggest complaint about a lamb shawarma or gyro sandwich is that the meat isn't properly crisped then thinly sliced when it should be.  The lamb here unabashedly comes in tender chunks without any pretense of trying to be a shawarma/gyro and I'm perfectly fine with that.  It's super tender and bursting with flavor.  Plus the generously creamy harissa yogurt sauce just takes it to the next level.

Chicken Salad: I'm really not a salad fan, but this salad could change me.  For one, they let meat, creamy sauce and cheese dominate the salad with veggies just making a guest appearance.  And then the chicken itself is heavenly.  Salty, cheesy, juicy, tender.  And the portion is ginormous.

Greek Fries: Thick cut and crispy all around.  Not as mind-blowing as the mains, but still solid.
author: Adam B.

description:
My favorite restaurant in all of SF. Amazing quality food, always delicious,  such unique flavor combinations, fresh CA twist on greek food. Plus great location, fun spot, kind staff

Favorite items
-veggie salad (the sweet potato with all those yummy ingredients!)
-greek fries + greek ranch -(i dream about these)
-frozen green yogurt + baklava topping
author: Nazlee H.

description:
I was excited to check out Souvla since I love Mediterranean food, but it wasn't the food that knocked my socks off - it was the wine! The Greek white they have is so delicious, I asked about purchasing a bottle at the counter. Not only was this possible, but they also sold me a bottle at cost. Amazing. I can't wait to crack that baby open. 

I had a chicken gyro in a lamb set-up - that is, everything in the lamb gyro except for lamb, sub-in chicken. It was okay but I honestly wasn't wowed. The fries, on the other hand, were fantastic. And I would love to try that frozen Greek yogurt with baklava. 

I'd like to check this place out again on a future trip to SF. The salads looked delish and I think that might be my order next time. And that wine. Obviously.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Souvla is fast becoming my post Sunday morning yoga/Pilates/Bootcamp meal of choice. The sandwich is meaty and bready and oily enough to quench that post-workout thirst, and its proximity to coffee (Ritual) and juice (Juice Shop) does not hurt.

Tip: get your own order of the garlic sauce.

Five Stars!
author: James G.

description:
its one of many cuisines that hasn't been given a contemporary touch, and souvla has finally given greek food what its been missing. many souvlaki joints growing up still look the same today as it did 30-40 years ago, some continue to stay open cause of the people in the neighborhood, or the case of my all time fave in front of MSG closed down (https://tinyurl.com/ycuro2rt), best white sauce ever that I can't find anywhere else. 

souvla lamb gyro isn't on a vertical spit and doesn't have the typical gyro V stack which is good cause the gyro stack can be mixed with other types of meat, with souvla it's all lamb. 

the lamb was hand chopped vs stripped sliced and this is where the V stack is a little better because every bite of the pita to the last has meat. regardless of the bite to meat ratio the lamb had great natural flavor on its own and was seasoned well, and the toppings even with the "spiking and pickling" was very greek.

the yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey is something classic and given a bit of contemporary touch, and it was cool they used the infamous nyc to go coffee cups. i could eat that all year regardless of weather for a sweet treat.


only downside to souvla. when it's busy like the night we came there are no tables to be had. many diners treat it as a reservation eatery so they camp even when their meal is done. if it was summer no big whoop people can go to an outdoor table or stoop. we finally did get a bar table outside but halfway through the meal the lamb and fries got cold. 

even with the long wait for a table and the food getting cold it didn't sour the experience at souvla. we talked about it after that they would do well anywhere and hopefully they expand beyond SF and the bay.
author: NYSD G.

description:
There's always lines outside Souvla but there were still spots available at the communal tables and benches during dinner time. The prices are a little high for a casual restaurant but well worth it for the good quality meats. The decoration inside is cute and the service is really nice.

I got the lamb salad ($14) since the lamb here is my favorite meat but the chicken is really great too! The salad is served in a huge bowl with cucumber, radish, onion, and cheese. I didn't even finish it because they gave so much. 

We also got a side of the juicy potatoes ($4) which has this amazing soft texture because it's been soaked in rotisserie drippings. The frozen greek yogurt here is addicting! Perfectly creamy and not too heavy. I got the baklava crumbles and honey syrup ($5) which was very sweet so wouldn't recommend this if you don't want something overly rich.

Overall this is one of my favorite places to have for lunch or dinner! Definitely try the lamb and frozen yogurt!
author: Linda X.

description:
I ordered the breakfast sandwich (pita w/egg, tomato, onion, garlic yogurt, avgolemono sauce) w/lamb (chicken and pork also available). The pita was fluffy and thick, and the lamb was juicy and flavorful w/o much of the stink of lamb meat that many do not like.

Moreover, the breakfast sandwich has two distinct flavor profiles that mix well. The first flavor profile resembles that of a breakfast burrito; the egg, lamb, tomato, and onion taste savory balanced by a touch of tartness and acidity. The garlic yogurt, lamb, tomato, and onion taste like a normal pita. Different bites of the sandwich gave different ratios of those profiles, which I enjoyed.

I also ordered fries w/harissa spiked yogurt. The fries tasted like standard (for restaurants) fries w/fragrant oil and crumbled cheese, and the harissa gave a contrasting hint of sharp spice.

The service was quite fast; I received my order in 5 minutes.
author: Justin S.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening. Lot's of people mingling, talking, and eating. Wonderful atmosphere, but hard to talk with your companion among all the other chatter. 

I tried the fries, which were excellent. Definitely choose a dipping sauce, as it adds to the flavor. As I only wanted a little something, this was more than enough. Wish I had tried the yogurt. I did have a bite of the pork sandwich. My friend hated it, but the bite I had was fine. 

Definitely will be going back. And wonderful that there is the park nearby to take food to once the weather begins heating up.
author: Janice O.

description:
i've been to souvla before, devoured (and loved and had my sweet potato world rocked) by the sweet potato salad, but i didn't have the stomach space for frozen yogurt during that first visit. so the opportunity popped up for dessert again (when doesn't it?), and i had the frozen yogurt with baklava.
 
the yogurt is very similar to the plain tart flavors at frozen yogurt shops. it's creamy and tangy and not too sweet, which pairs perfectly with the honey drizzled on top and the soft, sticky baklava smacked on the side of the yogurt. it feels worth, since i've easily paid this amount ($5) for a much smaller amount of specialty ice cream.
author: Heather F.

description: Solid fresh cheap eats in SF which is a rarity. The line moves quickly and the wait is well worth the investment. Love that they understand their niche and don't have waiter service.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
You choose a protein (or veggie) then a preparation of salad or sandwich.

FYI, it's not a typical gyro.  Meats are slow roasted, but not carved off a loaf on a vertical rotisserie.
 
In my pita sandwich, chunks of lamb were falling-off-the bone soft, with delicious braised flavor - perfectly tender and juicy!  So good, I'd eat just the meat and the bread, forgoing the harissa-yogurt sauce, feta, pickled onions, radishes and cucumbers.

I would like to try the fries served with meat drippings.  Sounds fantastic!
author: Sondra H.

description:
Souvla is my go-to for casual weeknight dinners with a friend or three when I'm trying to eat good food without blowing my entire budget on a single meal.

The menu is fairly basic: your choice of pork, chicken, lamb, or sweet potato in your choice of salad or sandwich. Both are excellent. I usually order chicken, largely because of the aesthetic window of rotisserie chickens spinning on the back wall (also because it is usually tender and delicious) but the pork and lamb options are also solid. You can't go wrong with any of the meats. I typically order salad so that I can feel healthy enough to follow it with frozen Greek yogurt. The baklava crumble & honey topping is a delightful conglomeration of textures and flavors. I would also recommend the olive oil and sea salt.

Be prepared to wait, or plan to arrive a bit earlier or later than the standard lunch or dinner rush. You order at the cash register and they give you a number, which you can take to a table to wait (if you are lucky enough to find an empty one or stealthy enough to snag a seat as the previous patrons finish). After many visits, I've observed that the line typically gets longer on the hour, especially if you are going at a peak time (e.g. Friday or Saturday dinner).
author: Kristen G.

description:
One of my favorite Greek places to get my lamb wrap! Everything from the atmosphere, decor, service & food is perfecto. Located in the cutest area in Hayes Valley. Totally recommended to go to this area for a date night *wink wink* or a nice dinner night with a group of friends! 

My favorite thing to get here is the Superior Farms Lamb Leg Wrap which consists of Harissa spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, feta, and pickled red onions. Doesn't that sound amazing? It tastes as good as it sounds! The lamb meat is made to perfection with tenderness & juiciness. Nothing about it was overwhelming and it was very flavorful. This itself is $13 which is a bit pricey but I felt like it definitely was worth it. My tummy was happy. 

I've also tried the Greek fries ($4) which was crunchy but not something I would get regularly. It was well seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, and cheese! Everything with cheese is good to me. For an extra $0.50, you can add this deliciousness inside your wrap! 

The frozen Greek yogurt ($5) is one of the most popular items here! I got mine with honey with baklava crumbles it was so good! It has a tart & creaminess to it which makes it well worth! 

Overall, great food & ambiance. Only docked a star off for the wraps being on the pricier side. Definitely one of my favorite places to go to in the area. 

Tip: try the hot sauce with everything! What doesn't taste good with a little spice?
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Not bad! If you're in the neighborhood and looking for a quick dinner, then this is the place! 

I met a friend for dinner last night, and I arrived a bit early so I had a glass of rosè. Their house rosè was good, not the best, but still good. It comes with a wine glass and a copper mug, and for about $10 a glass, you certainly get what you pay for in terms of quantity! I had about two full glasses with a single purchase, and it made waiting for my friend all the more bearable. 

This restaurant is self-seating & self-ordering, so I waited in line and snagged a table outside as soon as I could. One of my qualms about this restaurant is that there aren't enough tables. I'd say the restaurant could seat about 40 people comfortably, and after that it would get very cramped. I was lucky enough to get a table when I did, otherwise I dunno what I would've done! 

When my friend came she and I took turns to stand in line and order, for fear of losing our table. She had the vegetarian salad and I had the pork sandwich with a side of fries that came with garlic yogurt. We dug into our food, and finished most of it. I wasn't too impressed with my sandwich. My friend said her salad was fine, but I think it's hard to judge a restaurants quality of food simply by their salads. The fries along with the garlic yogurt sauce were amazing! We both finished the order, and raved about it afterwards. The fries were slightly greasy and crunchy and hot, and paired with the sauce it was soooo good. 

To sum up, if you're in the neighborhood give this place a try. It's alright, I've had better Greek food over at Bursa in West Portal-best sandwiches ever. However, this place is still good and has a nice vibe. Staff were very nice and accommodating, and the long lines were always nice to see. Takeout seems to be the better option here, as the majority of people I saw in the restaurant would come in and leave with their bags of food. I don't think I'll be back, but it's nice to have in the back of my mind in case I want something different while in that area.
author: Taylor M.

description:
This place is fantastic, I would eat here every week if I could and it's one of the better places to eat in Hayes Valley.

You basically pick your choice of protein (chicken, lamb, pork, or roasted sweet potato) and get it as a wrap or a salad - it's a slightly small menu but it's relatively healthy and the options are all good, so you can't really go wrong. The salads are a bit on the pricey side, and it's usually around $14 for the chicken, but for the quality and quantity of salad, I find it's worth it.
