The Mary's Free Range chicken salad is one of my top 3 salads in San Francisco (up there with the Plant Organic kale salad and the OMG Omega salad from Sweetgreen). It has their "Granch" dressing which is made with Greek yogurt, fennel. pickled red onion, and cheese over a mix of kale & romaine. The chicken is fresh rotisserie chicken so no cold, bland chicken here. The whole salad comes together wonderfully with a lot of textures and flavor and they are pretty generous with the chicken. I normally ask for dressing on the side since a lot of salads tend to be overdressed, but I don't normally find the salads here overdressed.

The frozen Green Yogurt froyo is also amazing - it's tangy and sweet at the same time and pairs perfect with the toppings. My favorite topping is the baklava crumble and honey syrup. It's worth the $4-5 splurge for this treat.

The lines around peak lunch and dinner hours can be quite long, and there isn't a ton of seating inside, so be prepared to wait and to also take your food outside to Patricia's Green to eat. You'll have to exercise patience to get your food and maybe a table, but it's worth it for the salads. I always crave salads from this place - it's one of my favorites!
author: Christina L.

description:
Simple menu. Always fresh. Go-to lunch spot. 
Don't leave without the Greek frozen yogurt! I love it with the sour cherry syrup but topped with baklava is a close second...currently wondering if they'd do both. And salivating. Eat here! If I had only had more than 2 thumbs to put up...
author: Brenda R.

description: Chicken salad deserves the hype! The fries with the garlic dipping sauce was unforgettable. I'd like to come back to try the frozen yogurt next time..
author: Grace L.

description: My daughter brought me here this evening for dinner. The service was fast and the food, great. We each had the lamb/ hers in a sandwich, mine in a salad. I love lamb and the meat was yummy.
author: Monica T.

description:
this is really close to my home.
5 minutes walking and $15.00 is all I need.

I had the lamb leg sandwich / gyro and a small bottle of Greek soda.
the pita was kinda dry but the meat was tender and flavorful.
it's a definitely neighborhood favorite.
you'll feel comfortable being here and saying hi to everybody.
cozy & homey.
author: Rudy H.

description: Souvla is located in a great part of town; the food is great, and the ingredients are all so fresh-however the portions are small. A must try, but beware it is incredibly hard to find parking, but then again it is SF.
author: Israel Y.

description:
Good food generally but very sloppy operation for takeout. It's a shame because it could be great if they cared a little more.

Repeatedly messes up orders, don't count on receiving exactly what you want. 

Also sloppy on food.
-Meat often has bone/cartilage/tendon/excessive fat. -Salad often has the inedible base rib of the greens. 
-Dressing is basically 90% oil and they put too much - stick with the yogurt sauces (which are delicious)
author: Andre N.

description:
5 stars for the greek yogurt topped with olive oil and sea salt! The froyo was creamy, but not very sweet or tangy.which went really well with the savory elements of olive oil / flaked sea salt combo. I am still dreaming of this dessert from Chicago! 

Lamb gyro was good too, but the meat was under seasoned. The hot sauced help, but the lamb should be seasoned with additional salt and herbs. I see most people ordered salad here... perhaps that's the thing to get next time.
author: Lina W.

description: Casual Greek spot with yummy food! There is usually a line out the door, but it moves pretty quickly. Love their avgolemono soup and chicken salad! Greek fries are pretty basic, but also good.
author: Lillian B.

description: YES to everything about Souvla! Love that they also have their spitfire roasting their meat. I have yet to try their other menu options - especially the lamb - but I am in love with their chicken salad. The chicken tastes super fresh, and it's well-spiced without being too salty. I love that the salad incorporates fresh orange slices and pickled onions, both of which pair nicely with the yogurt dressing.
author: Connie X.

description: I love Souvla!! The storefront is adorable and food is amazing! I always get the lamb salad, I need to branch out but it's so good I don't want anything else! One day I'll get a sandwich, but I just love how much food you get with the salad! Just try not visit during their busy times. It's crowded AF and they don't put as much love into your food when it's busy.
author: Amber L.

description: Super bustling and busy. Great food that came out quick with a cute atmosphere and great interior finishout.
author: Trent W.

description: I absolutely love this retaurant! It's a bit on the pricey side ( from a student perspective) but it's completely worth it! The fresh rotisserie chicken in the salad is my favorite.
author: Sarah R.

description: We were on a day date & I ordered the frozen Greek yogurt topped with baklava & drizzled honey; and now I find myself day dreaming of this frozen treat. It may just have to be a regular thing when we come back to the city.
author: Marie B.

description: The line moves fast so hang tight. The food is def worth the wait. Went on Saturday night at 7:30 pm and waited maybe 25 mins. All the food was delicious and the frozen Greek yogurt is worth all the calories!!!
author: Amy T.

description: Love this place. I live down the block and eat here all the time. With that said this review is for a particular employee, a young lady with gauges and tattoos that works the front. Every time I come in she has a pissy attitude. I even mentioned it to a friend of mine as we were on our way there for lunch. She was working the register and sure enough made it clear she had something stuck up her a** and my friend noticed it too. And it's not just me, I've seen her get snippy with other customers. Besides her everyone is super cool, says hi and calls me by my name and knows that I'm a regular ( Sour face acts like I'm brand new every time i come in) and the food is awesome. It's just that one sour employee that makes me not want to go there if she's working.
author: Wis W.

description:
Hmm...so Michelle Obama orders food from here and carries it with her on the plane?  Really?  I have news for her, the food served on the plane might be better than this overpriced bowl of salad!  But then, this is SF, how will you pay your employees and still stay in business if you don't bilk your customer?

I'm not going back!  Even Daphne's is better(tastier).
author: Chitra J.

description:
The food was good, not great. Portions left me hungry, maybe it was because I got a wrap/sandwich at lunch? A $14+ after tip sandwich/wrap shouldn't literally leave me with hunger pains tho, really hayes-valley'd me!!

Their frozen yogurt is tasty, I'll stick to that when coming by here.
author: John O.

description:
Heard great things about Souvla, so when my friend suggested going here for lunch I was excited. We went at noon so I was afraid of how busy it might get. Parking was a little difficult but that was already expected. It was a nice day so even if we had parked far it was a nice walk to the restaurant. 

The restaurant was small but very warm and welcoming. We sat close to the front with a counter and open window frame. Next time, I'll try going to the back patio. 

Cleanliness (5/5): The restaurant was busy but everything was clean and ready for customers. Nothing else to comment! 

Connection (5/5): I like the simplicity of the menu. Makes reading the menu and ordering very easy. We didn't know what to order because it all sounded good so the cashier helped us navigate the menu. Throughout the meal, employees did ask us if we were okay or if we needed anything. The atmosphere is very casual and the attentive of the employees was excellent. 

Product/Service Provided (4/5): I ordered the "American Homestyle Pork Shoulder" as a salad (you can order you dish as a salad or sandwich). The dish was very good and balanced. I usually dislike feta cheese but I wanted to try the dish as is. I think it converted me to eat feta cheese - it wasn't overwhelming and the size and amount of cheese complemented the dish. The only note I would make is there were a couple chucks of pork fat (which I would've been fine with if it were crunchier). Some of the pork was also a little dry - so there was some inconsistency in the various pieces of pork.
author: Martin N.

description: Best Greek yogurt I have ever had. Baklava crumbles were delicious. They were also discounted for pride.
author: Mandy P.

description: Absolutely LOOOOVE this place!! Go greek style - you won't regret it! ;)
author: Daniella V.

description: This place is super cute and I think the two stars is only accurate if you order the vegetarian sandwich- it's basically just a big sweet potato wrapped in bread. Other than that, they have a super cute hip Greek vibe. All my meat eating friends chowed down and loved their sandwich! Also they have v good fries and looks like some goooood frozen Greek yogurt.
author: Julia D.

description: This place was good. You can tell everything is made with fresh ingredients. I had the lamb gyro but they call it a sandwich. The fries were decent. All in all, for not being a traditional Greek place it was a good clean Greek restaurant when trying to be healthy.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I'm going to say it...it was only just OK.  It wasn't worth my excitement.  The greek frozen yogurt (plain or otherwise) is really really good.  I'd definitely get that and the fries were super crunchy on the outside and nice and steamed on the inside. 

I was really disappointed with the wrap/sandwiches which I guess can be compared to gyros.  I tried the pork and the lamb and both meats were dry, the pita/wrap itself was also dry and there was a lack of sauce.  I thought the flavors were good just ate overall dry and tough.  The line moves fairly quickly and the food arrives sooner than you think.  I'm OK with the price point this being SF Hayes Valley and the assumption is they're using better ingredients but man, it was like waiting forever to go to Disneyland, telling all your friends about it and then Mickey turns out to be a punk.  Crushed.  But still....Michelle 2020!
author: Eileen A.

description: I crave this place's fries almost everyday. Although it get extremely crowded and the line tends to get really long its worth the try. I would order to go the next time I go because i really liked the taste and uniqueness of the food. Although I tried a veggie option this time, all the ingredients mixed perfectly and gave it the Mediterranean flavor that makes it special.
author: Sophie E.

description:
Delicious and well priced. I usually go for any of the wraps. Meats are juicy, well spiced and accompanied by a nice variety of veggies. The wraps are all tasty and filling. To be gluttonous I go for the feta fries on the side. 

Sometimes I get a craving for their lemon soup. It's simple and warms my soul.

I also like that they have froyo. I go for the honey and sea salt topping. That said it's not my favorite froyo but it hits the spot. 

Great for lunch. Go treat yo taste buds.
author: Carina K.

description:
The Greek Frozen Yogurt was addicting and amazing! As someone who is a hardcore greek yogurt fan (literally I eat it everyday), greek yogurt in froyo form? What could be better?!...well the toppings on it. I got the one with Bakalava Crumbles & Honey syrup, and it was a great $5 that I have no regrets at all of spending. The greek froyo part itself, is plain, but delicious as is already. The frozen yogurt is tart and creamy and literally tastes like my favorite type of thick, creamy, Greek yogurt (think of brands like Fage, Siggi's, etc). The baklava oozed of cinnamon, pistachios, and honey and went perfectly with the slightly tart yogurt. They have other flavors such as Olive oil & flaky sea salt, Cherry, etc. 

Souvla also has salads, sandwiches, fries, drinks, and other goodies. If I hadn't already eaten when I came I would've definitely dined here! I definitely am planning to come back again soon!
author: Joy W.

description:
4 stars just for the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup!!!! I also tried the sour cherry one, which would be good if you're thirsty, but if you want something that leans more towards sweet dessert.....the baklava one is the best!!!!

I thought the food was whatever. If I had to rate the food only, I would say 2.5-3 stars. The portions are large and the ingredients are fresh, but the protein was dry. We had lamb, pork and chicken and I felt the same for all 3 proteins. The fries were good though!!!!!

It does get crowded and if you get a table, then be prepared for people just watching you like hawks to steal your table next.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Come for the Greek Yogurt! So what if it comes from a soft serve machine? So does Yogurtland yogurt and I love Yogurtland. But anyway, it tastes divine, exactly as you (or actually I) can imagine-- thick and tart frozen Greek yogurt. Higher in protein, so it must be good for you? Yeah, exactly! Now, it can be enjoyed alone but why not add the bells and whistles? Don't bother asking if you want the baklava crumbles because duh, yes you want the good stuff. Keep in mind, it's sweeet.

I was wrong in ordering the chicken sandwich the first time as all I can remember was waiting in a long ass line and being disappointed by a mediocre tasting wrap, that was also falling apart, a sad wrap really. Free range in this case meant too healthy and a bit tasteless. So lesson learned, note to self, stick with the yogurt and you won't be disappointed.
author: Amy L.

description: I think this gyro is the best one in SF especially lamb meats!! And their frozen Greek yogurt with crunchy baklava is yummy!!
author: Yumiko H.

description:
The food and frozen yogurt are delicious, the service is fast, wine pours are generous, and the ambiance is nice. I had an easy and pleasant experience dining here late on a Saturday night with friends.  I ordered the chicken salad, which was packed full of fresh lettuce, kale, and shredded chicken and topped with a refreshing "granch" dressing (made with greek yogurt). I don't even like ranch dressing, but I loved this "granch" -- it was healthy, flavorful, and a perfect pair to the salad.

I also had the greek yogurt with sour cherry. It was super delicious, although I'd recommend trying something else if you prefer your fro-gryo sweeter. The sour cherry, true to its name, is definitely for lovers of all things tart.

I didn't have wine, but my friends who did received very generous pours (an initial one, plus additional wine in a tiny carafe). No paying $12 for a thimble sized pour of wine here. I'm sold!
author: Ran L.

description: Love coming to this place. They have the best fries and honey Greek yogurt. I usually order online and pick up. It's convenient, fast and the staff is friendly.
author: Nancy T.

description:
When I was in college in Virginia a couple years back, we used to have a place called Berry Berry that served real Greek froyo. I was obsessed! I got into froyo toward the end of college and when I moved away I continued to get froyo a couple times a week. I had a seperate budget just for froyo. Ish was real....Then one day I realized that all the froyo (even the original tart) was not the same. It could never be as good as the greek froyo at Berry Berry. I stopped getting froyo and turned to boba to fill the void in my heart (read: stomach). 

After discovering Souvla I've found love again. Best Greek froyo hands-down! The froyo here blew my mind. I never though that olive oil would go well with sweets! And sea salt?? What's up with that? But, it was recommended, so I had to put my reluctance to the side. I tried the first spoon. AMAZING!! The olive oil was so fresh and the sea salt added a little munch that was much needed. Wowowowow, I will never leave froyo again. The void has now been filled! Thanks, Souvla!

Oh, also the food was scruptious too. You can't go wrong with anything you order at this place! Highly recommended!
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Wowowowowowow Souvla has done it! AMAZING gyros AMAZING frozen yogurt. I have eaten my fair share of gyros, and Souvla serves one of the best chicken gyros I've ever had. Their fries are really good too. And to top it off, make sure you get some frozen greek yogurt with baklava. It is such a good dessert, my friends and I made sure to come back again for more while we were in the SF area. Great atmosphere in a great location.
author: Dylan S.

description: Delicious & authentic Greek food! My lunch there made my day! The salads are fresh and flavorful, the chicken was so well cooked that it was melting in my mouth! I would definitely go back for the Greek yogurt and Frenchfries
author: Aleksa ..

description:
If I'm honest with myself, I probably was drawn to Souvla due to the Anthora coffee cup designs that I saw through the window.  Seeing those cups always remind me of New York City, and I can always use a place that serves good Mediterranean food!  

I thought Souvla had some nice aspects to it.  The restaurant has a sleek ambience that works perfectly for a casual dining establishment.  In terms of ordering, you can decide between various protein or vegetarian choices in either a sandwich or salad form; I was torn between the chicken and lamb, but I finally decided on trying a chicken sandwich.

To their credit, the chicken was juicy, and I liked the contrast between the savory meat, pickeld red onion, and navel orange chunks.  However, the bread was tough, contradicting its seemingly fluffy appearance.  I also tried the greek fries, tempted by the combination of olive oil, lemon juice, and cheese, but I found it surprisingly bland given the stated ingredients.  While my meal may have lacked some spark, I thought the frozen greek yogurt was a wonderful way to end my dinner.  I tried the baklava topping, and while I don't think the texture captured that flaky, filo dough goodness, I enjoyed the combination of honey, nuts, and that chewy/sticky texture that you get with baklava.

I'd probably go back again (at least for the greek yogurt), but this place turned out to be overpriced for what you end up getting.
author: Keith H.

description:
Sad to say, I didn't get to try to food here BUT OMG their frozen Greek Yogurt is AMAZING.

Seriously, skill the long line at smitten ice cream and come here for a delightful, not too sweet, packed full of protein, semi good for you treat! 

Okay, I lied, the line here was pretty long on a Saturday afternoon, but worth it!

The Greek Froyo was creamy and thick in consistency. It also wasn't too tart which is the case with a lot of greek yogurt. I went with the simple topping of just honey and I couldn't have been happier. Definitely recommending coming for an afternoon or post dinner treat. I can't wait to try the food.
author: Diane T.

description: For the price, some of the worst food I've ever had. The food is bland and the wine tastes like it came from a box. I can't fathom how this place is busy.
author: David K.

description:
Best way I can describe this place: Quality, hipster Mediterranean food.

For your meal, you pick a protein, and then choose whether you want it in a pita sandwich or a salad. They have a vegetarian option too! 

We ordered a chicken sandwich and a lamb salad, with a side of fries. Both proteins were great, but I LOVED the lamb. It was so tender and flavorful, and looking at the dripping meat in the rotisserie in the back of the restaurant, I can see why. I even liked the salad alone a lot more than I thought I would. It was well dressed with kale, romaine, fennel, pickled onions, and feta cheese, and it didn't taste plain or boring at all. The pita for the sandwich was soft and a good size, and the fries were perfectly crispy and seasoned.

I ended up coming back a few days later to try the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey, and my boyfriend and I both loved it! I was a little worried that it would be overwhelmingly sweet especially with the addition of the baklava and honey, but it was perfect. The frozen Greek yogurt itself was tart and tangy/cheesy (not very sweet at all, which I liked), and it went perfectly with the baklava crumbles (I don't taste much of the honey).

What a Hayes Valley gem. I'll be back!
author: Sara L.

description:
BEST GYRO I have ever eaten in my life. Oh myyyy sweet skittlez!!! That lamb gyro, with the thinly sliced radishes & cucumbers.  Really heavenly.  And that adorably delicious greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbs & honey. Oooooooh E!! Those 2 items are perfection and 5 stars.  
However, there is something very annoying about the place.  The highly sleek, systematic, soulless hipster vibe is not my thing.  And come on I gotta have an option to have a diet coke!! 
Take out is probably a good idea, as well as going very early to avoid crowds.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
The Greek yogurt with baklava and honey is to die for. The very first time I came to Souvla was off a recommendation to try the Greek yogurt, and I have been in love ever since. 

The second time I came, I got the chicken sandwich and decided to eat it at the little park around the corner (Patricia's Green). I love love love rotisserie chicken but am often afraid that the white meat turns out too dry, and the first few bites of my sandwich were just that. Fortunately, the navel oranges were so sweet and juicy they really brought the chicken to life! Halfway through my meal I was struggling to take graceful bites - it's a very big sandwich! - and dropped two orange slices to the ground, delighting nearby pigeons. Towards the end of my sandwich, the chicken was sitting in its own juices and luckily made for flavorful last bites. 

I then turned to my friend, who had gotten the pork shoulder, and took a bite of his sandwich. Good God, the tomatoes and cucumber together made the most delicious combination with pita and pork.

When I go back again, I think I'll try the lamb or pork, but no matter what I'm saving enough stomach to get the Greek yogurt with baklava.
author: Jenny L.

description: The food here is good but I'm giving it only 3 stars because of a bad customer service experience I had when visiting the restaurant yesterday. After the woman rang up my order and I paid, I then went back to kindly ask her to put my dressing on the side for my salad as I had forgot to request this when I first ordered. Her response to me was "No I can't do that." At first I was shocked at her response so I stood waiting to speak to her again, and only when someone from the kitchen came out, luckily, did she then tell him I wanted the dressing on the side. I just can't believe how rude she was and how it left me a bad impression of this place. Too bad, because the food was good, but this woman's customer service was just terrible!
author: Annie K.

description: Love it here! I've only tried their frozen yoghurt and fries and adore their frozen yogurt. The baklava one can be a bit heavy so I now get the sour cherry . It isn't too tart, it's perfect.
author: Mira B.

description:
The best causal Greek and Mediterranean food in the city! There is always a line but it moves quickly. My friend and I got the **Lamb, **Pork sandwich. We also ordered the chicken salad thinking the sandwiches wouldn't be enough. But little did I know it was huge. So full of flavor in every bite. Wasn't too heavy and the meat was tender. So good. We also order the **Greek Fries. It had good flavor and it was crispy. Better than garlic fries at the ballpark. 

But my favorite dish was their **CHICKEN SALAD. So tasty, refreshing and full of flavors. The mandarins was a great touch for the salad. They are not skimpy with their meat, gave lots of chicken. One of the best salads I had all year. 

The decor is very modern comfort and the staff was friendly. Can't wait to come back and have their frozen yogurt. I was way too full to order it yesterday.
author: Sandy B.

description: Had the pork sandwich, was nicely balanced and tasty. Pita bread was good, and the pickled onions were quite nice. The pork was a bit dry on some pieces, but the fatty sections were extremely delicious, the Greek yogurt on it was quite tasty as well.
author: Michael J.

description:
Gratifying food. 

Lamb gyro was bomb. If you're into tzatziki order it with garlic sauce on the side. It's a must. I would prefer the bread to be softer. Will order as a salad next time. Quintessential Greek fries. Picture perfect lunch. 

But let's be honest... the best, most rational reason to come here is for their Greek froyo with baklava and honey. Smooth texture, melt in your mouth yogurt with luscious honey and tender baklava. Ooooooooo yeahhhhh!!

However, some things need improving:

1. Cunning salesmanship. When I ordered the garlic fries the cashier told me the fries came with a choice of three sauces. When I checked my email receipt I saw I was charged for the dipping sauce. Meh. 

2. Service. I tipped 20% and encountered weird interactions when requesting items or asking questions.

3. The froyo center is hollow. They could be a little more generous and fill the cup properly. 

Highly recommend take out. Avoid lunch hours. Not the venue for an intimate, cozy meal. This place embodies the pure flavors of Greece but in a well groomed, glossy, hipster fashion.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Holy smokes! The froyo is so so so good. Baklava was meant to go on froyo apparently. The salad was delicious, but I got mine to go and by the time I ate it there was quite a bit of grease on the bottom. Maybe it was because I got the lamb.
author: Savvy P.

description: Awesome French fries! Love the wine list also. Not a huge fan of the sandwich but the salad is great and the French fries and wine are more than enough to have me come back when I'm in the area for lunch..
author: Sam R.

description:
"Hella good."

I've had Souvla bookmarked for a while and I may be the only person who frequents Hayes Valley that hasn't eaten here but better late than never I suppose.

I dined with a former colleague and had the lamb sando and we split the fries. Both were excellent and except for feeling like it was a few dollars overpriced, I really liked the food, the space, and the service. 

We came at noon and the line was out the door. They seemed to be doing brisk business via take-out as well. It was chilly today so I didn't try the frozen Greek yogurt but it looks like it would be a nice treat on a warm day.

Diversity score: IDK. Same issue w/ racial disparity between people busing the tables/cooking and "front of the house" but that's something every gentrifying eatery needs to work on. Hope manager hires people from the neighborhood, trains them, and gives them the chance to move up and take leadership positions. It's a typical hipster watering hole in Hayes so... 7/10?
author: Semuteh F.

description: What is the big deal about Souvla?? Went there for lunch today after all the hype and I am deeply disappointed. The food was underwhelming, the seasoning was lacking. Very bland food for Greek food which has so much flavor. Will not come back.
author: Amisha G.

description:
Sigh. I really wanted to like Souvla. I wanted to like it so much I went twice and braved the line each time. Usually if I'm neutral to negative about a restaurant, I'd rather try somewhere new than try the same spot again. Buuuuut I thought I'd give Souvla a second chance. Womp. 

The first time I went I had the lamb salad. The salad was bland, lamb was gamey (also bland), and I didn't enjoy my meal at all. My brother gave me some of his lamb sandwich which was better, but not thaaaat great.

I went last night with a friend for the second time. We both got the chicken sandwich. The chicken was gamey, dry, and extremely salty. The hot sauce on the counter didn't even help! #icanteven

The ratio of ingredients were pretty poor: two teeny tiny orange slices, a slither of greens and enough Mizratha cheese for one bite, all on an extra large doughy pita bigger than the size of my face. The pita didn't have any flavor either. Not sure what this mysterious "granch" dressing is, I didn't see a lick of it. 

I thought the entire meal could benefit from acid such as lemon, garlic, and a ton of sumac (being Mediterranean and all...), perhaps hummus, an herb such as dill, and cucumber. Tzatziki would be nice, too (yes, I know how to make Mediterranean and Greek food). 

Wah wah.

The ambiance is cute and the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is fine.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Since there's so much love heaped on this place, thought I'd share a slightly dissenting opinion while still respecting that it is a quality place to get some greek meat-based salads. 

That said, it's slightly overrated in my book -- would give it a 3.75 out of 5. 

Here's why: 

- Lines are long
- Salads are not bad by any means, but the quality varies by night, and how much I enjoy the salad is directly correlated to how much feta they drop in
- Salads are expensive - $14 for the lamb (seriously, if I'm paying $14 for a salad, it better be slightly life-changing) 
- The lamb isn't great, especially compared to mediterranean and persian restaurants from LA, or just compared to Souvla's chicken 
- The fries are average 
- Everything is too pricey, considering it's set up mostly as a fast food place (order at the front)
author: Salim Z.

description: Love this place. It's always crowded, even at 2:30 on a Monday. The menu is customizable (I had lamb over a chicken salad setup), and service is friendly and fast. If you eat in, you'll likely need to make friends and sit with some strangers, as there is limited seating inside. Build in some time to walk around the lovely Hayes Valley shopping area after your meal!
author: Christina G.

description: Eh. Overprice hipster salad place. Just another regular Hayes valley restaurant with ok food. Their chicken salad is better than other menus.
author: Lauren L.

description: I had heard great things about this place and it lived up to the hype. I had the lamb sandwich - the meat was tender and flavorful, the radishes, cucumbers, and pickled onions added the perfect contrast, and the pita wrap was fluffy yet formidable (i.e. didn't disintegrate with juicy oils). Service was excellent. Definitely going back to Souvla soon.
author: May C.

description: I've stayed in Greece for 3 months and been to quite a few Greek festivals and this place captured what the Greeks have perfected Lamb on a spit. Little bit pricey but if you are hankering Greek eat here.
author: Joe B.

description: Great portions. DELICIOUS food. AMAZING Wraps and Fries. I definitely have to come back here for some Greek Frozen Yogurt. It is a tiny bit pricy, but what isn't in San Francisco? Their sauces are also delicious. We got to try them all and they were all on point, though I do favor the Garlic one quite a bit. Definitely come here if you are in the area!
author: Sam T.

description:
We needed a quick bite to eat before attending a pre-ballet lecture/talk at the War Memorial Opera House and Souvla fit the bill. It's casual (order at the counter and find a seat), but the restaurant's decor is modern and the vibe friendly. The location can't be beat too. It's only a few blocks from the Ballet and Symphony, and close to bars, coffee shops, etc! 

The DH (dear husband) and I both ordered the Pork Shoulder Sandwich ($11), and Greek Fries ($4) and the Souvla Side Salad ($5) to share. The pork sandwich had minted yogurt, pickled red onions, cherry tomatoes, cucumber and feta in it. The sandwich was okay (needed a little more spice for me), but it was very hearty. I almost wished I'd ordered the salad instead which costs a dollar more. It would have been a lighter dinner. Careful with that sandwich! The juices from the meat and dressing dripped and almost got on my outfit! 

I actually enjoyed the fries and salad more than the sandwich. Even though the fries were not as good as Opa Fries, they're nicely seasoned and they're not too thick. I loved the salad! Loved how refreshing it was. I would definitely order my choice of protein on a salad next time. The sandwich was too heavy for me! 

We didn't order dessert as we had to leave and walk back to the WMOH. They do have Frozen Greek Yogurt that you can choose to top with baklava and other sweet toppings. 

Sodas, Greek wine and beer complete their menu. We just went with water as I always grab a glass of wine at the Ballet before the performance. 

Souvla is a good option before the Ballet, Opera or Symphony if you're wanting something quick and affordable!
author: Hazel C.

description:
Chicken and lamb wraps were sadly disappointing. Dry and lacked flavor.

The only thing saving this place is the nice interior, amazing fries, and great location.

Hope they can turn it around...
author: Anton G.

description:
Decided to try this place since it was close to a piano bar that my girls and I were headed to later. 

Service: You order up front and you get a number and they bring your food out to you. Friendly staff, recommended a couple of items from the salad and sandwich menu.

Food: Ordered the lamb sandwich, and my friend ordered the chicken salad with a side of fries. The lamb sandwich was very Bland and tasteless. The chicken salad was much better but nothing to Rave about. The fries were great the fries were great!

So many better options in San Francisco, this is definitely not a place I will come back to.
author: Sasha S.

description: I love Souvla. It's simply amazing. The only thing I would change is that I would make their lamb a little more lean. I always get their lamb salad and I love it!!
author: Donya F.

description: I've actually been here a couple of times and the food is decent but experience with the staff today put me off for good. It is an awful feeling when you're made to feel like a second rate customer because of your race.
author: Aryn Y.

description: I heard a lot about this place from my friend who lives in Hayes valley and we went there for lunch in a day when I was starving! Ordered chicken sandwich for me and a chicken salad for my friend with a garlic fries. The sandwich was okay, it was not as delicious as I heard about it. But the portion is really big and generous! The fries could have more garlic and the salad was okay too. The environment is cozy but crowded, but the good thing is you don't feel uncomfortable although it's so crowded. The only thing I didn't like about this place was they charge you to refill the tiny sauce for fries!!! In general it was a good place for having lunch and the price was affordable!
author: Sara S.

description: This place is fantastic but recently their frozen yogurt has gone south. It tastes processed, overly sweet and bland. It used to have this rich, tangy flavor that no one else had. Now it tastes kind of like Tasty D-light. I really hope they fix this problem!!!
author: Michelle T.

description: Great food and great service!   I emailed Souvla the day before my visit asking about dairy free options and I received a response in minutes.  This never happens.  Pita doesn't have dairy (yay and it's delicious) and fries are the best...hot, crispy and fluffy inside.  This restaurant is amazing!
author: Janet Y.

description: LOVE SOUVLA. The chicken pita with hot sauce is so good. The food is quick and the people are friendly. Definitely a must try!
author: Jazlyn H.

description: I really wanted to like Souvla more - especially since I just moved next to them and there's so much hype surrounding this place all the time. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed with the pork sandwich that I got. While the veggies and sauces were excellent, the pork itself was extremely dry and lacked any kind of flavor whatsoever.
author: Sam M.

description: This review is so meh based on take-out not the actual dining-in experience I ordered the chicken salad. Definitely plentiful and tasteful
author: Ricky E.

description: Ordered pork salad. Incredible, a great amount of pork with the salad. One of the best salads I've had in a long time. Big portions so worth the extra money. Had rose wine as well which was a great. Staff were super friendly. Accidentally brought me out a salad for sit in and I ordered to go, was corrected very quickly. 10/10 recommend
author: Abby B B.

description: My first time eating here and it was DELICIOUS. Get the fries with greek/ranch sauce. So good. Definitely coming back here.
author: Bri M.

description:
Finally we've been able to make it here!!!
I've been trying to cross this place off my list for a long time.  Once I got her the line was out the door, keep in mind the place is relatively small.  Operationally everything runs so smooth here, this place is a well oiled machine.

We ordered a lamb sandwich, greek fries, and 2 frozen yogurts ( baklava, and cherry).  Initially I thought $13 for a gyro was ridiculous, however, they use big chunks of lamb here, rather than the compressed lamb/meat slab.  The sandwich was made with fresh ingredients and was delicious, the fries and yogurt was just as good.  Definitely a bit of a hipster twist here from traditional gyro sandwiches, but in the right direction.

I will more than likely be back to try more of their sandwiches!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: First time here at the recommendation of my boo-thang prosecutie. OMG! I had the pork sandwich with fries. My friends had the chicken and land salads. OMG! That pork sando was so flavorful. On soft pita with fresh veggies (no cheese bc I was trying, key word "trying" to be healthful) and it was damn good. I had the yogurt sauce on the side and used it sparingly. This was flavorful by itself but add that sauce and Lawd, especially with their hot sauce sitting on the table - great, almost guilt-free lunch. And I say almost bc of course I had the fries - delish! And did I tell you we had dessert - I threw the whole healthy bag out the window with the fro-yo topped with honey and baklava and my friend got the fro-yo topped with OO and sea salt. Talk about a GG (greedy girl) heaven! So yummy in my tummy. I mean, it was exceptional! The contrasting flavors, the tartness of the Greek fro-yo, Lawd! It as amazing! Loved loved loved it! I'll be back!!!
author: Tinnetta T.

description:
Food is good but nothing outta this world. Waited in line to order and the bottleneck is mostly people who order wine/bubbly because the cashier will pour it into a chilled pitcher before pouring it into your glass and then you finally get out of the queue. I think they do this because seating is limited.

Ordered the lamb and pork shoulder salad. Both were good but I wouldn't wait in line just for it, especially during lunch hour.
author: Ellen C.

description:
The food at Souvla is so consistently delicious that they really can do no wrong. Anytime I'm in the area, we eat there because it's so good - if I lived closer, it would become a bad habit. The menu is simple, but there is no such thing as a bad order. 

My favorite item on the menu by far would be the roasted white sweet potato salad. I don't know WHAT's in their dressing but it's super addicting. It's probably the most filling and satisfying salad you'll ever eat. Another great item is the lamb gyro; the meat is beautifully cooked and not super greasy. Greek fries are always a must no matter what entree you're ordering. Dessert is also a must: I highly recommend the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup. The sweet and sour flavor profiles are out of this world. In terms of their beverage selection, I've only ever had their Greek beer and it goes really well with the food (it's a refreshing lager). 

Everything else about Souvla is a slam dunk: their marketing/branding is on point and memorable; the space is clean and simple; the giant wall of rotisserie chicken is a sight to see; and ordering is quick and easy (unless there's a huge line). The one downside when it's really busy is the seating. It's pretty much communal seating but it does get super tight in the space when all of the seats are occupied. Food comes out super fast and you pick up the dessert separately (once you've finished your meal) so that it doesn't melt. 

Definitely a more casual, quick spot, but the food is high class all the way.
author: Regina L.

description:
I'd hear this place was popular and I'm glad that I came at a time when there wasn't a crazy line since we were able to find a table immediately.

This place is definitely pricey, as far as a place with a simple menu of "sandwiches" and salads.  I opted for the salad, which was good.  It was definitely satisfying and tasted very fresh.  I think next time I go, I'd definitely go for the gyro.  I'd also be interested in trying the frozen Greek yogurt - that seems very unique and something that would end the meal on a satisfying note.

This place is very popular and doesn't have enough seating to accommodate everyone so be prepared to wait or take your meal elsewhere.

Overall, I liked it, but I don't think I understand the high pricing...it's fine as long as you can easily walk in because the salad was not worth a long wait in line.
author: Ken G.

description:
This has become my new favorite Greek fast-casual restaurant! There was a huge line when we arrived, but it moved fast and our food arrived even faster! 

My friends and I shared a bottle of rosé (so awesome that they serve wine by the way)! We also shared a side of fries which were perfectly salty and crunchy!

I got the sandwich with chicken. It was so big that I couldn't finish it all but WOW it was tasty and you could tell all of the ingredients are fresh. The chicken was tender and shredded. With their "Granch" dressing which was creamy and delicious. As well as navel orange, red onion, and pea shoots. They place their hot sauce on all of their tables which I put on my sandwich and it escalated the taste! Their hot sauce is so so good! I put it on every bite!

Last, you must try their frozen greek yogurt! It's tangy and creamy the perfect dessert if you love greek yogurt. I topped mine with olive oil and sea salt which was addicting! Some people feel weird about the olive oil taste, but the combination is outstanding in my opinion. Highly recommend trying it if you're the type of person that likes to drizzle olive oil on your food.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
Very cute, small but service is very efficient and quick!

My best friend and I stopped by for lunch around 12pm and we missed the lunch traffic. You order at the counter, a number is given and waiter will bring your food to you. You can order the yogurt with baklava first and get it after your meal without waiting in line.

There are limited seating but we didn't have a problem finding two open seats at a table. 

I ordered:

Fries 
Lamb sandwich 
Greek brunch punch $6
Yogurt 

Total with tax $35

Overall- 

fries were awesome. So crispy and salty!

Greek brunch punch - refreshing but so small for a cocktail :(

Lamb sandwich - maybe I should have gotten the salad like everyone did but I had to try the sandwich since it was my first time and assume that's what souvla is known for? The cucumber and feta cheese was a great flavor combination but I thought the lamb was kinda dry. I actually wished the lamb was in stripes rather than chunks of meat? It was kinda hard to eat. Regardless the sandwich was flavorful and satisfying

Baklava yogurt- refreshing! I'm not a frozen yogurt fan but I can tell why everyone likes it! Great happy ending to the meal :)

Overall, friendly and quick service with great food makes me want to come back again! Especially for the fries and I want to try the salads!

Yummy!
author: Carol Y.

description:
I've had my fair share of salads and Souvla's chicken salad is BY FAR my favorite!

Their chicken is always flavorful and juicy and they add in some fennel, pickled onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese, and the best part - mandarins. I'm usually not a huge fan of fruit in my salad, but this was amazing. It's also a plus that they never skimp out on the meat. I always leave feeling happy and full!
author: Carrie L.

description: Came here for lunch with my cousin this afternoon. There was no outdoor seating available (it was a rare 71 degrees) so we took our food to go and walked to a table in the park area down the block. I had the Greek fries and a side salad. Everything was fresh and the fries had the perfect amount of crisp. I also thought they made our order fairly quickly considering the line. Will be back to try other dishes.
author: L. W.

description:
Yuppified Daphne's. 
 
Don't get me wrong, I enjoy yuppified food and have no problem paying a premium price, if justified.

Souvla's marketing is on point with great buzz words on their menu (e.g. "American Homestead Pork Shoulder", "Superior Farms Lamb Leg", "Harissa-Spiked Yogurt", etc.) and hefty prices to match. If I'm going to pay 2x the price for a chicken gyro wrap, the chicken better be free-range and Mary, herself better be tending to them--am I right?

Let's start with the good. I like that Souvla's menu is very simple. Choose a protein (pork, chicken, lamb, or veggie), then decide whether you want a wrap ($10-$13) or a salad ($11-$14). Make it a combo meal with sides ($4-$6): fries, potatoes, side salad, or soup. Have a sweet tooth? End your meal with Greek froyo ($4-$5). They also have wine and beer so you can get your drank on. 

Order at the counter, get a number, and your food will be delivered to you. The space is tiny, loud, and you will have to hover for seats. Luckily, there's a quick turnover. My co-worker and I found seats in 2 minutes and received our food 2 minutes after. Great for people who are pressed for time.

Now, the not so good. We paid $40 for one wrap, one salad, and one order of fries to share (including tax + tip). Expensive for a casual, "fast food" lunch with no waiter service. At these prices, I expected the food to be Greekgasmic.

I appreciate Souvla's use of fresh, high-quality ingredients. Given how simple the menu is, it's unfortunate the food was less than mediocre. 

My Superior Farms Leg Lamb Wrap ($13): https://bitly.com/a/bitlinks was superiorly dry and bland. I enjoyed the warm, thick, and fluffy pita bread but it was filled with flavorless, tough, and chewy cubes of lamb (texture of well done top round). The lamb was devoid of any spices. The yogurt sauce was concentrated at the opening end of the pita so I kept reaching for the bottle of hot sauce on our table to add flavor and moisture to the rest of the wrap. I ended up using half the bottle. 

My co-worker said the chicken in the Mary's Organic Chicken Salad ($14) was dry and bland as well. This seems to be the common complaint among other yelpers with their proteins.

I couldn't help but think one could buy nearly 3 whole rotisserie chicken from Costco for $14. Yikes, I sound like a cheap phuck but at least Costco's rotisserie chicken is well-seasoned and moist. 

The saving grace were the side of Greek Fries ($4). They were piping hot, deliciously crunchy, and fluffy on the inside. The fries are supposed to be topped with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, mizithra cheese but we barely got a smidge of each. You have to pay an extra $1 for a tiny container of dipping sauce--what the heezy?!? If you're going to nickel and dime customers, just charge $5 and include the sauce. It's an inconvenience to later find out that ketchup is not available and have to stand in line again (and that line can get long) just to buy the dipping sauce.

I doubt I would return to Souvla, nor would I recommend it to anyone looking for a legit Greek meal. It's overpriced and the flavors are dumbed down.

Maybe Uncle Jesse will go into the restaurant biz in Fuller House: http://usm.ag/1Mkqe4I? Wouldn't mind a bite of his gyro. Oops, did I say that?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Wish it wasn't around $15 but damn the lamb salad was so good! Loved the service too, the man at the counter who may have been the manager was very friendly. Was very cute inside as well.
author: Shabnam E.

description: OMG suuuuuchhh good food! The garlic fries are amazing! Has such a cute Greek vibe and beautiful aesthetics. I got the Veggie sandwich and ate it before I ever got a picture!! Definitely a place worth stopping at Thank You Souvla Chefs
author: Jay-Zee S.

description:
We've been getting dessert to-go here for awhile now (sometimes coming cross-town specifically for it), and finally tried dinner as well. The key here is to swoop swoop swoop another table as soon as someone's leaving. With a line out the door and a small footprint, you gotta be fast.

-Veg Sandwich (4/5): sweet potato is the star here, and I'd eat this any day. The garlic in the yogurt is the strongest flavor; the other ingredients (myzithra, walnuts, pickled onions, kalamata onions, pea shoots) are pretty subtle but together make for a satisfying entree.
-Fries (3/5): the fries themselves are solid but the lemon is undetectable and the myzithra (which I love) nearly nonexistent. There's an herby flavor from the parsley. Nothing to write home about. Sadly the potato side is not vegetarian.
-Soulva Greek Red Wine (2/5): I'm not a wine connoisseur but it was pretty disappointing. The 500ml mug makes for two very generous glasses.
-Baklava Crumbles & Honey Greek Froyo (5/5): THIS IS WHY YOU COME HERE. Mmmmm soo good. The froyo is thick and tart, which helps balance the very sweet baklava and honey. If you ask nicely they'll give you extra baklava for free. Get it to-go and eat it in the park.
author: Cristina S.

description: Great casual eatery with great Greek food. Ample serving sizes. The baklava yoghurt was great. Greek beers and wines. Crazy busy atmosphere, but they get the orders out quickly so you're never waiting too long.
author: George T.

description: Can't get enough of this place! 100 stars if it were possible. Parking is easy in this area which is a huge benefit. Ordering online is extremely easy and everything is ready within a few minutes. Lots of yummy drink options with adds a nice touch to the food.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Greek Yogurt w/Baklava Crumbles, Syrup- #2 on the 2015 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I only came in to try out the Greek Yogurt w/Baklava Crumbles, Syrup ($5) since we already had dinner at another restaurant nearby that didn't have an interesting dessert menu. We decided to drive to Souvla on a Tuesday night, and it was still SUPER busy around 8pm. Although there were a good amount of people waiting outside for their to-go orders, the line to place the order was luckily short, and we were able to place our order quickly. They made our greek yogurt on the spot, so we were in and out in 5 minutes. We were able to stand outside to eat it, and it was delicious!! I just wished they layered the baklava crumbles and syrup, since it's too tempting to eat them all at once, and then you're left with a lot of greek yogurt.

Overall, it's totally worth braving the crowds at Souvla to try their greek yogurt, and I will have to come back to try their food also! Parking can be very tough in this area, especially on the weekends.
author: Amy D.

description: This review is for the Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt exclusively because I am obsessed! Perfect flavor combination. It's worth going for this alone.
author: Ana M.

description: I come here for lunch when visiting the city. This place has the best roasted chicken salad in my opinion. And a great accompaniment to this is the garlic fries and pink sauce. The staff always greets with a smile and the food is on point. To tell you the truth I have not ventured far from the roasted chicken because it is THAT good!  In the back of the restaurant you will see the chicken slowly roasting on spics with the juices dripping down. If this doesn't get your salivary glands excited then maybe the smell will. The restaurant is small and always packed no matter what time you go. If there are no tables available take your food to go and sit in the park steps away. Souvla has salads at their perfection and hopefully one day will open another location closer to San Jose.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Souvla has been on my bookmarks a few weeks now after I read about it on an SF food blog (of course...)! I haven't been to many Greek restaurants so I was excited to give Souvla a try after reading so many glowing reviews. 

You order first, pay, then find a table. The menu is simple and straightforward: you choose your protein, and if you want it in sandwich/souvlaki form or salad form. 

I've tried the lamb, the pork, and the chicken in both sandwich and salad form, and the pork salad is by far my favorite!! The lamb is cut into cubes (not thin slices like traditional gyros) and is super tender and moist. The chicken sandwich/salad has the best toppings in my opinion, with the oranges and pink pickled onions. But the pork shoulder definitely takes the cake for me as the best meat!! It's seasoned and cooked perfectly. 

The Greek fries are thick and crunchy, and were seasoned with lemon juice, olive oil, and cheese! Also you can get your sandwich or salad "Greek style" for $0.50 extra, and they add fries INSIDE your sandwich or salad!!

You will be full if you finish your meal because the portions are huge. The sandwiches may look small in pictures but they definitely are not! Souvla puts a large amount of meat in both the sandwiches and the salads. I can't wait to come back and try the pork shoulder!! Mmmmm!
author: Tara A.

description: I LOVE the food here! The salads are fantastic. Be warned, the place is tiny. If you want to sit down you probably will have to scramble a bit, definitely couldn't sit down with more than 4 people. More of a takeout situation.
author: AC K.

description:
This place is great! The food is simple and delicious with large portions. I got the chicken salad and everything in it (citrus, kale, cheese, yogurt-based dressing) paired really well together. The pork shoulder was also cooked well and tasted great with the ingredients in the salad. We also got the Greek fries which came topped with cheese and herbs and were perfectly cooked -- crispy yet soft and cooked through on the inside. And did I mention the portions?! I'm definitely not a light eater and I took home leftovers. 

It's on a busy street in Hayes Valley and there's most often a line out the door, but it moves quickly. It's not a huge place inside, but there is enough seating that you won't have to lurk and wait for a place to sit. The service is generally pleasant, but can be a bit brisk if you don't know the drill of what to do already. I will be back!!
author: Christine G.

description: This is typically my pre-Rickstop Shop/Davies bite to eat. Tasty all around, nice portions, cool interior vibes, and cheap.
author: Ryan S.

description: Souvla is a tad overpriced in my opinion, but I keep coming back whenever I crave good/clean Mediterranean flavors. They could give more meat in the salad in my opinion. The yogurts are a must! I would recommend non-locals to give it a try at least once.
author: Rei T.

description: Everything is tasty and delicious. Since l went to there weekend, waited so much on the line but that was OK. However, the price was expensive l think.
author: Amy A.

description: Absolutely delicious food. I got the lamb salad and the meat was cooked to perfection. The dressing was delicious and they give a very generous portion. The atmosphere is really cute. Great for a date night or dinner with friends and family. The wraps look delicious too. Will definitely come back.
author: Sonal J.

description: easily one of my favorite spots in hayes valley!  the chicken salad is consistently good, and once you get past the *sometimes daunting* line to order, the food comes out quickly.  highly recommend taking one of the outdoor seats if they're open, so you can get the full people-watching experience while you eat :)
author: Courteney S.

description: Great  place for quick Greek food. The wraps are amazing, but the secret weapon is the frozen yogurt. It's all awesome.
author: Zach H.

description: Great salad spot in the heart of Hayes Valley. I had the pork salad ($12) which was excellent. There was plenty of meat in the salad and other sides that made for a hearty meal. You can also choose from 2 other meats (chicken and lamb) and 1 veggy option. Salads can also be made a sandwich, which is really pita bread. The menu only has 4 items otherwise I would rate 5 stars.
author: Karim I.

description: Excellent flavors, food was amazing. Had the lamb salad and the juicy potatoes with rotisserie drippings!
author: Sonya G.

description: Been back a few times and always get he salad. Delicious and filling. Still think they're greasy but it's gotten better.. The rotisserie chicken dripping potatoes are great and you can explore some interesting froyo options. One of the most casual spots in the area.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Didn't get to try the food here, but I did get to try the frozen yogurt! OMG, YES. The most popular flavor is baklava crumble with honey syrup. AND dang, it's just as good as it sounds. There's just enough baklava bits to give it some texture. Both the baklava and honey was a nice contrast to the tartness (not super, super tart) of the frozen yogurt. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this. 

TIP: it's a pretty small space. You order and then seat yourself. It's first come, first serve. So,  be patient or be ready to take it to go.

Definitely will be coming back here to try their savory dishes!
author: Cassy H.

description:
Huge fan of this place. great atmosphere! I love how it's casual in the way that you order food at the counter but the restaurant itself doesn't feel too casual. the cashier was so friendly and helpful.

I ordered the lamb sandwich, greek fries, and bubbly wine. A++++ My friend ordered the lamb salad and said it was amazing. The food came out so quickly too!

Highly recommend this place. It's on the smaller side and tends to get pretty packed but don't fret! There's a park down the block where you can also eat if you so choose (I've done this before and it is lovely). 

Oh and I also ordered the Baklava fro yo... unreal. order it.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Greek Me Good!

Ordered:
Pork Sandwich $11.00
Lamb Salad $12.00
Greek Fries $4.00

Tina's Thoughts and Triggers
- Line out the door, but it goes real fast! We came around dinner time and it was still rapid
- Parking might be a little difficult seeing that Hayes street is dine central! 
- I wish I got the worker's name, but he was amazingly awesome! He gave my friend and I suggestions on what to get and got the food experts to cut it in half for us! He was super friendly and accommodating.
- Greek fries, or yet any fries, but these fries were addicting-ly yums (Yeah, I know that's not a word)
- Friend and I wanted to get pork and lamb, but didn't know which one we wanted. We decided to do the lamb salad and the pork sandwich. This was the best choice to get the best of both worlds. 
- They are known for their frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and syrup. And olive oil and flaky sea salt, wildflower honey, sour cherry, and other flavors are other options. I didn't get it since I don't like how sticky the baklava gets stuck on my teeth, but friend got it and it was really good - and for the most part, what people wait for as dessert for their meal! Suggestion is to order it while you're already in line or you'll have to go back in line. Hahaha, obvious, but it'll melt fast.  
- Friend saved half of her wrap for later because they are huge, but ended up eating it right when she got home. 
- I would come back for the wrap/sandwich! Can't wait!
author: Tina N.

description: Totally lives up to the hype.  Long line went quickly as well.  Can't wait to go back.
author: anthony v.

description:
I always get the sandwich (wrap) and I love all 3 types (chicken, lamb, and pork). The soda is a bit pricey and tiny! I still need to try their soup and frozen Greek yogurt.

The woman working the pick up area during lunch today was rude and grumpy!

I ordered the chicken sandwich. It was a tad dry but gets a pass because of the nice clean chicken flavor. I would get it again. The potatoes were soaked in chicken drippings. They didn't look like much but I kept coming back for them. My friends were all about the yogurt.
author: Huey N.

description:
This is my favourite salad bar and everything other thbic outlet can learn how to keep your cuisine cultural yet healthy and popular.
The yoghurts make great dessert options.
author: Auroshikha R.

description: Good food for a good price. Very casual. I liked it. I would say it is a fast food, super high quality fast friendly (:
author: Rafael M.

description:
This is a clean and modern "Greek" restaurant located on possibly my favorite street in Hayes Valley. The menu is basically pork, chicken, lamb or veg sandwich or salad and some sides. There is also some good looking ice cream served at the counter as well. 

When I came here, it was at 3 pm on a Friday on though there was not a line, there were still a fair number of people dining in. My friend and I decided to split a chicken sandwich and an order of fries. The chicken sandwich is supposed to come with ""granch" dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese." I did not taste any navel orange or fennel, and there was only the slightest sprinkling of cheese. The sauce was not distributed evenly through the sandwich either. Not to mention, the chicken was dry and salty. The fries are supposed to come with cheese, oregano, and olive oil as well, but again, there was only the slightest sprinkling of cheese with no olive oil or oregano flavor either. What a disappointment. At least the price wasn't exhorbitant.

Service was fine and the other diners seemed happy, so maybe we should have just avoided the chicken.
author: Jung-In S.

description:
Love this place. Simple, good food--my favorite is their harissa-spiked yogurt that they serve as a dressing on their salads. They don't skimp on the meat either. The first time I ordered a lamb salad from them, I ordered it with extra meat because I was afraid they would be like most places and give you a measly 1.5-ounce serving. Well...I wound up with what looked like a meat salad on my plate--as in, meat, and the kale, romaine, cucumbers, and radishes looked like they were just garnishes hahaha...lesson learned. 

Next time, I ordered the lamb salad, I didn't get extra meat. Still a decent serving. 

One of my go-to places for sure.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Ordered takeout dinner from here, so can't comment on the ambiance. The food was quickly made and fresh.

Roasted chicken salad - Salad had a good amount of free range pulled rotisserie chicken dusted with a mild cheese, mizithra (kind of like cotija meets feta) With the combination of ingredients, it was texturally too rough with the kale and fennel. Kale salads can be on the bitter side, but the orange slices and fennel didn't quite balance it in sweetness but stood out on their own. Chicken was pretty good and moist. I'd say it's on par with a Split Bread quality salad.

Frozen greek yogurt (olive oil and sea salt) - Yogurt is a soft serve froyo consistency watery and icy but still rich in flavor. Sweet, but not overbearingly so like Pinkberry or anything. The combination of sweet, salty, tangy and savory was highly addictive.

Healthy and clearly high quality eats, but kind of on the pricey side.
author: Truc N.

description: Very large menu. Salads bar are tasty. Pork may be a little tastier. Very friendly and attentive service.
author: Sadie J.

description: love sandwich and salad, lamb and pork. we're happy & satisfied :) will come back often & order online next time too!!
author: Emerson H.

description:
Just tried Souvla for the first time last week (upon recommendation by a Warby Parker employee) and I'll definitely be back many, many times! It was super quick and delicious - I ordered the lamb as a salad bowl and my friend ordered the lamb gryo. Both were great, but I was a little disappointed that the salad was more expensive than the gyro, since it's less bulky, but I'd order it again in a heartbeat. The fries and garlic sauce (an extra $1!) were also too good to pass up!

Pricey? Heck yes. Worth it? Definitely.
author: Marissa V.

description: Didn't live up to the hype. Their clientele can give you an idea of how authentic their food is. It's a gyro. Not a sandwich.
author: Julie G.

description: I love it! I tried the lamb salad~ Best salad I've ever had! The outdoor seating is also lovely at night!
author: Tu N.

description: I don't understand how there was a line out the door at this place. It was so bad that we threw out everything inside the pita sandwich and just ate the bread. The fries were good. We were so excited for the baklava froyo.....it tasted spoiled.
author: Valerie S.

description: So far our favorite place to eat in our San Francisco adventure.  My wife loved her salad and the pita wrap with real cubes of not-ground lamb was heavenly.  Not to mention Greek froyo!
author: Devin R.

description: Oh My GAWWWWD!!! I wish I can give this place more stars!! Best chicken mediterranean salad I've ever had hands down!!! The dressing they use is Greek yogurt which was perfect!! The Greek fries were amazing alongside Greek yogurt dip! I completely understand why the long line everyday! If you are trying to dine in during the week for lunch try to be there by 11:45 am the latest and you should be able to grab a table. Too bad the line was too long for us to order a frozen Greek yogurt but that gives me a great reason to come back!!
author: Sandra S.

description: Atmosphere was lovely, and the food was AMAZING!  Best french fries ever.  The pork shoulder gyro was big, incredibly flavorful, and the hot sauce on the table was perfect.  I ordered the greek iced tea, which is lightly sweetened and comes in a bottle.  SO GOOD!
author: DeAnne S.

description:
I'm personally not the biggest fan of Greek food but had to give this place a try because so many fellow yelpers raved about it. At 6:30PM on a weekday, the line was already out the door. 

Chicken Salad (13) - STRAIGHT FUEGO! Highly recommend! Next time I'm definitely getting dressing on the side because it is a bit oily. The "granch" dressing is basically greek yogurt and ranch, which is as delicious as it sounds. Defeats the purpose of eating a salad if you're gonna drench it though. If you choose to live your life on the edge, by all means, go ham.

Lamb Sandwich (13) - Lots of meat so you're definitely getting what you paid for. However, the lamb was a tad dry. I felt like it could've used more yogurt. The cucumber gave it a nice crunch and was refreshing too! 

Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles (5) - ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Not too sweet, even with the syrup. Perfect way to end the meal.

I would make my way over here for the dessert alone. This is an excellent spot for a solid post-gym meal. Will be back!
author: Lucy N.

description:
I'm a big fan of Greek food and I was a little hesitant about this place because it seemed too "healthy" and "hipster" to have good flavor, but I was wrong! This place is so charming. Loved the décor. My friend and I stopped by for a quick bite before heading to a yoga event at Fort Mason.

We shared the Mary's Free Range-Chicken salad and Superior Farms Lamb Leg sandwich. Both were AMAZING. I don't know what they do with the kale-- but it's probably the best kale I've ever had. You know, now that I think about it... I'm not even sure it was kale. Whatever it was, it was bomb.

I did notice that it seemed like everyone around us ordered the Greek fries-- there must be something special about them. I'll have to try them next time I'm here. I also JUST noticed that they have Frozen Greek yogurt on the menu-- definitely will try that next time too!

Tip: You order first and then find open seating. It can be a little crowded, but you should share tables and meet some friends. :)
author: Linda N.

description:
Okay, I've tried Souvla a numerous amount of times now, that I can finally give it a solid review.

I don't come around Hayes Valley that often, but I decided one day I was looking for a really good wrap. Stumbled upon Souvla, and my craving was somewhat satisfied. 

The chicken wrap was pretty good, except the chicken was dry. Same if you get the salad. Chicken needs to improve a bit more, and needs to be juicy.

The lamb was pretty decent though. This, I'd probably get again.

The fries and potatoes are really good! Carbs, can't help myself.

BUT, THE FROZEN YOGURT. I became addicted. I tried the olive oil and sea salt, which was my least fav. But with honey drizzled on top, so yum! I can eat it everyday!

I even asked the guy where they get the honey from, and he said its imported from Greece. Ugh!
author: Nika K.

description:
I love me some tender, Greek lamb on a pita with heavy tzatziki. Like, I really like it. It's not even 10am yet, and just writing this review has me planning on eating Greek for lunch or dinner... or both. 

Souvla is the best Mediterranean anything I've had in SF, and I thoroughly enjoyed my lamb pita. I also loved how it feels like a little take out spot, but you can totally saddle up and wash your flavourful goodness down with rosé. 

The only reason I'm not giving this place five stars, is because of the lines. SF loves to line up for things, but when you're hangry, this place has the potential to really get your goat.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
I ordered a greek chicken salad for a lunch meeting through Caviar and was able to customize it to my whole30 needs without being a pain! 

Whole30 Order: Chicken Salad - fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots over kale and romaine lettuce. Plus I added white sweet potato and it was delicious. I ordered the olive dressing on the side. 

I normally eat salad once in a while since it can get boring, but I would definitely each this salad every week! It had great flavors and juicy chicken. I would be interested in trying the pork next time.
author: Alpacalunchforus 1.

description: I don't get the hype.  Lamb sandwich: dry, flavourless lamb.  French fries: undercooked, flavourless.  Harissa sauce ($1 extra): no taste harissa.  Any street souvlaki joint does better for 1/4 the price.
author: c n.

description: I have to say I'm not a fan nothing is bad but nothing is real Greek to me. I love Greek food which we are clearly missing in this city. But this is Americanized Greek food with a fast food twist. It's like a Panera of "Greek food" while the baklava yogurt is great nothing here oozes that traditional Greek/mediterranean itch I so badly need scratched
author: Morgan S.

description:
Hands down, the BOMB DIGGITY! 
First time here and I was not disappointed in the least. 
The staff here goes above and beyond ! And the food .... THE FOOD IS AMAZINGGGGGGGG! 
We got the pork shoulder and free range chicken sandwiches and a side of Greek fries. Everything Was made to order and sooooo tasty. Will absolutely be back. This place is a gem for sure
author: Kamaria S.

description: Returned to Souvla, but this time to try a dessert! Today, I got the Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup. It was so so good!! The yogurt is plain, creamy, smooth, neither bitter nor sour nor sweet. Almost like milk in that way, I suppose. It's delicious. And then that topping. Wow! So amazing. The baklava and honey syrup is very sweet, as you'd expect, but if you can control yourself enough to take little pieces of the topping on your spoon to pair with the yogurt, you'll enjoy a beautifully balanced dessert. I'm curious to try out their other flavors!
author: Jen A.

description:
Went back with my family, and finally got the frozen Greek yogurt with the baklava and honey--Souvla has solidified the fifth star for me.
Got the lamb sandwich again and there's really not too much more to say as all the other reviews cover how amazingly good it is.
Still true that the amazing bread can tire your mouth out a bit, but I love bread so whatever.

COME HERE.
(or don't, because the lines are getting a little long.)
author: Gautam G.

description: Their vegetarian wrap is so beautifully planned and assembled. It feels like such a treat to eat. Their greek yogurt with anything is to die for. This is my go to spot in Hayes Valley.
author: Karishma S.

description: $11 salads of $10 pita wraps. Only 4 options (lamb, chicken, pork or veg). I had the veg salad and my husband had the pork salad. Both salads were good, fresh, and a nice size. I wish there were more options, especially for vegetarians.
author: Jenine G.

description: I was surprised there was a line out the door here, but it smelled so good I decided to wait. Glad I did! The chicken salad was huge and fresh and delicious, the juicy potatoes really lived up to their name, and the frozen Greek yogurt with honey was tangy and the perfect texture. If it hasn't been so dark out, it would've been great to eat in the park on the corner. I'll be back.
author: Madame W.

description: Cute place, good food, pretty decent prices. I would really love more options on the menu since it's pretty small (preferably more veg options) but still good. The veggie sandwich was pretty good, it wasn't incredible but I still really enjoyed it. Greek fries were delicious and so was the baklava Greek yogurt. Would come back & if you can sit outside and enjoy the cute little street it's on that's a plus :)
author: Cara N.

description: The chicken in my wrap was way overcooked.  Given the price, the line and the tiny room, not worth it.  Won't be back.
author: Jay R.

description: Nice servers and very busy there. Lots of to go orders were stacked up and many more were being prepared for delivery which is likely why the wait ended up being long. Ordered the veggie sandwich and veggie salad to go. Found both to be very bland and the potatoes were too thick/sweet tasting so I removed them. Overall taste was not exciting or memorable. I think this is best for meat eaters.
author: Win S.

description:
Two stars for the service, fries and baklava frozen yogurt. I was expecting a lot when I saw a huge line on a Wednesday night but sadly my meal was disappointing. It was just an overpriced sub-par chicken salad with no Mediterranean influence. The fries though were excellent and the Greek ranch dipping sauce was delicious. The salad could have benefited from a dipping sauce like dressing.  

The service was excellent and I would only come back for the yogurt topped with baklava.
author: Rachel N.

description:
We came here for lunch one weekend and it was packed.  We were lucky enough to grab a table before it was taken, but it's really hard.  I saw some people still waiting for a table even after their food was ready.

I had the chicken sandwich while my friend had the salad.  The sandwich itself comes in a large pita with lots of chicken pieces, cheese, lettuce, and a few pieces of tangerines.  At $13 it's pretty expensive, but it was stuffed with chicken.  Not a bad thing, except it was way too dry.  The tangerines helped, but since there were so few pieces of those, it wasn't that much of a help.  A little bit more sauce would be good too, cause it was a bit too bland as well.

I wonder if all the high ratings are for the baklava, cause I've had better gyros elsewhere.
author: Karen L.

description: I had lamb over salad. Meat was very tender and delicious. Portions are hearty. Overall everything was just great. Little pricey but definitely worth it. I will try chicken next time.
author: Tar K.

description: Best salad I've had in years...no joke. Had the chicken bowl and loved every piece of it. Large portion and got fries on the side which were also amazing with their signature dip "Granch". Always crowded and line so be prepared but worth it for a daily cheap and quick lunch. They need to expand.
author: Ranee W.

description:
Hipster, please:

I got the chicken sandwich. Seriously let down, cause I know it could be so much better. What's the point of sourcing high quality local meats when the staff just kills it? Chicken was so dry and overcooked it could have been canned tuna. The veggies were nice and crispy and seemed fresh, but the pita was a sorry excuse for a Greek wrap; this was on par with Safeway pitas.  Not even grilled or warmed up. 

At least the wine was a large pour.  But there is no way this food is worth the wait. 

If their corporate chef could please pay a little more attention then I'd be a happy repeat customer.

Update:  as I was waiting in line to use the restroom, I saw one of their kitchen prep employees blowing his nose, then he did not change gloves or wash hands before going back to picking chicken.  Yuck.
author: Lauren K.

description: Dope. Totes delish. Frequent stop for high quality fast eats. Highly recommend. Can't say it enough
author: Greg W.

description:
Okay the line at lunch can be long (?), but anyways the food here is fresh and on point. Am I going to force a friend out of town here, god no, but I will force my local friends to meet me here for lunch. 

Additionally love the fact you can order them off some of the delivery services.

Oh always get Greek style, gosh that sounds wrong.
author: Robert E.

description: Only been here for the Greek yogurt (which is amazing with the baklava) and wine but I'm sure the food is just as great! Finding a table is sometimes a challenge because it's usually always busy but I find this place to be a perfect stop to pick up something sweet while you're walking in Hayes Valley.
author: Miss A.

description:
There have only been a few times in my life where I've walked into a fast-casual food spot and thought "My God... this could be big not only in this city but nationwide." The first? When I first strolled into what was a local Denver spot called Chipotle Mexican Grill years ago in Denver. The second? A dumpling mecca in Shanghai called Din Tai Fung. The third? A revolutionary salad spot in Dallas called Bread Zeppelin, and most recently, a Greek spot in San Francisco called Souvia. This is going to be big. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

In my mind there's a difference between "gah look at that line what an inconvenience" and "wow look at that line that place must be LEGIT". With Souvia it's very much the latter, but know that the layout is such that lines can easily pour into the street and even once you're inside you'll have people circling your table like a batch of vultures. 

Even so, the service at Souvia is fast and friendly, and that's largely thanks to what is a brilliantly simple menu. Pick your protein and how you want it and BAM. There is is. Dessert? Go for it, and you can expect it all in relatively short order. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

I'll get right to it - my $12.00 chicken sandwich was huge, and I made a huge mistake by ordering some frozen greek yogurt to go with it. Now, $12.00 isn't exactly cheap (we're talking more expensive than a Chipotle burrito with double meat here), but as you can see in the picture this was a quality dish. Star Granted.
