That being said, the food is outstanding. I love the minimalist approach to the menu; they offer 4 options to be served as a gyro or salad. All the gyros i've had taste fresh but with warmth of home-made / authentic greek food aspect. The restaurant also offers beer + wine and most notably a unique, frozen greek yogurt served with unique flavor options. Definitely worth sampling them all.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Cute, greek place.  Lots of natural light, counter service, and surprisingly expensive.  Guest check for two modest eaters:  $38.07.  Order wisely.  And also, caveat emptor, there is a general sense of upsell pressure from staff there.  "If you're dining in, why not a glass of greek wine?  Why not a side order of greek dressing for $2 more?"

As for what we ordered:

The chicken bowl comes with kale and delicious greens.  I'd say that is a 4 star item.  My friend loved it, period.  I thought it was a tiny bit small for what I paid ($12) and a tiny bit overdressed with olive oil, but still really was the highlight of our food.

The lamb sandwich wrap--I love pillowy wrap bread, so I almost always prefer the sandwich over any platter.  The ingredients individually were all very well done and delicious, but they didn't work together as a whole.  And this lack of balance can easily be fixed. Specifically, here are the elements:
* meaty (a little too much and also not cut in a sandwich friendly way), 
* sour (not enough yogurt sauce, so be prepared to shell out an extra $2)
* comfy carb (pretty good, pillowy wrap bread), 
* fresh (way not enough vegetables), and 
* unctuous (olive oil literally dripping all over my hand and plate).  

What most people may expect from the gyro memories of their past is a mystery loaf of lamb/beef on a spit, thinly sliced to be easy to eat.  This wrap is not that--it's 100% genuine lamb.  Suggested improvements:  I'd actually use about 3 less chunks and shred the lamb a little bit more.  Also, please pick through and remove the excess connective tissues.  On at least three pieces I ate, I was stuck with lamb gum.  I've uploaded a pic to get a sense of the inside of the wrap.

FRIES:  excellent.  I happily ate them all, along with the rest of my $2 granch sauce.

Greek yogurt dessert:  as the restaurant was starting out (day 6), many guests who talked up the owners got the dessert for free.  Alas, we paid for ours.  At $5 it seems pricey, but I would say it was really worth it.  One of the owners went through the trouble to get those once ubiquitous NY coffee cups (a very nice touch).  The yogurt itself had a beautiful sourness and tang and the toppings and sauces were unusual and just worked.  Chopped baklava?  Really worked!  Although it's more expensive than some places, it's one of the two places I will now eat frozen yogurt (the other being Fraiche).

The people working there were nice and knowledgeable.  But the suggestive sell element was less focused on my personal well being, and more on upping the already hefty guest check I felt.  So that put me in a guarded mood rather than a happy, neighborly one.  If you want me to buy a glass of wine, offer me a little sip at my table perhaps?  If you were expecting a $20 meal for two, this isn't it.  The guest check for the meal (wrap, bowl, fries, extra side of greek ranch, and yogurt) will set you back a whopping $38.07 + any tip you might offer.  And this is for counter service, not table.  Three stars for the sandwich not living up to its potential, quite yet.  If the sandwich improves, I'd give this place four stars. And a definite 4+ stars for the yogurt.
author: Philip L.

description: This place usually has long lines, but tends to move fast. I tried the Greek rose wine which was on point. I also tried the baklava greek yogurt which had an unexpected tartness mixed with the rich baklava. A delicious combo that it took a few bites in to really appreciate. Wouldn't think it, but it paired well with the rose. Very eclectic decor, worth another treat if only just for the baklava yogurt. A+ for originality.
author: Linda H.

description: Quick service. Solid, hearty, authentic enough Greek wraps. Cool artwork and vibes. No complaints here! The lamb and chicken were both tasty, and the friend Greek yogurts with baklava, honey syrup, cherry, and sea salt were all scrumptious!
author: Andy L.

description:
baklava frozen greek yogurt!!
the yogurt was a bit too sweet....i was really hoping the yogurt would be like that one at pike place market but alas, i was let down to see it was just frozen yogurt.
nonetheless, baklava on yogurt is a genius idea!
author: Priscilla P.

description:
A friend and I stopped by for dinner on Wednesday night at 7PM and were able to find a seat pretty quickly. We both ordered the Lamb Salads, shared an order of the Greek Fries and had some greek wine, it was all delicious! The Salad was really fresh tasting and a filling size and had a lot of really juicy lamb meat. The fries were cooked well and with some hot sauce hit the spot. To top it off we got one greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and one with olive oil, sea salt and honey. The greek yogurt is tasty and the baklava crumbles are the way to go, we found the olive oil + sea salt + honey to be a little odd (mainly because of the olive oil).

I would definitely go back again but would make sure to get there on the earlier end of dinner time because by 7:30PM it was packed with people waiting for a seat!!!!!
author: Moneeza P.

description:
I really wanted to like this place - I swear. Especially after all those times driving by and peaking into the crowded interiors. I mean I definitely have a strong liking for the interior decor... Reminds me of a lush lounge thanks to dim lit intimate setting and plants hung about. The people who eat here look pretty good too, as expected from Hayes Valley.

But thats where the spectacular ends... Because when I tried my salad with chicken, the flavor fell short. Given the hype, it came out pretty average. Ingredients are fresh and seemed to be sourced with conscience! But I just didn't think the actual food matched the expectations.

Cool chairs though.
author: Grace O.

description:
Love the concept as greek staples like roasted chicken and lamb, in their traditional Mediterranean preparations, have been been under-represented in the fast casual segment.  Unfortunately, I think the execution at Souvla misses the mark and under-exploits the potential of these foods.  

On the positive side, the ingredients are high quality, the service is fast (a line extending to the street moved very quickly), and the environment in the restaurant is pleasant.   My wife and collective had the chicken sandwich (essentially, a souvlaki), the "juicy" potatoes (prepared under the chicken drippings), and a lamb salad.   The meat was a little dry.  Dry meat and bread is a bad combination in any sandwich.  More critical, I think, was that -- across both the potatoes and the sandwich -- was a missing "herb-iness" that is essential to Greek cooking.  The potatoes should have been bursting with oregano and lemon flavor, when in reality it lacked both save for a insubstantial scattering of oregano.  Same with the sandwich.  The chicken should have been rich with a garlicky, lemony, oregano-ized marinade, but it tasted fairly plain.  It's a real lost opportunity as both the meat and potatoes should have been rich in flavor.  Instead, everything was kind of bland.

Overall, the place is a little disappointing and I probably wouldn't return here.
author: Andrew F.

description:
They put something magical in their salad dressing (I believe it's Greek yogurt) which makes this one of the most unique salads I've had. Their portions are large and satisfying, their ingredients are fresh and flavorful, and their lamb is super on point. They have a huge thing of lamb on a rotisserie for everyone to see, which is a nice characteristic element of the place that's hard to uncouple from my memories of the place.

Their Greek yogurt with baklava bits is life-changing. And you can ask for extra baklava. And you get it within 30 seconds of asking for it and you watch them fill a cup with swirls of the yogurt and it always feels like they're giving you extra. It's hard to walk past this place without instinctively walking in and ordering a yogurt.
author: Nancy H.

description:
This place is always packed. Every time I walk by it. Of course I decided to try it out on a Saturday. The one nice thing is that the guy at the register warned us that the food comes out quickly so we might want to find a seat before ordering so that we weren't standing around holding our food waiting for a seat. I really appreciated that! The veg salad and the lamb salad were great! 

This place is small, but the service was good and the good came out quickly. 

I am looking forward to returning and trying one of their frozen yogurts.
author: Jen G.

description:
Souvla has become really popular on Instagram lately; I can't seem to go on my feed without seeing either the racks of meat sweating or the adorable froyo cups in someone's hand.

You get a choice of meat to go into your sandwich, but I would advise against the pork; it was a little too hard, and the lamb was much better tasting. The greek frozen yogurt with baklava and honey is the perfect treat to take to go for a quick stroll around Hayes Valley afterwards.

Service is insanely quick, and seating is extremely limited. Come, especially if you need a new Instagram.
author: Christina S.

description: Such simple food, but so delicious.  I've had Greek food before, but they really take it up a level.  They have a few unique dishes as well.  Everything I've had here has been pretty amazing.  The sauces are the kind that you want to lick up every bit.
author: Greta R.

description:
Tried out Souvla for lunch Wed 4/16/14.  It took over that Sebo spot on Hayes next to Patxi Pizza.  It's more bright with some two-tops and a communal table.  

You order at the back register, pay, get a number, sit down, and someone brings you your food.

I got the Pork Shoulder Wrap for $10.  Extra yogurt sauce is $1.  Got my food pretty quick.  Wrap is average size, good amount of meat, tiny amount of yogurt, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese.  I thought the meat was a bit chunky and kinda dry, but not too bad.  The extra yogurt sauce I think is skimpy, can't even tell it's in there.  Guy said it's in there, right.

Asked for hot sauce got Cholula hot sauce - nothing special.

Then I got the Greek Frozen Yogurt w/ sour Greek cherry preserve $4, with tax $4.35.  Paid at the front register where the yogurt machine is.  Thought it was just ok, small cup, kinda tangy, melts fast, preserve was pretty runny - sweet and a bit sour.

You can charge your food.
author: Ann L.

description:
I was helping a friend move into his new apartment in SF and as a mid-move snack, we came here. All I can say is that he's pretty lucky to live across this place!!! I would come here all the time.

+ Pork salad: the pork was really good, not dry or flavorless. And they pack in a LOT of meat which is nice; I hate when salads are literally 98% lettuce. My only gripe is that because it was a salad, the yogurt sauce was spread pretty thin. I noticed the sandwiches were packed with so much more flavor. 
+ Lamb sandwich: I really really liked the ingredients that came with the lamb option, and the meat itself was pretty good, if not a bit dry. The real winner was the pita bread that the "sandwich" was wrapped in - soooo fluffy, not dry or stale by any means!
+ Greek fries: really crispy but a bit plain. It doesn't have very much flavor to it.

Wish I had gotten to try the frozen Greek yogurt, but I had to save room for Smitten ice cream! The decor is awesome and the space is really pretty, though a tad bit small. I wouldn't recommend bringing larger parties here. The order system was pretty quick, too. I could imagine myself coming here quite often for a fast meal. Too bad it's on the other end of the state..
author: Chloe K.

description: Update: the owner contacted me and asked for my credit card number for which he claimed he was going to refund me.  6 months later nothing has happened.
author: Sara S.

description: I love this place. I visited this cute little spot while at a conference, and wish they had one in Philly! You must order the chicken sandwich, and the frozen yogurt with baklava and honey. They are to die for! I also really enjoyed the greek iced tea.
author: Bianca F.

description: Cool spot in Hayes Valley. We had the gyro and fries. Both were very good - excellent rotisserie lamb, fresh veggies, and house made sauces. The fries were good too. A little pricey for a gyro and fries, but it's SF so we expected that! :)
author: Clive B.

description:
*so good*

We ordered a pork sandwich, a veg salad, and a frozen Greek yogurt with baklava.

The pork sandwich was okay, pretty good but not *wow*

The veg salad was amaaaaaazing! Love the white sweet potatoes and how well all of the ingredients work together. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon and getting this again.

The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was perfect; not too tart, a good amount of sweet, and a nice portion of baklava on top to even it out. The one with just honey looked great too!
author: Natalie C.

description:
This new spot is really nice - I like their energetic staff, bright colors, and good quality greek food!

* American Homestead Pork Shoulder, Yogurt, Cherry Tomato, Red Onion, Cucumber, Feta ($10) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco?select=M1vpWUXL4mT1Np1k1_PFPA#EY1UHT-jDitUP4gE_B_UDw
This had really great pork - it was rich and hearty and had a good flavor. It was all in a very thick soft wrap.

* Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles & Syrup ($5) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco?select=M1vpWUXL4mT1Np1k1_PFPA#yJnNDoM3gcccfJHZF8QVBQ
I loved this! The flavor had a slight hint of something cheese-y, the texture was thicker and more grainy than traditional froyo's. Just be aware it melts really quickly (and comes out just on the verge of starting to melt to begin with - so when they ask if you want your froyo right away with your food, maybe ask to pick it up afterwards. The baklava crumbles were amazing, covered in honey, delicious.

Menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco?select=M1vpWUXL4mT1Np1k1_PFPA#M1vpWUXL4mT1Np1k1_PFPA
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Excellent and innovative Greek-style cuisine, great service, awesome location and reasonable prices. The chef here, Tony, did eight years as chef de cuisine at Kokkari and it shows.

The chefs here are talented at being both inventive / experimental and delivering high quality, excellent tasting dishes. For example, multiple rotisserie meats, including lamb, pork and chicken hand encrusted with cheese grinds giving the meats a flavorful boost. We had the chicken and actually ended up taking an additional entire rotisserie chicken home with us. Another example is the Frozen GREEK yogurt - my favorite was the baklava flavor, but the olive oil and salt flavor was yummy and new. The salad was refreshing and well made. 

So, carryout is an option, but I still recommend dining in. The decor is pretty cool. There are both tables and bars to enjoy your meal. It's a small restaurant and popular so seating may be limited. It has a clean / hip vibe. 

The surrounding neighborhood is very cool too and worth walking around just to check out.

I highly recommend Souvla. Looking forward to returning.
author: David S.

description:
The lamb wrap here was disappointing. The lamb was super gamey and some were really dry and almost chalky texture while some other fattier pieces were less dry. I also tried the pork wrap and that was much better. The pork was tender and the addition of the crunchy cucumbers was great. 

The highlight of the meal was the fries. They must triple fry them or something because the outside is so crispy and the since is soft. The fries saved the place from being 2 stars.
author: Alice W.

description: Got the lamb and chicken sandwiches. A little bit on the pricier side (vs. other greek gyros places), but quality was definitely up there. Would love to come back and try their fries.
author: Thomas L.

description: Lamb salad, hot sauce, sweet potatoes, pita.  My #1 order on Caviar.  Work or home, half an hour or so. The chicken salad is also fantastic. What a time to be alive.
author: David M.

description:
Avgolemeno! 

Had a meeting at City Hall, and was looking to kill some time nearby before heading back to the east bay. My friend mentioned she was craving Souvla, and it was within walking distance. It's a cute place, with that bright blue/white vibe that's become indicative of Greek restaurants. The place is set up al fresco, so you order your food at the counter, grab a number, and your grub will be brought out to you. It's fairly small, as with most places in the city now, but we were able to snag a table outside. The place was packed, even though it was a weekday! I took this as a sign the food would be good. 

And it was! I ordered the lamb sandwich and avgolemeno (lemon, rice, and chicken soup). The lamb sandwich is similar to a gyro, but the meat wasn't as seasoned/garlicky and seasoned as I'm used to. However, the meat is much better quality. Instead of ground lamb, you get nice chunks of quality lamb meat, cooked to perfection. I tried some of my friend's greek fries, and they were nice and crunchy, not overly salted or anything. The real star is the avgolemeno. There is something super comforting about this soup, and it was hearty, not too lemony, and delicious. Definitely a place to make the effort and check out! I have to go back and try the frozen yogurt.
author: Angela L.

description: A little too trendy and hipster for me, but the food was okay.   For the price, offer a little more food.
author: Edgar C.

description:
This place is pretty awesome. We got take out here on a Thursday night and the wait in line was longer than the wait for our food. Had the pork sandwich and the lamb salad, got a side of the Greek fries and the baklava fro-yo for dessert. The pork sandwich was stuffed with meat and tasted like Mexican carnitas, it was pretty greasy. The lamb salad was good, also a lot of meat.

The show stopper was the dessert. I will bring people here just for the dessert! Tart and sweet, oddly tasted like apple pie ala mode, which I'm totally happy with. Great place, if it comes down to it, pass on the fries and put that money towards more dessert!
author: Ray K.

description:
Souvla has awesome Mediterranean sandwiches and salads. The ingredients have been super fresh every time I've been here. Serving sizes are generous, and I always leave full. The Greek yogurt with Baklava is a must-try if you like dessert!

It's a small place like most of the casual spots in Hayes Valley. Seating is open and there are usually plenty of spots. Good spot if you're in the neighborhood, but not worth a trek across SF.
author: Connie Q.

description:
Very trendy little place in the city, tucked away on a side street with cute shops.  There was a bit of a line, but it moved fairly quickly.  Like most places in SF, this place was small, but they had a nice seating area outside, and a few tables indoors. 

I did the lamb gyro, which was great, but not the best I've ever had.  The staff was friendly, but I couldn't help but feel rushed with the line behind me. Luckily I had plenty of time to read over the menu while in line.  The frozen greek yogurt with honey was unexpectedly good, and the best thing that we had there - get that!!
author: Madeline S.

description: Love this place! Nothing fancy, very down to earth and cozy. Food is delicious, service is very friendly. Great spot to catch up with a friend. The outside is heated which is nice. Vegetable wrap is my favorite!
author: Kristina Y.

description: Ordered take-out and sat at the local park. We ordered the pita sandwiches - one lamb and one pork with hot sauce. They were extremely tasty with a medley if great flavors.  We liked it so much we ordered take-out and delivery another day. We ordered the same only in a Salad instead of in a pita. I personally enjoyed the Salad better and ate the pita on the side. The veggies were very fresh, and flavorful.
author: Terese C.

description: This place used to be awesome. We order from there a few days a week and lately the quality is just declining. Feels like they don't really care anymore and it's just sloppy. I ordered a salad today and it was just so poorly made. I ate three bites and threw it away. Hoping they put that original care back into the product. Otherwise, we're going to have to find a new go-to.
author: Cathy L.

description: I checked out Souvla for the highly talked about frozen Greek yogurt with baklava and honey crumble on top the other day after getting a luxurious mani/pedi at my main spot LuxSF across the street.  I definitely enjoyed my little treat, especially the yogurt part of it!  The crumble was OK, and for next time, I'd definitely want to check out some of the other toppings.  There's only one size option for the frozen yogurt as well as it's served in an 8oz cup. I definitely love the idea of frozen Greek yogurt, especially since there are so many dessert options in the area, having a healthier one is very welcome! I'll definitely be back to check out more of their food items too since that chicken looked delicious on the plates I was seeing come out the kitchen.
author: Lisa I.

description: The baklava yogurt is amazing! Make sure to get there before meal rush because it gets packed.
author: Alan G.

description:
I had been meaning to try Souvla for a while, as I am a big fan of greek food. Since I was in the area and in need of lunch, I decided today was the day that I give it a try.

The location here is great, just a few shops down from Patricia's Green and situated among a number of other great restaurants, shops and dessert places. The presentation is great as well, everything from the trendy menu to the plating of the items served to you.

I have a few problems with Souvla though. For one, if I am going to be paying $12 for lamb at a place where you order at the counter, I expect to be getting a good amount of meat. As evidenced by my pictures, this is definitely not the case. This is further troubling as it is obviously intentionally hidden by placing a pile of radish and cucumber on top of everything else. 

Secondly, there are basically three options on the entire menu for entrees. You basically get to choose from chicken, lamb or pork and that's it. If you are going to so drastically limit my options, I am going to place a much higher level of expectation on the quality than normal. Although the food was maybe slightly above average, these higher expectations were not met.

Lastly, I was rather disappointed with the greek yogurt with baklava crumbles on it. Quite frankly there were no crumbles. As this item was prepared before me, I saw the server literally pour frozen yogurt in a cup and then attempt to smash a piece of baklava on top against the side of the cup. This is simply unacceptable. It would be trivial to actually have crumbled baklava ready to at the very least sprinkle on top, or even better, actually mix it in to the yogurt like the professionals over at loving cup do.

I doubt I will be inclined to give this place a second chance. I think Souvla needs to spend less effort trying to be trendy and more effort into increasing both the quality and quantity of their food.
author: Mark O.

description: The food is great. I've been here several times and planned to come back. However, the service proved itself awful today. I was hanging out with a friend. We both good full meals. After finishing our meals, we kept sitting and hanging out and working on our laptops. One of the waiters came up and told us we have to leave if we won't be ordering any more food. The place wasn't even full. I understand it's not a cafe for hanging out, but this attitude left a bitter taste in my mouth. My friend and I both will not be coming back and we were regulars.
author: Irina I.

description: Really incredible chef and owner! I had a special order I needed and they came to my rescue. The food was fresh and delicious, we will definitely be back.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Stopped by here with some friends after a volunteer event. My friend was raving about how much she loved the yogurt with baklava crumbles so I definitely had to try that. 
One cup will cost you $5, but it was actually really good! 
I usually am not a fan of tarty food, but this was really palatable and went really well with the baklava and syrup. Really wish I had another to munch on!
Will definitely be back to try the food!

Really appreciated the interior design of the place. The outdoor seating, while minimal was really nice and would be a great place to talk with a few friends or a date. Inside reminded me of a really decked out homely kitchen.
author: Steven C.

description:
A great place for some wraps in Hayes Valley. We just randomly happened upon this place after walking around the area and working up a good appetite. They serve amazing Greek wraps (or salads if that's your thing) and really great fries. I tried out the lamb but was really curious about the pork...maybe next time. 

The line moved quickly, and despite looking crowded we found a seat and ate comfortably. The Greek wine was perfect and really refreshing; the whole place made for a great experience and very good food to grab while in the area. Since I like going to Hayes so often I'll definitely be coming back here!
author: Edwin A.

description: Probably the best greek frozen yogurt i've ever had. I definitely recommend trying the baklava!
author: Mitasha S.

description:
Food: good looking and good tasting
Mary's Free-Range Chicken sandwich was very pretty (so this is why Souvla is popular on Instagram!). I'd eagerly go back, as the sandwich was unexpectedly delicious. The orange and cheese toppings complemented each other well and tasted really fresh/healthy with the chicken. Get the sandwich to fill you up, unless you feel like paying $1 extra for the salad.

Atmosphere: Greek and Chic
A restaurant you'd stumble into while walking around Greece. It's very charming with open windows, fresh air, and blue walls. You can see the rotisserie in the back, so it feels like you're in a kitchen. We took our food to-go (it was wrapped very cleanly in a white box) because we couldn't find seating, but I would've gladly eaten here. Service was fast.
author: Thea S.

description: Yum! The veggie salad is delicious and the service is so fast! They had my online order for dinner ready in 5 minutes! Super impressed.
author: Wendy S.

description:
Great restaurant. Prices are in line with similar lunch spots in the city. Typically I avoid Greek restaurants because the meat is low quality and poorly prepared, but this was a welcome exception.

I had the lamb and Greek fries. Definitely recommend hot sauce on the meat.

Also, I was expecting a long line, but we were able to order and sit quickly. Pleasantly surprised to see how efficiently things were moving. Will be back
author: Siberius J.

description: I have been to this place two times, on a weekend and on a weekday. The first time that I went there, I ordered a lamb salad. It was so good that I ordered a lamb salad again when I went there for the second time! I will definitely come back.
author: Saman P.

description:
Best greek salads and frozen yougourt in town.

This casual spot is great for take away or a casual dinner or lunch, don't be discouraged by their line, it moves fast and is worth the wait. 

Their menu is simple and short, you can choose between chicken, veg, lamb or pork options and choose it in a salad or a sandwich. Always get the chicken salad, too good...
They have some other snacks too but the best thing on their menu and one of the reasons their becoming so popular is their baklava greek yougourt icecream. And you can ask for a sample too! 

Can't not love this place
author: Marta V.

description: The costumer service here is awful!!! I made a mistake of ordering online to the Divisadero location as I was in a rush during my lunch time. But I needed the Hayes location. I showed up at Hayes and told them I would just pay here and do a new order. But they took forever to let me do that and after the manager came and finally agreed I was able to order and get food. I called the Divisadero location asking if I could get a refund for my order that I had tried to cancel and they told me it wasn't possible. This is extremely disappointing as I don't think it would cost them a lot to just cancel my order and refund my money. This shows very poor judgment in management. I like the food but I doubt I would go back here again. Such a shame.
author: Sara B.

description: We came here without looking for any reviews and were blown away by the quality of the salad ingredients. Our favorite part was the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava. So good!!!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Another overpriced mediocre spot!
Service: Hipster rude, half a star
Food: Maybe one start at best
Decor: that's the only thing they have going for them, 4.5 stars

Not sure what's the hype about, but I am glad I tried it and most likely not going to miss it.
author: Zeek I.

description:
We snagged a table pretty quick on this Wednesday evening but the place was full. Big fan of the fast casual concept of grabbing a seat and placing and paying for your order at the counter. 

Friendly staff and simple modern and rustic decor give this place a clean and cozy vibe. We shared the lamb salad, fries with harissa spiced yogurt, and frozen yogurt with baklava topping to finish off. Perfect amount for 2 and I left feeling pretty stuffed. Not bad for around $27. Everything tasted great and I honestly have no complaints!
author: Sejal B.

description:
The food is great- tasty, good quality, and pretty healthy. The frozen yogurt is special- I don't usually like frozen yogurt but this stuff is good.

The reason I'm giving 3 stars is I feel strongly that their seating policy (or lack thereof) greatly decreases the enjoyment of the dining experience.  Yes, it's busy San Francisco, so hard to get a table at popular places, but the fact that you're totally on your own to find a table regardless of ordering sequence, set in stressful competition with fellow diners with whom you may end up sharing a communal table, hovering like hawks over those fortunate folks who are already eating, really creates a sour vibe.  I like sourness in my greek yogurt, not in my atmosphere.
author: Natasha P.

description: We've tried the wraps and salads here but the frozen Greek-Yo with olive oil and flake sea salt stole the show.  The slightly tart, lightly sweetened base offset by the salt highlights the fragrance of the olive oil.  It's an incredible combination.  The olive oil also adds a silkiness to the Greek-yo.  Hard to describe.  You must check it out!
author: Amy J.

description: One time I was eating on the table outside and someone bumped into my plate and spilled it everywhere. Very narrow tables outside but the chicken salad is a party in your mouth.
author: Laureano F.

description:
The nice staff and the Greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup are Souvla's saving graces.

Everything else falls way, way short of (admittedly high) expectations. 

Prices are slightly higher than you're prepared for, especially in a deceptively casual looking joint -- tack on fries and a dipping sauce to your wrap or salad and your meal runs almost $20. And that's before dessert (which, I can't repeat enough, is their saving grace). Most importantly, the flavors are muted, despite their vibrant, Instagram/Pinterest-worthy colorful presentations. The kale in the salad is tough, the meats are dry and lack flavor, and the portions are oddly small, especially for coming either with a pita or in a massive salad bowl.

The space is bright, airy, and warm, though, and if you want a sweet treat after your meal, get the yogurt.
author: Betty W.

description:
Love this place. Friend recommended thank goodness otherwise it probably wouldve taken toooo long to stumble into this place!

I feel GOOOD eating here, quality, healthy food. Plus it tastes amazing. You can choose your protein (chicken, lamb, pork, sweet potato/veg) then decide whether you want salad or sandwich version. 

The salads for one...creative ingredients that really complement each other. The sweet potato salad is the veg option that I tried today. Sweet potato in a salad is a great idea. So yummy, add some kale, walnut pieces, diced kalamata olives, mozzarella, pickled onions. It's going to be my go-to salad. 

Also dont forget to order the frozen greek yogurt. With baklava. Yeah, it's genius. And DELECTABLE.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Yes. Hell yes.

I could have easily split a gyro and fries with someone. I should have. I didn't. I rolled out of here after lunch super happy and needing a walk. Making a mental note to split my meal or take half to go next time.

My pals got salads and were able to leave room for frozen yogurt. I tried to not hate them for this. The froyo looked hella good. They rolled their eyes while they ate. I took it as a good sign.

Order at the counter, find a place to sit, or take your stuff to go. There's a neat little spot nearby to eat outside but we sat inside. Pounce on a seat as soon as you see one open up. It's a good exercise in reflexes.
author: Loli L.

description:
The food is good, but overpriced.  I don't know why I expect anything in Hayes Valley not to be overpriced, but I do, so I'll repeat:  The food is good, but overpriced.

I'm still sad that Herbivore is gone, so I'm doubly sad that Souvla will be bringing the Opa! to NOPA.  (Seriously, Souvla, the same restaurant in Hayes Valley and on Divis?  What are you, Boulange de Pretentious and Overrated and Over-saturated?)

The ordering system is ridiculous.  The people who work here are nice and efficient as can be, but the ordering system is set up to confuse and annoy people, and confused and annoyed people are more likely to leave sooner, thus freeing up the few available tables and long line for more soon-to-be-confused-and-annoyed people.

The sparse menu pages are precious and a total waste of paper.

Wow, this is sounding like a two-star review, isn't it?  But the food is good, but overpriced.  Oh well.
author: John S.

description:
This place is pretty dank. Although I eschew the trendiest, most popular places because of the frequent overhype, I was recommended this place by the person who I came to visit in SF. 

Walked right in and ordered the chicken salad. The technology here is advanced compared to Maryland, and you pay for the tip on a tablet. I can't imagine Joginder ever having this at Metro Dhaba. 

I like the ceiling window that allows natural light to shine on my tanned arms. It's in an upscale neighborhood and the people around here are slightly boring. 

The salad was very good. 5/5. Comes with free range Sonoma County chicken, tangerines, onion, cheese, some tasty dressing. They've got a common table in the middle where everyone can sit and talk about how ole Peggy Sue down the block didn't show up for her class. No but I saw most people playing with their iPhones. 

I enjoyed kind of blending into anonymity here.
author: Jerry B.

description: I got the lamb salad, greek fries, and the fro yo with sour cherry. I enjoyed the fries and fro yo but was quite disappointed with the lamb salad. I didn't really feel that the lamb tasted very good. The portion size was pretty good, but I was expecting more of the gyro lamb meat. I wish that the lamb was more grilled.The fro yo is made from fresh greek yogurt and was the best fro yo ever. The greek fries tasted delicious with the yogurt sauce. I probably would just come here for those two things in the future.
author: Shu T.

description: I wish this place were in MY home town! Greek style salads or sandwiches with lamb, frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherries or baklava crumbles, etc. wines. Charming, simple & delicious!
author: Marie D.

description: By FAR my go-to restaurant in SF. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Personal fave is the veggie salad. The decor is top notch as are the people working there. You absolutely must get dessert too. I really love the greek yogurt with olive oil & sea salt but I hear they are all amazing. Seriously if you go to SF and don't go to one of their 3 locations (hayes valley, the mission or divisidero) it is your MAJOR loss!!!
author: Kaila H.

description:
It's good for Greek fast food in San Francisco, but it's really disappointing compared to food in Greece.

I ordered the lamb sandwich. While they were generous with the lamb, it felt like my sandwich was mostly pita and meat. The feta was good, as were the cucumbers and pickled red onions. The only thing is that there wasn't enough of any of it to make the sandwich more evenly balanced and interesting. 

My husband got the pork sandwich which did have more evenly dispersed cucumber and even tomato(!!), but the pork itself was lacking.

We got a side order of fries which were good. The honey Greek frozen yogurt dessert was delicious!

Overall, it's worth trying, but I'll be continuing my search for good Greek food in the city. 

TIP: If you get there by 6:30 pm, it's easy to get a table. After that you're likely to wait in line.
author: Jaching H.

description: AMAZING frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumble. The Baklava is already sweet enough so I would skip the honey. Probably the best frozen yogurt I've had.
author: Isabella C.

description:
This was an unexpected find while strolling around Hayes valley. We just had brunch but their yogurt looked too good to pass. So glad we decided to pig out because they were amazing!! 

The line was out the door but moved fast. The décor was bright, airy. Space is small but you can take it out and eat at the park which I prefer.

We had the yogurt with wildflower honey and with baklava crumbles. Both were refreshing and delicious. Texture was softer than the typical creamy Greek yogurt but still good nonetheless. 

Perfect treat for a sunny spring afternoon!
author: Vanessa N.

description:
I was really bouncing back between giving this place four stars or three stars. But In the end, I always give my ratings based on whether I would come back. Sadly Soulva doesn't succeed with this form of evaluation.

Let's start with the good: the meats that this place cooks are exceptional. I haven't had such tender lamb or pork in a long time. They have a rotisserie in the back so you can see them roasting their chicken which is just as good. This place is also in the hear of Hayes Valley amongst a lot of restaurants and shops so it's one of the better parts of town.

However... if you are going to be a place that has a limited menu (w/ high prices!), you really need to make sure said items are exceptional. I got a sandwich and a salad. I am not a big fan of pita to begin with, so maybe this was the issue, but I seriously felt that pita was the only thing I could taste with each bite. I don't why it was so overpowering. Like I said, the meat is delicious so I actually found myself pulling out the meat to enjoy it rather than sacrifice the taste with the pita. The salad was not that much better. The harissa dressing wasn't bad but it wasn't exceptional either. I think the thing that bothered me was the fact that it wasn't really Greek, it was a kale salad with the dressing and then the meat. Granted, this place is more Greek fusion (first place of its kind that I have tried), but still it wasn't too spectacular. The fries also... It seemed like the only thing different than regular fries was the additional of some grated Greek cheese, I mean come on, really? I also tried the soup, which actually wasn't bad, probably the best part of the meal...

Maybe I am just super picky because I have been to some amazing Greek places (see my past reviews) and also this place is more Greek fusion as I said earlier. Unfortunately, this concept needs to be more refined by Soulva, especially if they intend to keep a limited menu... Part of the reason I docked this review down to three stars is because I am already bored.
author: Kunal N.

description: The lamb quality is so disappointing. The only redeeming thing is the Greek potatoes and the frozen yogurts! The olive oil flakey sea salt is my favorite
author: Natalia G.

description: I came back here recently and it was the first time I experienced a decline in their execution.  At dinnertime on a Thursday evening I was served a lukewarm wrap and the pita bread was thinner and tougher than before.  I used to love the fresh fluffy pita!  What happened?!  Are they overwhelmed due to the opening of their Divis location?  It's frustrating to be served lukewarm food when you are dining in a restaurant - the pork was less tender due to temperature.  Luckily everything else was still as good as before - the ingredients still very fresh and the flavors all solid.  Because my pork shoulder sandwich was still good, just not amazing, I'm not docking any stars this time.  But if I return again and have a similar experience I may sadly have to cross Souvla off my list of favorite eats in SF...
author: Beatrice W.

description:
My ultimate favorite dessert - the greek yogurt w/ Baklava. Its sweet, but not too sweet, cold, crispy and refreshing. Its so delicious. Originally, I didnt want to try it because I'm not a big fan of Baklava in general. My bf got one for us to share, but he ended up needing to get his own that day. Its so good, that at times I get two of them! One to eat there, let my tummy settle and  one for the road! I'm a pig, especially when it comes to something I love. 

Must try (but I'm a sucker for soft serve).
author: Mo W.

description:
Chill little Greek sandwich joint w a small wine selection. Weird thing is though, we came here for their frozen Greek yogurt. Located in a hip little section of Hayes Valley, the spot is real unassuming and has a nice vibe to it. I've been told the food is pretty good, but didn't give it a shot as we ate prior to stopping by. 

- Baklava Crumbles w Honey  - GOOD

The spot is a little pricey, but would make for a good place to grab lunch. Parking isn't too hard to come by, but can see it being a hassle during busier hours. Would recommend for sure...
author: Jaso N.

description:
I ordered the Homestead Pork Shoulder sandwich wrap, which was really good, and moist and lots of flavor.  My wife ordered the lamb sandwich on pita, but she thought it was too drippy. The juice just poured out the end while she held it up to eat it! So it was a bit messy to consume.  The green side salad was fantastic.  Just very fresh ingredients and just perfect!  The fries were fine too.  The place is small and cozy but friendly.  The service was very good.  We sat in the corner inset next to the window so we had a nice view of Hayes St.  Very nice trees on this street!  

We did not have time to try any dessert.  The prices were a bit high but not too bad. My wife gave it a three star but I say it is a four star experience.  I just love Greek food!
We may try again when back in SF and Hayes St.
author: Michael S.

description:
Cute little place. 

I walked by it and there was just so many people inside and outside waiting for the food. I'd definitely have to try some of the sandwiches next time I'm in the area. 

I ended up just getting the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey. It was really delicious actually. The greek yogurt was nice and sour as expected. the baklava crumbles were this great sweet addition to the yogurt that was slightly crunchy, but still really sweet. The honey added this great sweetness, but not overly so. 

Protip: get the frozen greek yogurt. Really delicious.
author: Nina Y.

description: Flavorful, high-quality salads served in a casual setting and in a gorgeous, natural light-filled space. Souvla is probably the best casual, affordable dining option in Hayes Valley, and you can't go wrong with any item on their simple and short menu. Definitely give it a try!
author: Alexi K.

description: Souvla is so yummy! It's a pretty small joint but very delicious food. How it works: you get in line at the door, which leads up to the counter. When it's your turn you can order your drinks, desserts, and entrees at the counter and then take your number and sit down (hopefully you can find a seat). If you're getting the frozen Greek yogurt, you should ask to get it after you finish your food so that it doesn't melt while you're eating! We unfortunately forgot to ask so we got our dessert first and started off with that, which is fine because we don't really mind haha. I ordered the lamb salad and my boyfriend got the chicken shawarma. I didn't try his but mine was sooooo yummy. The salad is tossed and dressed well which is really important to me! The lamb was so juicy and tender and flavorful. I definitely recommend this and the frozen Greek yogurt with honey and baklava crumbles! Both are to die for. Make sure you come early to avoid a long wait time!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
LOVED Souvla!

From the decor, to ambiance - beautiful white tile, a giant rotisserie, high ceilings, and communal tables - to the food, everything was great. 

I had the veg salad, which came with (and I think the menu often changes) white sweet potato, pickled onions, walnuts, cheese (manchego?), and garlic yogurt atop a bed of kale and romaine. It was PERFECT! they also serve their white wine in an adorable little tin mug - 8 oz - with the glass. So you're really getting two glasses for the price of one!

I also liked being able to order at the counter, so once you're done eating you can quickly skedaddle.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I've been to Souvla a few months ago and their lamb gyro was delicious! So i decided to go there again and introduce it to my sister. We went there last night and got a lamb sandwich/gyro, and salad to go. The person taking our order was very friendly and welcoming, as she gave us free fro yo samples. 
However, the food was very subpar this time. My lamb gyro was very dry and tasted really bland for some reason. I could taste the pickled vegetables and the garnishes but zero lamb flavor. It was very sad :(

My sister didn't really like her salad since the lamb was also dry and there was too much dressing.
author: Franz C.

description: I really liked their froyo with baklava crumbs. It was amazing. Their fries are also good. However, I found their chicken sandwich to be ok and not worth the cost. The line was also absurd. Go for the froyo!
author: Jeremy P.

description: One of my favorite places in the city! The food is absolutely delicious! I haven't tried anything I didn't like. My only complaint is that there is barely any seating for how crowded the restaurant is. However, it's a small inconvenience for some delicious Mediterranean food!
author: Joy L.

description: I love all of the salads here, the wraps and of course the Greek frozen yogurt with the baklava bits drizzled with honey. The meats sometimes can be a little inconsistent, sometimes the lamb can be amazing.. And sometimes it can be dry, the chicken is for most always dry so I always avoid ordering that. I finally tried their pork shoulder.. And it is amazing!! But I would have to go back to order it a few times to see the consistency. It is really flavorful and you get bits of the crunchy fat? You can order the dressing on the side because sometimes it does get a little oily. Seating is limited here, so be sure to have one person to find a table while another goes and order if it you see that it is a little busy. Btw sitting by the rotating oven does get a little warm. The food also comes out really fast!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Great place! This isn't authentic but still good. Had the sweet potato sandwich and it was delicious! It definitely needed some hot sauce but I would go back for it again. The fries were decent, but not memorable. 

The frozen yogurt is always good here!
author: Akshaya V.

description:
Had the Lamb Sandwich and Honey Greek Yogurt today.  Both dee-lish!  Fast friendly service, too!

I'm not usually a fan of lamb, but decided to try it given all the rave reviews.  The lamb was well-seasoned, tender, and juicy.  I loved the pickled onions, cucumbers, feta cheese, and sauce.  I practically inhaled the sandwich lol.  The greek yogurt dessert has a nice tangy flavor and it goes great with the honey, which becomes kind of hardened due to the cold yogurt.  So yummy!
author: Ana Marie L.

description:
Naming something the "best Greek restaurant" in SF doesn't go lightly, but I would say that. 
Their gyro is simply un-reproducible. Their meats are brilliantly seasoned and the bread is crunchy but also warm - I need to go back soon.
author: Andy L.

description:
At 2:30 on a Saturday, Souvla was just short of jam-packed. I was lucky to arrive right before a fresh rush and to find a place to stand at a table outside to wait for my to-go order. 

My high expectations for the food were not met. Both the pork and the chicken were surprisingly bland - I agree with the nyt article where they had to add more feta to the brine. Additionally, there were some chunks of fat (not nicely rendered and tasty, just globby) & connective tissue in both the chicken and pork - a little of this is not a big deal, but it was excessive to me. 

The rest of the components of both sandwiches were quite good and interesting, although there wasn't enough of them to make up for the bland meat.

But, the fries were excellent, and the salad was pretty good.
author: Lisa K.

description: I can see why this place is popular - it's quick, it's easy, and you can almost believe it's reasonable. But I don't know what people are talking about in their reviews when they mention satisfying portions. I ordered the chicken salad and it arrived barely meeting the halfway point of the bowl.  It definitely did not look like any of the pictures on Yelp. For an item with the word chicken prominently featured, there was very little. What was there was shredded bits scattered around the salad, and even worse was it was super dry and stringy.  Did not seem like a $15 salad and was not filling enough to be a meal. The pork sandwich was also dry and lacked some flavor and sauce.  If this is indicative of other items, I think the meats are being way over cooked. Fries were good.
author: whatever I.

description: Of all the little joints on Hayes, this is where we keep on going back to. Line can be intimidating, but don't worry it moves quickly. Never waited more that 5 min. Top items: Fries, though a bit inconsistent can be soggy at times; Chicken Wrap, delicious on occasion, but too wet or salty on others; Strauss frozen yoghurt with sour cherry-the bomb every time.
author: Stephen N.

description:
All I can say is WOW!!
I am really surprised that I didn't hear of this place before. If i knew a place like this existed, much earlier, they would be seeing me very often.
The most simple yogurt, yet it is so delicious. To make it even more spectacular they add baklava with honey on top and the taste of the two together is just AMAZING!!

Absolutely my favorite yogurt so far. The crazy thing is that there is nothing special to it because its just regular yogurt. I think the secret is the baklava :) I know I will be back here for more very soon. Also I am really interested in trying the schwarma. I can only imagine how good it tastes!!
author: Julia K.

description:
Souvla is so good, it put the other Greek spot down the road out of business. 

The are many reasons why this cafe/restaurant rocks, but it mainly boils down to:

1) THE DECOR: In typical Hayes Valley fashion, the space is adorably chic, minimalist and modern. It bears little resemblance to other more traditional Greek restaurants -- ornate carpets have been replaced with hardwood floors, clunky wooden furniture with industrial metal stools. 

2) THE FOOD: I've had the Greek fries (incredibly crispy and seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, oregano and mizithra cheese), avgolemono soup (basically egg-lemon soup with rice and chicken -- one of my favorite soups in the world -- though I will say Kokkari's version is better) and a lamb gyro (complete with yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onion and feta). The meat came right off the rotating metal spits on display and was so damn tender and flavorful. I've still got my eye on their brunch menu, Greek salads and Greek yogurt though ... next time!

Sadly, seating is limited. There's really only one large table which in my experience is usually occupied; the others are all tables for four, unless you opt for the bar seating in the back (but then as everyone knows you can't face your friends while eating which is a major bummer). Ah well. Think of Souvla when you want to catch up with 1-2 friends max and you'll be fine.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Absolutely obsessed with this place.

I finally understand the hype. It's one of those places that just does everything right; their fries are well seasoned and crispy, their salads are flavorful and meats are juicy, the frozen greek yogurt is the perfect consistency and level of sweetness. I just cant get over how good this place is; would eat here everyday.
author: Becky M.

description: Delicious!! The lamb is better than the chicken but they are both great!! The Greek fries were not as "Greek" as they should have been. Needed more of the toppings. Overall, it was delicious.
author: Vicki K.

description:
Wow super delicious! Cute little place in Hayes Valley next to the Proxy. Really delicious Greek-style wraps and amazing fries with cheese and olive oil.

You can pick 4 proteins- pork shoulder, chicken, lamb, and vegetarian and go for a wrap or salad option. I got the lamb gyro with pickled veggies and yogurt sauce in an awesome fluffy pita bread. SO GOOD. Protip: get it "Greek style" for 50c more and you get Greek fries in your wrap!

The salads are huge and looked delicious, so I'll be sure to try it next time. I got the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava and syrup for dessert. YUM. Perfect, tart yogurt, and delicious baklava crumbles. 

One star less for the price - it can run a little high. My wrap was $14- it will make you full and they're generous with the meat portions. They also serve beer and wine.
author: Kate M.

description:
One word for this place: NOM. 

Need I say more? ...Okay, okay, if I must. Souvla is a tiny little gem of Hayes Valley with a pretty simple menu done extremely well. 

Nomming tips: Any sandwich you can order as a salad instead. The froyo is BOMB --nice and tart with unique topping combos. If you're like me, don't miss out on the side of fries, you won't regret it...well maybe a little, but they're so good so who cares.

When to go: Great for lunch especially on a nice day. IT'S A SMALL PLACE so it gets loud and crowded during peak dinner hours, but it's also order at the counter style so people flow through fairly quickly! 

Heavenly noms await you!!
author: Erin R.

description: People love this local chain because it looks hip/trendy, but it is not worth it for the lines & prices. $13 lamb wrap- lamb was SO dry...not a good sign for a Greek place.
author: J. A.

description: This place is pure magic.  I can never leave without getting the frozen Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt (even though I'm always too full for it).  The lamb salad is my go-to, it's the perfect combo of flavors and texture.  I also recently discovered their hot sauce which makes it even better, if that's even possible.  I also really love their red wine.  Only downside is the line, but just goes to show how yummy this place is.
author: Elise C.

description: I got the pork shoulder salad and the baklava frozen yogurt. I was really looking forward to the frozen yogurt and wanted to skip dinner for that! It was delicious tart yogurt that taste like yogurt not super sweet. The baklava on top was perfect!! The salad I don't think is too healthy, but real tasty! It had a puddle of oil on the bottom of my bowl after
author: Karen T.

description: Favorite place for a healthy meal, especially after attending class at YogaTree, which happens to be right next door. They've got great salads and their Greek frozen yogurt is a nice little cheat (why not, if eating salad for dinner!).
author: Joanne G.

description: I can only recommend the gyros from my experience. The meat is always tender and the fixings on point. My only disappointment is lack of seating, otherwise solid lunch spot.
author: Seony K.

description:
Ok, let's get one thing out of the way first, this place is really expensive. $13 for a seat-yourself, Fast Casual Mediterranean wrap is a lot of money, even in this prime Hayes Valley location (the interior is also really nice/clean/modern and trendy).

That said, the food is REALLY good! The lamb wrap was likely one of the best I've ever eaten. Juicy and succulent and delicious. The pork wrap was almost as good as well. I'm also a sucker for Avgolemono soup. The lemony flavor is just so good, I can't stop eating it.

Anyway I've been craving the lamb wrap and the lemon soup ever since the last time I ate here (which was a while ago!) so I would almost give this place 5 star if it wasn't for the price. Go try it! Just don't make it so busy that there's a big line next time I want to go!
author: Ely L.

description:
Souvla is a hipster greek place in Hayes Valley. To go straight to the point, the staff is super kind and friendly. There's not much to choose, you either go for a salad or a gyro (sandwich). Pick a meat: beef, lamb, chicken, or pork.

The chicken is cooked in front of you (rotisserie chicken). It's a bit pricy but then again what's not pricy in this city. I had an extra order of fries with the garlic sauce, and it was extremely delicious!
author: Silvia L.

description: Pork shoulder sandwich was delicious!! Nice little place for eating alone or with friends, service was really fast
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place is very small, loud, packed with people, and extremely busy for dinner. However, the line moved quickly and the service was fast. I ordered the salad and a chicken wrap. The pita bread was a bit sweet and the pieces of mandarin oranges were an interesting twist to your traditional greek wrap. The chicken actually tasted a lot like tuna.
author: James S.

description:
I've been coming here since they opened and have always left with my taste buds and tummy very satisfied. I happen to work for the company who supplies their plates, so I have a special place in my heart for a business that buys local as much as possible. Charles and his team are ultimate professionals, and this little restaurant in the heart of Hayes Valley garners all kinds of (well-deserved) attention from the media. I love the concept, the simple menu, and sticking to the things that you can do better than anyone else around. The flavors here are off the chain, and you cannot go wrong with either the pita or salad. Also, the hype you're reading in all the other reviews about the frozen greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt? It's not just hype, my friends. You really must save room for this treat when you come here. 

Also, I just want to mention that while Souvla does Greek food extremely well, they don't take themselves too seriously. We came here with some friends for my husband's birthday, April 1, and they had completely transformed it into a taqueria for April Fools. They even hired a Mariachi band. So fun!
author: Lisa H.

description: Souvla offered some fantastic Greek food! We arrived at 6:40 on Wednesday night and it was starting to get busy. The two tables outside were open but none of the tables inside had seats available. We grabbed three seats along the wall and ended up moving to a table as soon as some people got up. They have hooks under the wall tables surrounding the place which is a super plus. The communal table in the middle was great. It was roomy enough to share. Steve held down the fort while we ordered. My friend had the  Lamb Sandwich, I had the Chicken Sandwich and Steve had the Pork Salad. We also got the Egg and Lemon soup. The soup was delicious and hot. It had really good seasoning with bits of chicken but none of flavors were overpowering. The Greek sparkling mineral water and beer were both refreshing. You order efficiently and grab a number. The food is brought to you, served in white tin bowls in little trays. We loved our food. The bread they used to wrap the sandwich is chewy and held together well. I almost always have issues eating wrapped food but none of the stuff fell out. The paper and bread held everything together. I loved the pickled veggies and tangerine oranges with the meat. Everything tasted fresh and light. The salad was too hearty for me but my husband loved it. I don't like a mouth workout so the pieces of kale and stuff were too big for my liking. Steve very much enjoyed the salad just the way it was. We ended the night with Baklava Yogurt and French Fries. Both "desserts" were great. The Fries were cooked nicely and had yummy lemon seasoning. The Baklava Yogurt had the perfect tanginess and sweetness because the flavors complemented each other. The service was great and the place was clean. Even the restroom was tidy. You can see into the kitchen while you wait for the restroom and the kitchen looked clean and well organized. A HUGE line formed while we were eating and many people had to wait for a table. The line was steady even after we were all done eating. It's a very popular place and worth it.
author: Jen L.

description:
The owner here is so unfriendly, we have been there many times and he never gives us the time of day.The food is way overpriced and not all that.
Sit on the sidewalk and enjoy the view of the  ugly tree well full of garbage. Git rid of that thing, it blocks the sidewalk as well.
author: K. K.

description:
I get their Chicken Kale Salad for lunch all the time. It is consistently yummy. 

I'm not a fan of yogurt so the sandwiches always seem a bit dry to me. But the chicken salad is so good.

Also, the staff is super friendly and ordering takeout from their website is really easy.
author: Paige B.

description: Oh my Theotokos. The avgolemono soup crushes game.. there's really not enough of it that I can find in the Bay Area . Everything else  I've tried so far is  pretty amazing as well. I am Greek and there's not a lot of options so you can only imagine how hard it is to get my fix. I've only had take out from my roommate so I'll be visiting the restaurant asap to try the menu in person.. I'm not going to cry about them not having something on the menu but I really really really need to find another place with actual dolmades. My cravings would then be ultimately complete. I've only found one spot in the city (kokkari) that actually makes them the authentic Greek way. I might be the only person in SF completely obsessed with dolmades tho
author: Adriana S.

description:
I think it's all about the grogs of wine here..or the Greek lager. Too bad we didn't try either.  Many of the people who dined there were ballers and got glasses of wine plus a salad or sandwich, which would run you about $25, just for lunch! 

The salads were pretty ginormous, and so were the pita sandwiches. I noticed that the pita bread was a bit inconsistent though -- some were fluffier than others.

I liked that the menu was very well laid out and simple to understand. It almost read like an infographic! Also really liked the skylight inside. That really added to the atmosphere.

Seating is first come, first served during lunch, which means it can get pretty hectic with people hovering over you for a seat.

If you have room (and money) left, try out the greek yogurt too!
author: Audrey L.

description:
This place is "backwards" - but AWESOME - in that the salad is much much better than the gyro where usually it's the other way around at most places. Everything is pretty pricey but I can't recommend the salad enough. I got it with lamb and it was extremely hearty, flavorful, CHEESY, and filling. The lamb gyro was just okay - the wrap itself was underwhelming. 
The greek fries were also amazing, especially with the greek yogurt ranch sauce. It has a lemony and tart flavor that's a little unusual at first to dip your fries into but I became instantly addicted.
author: Allison Y.

description:
I hate to give bad reviews but let's be honest here, the food was bland and overpriced. The lamb leg salad and lamb gyro, the meat was flavorless, overcooked and hard to chew. The avoglemono soup was ok, nothing special. The greek fries were most enjoyable but even then they were a bit on the greasy side.

The decor is nice. I like the simplicity of the restaurant which was modern and very clean.

Well, I'm not sure if it was just a bad day for lamb, but reading other reviews, doesn't look like we were the only ones to have this problem here. 

Don't think i'll be coming back until they are consistent with serving tender lamb. 

And for $45 for two meals and two sides, not including tip and we had no drinks was pretty expensive to me for lunch. I don't mind paying if the meal was worth it. This definitely wasn't worth it. It's too bad, really wanted to like it.
author: Heidi L.

description: Finally made it here today. Saw them on Infatuation. I got the chicken sandwich and the navel orange in there blew my mind.  I guess I skimmed it when it was listed on the menu. A couple of bites in i got to the orange bits and it was great! I also got the greek fries which were also awesome thick cut fried well season with cheese and some herbs. Do not leave without getting the fray with baklava on it! probably my favorite froyo I've ever gotten. Also tried greek beer for the first time here. Definitely coming back every chance I get.
author: Thielson D.

description: Very good gyros, but pretty pricey for street food. $17 for a lamb gyros!  Greek fries were good, too. I'd go back if it weren't so expensive.
author: Virgette D.

description: What a great little Greek restaurant.stop by to have a salad. It was great. The frozen yogurt with baklava was to die for. The staff is super friendly! Loved it!
author: Danai P.

description: I love Souvla but waiting 30 minutes for my take out dinner was very disappointing... Especially when you find out your order was never received. :( Make sure to ask if your order was put in rather just waiting.
author: Lina L.

description: I'm actually not all that impressed. I love greek food dearly but I didn't find the pork or lamb wrap to be all that excellent and the condiments, while tasty (I tried all four with the admittedly excellent fries) used too sparingly on the wraps. The pita was also a bit too tough. The avgolemono was also a bit thinner than I prefer. The price is also a bit high. My friend and I split the two wraps, fries, and soup and spent $40 ($48 after tip).
author: Misha T.

description:
Everything here is great.

The chicken, lamb and pork shoulder are all amazing.

The chicken is moist and tender.
The lamb and pork are perfectly seasoned.

Wrap or salad - you can't go wrong either way.

The tangy/sour Greek yogurt with baklava is to die for.
author: Matt W.

description:
When you walk in it's easy to tell: it's all about the rotisserie chicken! I got the chicken salad, which comes on a bed of kale and romaine, "granch" (Greek Ranch), clementines, and some onion. The contrast of the warm chicken breast pieces and cool kale, etc. simply worked. 

Friends got the french fries (cooked just right), and the lemon/egg/chicken soup which was described as  being "surprisingly good," and "cozy."

For dessert you can feel good about yourself with a cup of high protein greek froyo. I got the baklava kind, and yes, it was yumE. Everyone else got the olive oil and sea salt, and while too savory for me at dessert time, it tasted pretty good when I dipped a stray fry inside. 

You'll probably have to wait to sit, or settle for bar seating, it's first-come-first-serve seating.
Shouldn't be too difficult if you come with one other person though. It's one of those places I find myself referring friends to who want something of quality that isn't going to break the bank.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Really tasty, well priced souvlaki and chips. I always have the chicken salad and it's very tasty. As someone who has eaten a lot of Greek food, it's dumbed down a little and it's not the best I have eaten- but it's great when you want something quick and easy. 

Could really do with some Greek classic starters, where are the dips and pita? Olives?

Try the yoghurt, delicious.
author: Allie S.

description:
Felt like I was in Greece!
Except in Greece they put fries in the gyros..I miss that! Anyways absolutely amazing lamb "sandwich". I did get the fries as well which were perfectly seasoned, and put them in the gyro myself YUM! I cannot wait to go there in person (vs postmates) and try the frozen Greek yogurt!!! 
I don't think I'll order the soup again as it was way to salty compared to others.
author: Drea L.

description: We picked up a to go order from here - I ordered a lamb salad, a Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles, and some Greek fries to share. The salad was very good, with generous amounts of lamb and was mixed well, highly recommended. The Greek fries were just okay; nothing really stood out to me even though it sounded quite good on the menu - with olive oil and parsley sprinkled on it. The Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles definitely stood out to all of us though - the yogurt was just tart enough to balance with the sweetness of the baklava and syrup to make for an extremely delicious dessert to cap off the meal. It was so good that we came back a couple of weeks later just to order some of the Greek yogurt with baklava after eating dinner at another place. Definitely come here to try one of the their entrees, but also make room for some yogurt!
author: Wayne H.

description:
I just realized I've never reviewed Souvla - which is damn right blasphemous.

I live in the neighborhood and have eaten Souvla at least once (if not multiple times) per week for over a year. Feeling lazy but don't want to eat crappy take out? Get Souvla delivered (I use Caviar).

My go to is always the same:
Chicken salad with extra meat - the greens itself are sturdy, tasty, well balanced with a bright flavor that leaves you full without being bogged down. The chicken is also usually on point, but can occasionally be a little dry or fatty. The orange and fennel are HUGE bonuses.

Greek fries + Garlic yogurt
These are just addicting, although delivery can leave them soggy. I don't blame Souvla though, that's the price for my laziness. I could eat the greek yogurt side with a spoon. The mizratha cheese they use is super sharp and salty, which I love. 

Bonuses when I eat in:
Greek yogurt with sour cherry (add sea salt!)

Greek beverages (the iced tea and lemon drink are BALLER)

I've had the chicken sandwich but the wrap they use is too thick for me, it dries it out. The salad is always the move. I've had the vegetarian salad, while the flavors were good, the sweet potato was a little dry for my taste. I dislike lamb and have been meaning to try the pork.

Price is a little steep, but it's Hayes Valley and the portions are big. 

Basically, I'm obsessed.
author: Alexandra K.

description: Goegeous decor, wonderful portion size and a fresh new take on Greek. The sheer amount of take out should say something about this amazing little gem! The simple walk up ordering was perfect...I highly recommend!
author: Katie H.

description: 3.5 -- The flatbread was disappointing...it didn't have the right texture for me (not soft enough); chicken salad was fresh and good -- loved the slices of orange which brightened the dish. However, I realized I don't enjoy having rotisserie chicken on a salad...the mix of warm and cold doesn't do it for me somehow. Happy to have tried it though. Service was great and line moved fast.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Not sure why anyone comes here for food. Tried both the chicken and lamb sandwiches. I was grossed out by the watery boiled meat in both. 

The Greek yogurt is pretty good though, the baklava crumbles are fragrant and soaked in honey.
author: Meg A.

description: hmmm long lines too expensive. Ayola near financial district is much tastier better hot sauce better service shorter lines. not sure what happened here or how the reviews are so amazing. I let the manager know about my discontent and they refunded $5 on bill of $43 for one person.
author: Mohan K.

description: Fresh and flavorful. Friendly, efficient service. The veggie salad option (kale, sweet potato, kalamata olives, pickled onions, walnuts, & Greek cheese) is excellent--you can come here with your meat-eating friends and still get a delicious, filling lunch.
author: E. R.

description: Literally a little cup of frozen greek yogurt with baclava ray of sunshine heaven in the massively overpriced consumer hell-pit that is Hayes Valley.
author: Emily O.

description: Yummy yummy food. The chicken was absolutely delish, potatoes in rotisserie drippings major yum and lastly, dessert- frozen Greek yogurt with honey !! I will certainly be coming back.
author: Amanda L.

description: Bomb.com lamb salad. The meat is moist and delicious; I have also had the wrap but the pita is a bit to much chewing- maybe lavash would be better than pita. Make sure you get it "Greek style" which means fries- yum
author: Kam L.

description: Baklava Greek yogurt was heavenly .. I love froyo so this was great especially with the baklava crumbles on top. I also had this pork sandwich looking thing. Cute spot, clean and friendly staff!
author: Colette P.

description:
Greek food with a twist. Good for lunch. 

I thought the food was good and pretty healthy, but not something I'd come back again for. 

You chose a meat and it comes in either a salad or a wrap. I chose FREE RANGE CHICKEN in a SALAD, and it was a filling potion.  My friend ordered LAMB and I thought that was tastier.  They also have a lemony rice soup, wine, beer, frozen Greek yogurt. 

Seats are FIRST COME FIRST SERVED so you have to awkwardly hover around tables that look like are finishing up. There aren't that many seats and I noticed a lot of people order to-go. 

You order and pay first at the front. 

Parking - street meter or residential nearby but it's usually pretty busy
author: Jenn L.

description:
As many other Yelpers have explained, I also dont think this is truly Greek food, it uses similar flavors and ingredients and does a great job at it but i can see how someone would be disappointed if they were expecting Greek food. 

I had the chicken sandwhich and it was quite tasty, I went after the rush so I enjoyed my meal inside. The place is cute and the staff was very friendly. I will def try their greek yogurt with Sea Salt next time, as it was reccomended by a friend. Also their fries look yummy!!

I will def be back :)
author: Hetal P.

description:
If I don't order Souvla at least once a week, I am not a happy girl. Souvla has the best Mediterranean food  in the city, hands down and there isn't a dish here that I don't like. 

I typically order the chicken sandwich, made with chicken, tangerine, kale and the most delicious pita you ever did taste. Just add in Greek fries and you're set for one tasty meal.
author: Jalahn W.

description:
About a week after dining here, my friend sent me a link stating that this is one of THE places to go to for frozen yogurt. Unfortunately, we didn't try any. D'oh! Next time, I guess?

We had the feta fries, but the container they came in stopped us from actually eating all the components together. All the cheese and garlic fell to the bottom of the funnel. 

I had the pork salad. The first bites were amazing -- salty, savory, delicious. It was a rather large meal, however, and by the end it felt way too oily.
author: Lisa S.

description: Pretty good food. I got the chicken sandwich which was decent.  Their fries are A+. A little too expensive for what you're getting though
author: Arman J.

description:
What a cute spot in Hayes Valley...my favorite neighborhood to dine in. This place is literally right next to Patxi's...it's new so I hadn't noticed before, it's adorable and chic. The environment is friendly and the walls are decorated with cool, Greek memories almost as if it were your own friends and family on the walls. 
The chicken salad was SO good! We also ordered a lamb sandwich but I found the salad and chicken so refreshing and delicious. Totally a place I would go back to and between 3 of us we split two dishes and felt totally satisfied. I even had a to-go bag for leftovers. Good for casual, dining and something that isn't too heavy!
author: Priya S.

description:
Phenomenal. 

As someone who lived in Greece for several years, Souvla is the perfect blend of a Souvlaki stand and California Quick Service salad joint. 

I had the lamb salad and it really was perfect. With a side of Greek fries.  That I of course put INSIDE the salad. 

The flavors brought my tongue back to Greece, and the simple design brought me to Mykonos. I will be back. And I will eat everything on the menu.
author: Justin S.

description: The food was great, but the place is small so there was not much space to sit and eat. The chicken sandwich and garlic French fries are a must! It is a little pricey but pretty authentic which makes up for it.
author: Anastacia G.

description: Best frozen yogurt you will ever have! I always stick with the classic of honey topping and love it every time.
author: Erica B.

description: It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing. It was just ok, a bit flavor-less, actually. I got the pork sandwich, and was expecting just a bit more of a flavor. The ice-cream though is top-notch, will definitely be back for more of that sour-honey goodness.
author: Maria V.

description: I thought about ordering the salad, but am glad I went with the sandwich. Not too bready and the meat was tender and not too dry. Perfect balance of all the ingredients.
author: Colgan P.

description: We stopped in for a late lunch and ended up fighting over every bite, the lamb sandwich, greek fries and greek tea were all exactly what you want them to be.
author: Jeff V.

description: Best chicken, pork and veggie salads at an affordable price!!! And their Greek yogurt is quite delicious. Hayes location is my favorite since they were the first store. Secret pro tip: order online and pick up in 5 mins to beat the lines. Walk right up to the left side of the counter and say your name. Seating is a little hard, but so is everywhere else is SF. Go early and beat the lines and get seating.
author: Catherine G.

description: Went for a froyo run. Ordered the Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. Was delicious! Very generous portion! Be prepared to wait in line in the evenings. Highly recommend!
author: Ghazal S.

description:
Came here twice on a weekend! There wasn't much of a line and even if there is, it goes by quickly! However, parking is frikkin terrible around here!
