The first time I came here, I got the Chicken Salad which was scrumptious! I thought I'd let myself go a little bit and ordered the Baklava Green Yogurt for dessert :P That was sort of a guilt free type of dessert! I'd like to try their other flavors!

The second time I went back, I thought I should try something new.. so I ordered the the Lamb Salad which was not as good. The meat just seemed little dry so I'd stick with the chicken around here! 

I won't lie, their sambos and fries look deadly!
author: Michelle L.

description:
So yummy!!! BAKLAVA GREEK YOGURT! 
Will be my must have every time I'm in San Francisco! 
Sweet, tarty, crunchy, salty, creamy
author: Celeste C.

description: Hands down one of my top three favorite places to eat in the city. It's so unique, healthy and fresh - there's nothing else like it. The chicken then rotisserie in-house is amazing. I always go for their Vegetarian Salad (add chicken) cause the sweet potatoes are so good. Plus a side of Greek fries. And no way will you be able to leave without the Greek frozen yogurt and sour cherry sauce!
author: Jeanna B.

description:
10/10 modern take on a Greek classic. Roast potatoes served in the dripping from the spit with oregano, Avgolemono and the lamb souvlaki were all great. 

The ambience of the joint is nice, dimly lit, the decor very minimalist, modern and swish.  Staff are all happy and friendly. 

Only thing is it's kind of hard to see where it is from the street and it doesn't stand out at all with little exterior branding.
author: Iain M.

description: Yes, seating is limited. Yes, there will likely be a line. That being said, the food here is so worth it. While I can't personally vouch for the lamb or pork, their chicken is amazing. Especially in the salad. My dining comrade gave their veggie salad an enthusiastic thumbs up and we both fought over the fries. My final tip is this: do not leave without trying the frozen yogurt. For full disclosure, I'll admit to having a serious love affair with plain tart frozen yogurt, which means I'm practically an expert on the treat. Souvla's does not disappoint. Moreover, their toppings pack an extra punch. Personally, I prefer the honey the best, although the cherry was a close second. Skip the baklava toppings unless you have a massive sweet tooth.
author: Morgan B.

description: This place is legit. Fast food w/great service and fresh ingredients. I had the chicken salad and it was big and yummy. The place is small or "intimate."  There is bar seating outside for about four people total. Back to the salad--- a little different on a Greek take, actually not sure that it was really a Greek salad but it was good. The chicken taste like rotisserie; it had romaine lettuce and kale; there prices of mandarins in the salad; and it had a type of yogurt dress along w/ some olive oil and what tasted like cijota cheese. Again, it was like Greek w/ a twist. Oh! And the frozen yogurt was a nice, creamy, and smooth!!
author: Angelica C.

description:
Good food but not great value. 

We ran here on Friday before the Karsh Kale concert to grab dinner. Got the lamb wrap ($12) and sweet potato wrap ($9) to go and it only took a few minutes. I was kinda just expecting them to hand us the wraps to eat on the street but instead the wraps were individually boxed up. 

Tip - if you're planning on just eating it right away just ask for the wrap without the box. The box defeats the purpose of eating it on the go.

Both wraps were very good. I liked the radish and cucumber in the lamb wrap but my favorite was the sweet potato with kalamata olives. Nice combination of sweet and salty. 

However, they weren't very filling. Do not, I repeat, do not share or you will be starving. These are not Greek burritos. I'd say one wrap = 1/2 burrito in terms of how much it will fill you up. So it's not great value considering what else you could get for $12.
author: Jean K.

description: Great portions and taste! The Pork Salad was amazing, right combination of pork(delicious), dressing and greens. Baklava and honey on Frozen Greek yogurt was mouth watering!Friendly customer service and clean, light environment.
author: Daniela B.

description: Soooo good. Tried several items and loved every one of them. Seating is limited but don't let that stop you it's worth the wait
author: Kim K.

description:
Good lord!!! They say keep it simple, and do whatever you do well. This place hits the nail on the head. I Love the lamb sandwich and salad. 

Pro tip: Call in your order. It gets really busy for lunch and dinner.
author: Ryan B.

description:
So good I went three times in one week.

There's usually a line, but totally worth it. Get the french friends! They're on point.
author: Noga R.

description:
Came by on a Monday around 12:30, and the line was out the door. It moved quickly though! I ordered the pork salad with dressing and cheese on the side. The food was served within ten minutes of us sitting down, and it was so good! Huge chunks of juicy pork mixed with kale, romaine, tomatoes, and pickled onions. The salad portion itself was big enough to satisfy my hunger and to justify the $12 we spent on it. The garlic yogurt dressing was creamy, but acidic enough to cut the fat of the pork. I would recommend getting the dressing on the side, since I used about 1/4 of it and it was definitely enough. 

I definitely plan on visiting Souvla again to try the rest of the dishes, especially the lamb and the frozen greek yogurt!
author: Abby S.

description:
This is our go-to for almost any kind of craving...casual mid-afternoon bite, drop-by dessert... Found the sandwiches to be tastier than the salads, and we always get the fries and a sampling of the frozen yogurt (the cherry rules but the baklava is a close second).
Never get tired of this place.
author: A K.

description:
Food is great (maybe even more fantastic than when I first tried it) but staff needs to know the policy on patrons bringing in their pets. 

During my lunch, I saw two different people bring in their dogs INSIDE the restaurant. Not okay. Sure your dog is cute but be considerate enough for the people who have allergies. Pets are not allowed inside an establishment that serves food. Save that ish for outside.

Get it together, Souvla.
author: Joy A.

description: Cute place. The chicken salad was yummy. The fries are good. I will need to try the yogurt next time. I didn't give it a 5 star because the salad is costly for what it is.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: There was a line but it wasn't too long of a wait. Salad with veg was really good. I was able to substitute the cheese for cherry tomatoes (+1)!
author: Eva B.

description:
My mom got chicken salad + pork shoulder as take out, so I do not know anything about the service, but the chicken salad...
... IT CAME WITH THE SHARP BONE !! 
WHAT IF I SWALLOWED IT ?? GAHHHHHHHHH SO GROSSS 
I dont think I could ever go back to this place .. so disappointed ...
author: Yumi K.

description: Aside from the line (because too many people feel like I do), one of my staples in SF.  Never disappointed.
author: Jill S.

description: Unfortunately i only got to stop in for a togo order. However the place was packed so im not sure we 'd have sat in time for our need to go to a show anyways. Got the lamb sandwich. Well cooked lamb, onions and other goodness packed into a soft warm pita. Super tasty even on the run. I like the communal area up front then flanked by the high seats on the far wall. The extension to the outside of the space is clever too. Definitely a far cry from the old Sebo space. Will definitely have to dine in one of these days and sample all the other goods in a more leisurely manner. 4.3 stars
author: Kim N.

description:
With a few changes, this could be a spectacular lunch spot. The number one thing that needs improvement is portion size, or something to change the value equation. There are two counters, the one at the front is for yogurt and the one towards the back of the space is for ordering food. 

*FOOD:

Lamb Sandwich: The meat was cut into uneven cubes, making it unfriendly for sandwich consumption and there were a few sinewy pieces that should have been removed. There was way too much meat and not enough of the pickled veggies or yogurt sauce to balance this sandwich out. If you want more sauce they charge you extra, which just seems unfair. This had mizithra cheese on it, which doesn't really melt and just acts as a conduit for salt. 

Greek Fries: Nicely crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. These came with mizithra cheese on top as well.

Granch Yogurt Sauce: A nice take on ranch dressing, but it was $2 for this small portion. I know Chipotle charges the same for a side of guacamole, but unless they're using grass fed milk, it seems too expensive for a side of sauce. 

Chicken Bowl: This was their rotisserie chicken with sprouts, on a bed of kale with orange segments and yogurt dressing. The portion on this guy was a bit small and I could have used a bit more roughage to round the dish out. Everything tasted great and I didn't think there was too much dressing (something I am sensitive to in general), but again, the portion was a bit measly. 

Frozen Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles: This was a very yummy way to finish our meal. The yogurt was creamy and fresh and the sweetness of the baklava balanced out the tartness of the yogurt. 


*VALUE: 

$12 for a lamb sandwich seems a bit steep, when all you're getting is the wrap by itself. The quality is great, but unless something changes value-wise, it's unlikely I'll be back. Also, charging $2 for extra yogurt sauce is just too much, especially since they wouldn't give me half portions of 2 different flavors of yogurt sauce to try when I asked. 


*ATMOSPHERE: 

It was nicer inside than I thought it was going to be. Very minimal with some nice accents of foliage.
author: Victoria J.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in Hayes Valley.  A great place for fast and delicious (if a bit greasy) food right in the heart of one of San Francisco's coolest neighborhoods.  The chicken souvlaki is my favorite, and the frozen yogurt is really good too.  I also like the way they do ordering right at the door - very efficient.  Seating is a bit tight sometimes, but turnover is generally pretty quick.
author: Jeff A.

description: Very very good chicken gyro & fries.Ask for (pay$) for greek dipping sauce,one fry is enough for 2 to share. Food is very unique, different than others, very small, location, may have to wait for table or share table. frozen greek yogurt is very good.
author: Debra B.

description:
Souvla is a great place for Greek food. The line is long -- as if everyone was waiting for their turn at a Bank of Greece ATM -- but it doesn't take long for a delicious wrap with high quality meat and what's probably the Greek Heineken in a beautiful blue bottle. 

Seating is bar / communal table with a few tables along the side -- even when it's busy I've never had to wait to get a place to sit.
author: William M.

description: My friend Jimena recommended me to try this Greek restaurent so we ordered a delivery to home. I ordered a Superior Farms Lamb Leg wrap that comes with Harissa-spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onion, feta cheese and lamb. It was goos except that the whole wrap was very oily. The type of bread used reminded me of Manaeesh from back home, which was delicious. Along the wrap, i got side of fries that were really good as well (wish the quantity was more though) and the Greek Sour Cherry yogurt which is the best yogurt i have yet to try. That yogurt is the bomb and super delicious! Definitely recommend to  get it. Total price was around $22 which is not too bad. I was impressed by this restaurent and would definitely order more next time.
author: Jaafar L.

description:
Fresh, juicy, tasty and overall fantastic Greek food, people! 

FOOD: Everything was cooked just right. I ordered lamb Wrap (also available as a salad, which I'm going to try next time), and my taste buds were truly happy. The meat was very tender, juicy but not fatty, and it had just the right amount of seasoning/flavor. The wrap included thinly sliced cucumbers, radish, and pickled red onions. The bread was also delicious. Though the price of similar items is typically lower in the area, Souvla has all the rights to charge the amount they do, thanks to their food quality. And, the size was also very satisfying for a lunch option (perhaps, a hungry 200+ lbs man would want 2 of these though). 

SIDES: Souvla offers all their wraps in a form of a salad as well, plus they have Greek fries, salad, and couple other items on their menu. The Greek fries were wonderful! Lightly seasoned, perfectly cooked, golden and crispy with a touch of cheese. The fries complimented the wrap very nicely.

SWEETS: The menu of this place is a minimalist's dream: everything is organized neatly, and, although there are only several options to choose from, all of them are very decent. As for desserts, Souvla offers their famous frozen yogurt. Of course, I had to go with the Baklava crumbles for the topping. It was great! The yogurt was not really frozen, it was just perfectly chilled, so you could taste the tart, sweet, creamy but light deliciousness under a layer of decadent, honey-crusted baklava! It was such a pleasant finishing touch to my meal. 

DESIGN: A very modern and elegant interior with a dash of ethnic beauty.

SERVICE: 5++! Everyone at Souvla was super nice, the person at the front desk was very efficient and, despite the long line during lunch rush, our wait wasn't that long at all! We got our food ready in about 10 minutes. Plus, when we wanted to share 1 frozen yogurt in the end (couldn't go for a full cup after all the good food),  the front desk person served it in 2 cups with no problem at all. That kind of service does deserve 5 + stars!
author: Olga G.

description: Looking for yummy food, outdoor seating and dog friendly -- this is the place. Super friendly staff and perfect elegant yet simple food. Chicken salad, pork gyro, fries and some extra pita to the side, which was off-menu, but happily given by the staff. This is great Greek food, in a city that doesn't have a lot of it. SUPPORT THIS PLACE! Oh, and get a Greek sour cherry soda for kicks, it's fantastic!
author: Barbie B.

description:
Okay. Listen. This place is perfection across all 5 senses. I got the lamb salad, so delish and plentiful. Everything is so adorable, from the coffee cups, to the serving bowls, to the aprons they wear, to the damn mirrors in the bathroom. They music they play in the bathroom is even too legit to quit! 

This is a place that I will forever swoon over.
author: Adele A.

description:
I love Souvla. The staff is really friendly and calm even when there is a line out the door. I had to get my most recent meal to go because it was noisy and packed in the restaurant. The vegetarian salad with white sweet potatoes, walnuts, pickled onions, yogurt sauce, and kalmata olives on a bed of romaine and kale is fresh. The sweet and salty combo from the cheese and the sweet potatoes is a nice twist. 

The food itself is excellent. They make the food how you want it and prepare everything fresh with beautiful presentation. I am obsessed with the Baklava Greek Frozen Yogurt. The gooey glaze that they place on the tangy yogurt plus the crispy shaved baklava pieces are divine.
author: Jeannine A.

description:
As first, this may look like a hipster gyro place (and it sort of is) but it's quite a bit more.  They do offer glasses of Greek wine and exotic desserts but their focus is succulent spit-fired meats like pork shoulder, free range chicken, and lamb leg.  You can get any of those savory fillings in a pita wrap or salad bowl.  It's kind of like a Greek Chipotle.  But Chipotle doesn't have floor to ceiling glass-walled rotisserie cranking in front of you.  

I went with the Lamb Wrap, accompanied with Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onion, & Feta Cheese.  It was pretty good but the only reason this place fell from 4 to 3 stars is there was a giant puddle of oil gathering underneath as I ate.  It was so rich that I could only eat half in fact, I feared a coronary.  My wife, who had the Veggie Wrap with Garlic Yogurt, Chopped Kalamata Olive, Toasted Walnuts, Pickled Red Onion, Pea Shoots, & Mizithra Cheese, really enjoyed hers however.

Souvla is a great concept, I love places like that work with a few key elements and focus on quality and subtle elements to differentiate themselves.  Worth checking out if you don't mind the oiliness, I just don't think we will return.
author: Saminda W.

description: I had the veggie salad, which has white potatoes, and surprisingly, it was really really good. I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food and I thought eating it without the lamb/pork wouldn't be as good, but Souvla proved me wrong! I decided to try the lamb my second time around, and I was surprised that it wasn't served hot/fresh, the way I had expected, but since I got it on a salad bed, it was still just as flavorful. I love how they give you a huge bowl for the salad and don't skimp out, and I left feeling full! The ambiance is also nice, with white tables. There are 4-6 seaters on the left side, and individual "bar" like seats around the right side and the back (the back seats you can directly see the meat being cut/cooked - kinda cool). The seats in the middle you share, which at first, I thought was cramped, but for dinner, the bustle of the restaurant added to the good experience. Can't help but love this place!
author: Hana C.

description: Every time I went by, it was a long line onto the street, so when I walked in without a line, I thought I scored! Yes, the food was excellent! Service was superb for a little place like this. The guy at the counter explained to us in details and the kitchen people are so friendly and talked to us while waiting for a restroom to open. I wish we had this place back in Providence! Greek ice tea was so tasty! I highly recommend this place.
author: Tomoe S.

description: Excellent sandwiches here. Order "geek style" to get fries inside!
author: Steve U.

description: I had their American homestead pork shoulder sandwich wrap which can be ordered as a salad. I also had their Greek fries which tasted exactly the same I used to eat in Greece. Loved the food, everything about the place. I'm definitely going back.
author: Jacqueline V.

description:
Came by on a gorgeous Sunday - brunch time.  Good looking place.  Bright, clean and inviting.  Lots of good looking roasting animals but unfortunately, I didn't care for my selection.

2 stars - AMERICAN HOMESTEAD PORK SHOULDER salad - good portion size but I felt pork was not very interesting.

3 stars - SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG - this flavor I felt was definitely better than the pork.

4 stars - GREEK FRIES - yum!

4 stars - STRAUSS ORGANIC GREEK YOGURT (which is only served at brunch)

I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but if friends wanted to dine here, I wouldn't refuse.
author: Lille L.

description:
Not that Souvla really needs more reviews to prove to you it is worthy of a visit.  It's always busy, so be prepared to wait in line or call ahead for takeout. 

The lamb salad is my favourite, tender meat and leafy greens! Large portion - I was able to save about half of it for lunch the next day and it was still delicious and not soggy. The fries are also amazing!

The best part may be the frozen yogurt! Generous portion, rich flavor but not heavy. I get mine with honey and my husband swears by the baklava.
author: Alice T.

description: I'm in love with their chicken salad. It is so amazing. They serve their Greek yogurt on a take out container that looks like the coffee cup you get in New York City. Very cute.
author: Julie K.

description:
So happy to have this new addition is Hayes valley! Full stars across the board. Trendy, healthy, delicious, affordable. Spit meat meets frozen Greek yogurt. I'm in love. 

We had the lamb sandwich, the roast chicken salad, honey frozen yogurt and baklava frozen yogurt. Inhaled it all!
author: Rebecca F.

description:
Great salads ! Must try the french fries w. yogurt. 
Make sure to order a cold glass of white wine.
author: Beliz F.

description:
This casual, clean and small Greek place has delicious shwarmas and salads but the best part is the Greek frozen yogurt.

The lamb is soft and delicious.

The place was very popular but I was able to get a seat right away.
author: M S.

description:
I go back and forth on this place. I've been here dozens of times and the food is widely inconsistent. When it's good, it's REALLY good, but oftentimes the chicken is dry as all get out and/or containing bone or cartilage.

The soup here has a really unique flavor and I love it, BUT it's never hot. It arrives nearly tepid, the portion is microscopic, served in a chipped bowl that's maybe going for rustic but screams lead poisoning to me, and today I had to pick out a fun little chunk of cartilage from my mouth. Like pretty much e everywhere in Hayes Valley, I have a love/hate/convenience relationship to this place.
author: Aero F.

description: I admit it, I'm in a small food rut and I'm super happy about it. I work in the neighborhood and there is no cheap lunch/dinner option (dragon eats is the best bet there) but in the Hayes Valley land of $14 dollar salads... Souvla for me reigns supreme. I've had all of their salads, the soup, and the fries and I love them all. They're known for their roasted meats, which are usually fantastic, but not the salad I'm obsessed with. For some reason their vegetarian salad is just the perfect balance for me. Tons of hearty sweet potato, briny olive, tart pickled onion, and crunchy earthy walnut perfectly dressed. At least once a week I come here and order this salad Greek style (the perfect amount of fries for me) and a side of granch to dip my fries into . It's perfect amount for two meals for me. So there it is, at the land of roasted meats I'm obsessed with their veggie salad! Also my wonderful excuse to shamelessly eat some of the best fries ever. Sidenote, I love to put some of their hot sauce in the granch for my fries. Yum.
author: Jessica B.

description: Where have these desserts been all my life? It was first time here a week ago and I'm still happily thinking about their desserts! The place was pretty full on a late Sunday afternoon, but the line moves quickly. I had to order the frozen Greek yogurt with the Baklava and it did not disappoint! The flavors were great and the texture of the Baklava was excellent. Albeit, a little pricy for frozen yogurt, but I really can't wait until my next visit for this lovely dessert.
author: Lisa R.

description: Souvla is a good find. I've been there once but already know that I can always go back to this place for good food. I went here to have lunch with a friend and we were lucky to find "outdoor seating" (high-top seats on the storefront right on the sidewalk) for us to devour our orders. I ordered the veggie wrap which I wasn't very excited about because typically a veggie wrap at a Greek place means too much feta and undesirably moist eggplant but this wrap actually tasted good and wasn't too soft / falling apart. My friend also got an order of the (truffle?) fries which were delicioussss!
author: Meryam B.

description:
Husband got the chicken wrap
I got the chicken salad
Both shared Greek fries

Perfect date spot. Gets busy but it's fast to have a seat once you order.

We ended it with baklava crumbles Greek yogurt ice cream
author: Amalie A.

description:
Souv-love. 5-stars because this place is consistently excellent.

Some debate the presentation of a dish is of utmost importance because one "eats" with his/her eyes first. When I order a Chicken Pita with extra meat and Greek Fries - I eat with my hands and off my lap.

Yes, the colors are great: the citrusy navel orange and pickled onion give a pop of color & burst of bright flavor that compliment the mizithra cheese and glorious "granch" (Greek Yogurt Ranch). There's a great balance of flavors in each heavy gyro. I admit, some of my friends think the sandwiches are on the greasy side, but the pita performs a superb and sinful role of saving the precious meaty juices.

The Greek Fries are, hands-down, get-in-my-mouth-right-now good. Ask for them inside the pita sandwich and drool at the sight of the holy harmony.
author: Olivier K.

description: Wow, I haven't written a Yelp review in quite some time, but Souvla inspired me to do so!  We were walking by today at lunchtime and decided to stop in.  We don't just "drop in" to many restaurants, because I'm on Weight Watchers and my 7 year old son is a picky eater. It's hard to find a place that satisfies both of us, plus my husband.  Souvla to the rescue!  My picky kid had a chicken sandwich that had just bread, chicken and ketchup (phew!).  I had an AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS chicken salad.  The rotisserie chicken is to die for. OMG, it is so incredibly flavorful. My husband is a pretty big critic when it comes to how food is cooked, and he loved it too.  Rich, juicy, delicious.  The salad (mine sans cheese) was crisp, flavorful, and light, but very filling.  The service was excellent.  The food came out at lightening speed.  And they have four separate seating areas:  outside on the sidewalk, inside the front, along the side wall, and an outdoor rear patio section.  I'm already looking forward to my next visit.  One day after I hit my goals, I'll get that awesome looking baklava!
author: Sherri H.

description:
Salad or Sandwich.  Salad or Sandwich.  *lines moving...must decide*

Seriously stresses me out EVERYtime.  I love the lamb - it's super tender, lots of flavor. 

The veggie salad is better than in the sandwich.

And definitely get the Greek fries.  

Love Souvla, it's so cute, food is always so good. Sure, it gets busy - but it's worth it!
author: Katy M.

description: Hands-down the worst Greek food I ate in over 10 years: overcooked meat, no spices, luke warm. No thank you.
author: Max K.

description:
Good food, nice service, and quick too, but the seating area is really small and cramped and the portions are small. Because of that, I'd treat it as more of an appetizer spot than actual meal.

If I wasn't as hungry afterwards, I'd give this more stars.
author: Andy V.

description:
Overall a great place to eat. The salads are superb, the gyros well balanced. 
Cons: the lamb could be juicier and they could take better care removing the bones and the cartilage from the chicken.
author: Ramoun M.

description: A little overpriced but the food hit the spot when we needed it the most! Sad I missed out on the frozen yogurt, but will definitely get it next time. Made a pleasant discovery as well with the Greek soda!
author: Nadine C.

description:
Pros: delicious everything, and huge portions (even the salads). The meat is juicy and good amount is given. It's hard to finish! The greek yogurt sauce is a must. 

Cons: no space to sit so if it is cold outside, good luck. And given it is a place that is a healthy, upscale fast food place, people should not come here and linger around 30 mins after their food is done as others just stand around waiting for a table.
author: Taz H.

description:
Sooo the people claiming that this place will transport you to Greece obviously haven't been. That said, Souvla's a trendy yet casual spot with Californian "Greek" food that will satisfy your cravings.

Great atmosphere and friendly service, but the food is hit or miss. I've loved the vegetarian and chicken salads and the lamb sandwich, and then I've had super bland chicken sandwiches with greasy pita. 

Avoid peak hours-- it's a narrow place with limited seating.
author: Alyssa Y.

description: Dropped by on a Sunday afternoon for some take out. Service was great, although I only ordered one thing, it was excellent. I can be very indecisive so upon the recommendation of the cashier, I ordered the vegetarian salad with lamb, greek style. Greek style = salad with fries on top. When I got home 30mins later, the fries were still crispy (success!!), and they were quite delicious. The salad was huge, and I saved more than half for lunch the next day. Love the sweetness of the sweet potato and the saltiness of the olives in the salad. Definitely a good balance. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!
author: Annie L.

description: A great little restaurant, with a wonderful atmosphere.  You order first, then sit, and in about five minutes, they bring your food.  Great wine, fair pours and not breaking the bank.  The salads are very tasty - we had one of each (total of three) and fed the four of us.  The fries are great, and do not miss the yogurt with honey at the end!
author: A T.

description: Soooo delicious. I'm a veggie, so I ordered the sweet potato salad. It was stunning, delicious. Great service, adorable little space. Will totally be back.
author: Kate B.

description:
Souvla is awesome. There's almost always a line out the door, and for a good reason. Even so, they don't keep you waiting for too long.

On different occasions, I got the pork, lamb, and chicken salads. I loved the pork and lamb salads. They have all the flavors a dish needs, the meat is juicy, and I definitely felt good with the food in my stomach. I normally don't like feta cheese but it was perfect with the salads. The fries are great, too.

The chicken was a bit dry, so when I come back I'll just come for pork and lamb.
author: Charles G.

description:
The salads here are the bomb! Food here is very fairly priced for the quantity and quality that you get. The salad is extremely filling and they are pretty generous with the amount of meat. You can't go wrong with the lamb or chicken salads!

The desserts here are also amazing - I think the baklava greek yogurt is also on the 7x7 top 100 things to eat if you want to knock something off that list. 

Expect a long line for dinners on almost any day. If you can get food to go that is even better, since there is not much seating inside.
author: Jenny M.

description:
The food was fantastic, and very flavorful.  I couldn't decide what to order, as everything sounded so good! I even almost chose the greek yogurt for lunch, but figured I'd choose the healthy salad option instead. I ordered the veggie salad, the sweet potatoes made it a perfect dish. 

The place gets quite busy around lunch time, but by the time you wait for your food the tables turnover quite fast.

Will definitely try it out again soon!
author: Jenelle H.

description:
If you are in the neighborhood and don't make this a stop, you are cheating yourself! 

Probably the most delicious lamb gyro I've ever had...homemade pita and tender lamb.

They also have fun fro-yo flavors, which I didn't get around to - but really wish I had.

xoxo
lcf
author: lyndsey F.

description:
I ordered to go, paid and... Somebody else got my order!!

Thanks for messing up with my order. 
Now I hate this place with all my heart. 

I told them that it's not my mistake so somebody else took y order but people don't care. 
Wait in line again and order again and PAY again!!

This food is not worth double waiting and double price
author: Marianna P.

description:
Honestly, if I were to rate Souvla based just on their salads, I would've just given 3 stars, but their Greek yogurt really bumped them up to a 4. 

The salads are a reasonable portion, but I still think they're a little pricey. It's like $13-15 for one? I had the chicken and my friend had the pork. They were SOLID, but for that price and the popularity, I kinda expected something that would knock my socks off. I ordered the chicken knowing that it was from their own rotisserie, but it had this dry texture even though it wasn't necessarily dry. Maybe it was the (excessive) dressing that made it seem like it wasn't dry. Aside from it not being anything spectacular, I got quite a few bits of bone in my chicken.. I didn't make any complaints or return it but thought I'd just mention that. Also, the chicken could be shredded in smaller pieces? I know knives are provided but I personally just don't like using knives in a bowl LOL. 
The pork in my friend's salad was a little on the salty side but I guess the flavor was there. Had that dryishness also. 

Now for the greek yogurt! It was the perfect dessert!! It was so delicious, you'll definitely like it if you like greek yogurt. The yogurt itself was super creamy and perfectly tart but still sweet! I had the baklava crumbs on mine and I honestly was worried I would run out of topping befoe I finished my yogurt, but there was the perfect amount to have it dispersed all the way! If you like nuts&cinnamon I definitely recommend this one. My friend got the wildflower honey and that was so aromatic! I recommend that one if you like floral flavors (: 

Overall, Souvla is super cool. I love the decor, it's super bright and clean and the workers are nice (they have cool aprons too). I could skip their entree items, but definitely recommend their greek yogurt. It's something worth coming for. Prices may be a little up there for what you get but it's SF so eh. Oh yeah, just a tip, the lunch rush is crazy. Everybody's there LOL. 4 stars.
author: Holly P.

description: One of the best restaurants in all of San Francisco, in my opinion.  Tasty, healthy, nice ambiance & easy to add dessert or wine.  I've had many a good meal and conversation here.  It gets full quickly but is worth the wait!
author: Nanz L.

description: I've been here twice and I love it! I heard about it because my moms boss brings her food and raves about this place so I had to check it out. First off they have a clean hipster lookin vibe to it. The vibe is great. They amazing chicken salads here that you have to try as well as their Greek yogurt and Greek fries! What I love is that the salad is so filling I got fully satisfied both times! I recommend it to anyone. The parking sucks really bad and the meters are expensive but it is so worth it. The workers are really nice. 5 stars all around!
author: Alexander H.

description:
This was one of the first places I tried upon first moving into the neighborhood.

Pork shoulder salad. Amazing. The pork is super tender and flavorful, and the salad is crisp and fresh. Beware: the salad portions are huge. They split portions for you upon request, so come with a friend, share a salad, and order the Greek Fries! The fries come out piping hot, and make sure you order some greek yogurt sauce for dipping. The fries are pretty plain otherwise without the dipping sauce.

There is typically a line during the dinner and lunch rush hours, but I've been pretty lucky where I don't have to wait super long for my order.

The frozen greek yogurt with cherry was a little too sweet for me, so next time I'll try a different flavor.

Super cute interior, but the place is small and seating is first come first serve.

Neighborhood favorite for sure!
author: Crystal C.

description:
In general, I'm not a huge fan of Mediterranean and Greek food and I don't necessarily love the idea of gyros. However, several of my coworkers had raved so much about Souvla that I finally decided to give it a try... and boy am I glad I did! 

I ordered the pork shoulder sandwich ($11) with a glass of the sparkling greek rose ($12) and man, was it one satisfying lunch! The meat is so tender and bursting with flavor and the creaminess of the minted greek yogurt and feta cheese coupled with the extremely soft pita bread was to die for! Also, the sparkling rose was perfect to unwind over on the hot afternoon. Perfectly paired. 

I highly recommend trying Souvla for a transformational gyro experience! It's a cute and small restaurant tucked into the heart of Hayes Valley - definite must-try. 

Happy Eating Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Although super busy and cramped, the food is delicious and the frozen yogurt is to die for!
author: Christina N.

description: Fresh food, Simple choices, high quality. Seems like there is always going to be a long line, but it moves pretty quick. The vegetarian option is a roasted sweet potato sandwich or salad. It was good but the meat options looked to be better.
author: Noelle J.

description: The frozen greek yogurt here is so delicious. I have tried three of the four flavors, and the baklava is by far my fave - they are all yummy though! The rest of the menu is good too, limited, but tasty.
author: Elise M.

description:
I've walked through Hayes Valley a couple of times but this place has never stood out to me until a co-worker mentioned that they have very good food; I was not disappointed! I ordered the chicken gyro and we got greek fries to share with greek ranch. The combination of the chicken, orange and onions was great and I could tell the chicken was of good quality. The fries were amazing and I could've eaten the whole basket by myself! 

This is a small place where you order at the counter and it's seat-yourself. I would recommend take-out if you don't want to wait for a table but if you get lucky, it's a really cute place to sit and eat.

I'll definitely be back to try their greek yogurt that is so famous! After an entire gyro, you're too full to try that as well :(
author: Malika R.

description:
I love eating at Souvla whether I'm eating solo or with a friend. The ambience is always warm and inviting with a clean, minimalist decor. The staff are always extremely friendly, and you will often find the owner (Charles, maybe?) working behind the counter or on the floor interacting with guests. I always applaud an owner who takes a hands-on approach.

The food... I really enjoy the simplicity of their menu. There are three meat options and one veggie option. They all come either in a wrap or as a salad. The salads are particularly amazing. The meat portion is very generous and the meat itself always juicy with great flavor. The chicken salad has mizithra cheese, pickled red onions, kale, and orange segments which create a great complement to the rotisserie chicken and an awesome balance of flavors.

While I've been less impressed with the greek yogurt, it still satisfies my sweet tooth fix. However, I come here for the entrees, the service, and the dining ambience. 

It does get crowded, and seating is very limited. There's always the option of eating down the block in Patricia's Green. 

Thanks, Souvla!
author: Duke D.

description: Substantial portions, reasonable price. Cool that they have sandwich and salad options for each of the four main dishes. The frozen yogurt looked amazing but we were too full. Only downside is very cramped seating. Will be back for that yogurt :)
author: Andrew S.

description: Food is ok nothing special. Their yogurt is worth coming back for. However the line can be insane but moves relatively fast.
author: Tonia D.

description:
In some cases the hype is for real - this is one of those cases...

The gyros (or 'sandwiches' as they call them) are not-your-typical gyros; the lamb was tender, had great flavor, and whatever it is they do to the red onions is a nice touch. The Greek Fries are a treat as well, of course Mizithra makes almost anything better...

It is a little pricey but worth the extra money. The interior is cool, staff is friendly - a great place to spend a little time in Hayes Valley...
author: Arthur S.

description:
So happy to finally try Souvla today! 

The space itself is bright and clean, slightly giving a Santorini-esque vibe. 

My boyfriend and I tried the chicken salad, lamb sandwich, and a side of fries. Everything was delicious and tasted extremely fresh! 

Overall, great spot for a quick, casual lunch! I will definitely be back - next time to try their Baklava frozen yogurt!

Shout out to the super nice girl at the register!
author: Juliana K.

description:
I have only eaten here once, but I was pleasantly surprised by the lamb sandwich (gyro). It was really good, maybe the best I've ever had. The ingredients tasted fresh. The price was a little higher than I expected, but considering the quality of the ingredients it seemed reasonable. A gem for the neighborhood and I look forward to coming back.

As other reviews mention, seating is limited so it will be hard for groups larger than 2-4 people.
author: Thomas M.

description:
My roommate mentioned Souvla a few times, saying the salads are huge and delicious, and it was one of his favorite things to eat. So I went a few days ago, but they were closed for a family thing, and I ended up eating Oreos for dinner instead. It was a little bit tragic after my roommate got me so hyped. Anyhow, I finally went tonight. I got the veg salad and it was AMAZING!!!! I had just the salad for dinner, and I feel like I had a fabulous dinner.

The yogurt dressing, the mizithra cheese, the super fresh and crunchy kale, the delicious sweet potatoes, the sweet sauteed onions, and the kalamata olives combined into a perfect flavor combo. It seems so simple, but just tastes so good. This is one of my new favorite things to eat.
author: Christopher L.

description: An absolute gem in San Francisco. Seriously, the best deal meal that you can have in San Francisco. $14 for a chicken salad and on top of that, top it off with greek fries for 50 cents! It's a portion large enough to share among 2 people. Best place in town when you're like "wtf do I eat tonight??!!" Souvla is the answer!
author: David F.

description:
Love Souvla!

A great salad is hard to find. Especially great salads that are fresh, healthy, filling and SO delicious not to mention cheap. I go there at least once every other week and sometimes twice in one week. I'm a creature of habit going for either the chicken or the sweet potato salad and Greek style! Love their rose, too.

They get crowded and because it's open seating, it's hard to find a seat so go early or get it to go!
author: Lisa K.

description: My husband and I are Kokkari addicts (with Evvia as a back-up) so it's no surprise that Souvla's a hit! We've been to their Hayes Valley and NOPA locations, and though I'd like to say they were both equally consistent, the latter (NOPA) was better, e.g. the actual wrap was softer and not as rigidly thick as Hayes location. The Avgolemono was fantastic at both, and the salad sparkling. We've had the pork shoulder and lamb, and though we love both, prefer the lamb. I love the mix and match options, e.g. you can get any meat as a wrap or on salad--and their salad isn't just a bed of wimpy greens, it's a true greek salad with plump, juicy tasty bursing with flavor red tomatoes, juicy fresh cucumbers and kalamata olives, with feta, and a dressing with miles and miles of will not quit flavor. Their fries come in a charming cup and are perfectly crunchy with just the right amount of soft give, and excellently salted. But the ultimate is their yogurt, which I love with sea salt and honey (my husband loves their baklava crumble). We sat outside in the patio and had such a phenomenal time . . . no wait and quiet. But the Hayes was deafeningly loud, zero acoustics, a a line forever, zero seats, aghh . . . but the food is as solid as anything, with freshly roasted meats--there's no better and fresh 'quick bite' around :-)
author: Ranjan P.

description: I had the lamb sandwich; my companion ordered the pork sandwich with Greek fries. The portions were satisfying; the service was quick (within about 5 minutes of ordering).  The lamb was on the plain side, with several bits of fat or tendons. The Pork, on the other hand, was moist and tender. I would come back again and try the chicken sandwich or salad next time. We did try the yogurt with baklava topping. It was good, but don't expect it to be like baklava. It's worth giving this place a try.
author: Jean T.

description: I stopped at our lunch break at this place with my friend, place is med size, limited menu, food tastes good, little crowd but I guess it's normal for SF during weekday, my friend ordered bowl lamb with potato and bottled tea, his bio was almost 23$ he was upset kinda lol other then that good place for quick lunch/dinner :)
author: Vladimir S.

description:
Mmmm! Are you in the mood for something casual, straightforward, fresh and healthy? 

Souvla has a simple menu (do you want that in a sandwich or in a salad?) and flavors that are just about perfect.

Their veg salad, served in a big, white enamel dish with a navy blue rim, is hard to beat (try it even if you're not a vegetarian.) 

Their frozen yogurt with simple toppings is worth it: I like the one with olive oil and salt but have also been known to devour the one with baklava.

Final note: the servers and people who work in the kitchen are so incredibly nice and go out of their way to accommodate you.
author: D Z.

description:
Exquisite salad or sandwich and meat combos make this place the ideal spot for a scrumptious Greek meal with the icing on top being the frozen Greek yoghurt and wine offerings.

We had the pleasure of dining at this spot on a Tuesday evening which we stumbled upon whilst walking along Hayes Street one warm evening in SF.

What topped off my giving this a 5* review was the friendly accommodation of our 'last minute' ordering just before 10pm. Whereby the service staff kindly let us stay past the 10pm kitchen-close time without a hint of apprehension!

Thank you SouvlaSF we'll be dining with you again soon.
author: Alex W.

description:
Nice casual GREEK! spot in hayes valley after grabbing some drinks and the line is biergarten is outrageous and chez maman's wait isn't quite worth it (my situation)..

The place is small and you order, then first come first serve with seating.  It was definitely uncomfortable - people hovering over your table trying to figure out if you are going to be done by the time their food arrives.  

We were lucky and nabbed a spot at the counter (back of the place) just after ordering.  We both got a lamb gyro and were excited for some extra carbs with the fries. 

Tasty, BUT neither of us liked that the lamb was served in the pita in cubes/large chunks.  Made it pretty difficult to eat to be honest and did not enjoy it was much as a gyro you'd pick up from a dive spot that's thinly sliced.  Maybe personal preference?

Appreciate the option, would definitely go back to try the chicken (assuming not cubed?).. but should read up first.
author: Melody T.

description:
A must try! (if you like Greek food)
I have to admit I only tried the Veggi Sandwich to go, but I'm looking forward at going back and trying out the Lamb.  The sandwich I had was well made, full of flavor and the service SUPER quick.  I took mine to go and from odering to being on my way was less than 5 minutes, and this was at lunch time.
author: Frank C.

description: There are four mains that you can get as either a sandwich or salad. I wasn't sure about a potato sandwich at first, but after one bite, I was sold. I enjoyed the chicken as a salad, but the kale could've used some more massaging or something because it was pretty tough. The lamb sandwich is delicious and dripping with juices. I would recommend that if you're looking for something a little more traditional. The juicy potatoes were indeed juicy, but also incredibly oily. The greek fries are great for sharing and large cut. I tried the avgolemono soup one day and it was sooo good. There was chicken, rice, egg, and lemon. Very savory and hearty for a broth-based soup. I love the use of pea shoots in multiple dishes here. Space is cramped and oddly placed. Don't come with more than 2 other people! A little bit pricey, but love that the meats are slowly roasted.
author: Jennifer W.

description: OPA! Very authentic. Avgolemono is delicious--be brave! Just as good as anything Yia Yia used to make.
author: Tom M.

description: Ordered the lamb sandwich ($13 before tax). Pretty generous serving of lamb, tasty & flavorful too. The sandwich comes in a pita wrap with feta cheese sprinkled on top, and it was pretty filling - no sides needed. One star off because it was way too greasy, it came in a pool of oil which I had to soak up using napkins... :(
author: Casatrina L.

description: very cute place to eat! it looks really good! i only came for the greek yogurt with baklava and it was really good! i reccomend!
author: Brenda S.

description: In town for a conference I stumbled across this place with a friend. We were drawn in by the line out the door, and by what seemed a nice atmosphere. It's a nice space and the menu is simple and appealing. Unfortunately the food we had was just so-so. My friend had the white sweet potato sandwich and I had the pork sandwich. Both were a bit dry and too bready; while tasty they were not that special.
author: Lachlan B.

description:
Came here with high expectations, but left dissatisfied..

Maybe it's because I actually real Greek food as in Greece..

Anyways :
-pita was cold and tough 
-chicken and lamb was dry and not well seasoned

Overall, did not like the Greek food here, only thing I enjoyed was the fries.. 

It's on the pricier end too ;p bleh
author: Jean K.

description:
I have been here about 10 times. The first 8 times were great, even though the food is expensive, it was worth it because the quality was great. 
The past 2 times I've gone the service is still good, but the meat was dry and the pita was too! Those are the two things that really set it apart to begin with. I won't be going back until I hear they've gone back to their old ways.
author: Sabrina K.

description:
My friend and I were walking around Hayes Valley deciding what to eat. As we were walking, we saw this little white restaurant with people eat big bowls of salad. For a sunny and hot day, it was the perfect thing!

When we walked in, we went to the register to order. Their menu is pretty simple, you choose your protein and you can get it in a wrap or salad. We both got rotisserie chicken salad and shared fries. We got our number and found a spot at the bar. Our order came very quickly! 

Chicken salad: I was expecting mixed greens or iceberg but the salad was filled with kale with sprinkles of romaine! There were a ton of ingredients in there. It had pickled onions, pea shoots, chicken, nuts, and I can't remember what else! It was delicious and so filling! 

Fries: so good! Crispy and perfectly seasoned. You don't even need to dip it in anything. 

On our way out, we noticed a frozen yogurt bar on the left side. We got samples .. walked out .. then walked right back in to each order our own. We both got plain greek frozen yogurt. It was so good .. creamy yet light! I noticed they had frozen yogurt with baklava crumble .. I have to try that next time! 

This place looks like it can get pretty busy during lunch hours and might be hard to find a seat! But definitely worth a try!
author: Thatcher H.

description:
So happy I came across this place!! It's always packed and for a good reason. 
Souvla makes some of the best salads in the city. They have quite a variety of dishes both meet, poultry and vegetarian.  I especially like their rich and flavorful salads. My favorites are the vegetarian salad that comes with warm sweet potato pieces and the chicken salad. You can really feel the Mediterranean quality of cuisine. They are generous with their portions and with the dressing. This place is quite different from other restaurants in the city and it's refreshing.
author: Schisandra S.

description:
I guess the restaurant's name, "Souvla," is a meat dish. It might seem silly that vegetarian me loves going here, but their veggie salad is really good.
It comes with roasted potatoes, this amazing yogurt sauce, and tasty salad things.

The first time I went there was for lunch on the weekend. The line was short, and I was impressed with how fast I got my food. 
I've also gone while it was really crowded, and sitting inside was no fun. It's seat yourself, and so folks are looming over your table, waiting for you to finish your food. Too stressful.
Luckily, there are some seats outside. Or, even better, you can grab your food to go and eat in the park nearby.
author: Jessica S.

description: The chicken sandwiches are guaranteed to be good. It's perfectly Mediterranean with the tangy yogurt dressing, slices of orange, and perfectly roasted, juicy chicken. However, avoid the juicy potatoes. The reason why is that when they say juicy, they mean drenched in olive oil with little seasoning. It's like eating these sad, oily things that are bland and just sad. Takeout and eat-in wait times are minimal. They are hustlers and get your food serviced quickly.. Also, they're a friendly group here. Chicken sandwich!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Tried Souvla for the first time the other night...  I was looking forward to it because I had heard good things from a few of my friends.  I was not disappointed...

I loved the look and feel of the place.  It so reminded me of the smaller little restaurants in Greece.  Bare floors...  Greek homey decor...  and not overly lit.  And although the music wasn't Greek, I did like the selection that was somewhat underground and hip.  In Greece, they would be playing music like that if they weren't spinning Greek tunes.  Of course being "hit" with the sight and smell of the delicious rotisseried meats was a big plus!

The food was delicious, and honestly, that was the most "home cooked" meal I've had at a restaurant in a long time.  The food is honest...  everything tasted fresh and natural and the choice of seasonings were perfect.  I had a lamb pita sandwich...  the generous portion of lamb was succulent.  It was complimented by a slight twist on tradition, which I believe worked really well.  Usually, Greeks will just throw on some tomato, onion and a big blob of tzatziki, but this sandwich featured cucumber, pickled onion (which I love), and feta, which was all held together by yogurt which was spiked with harissa (red pepper sauce).  The flavors were all complimentary without any one being overpowering...  just the way it should be!  Also, this was served on what appeared to be a homemade pita!

For my side, I chose the Juicy Potatoes, which were roasted and coated with the meat drippings!  A little herbaceous spices gave the dish even more character.  I thought this was a great alternative to fries, as it reminded me of my yiayia's potatoes, (yes, I am Greek).  However, the fries that I saw looked amazing, and I will try those next time.

I topped that off with a cold Greek beer, which with the food and the atmosphere, brought me back to Greece.

And as if I wasn't full enough...  I'm just a glutton for punishment, I had to try the frozen Greek Yogurt...  which I topped with Visino, the Greek cherry syrup...  yep...  my journey back to Greece was complete!  Cold, tangy yogurt topped with that deliciously intense and sweet syrup just completed the experience.

Kudos to the staff who are all very friendly and helpful!

Once again, I will stress the quality of the food here, both of the food and in its preparation.  I walked out feeling satisfied that I had a nourishing and gastronomically fantastic meal.  I will be back...  I haven't gone through the whole menu yet!
author: Mike K.

description:
Good spot.


This place is pretty good all around - the food is pretty darn tasty, the place is cool and slick inside, the wait staff are friendly and hip. We got the baklava yogurt, which was delicious and chicken salads, also yummy. 

One down side is that wait for a table during high time. We waited for a table before ordering, which worked for us - most people got food and stood there eating it for a while first - we weren't into that.
author: Stephanie M.

description: A date took me to this place for dessert so I only had the frozen yogurt here. He recommended the olive oil and sea salt and I thought was really strange combo... but it was SO GOOD. The yogurt was smooth (not like Chobani which was what I expected). The drizzle of the olive oil and sprinkle of sea salt complemented each other quite well. I liked how it tasted very light yet flavorful. I tried a bit of my date's yogurt with baklava and syrup and it was good but maybe a bit too sweet for me. Good place for dessert! I'll have to try the gyros next time.
author: Pansy L.

description:
More like 3.5 stars - 4 stars for food and shaving a little off for price. The chicken salad is really good and fresh. The chicken is juicy and the sauce is a really nice lemony yogurt. However, I feel like you can definitely make this yourself at home and save yourself $15 on a small bowl of salad. That said, the Greek yogurt is amazing and something I crave often. Both the baklava and sea salt flavors are drool-worthy. And unless you know how to make yourself a fancy homemade Greek yogurt, this is worth getting. I'd come back often for the yogurt, but the salad will be an indulgence when I'm too lazy to put my own together. 

The vibe is great at night. It's a dark dining room, kind of a bar vibe. Fun to meet up here.
author: Mark T.

description: You get my vote!  My go-to order:  Avgolemono soup (better than my own!), small side salad, small side of pork or chicken, order of fries to share.  OMG, as good as it gets!  Everything is super tasty, just wish you let me take home a whole chicken BEFORE your 6pm rule.  PLEASE PLEASE open a SOUVLA down here in the South Bay!  Necessary!
author: B S.

description:
The veggie salad is really good if you're okay with a lot of olives.  The yogurt they top it with is really great and not overpowering.

The fries are pretty good too.  Not a lot of seating so we went home and took it to go.

Thanks!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
Bottom line at the top: amazing!!
--
Came here with a buddy and had the chicken salad, lamb salad, and Greek froyo.

Everything was so light and yummy. I'm usually a beef/lamb fanatic but the chicken here is so, so good (must be the feta brine) and I liked it better than the lamb. 

Top it off with baklava and olive oil froyo. :)
author: Dahlia S.

description: The  lamb salad was good, but was extremely greasy to the point I couldn't finish it!!! Next time I'll try the Chicken or the Wrap!!
author: Candace F.

description:
My sandwich was bathing in oil. It had so much oil that it dripped on the table. I realized too late that half of my sleeve was drenched into kebab oil. I do not recommend this place: the food was also almost cold when it arrived.

On the picture, you can see the oil that dripped from the sandwich on the right of the basket, on the table. The other half was in my sleeve...
author: Maxime D.

description: I was walking around the area and saw practically everyone carrying a Souvla bag to the park. Of course the foodie in me told me to check it out. I ordered the lamb sandwich, fries and my sister ordered the chicken sandwich. Both meats were so soft and tender. I was surprised at how big they were, definitely something my sister and I should have shared but I'm not complaining about yummy leftovers. What blew us away were the fries!!!! Crispy outside but soft and silky inside. I wished their sandwich came with a side of fries instead of ordering it separately. Overall my sister and I were both happy campers, will definitely be back for more fries and to try their famous yogurt.
author: Julie C.

description:
I love Hayes Valley and this cute little place. 

It's a very small restaurant but you can get seated fairly quickly. I've been here dozens of times but have only ever ordered the salad. The salads are filling and very large. My friends have ordered the lamb and chicken wraps and rave about them. 

You can't leave without trying the frozen yogurt; my favorite is sea salt and olive oil. I know it sounds weird, but promise it's absolutely delicious. My brother was hesitant, but ended up trying the sour cherry syrup and really liked it. Surprisingly, it doesn't taste like cough syrup.
author: Leona G.

description: Came here for lunch and got the vegetarian salad. I've never had such a satisfying, meat free SALAD in my life.  The main feature is the white sweet potatoes, which are absolutely amazing in this salad.  My only regret is that I didn't get a Greek yogurt for the road.  If you're in need of a quick and casual lunch spot (you order at the counter and your food is delivered to the table via a number) this should be at the top of your list!
author: Gieselle A.

description:
Got the lamb sandwich.

Above-average presentation; very mediocre, bland, boring taste.

Cubed meat not even gyro meat wtf.

Fries were OK.

Not worth $32 for two sandwiches and fries.
author: Alex S.

description:
I did enjoy my food but agree with everyone else that it is overpriced for what it is....

We got there around 7PM on a weeknight and was able to snag a table. Our food came out quickly (Shared a chicken salad, lamb sandwich, greek fries and greek yogurt). 

Everything tasted great but I couldn't help but feel robbed that I spent $60 to seat myself in a corner and have food come in 10 minutes. 

I would go back for the greek yogurt, though! Such a tasty treat.
author: Anne K.

description: The food is not really Greek. More like Greek-ish. Nevertheless, it does taste pretty good.
author: James D.

description:
Checked out one of the newer additions to Hayes Valley last night and really enjoyed it! Loved the casual welcoming atmosphere. I had the "veg" in salad form and it was so Delish! The combo of the sweet potato, cheese, and olives was really nice! My dad had the chicken wrap and also enjoyed it. We shared the juicy potatoes...these were amazing! So much flavor! 

I would definitely come back for a casual meal and would absolutely recommend it for the same. Fresh and flavorful - what more can you ask for?
author: Becca W.

description:
Expensive and mediocre food. I ordered at a cramped counter on my way in and got lamb wrap and fries for over $20 after tax and tip.  Free seating, so I grabbed my own water and took my number to a free seat.

Lamb wrap had big cubes of lamb. Maybe diced lamb leg? The pita bread was tough, but the sauce inside was tasty. A few veggies to round out the wrap...radish and onion I think.  Fries were under salted and under seasoned. Barely tasted the lemon. The cheese didn't add much, but they were decently crunchy.

The lamb wrap from Whole Beast destroys this one. Solidly MEH overall for Souvla.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Amazing spit-fired meats that you can get in a salad or sandwich (gyro)! I had the chicken sandwich and my girlfriend had the lamb. Mine was amazing!! So juicy and amazing flavor. It tasted so fresh and the pea sprouts and citrus gave it a unique artisanal flavor. The lamb was great too with its own unique toppings. Can't go wrong with the Greek fries either... mmm garlic. I have yet to try the frozen yogurt but am excited to give it a taste! It also looks a bit unique.

Not only was the food amazing but so was the decor! A sweet industrial chic interior and I couldn't stop looking around as I was eating. It was the small touches that got me pumped--the plates, small carafes of water you can bring to your table. Next time I go I'm definitely taking a pic. I'm a sucker for cool interior design. All around quality! I would def recommend this place!
author: Erik M.

description:
If you haven't been to Souvla, you definitely should. At least if you're into Mediterranean cuisine!

They have a straightforward menu: salad if you're watching your waistline or gyro (sandwich) with either pork, lamb, chicken, or sweet potatoes (for you veggies out there!). You can't go wrong with any of the above.

Our party of three each got something different: I had the chicken, my friends had the pork and lamb. We all really enjoyed our sandwiches, though mine was a bit greasy at the end. My friends also split a side of Greek fries, which they enjoyed, but I thought could use a little more olive oil. The Greek fries I've had at other restaurants are usually drizzled in a good amount of olive oil (it helps the cheese and herbs stick!), but if you're not into that they taste perfectly okay, with a sprinkling of parsley and mizithra cheese.

All in all, you can't go wrong here!
author: Liz G.

description: I found an unexpectedly healthy, fresh meal at Souvla- I eat paleo, and it was the rotisserie chicken that beckoned me in the door. We ordered the chicken and lamb over salad, requested dairy free and got no sideways looks from the friendly gal ringing us up. No problem. What came out was salad with kale, lettuce, some fixings and a pure olive oil dressing with herbs. Completely dairy, and grain free. The meat was exceptionally juicy and flavorful.
author: Ingrid P.

description: Another example of taking ethnic street food beyond it's humble roots to match the the demands of high rents and hipster trendiness. The result in this case is delicious, with the Lamb souvlaki and avgolemono soup both winners, albeit at a high Hayes Valley price point, with the lamentable trend towards long lines, counter ordering, after which one must scramble for a seat, elbow to elbow with the luck of the draw. As an ethnic Greek, the real way to enjoy this food is with leisurely stretches camped out at tables for hours while while waiters ply you with inexpensive dish after dish, not cued up and rushed out like at Starbucks, so that's why I've taken off a star, and why I won't be a regular,  but it's still worth a visit for the quality of the food.
author: Peter B.

description: Really excellent fast fresh and tasty. I love the veg salad with sweet potatoes, and the lamb if I'm feeling like meat.
author: Bowen D.

description: Yogorino used to have the same yogurt!!! I was heartbroken when they closed in SF, but now I can be happy again that Souvla has the same yogurt. And they top it with baklava and olive oil! A better topping simply doesn't exist. You have to like plain greek yogurt to appreciate this place though. I will be back for a shwarma soon!
author: Nikita K.

description:
Just picked up the order I placed online and the restaurant and service were completely inexcusable.

I've been a frequent customer of Souvla since I've been in the Bay because the food has always been fresh and excellent. HOWEVER, tonight's service was truly appalling and horrific that I do not plan on returning.

As I was picking up my food, 1) the cashier assured me she had my order ready to go (as I placed the order 15 minutes prior and received a text message confirmation that my food was ready for pickup), 2) the cashier turned me over to the server named Moudi who completely ignored me even when I was standing in front of him and chose to serve a male customer behind me, 3) Moudi then rudely told me to move out of his way even when I was instructed by the cashier to stand in that very spot, 4) Moudi then asked what I was doing in the restaurant as if I was a nuisance. I told him that I was there to pick up my phone order and he said he didn't know what I was talking about, 5) the cashier then heard Moudi say this and told Moudi about my order, 6) Moudi became very annoyed and irritated that he had to grab my order (which was sitting right on the counter in front of him), 7) Moudi then tossed me my package and slammed a cup of yogurt in front me on the counter.

This type of service that makes customers feel unwelcome is completely unacceptable. There are hundreds of other delicious restaurants in the Bay and especially in Hayes Valley that would happily accept customers and do so with much better attitudes.
author: L W.

description:
Oh-so close to a 4-star review...

We definitely had a good experience at Souvla - food, service, ambiance combined, I just wasn't wowed. In the mood for casual, fresh food, relaxing ambiance, and quick service? Souvla's your spot. We tried the pork and lamb wraps, definitely tasty but not memorable. We both had to ask for more sauce as we found our wraps to be on the dry side. The fries though...tasty! I couldn't help but feel like a good gyro is like a good burrito - go find the shadiest, smelliest, hole-in-the-wall spot and you're golden. 

Go for the greek yogurt dessert, just do it! We opted for the baklava crumble topping, which even for my obnoxious sweet tooth, was a tad too rich. Did it stop us from devouring? No.
author: Brianna M.

description: Really yummy food, especially the fries. I got the white sweet potato salad and Greek fries with garlic yogurt sauce and both were delicious. Definitely order the fries -- they were the best I've had in a long time. I also had my eye on the frozen Greek yogurt, but the weather was a little too cold for it. They have a nice looking outdoor patio area in the back that would be great for warmer weather. I'll definitely be back again. Also did I mention the fries?
author: Allegra G.

description:
I'm dreamy for this place! Whenever I pass through Hayes Valley I try to plan a stop here. The chicken is juicy and roasted to perfection. This is what I recommend:

Chicken pita sandwich. My favorite! Savory and sweet with citrus, herbs, pickled onion and "granch". Make sure to keep a napkin handy the chicken is a touch greasy. Put the homemade got sauce on it, it's Soooooo good! 

If you want the salad version of the chicken get the dressing on the side or it'll be a lot (at least for me).

The side salad is solid. 

The Greek frozen yogurt with black cherry syrup is ridiculously delicious. 

Potatoes sometimes amazing sometimes okay.

The sweet potato pita sandwich is really great. 

Pork is alright and cooked to perfection with a hint of mint but not my style. 

The lemon chicken rice soup is quite tasty but could use more chicken.

I love the food here!
author: Cyndie H.

description: Love the interior and design. The food is surprisingly good. Must try their baklava yogurt and pork shoulder sandwich. Sandwich is on the large size. It would be a good idea split in half and order a fires for two ppl
author: Wayne Z.

description:
I'm not sure why there are so many high ratings.  The food is ok, but definitely not worth the price.  I had a lamb wrap, fries and a beer and the total was $25.  Holy crap.  

The plus - the lamb wrap wasn't the pressed gyro meat you normally see on the spit.  It was actual lamb, so that's a plus.  

Be prepared for sticker shock.
author: Larry L.

description: Well, I just ate too much.  We ordered it for delivery though caviar.  I've been wanting to try in forever, but for reasons I'm not getting into, I was not having dairy-until now. I see what the big deal is.  Even considering it was delivery, it was nicely presented and packaged, the lamb was juicy, and the yogurt sauce on the spot.  The Greek yogurt soft serve with olive oil and sea salt was amazing; with olive oil not just on top, but also halfway through the cup.  I'm glad I don't live close by, because I'd be in big trouble.
author: Vivian P.

description:
The lamb wrap was a bit of a letdown. Don't get me wrong, I love gyros. I get one every time I pass by the Mad Greek en route to Vegas. I get at least one-a-day every day of Coachella. 

These gyros however are not the best I've ever had, even by fast food standards. I think it might be the consistency of the meat. The lamb had a tough, chewy texture, and the prices are saddening. For $14 I could have 2 gyros elsewhere. For the price, we decided to split a wrap and sadly felt hunger pains afterwards. 

The decor is beautiful, but I'm not sure I can justify the price.
author: Fiona Y.

description:
and a half.

Can not deny the strength in the concept and can not deny the intelligence in not having servers to drain your coffers however the food quality does not seem to be there....Id guess this is low end lamb and I am annoyed by the fact that the yogurt is from a cow when greek yogurt would never be from a cow. Its as though the authenticity bit is just gimmck whereas if it  was carried out in the food, it would be much better. Plus if you get the lamb salad without the fake yogurt they put nothing on it and its like dry old lamb with chard and lettuce and radish without any flavor or anything to bind them. In a city where many dont consume cow dairy(scary stuff!) to not offer another topping seems aggressively not giving a poop.
author: Kate S.

description: Really good lamb sandwich, juicy and good flavor. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Reba J.

description:
Hayes and Kebab is under renovation until 2016. The Hayes Valley go-to Mediterranean fix is no longer! Thank goodness Souvla popped up in time to fill our hungry mouths.

The line seems intimidating but it moves fast. Even during a quick lunch break I can order take out and not have to scarf it all down. Noshing on the yogurt helps pass time too. Yogurt toppings are tad on the sweet side.

There is not a single item on this simple menu I would not recommend. Honestly it is hard to not love roasted meats no matter chicken, pork or lamb. Soulva wins at making an interesting salad. It is not simply tossed together with some "mixed greens" but also includes fruit, pickled flavors and nuts. The best part of all is that you can walk away feeling great after eating!
author: Tiffany L.

description: This is one of my favorite spots in the city! minus one star because lately they have been cutting the kale wrong in the salads and leaving the super hard stem in. So much so i could barely finish half of my salad because it was hurting my stomach so bad. If they cut the kale right and massaged it a little more it make it less bitter, it would absolutely perfect. Writing this review so hopefully someone that works there will see it and change it because I have been so scarred that I haven't been back in two months and am really missing it!
author: Zoë C.

description:
Souvla is a high quality modern twist on your typical Gyro places in the city. I've been going to this place and have been meaning to review it. 

Here is a concise list of pros and cons for an easy read:

Pros:

Clean and Modern Decor
Easy Menu and Ordering Process
Very Tasty Lamb
Very Tasty Chicken
Fresh Veggies
Salads are a good portion.
Olive Oil Yogurt is excellent 

Cons:

Expensive 
No Free Sauces to go. 

Overall the place is very beautifully designed and makes a very tasty wrap/salad. The staff is friendly but the food is on the expensive side. The frozen yogurt is very high quality and the food comes out quickly. This place gets a 5 star rating because the food is that perfectly seasoned and tasty. If it weren't for that the place would be 4 stars.
author: Jorge N.

description: Super crowded, but worth it. The ambiance and decor is great and the food is so delicious and fresh. Love the chicken salad and the fries are so yummy!
author: Aya O.

description:
10 12 years ago we stayed here with a friend on Grove St. We return every year, but to another location. The hotel we usually stay in on Market street has gone up to almost $300 a night forget that. Our friend found us a place to stay on Grove, not $300 a night. 
Holy cow what has happened to the neighborhood. Now filled with many shops and restaurants, and has become quite fashionable. He suggested Souvla.
First, it reminded me of our fave Greek restaurant in paris 60 years ago. Long table with strangers seated next and in front of you, side tables, small seating outside, and everyone having a good time. 
After a 10 minute wait, I ordered a lamb sandwich, lamb yoghurt and the fixings, it was very good and enough for two.
The 2nd night I ordered a pork sandwich. Back to the hotel, discovered it was a pork salad instead. It had kale in it, not my favorite super popular green, BUT, it turned out to be  the most interesting salad I have ever had. Many chopped greens, and pork, and I simply cannot describe the dressing. Don't know what those tastes were, sweet, tart, not heavy with oil.
I highly recommend it, but you might ask first what the dressing is. I will tomorrow night when I return.
author: George V.

description: Cool ambience if you eat in, and for takeout you can only order online and pick up. If you order online, you can cut to the front of the line to pick up. When picking up realize that parking can be a nightmare. The quality of the food was as advertised. Souvlaki that hits the app for a Greek food craving but doesn't necessarily rock your athenaeum.
author: Gravitational A.

description: 5 star food. Chicken salad with sweet potatoes !!!  Get it .. Now!!! Lamb and pork salads are awesome too!  I eat here All the time !! So worth it.
author: Alvaro C.

description: Average lamb sandwich. Little to no flavor, found myself dousing it in the hot sauce they have on the table to add flavor. Lamb itself was pretty tough. Every aspect of the sandwich was pretty disappointing considering the $14 cost. Would not return.
author: Ahmed H.

description: Souvla is legit! And this is coming from a Greek American. Salad and sandwiches are delish. The frozen yogurt is to die for. I would come back solely for this. A must try!
author: Jenny D.

description:
Delicious everything - sandwiches, salads, soup, and frozen Greek yogurt - and friendly service. Order your food "Greek style" if you want fries in it! Small seating area inside (always warm from the rotisserie ovens) and a few counters outside are cozy. 

Tip: Order online if you want it b/w 11:30 and 1 - there's always a (well-deserved) line.
author: Crystal M.

description: Without a doubt, this is the best frozen yogurt I've ever had. Sour cherry syrup is bomb but the olive oil topping is simply magic.
author: Heather R.

description: Tried the veg sandwich...way too dry and lacked flavor. The sweet potato in the pita bread was a carb overload and it needed some fresh produce maybe tomatoes, avocado and lettuce. If you're a vegetarian go for the veg salad instead. Those are pretty much your only options.
author: Krystal G.

description: This place was really good.  Now I know what the lines are about.  I had the lemon soup which was really nice - good, filling, just the right mix of soupy and thick.  I also had the house salad which was good.
author: David G.

description: Their salads hit the spot. They are so fresh with great roasted meats and the perfect crunch. Don't forget to order the frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles.
author: melissa d.

description:
On and off place to go to. 

I've definitely had fries here that were BOMB and delicious but I took my friend here to get fries and wraps and the fries tasted old and not fresh and the wrap tasted so bland! 

Their salads are definitely filling with REAL chicken pieces! Not the nasty fake processed chicken! I would definitely go for that next time I stop by instead of the wraps.

The yogurt here is definitely tart but good with their toppings! 

I would say only go here during peak hours if you want fresh and not gross food.
author: Jessica W.

description: Tried the pork shoulder salad and it was very good. The meat was a little fatty, but flavorful. The portion was huge! I had tried their chicken salad from Forage, which was also really good. I haven't tried the frozen yogurt but will do next time. Will definitely be back!
author: Michelle K.

description:
I heard it was a good place. I am trying to find anything good about this place. I got it, the fries.! to sum it up: blend. and I don't smoke.
be ready to wait.
3 is a crowd. very hard to seat. 
oh and make sure you get a couple glasses of wine when you order or you need to stand in line again. 
good for Americans.
author: marc v.
