description: Amazing! Seriously. I am from NYC (and pretty food-snobby TBH) and until Souvla, I wasn't blown away with the SF food scene. But! I came here on Tuesday and sat in the most amazing seat with an open window and was given this delicious and picturesque vegetable salad. The man who helped me was SO kind and after lunch, he brought me a free greek yogurt to welcome me to the city. I am just so thrilled to have discovered this place.
author: Laura Jo H.

description: How did I not know about this place??? Lord jesus!!!!! This place is amazing. I love the lamb sandwich! The beer is good, the wine is good! The yogurt is delicious. I live two blocks Away and I didn't know that this place was here. I am so happy I found it. Super good! I would recommend it to anyone who likes Greek food!
author: Margarita V.

description: Got the lamb sandwich and was kinda disappointed, honestly.  The flavors were fine, but the lamb was a bit on the dry side - not what i expected from lamb leg.  Tried a few bites of my girlfriend's chicken salad, and that was really good.  Gonna have to try the pork next time.
author: Simon L.

description: The lamb wrap is phenomenal. The meat is tender the toppings are fresh and add a really nice crunch. Everything is tied together with this amazing Harissa yogurt dressing. The whole thing was a bit oily though. Also there was a HUGE line, so we ordered togo. It is a small space and I went at 7p, so I would suggest maybe going during the day.
author: Tessa C.

description: Greek froyo with baklava crumble and sour cherry syrup.  Sounds amazing?  It is.  And it's one of the top 100 things to eat in SF.  Go try it.
author: Sanket K.

description:
I've been wanting to try Souvla for awhile now and finally did this past Monday. Phew! It was PACKED in there! Came at 7pm with a friend and I hated how the line was so long and you pretty much have to fight for a seat to eat your food at. Although, the staff was definitely friendly and both they and the food move fast. 

The food was 4-star. We both had chicken sandwiches, and fries (although would have liked to be told we had to request/pay extra for dipping sauce). I did wish hummus was on the sandwich, or maybe a yougurt sauce. 

I felt that the price (28pp with one sandwich and one wine each) was a bit silly for somewhere that I have to fight to sit down and wait to order at a bar. 

Want to try the greek froyo next time!
author: Alexis T.

description:
Ever heard about Greek fast food? Yeah,I had Greek fries,veg sandwich and Harissa Yogurt all served in quick 5 min.And Dont walk outside their door without trying the yogurt.They also serve garlic,"Granch" and mint yogurt. Yogurt varieties aren't mentioned in menu so ask the server.

Seating is family style so just grab an open seat,even if it is on the same table.

Sandwich isn't that filling.Greek fries ok too.Service is super fast.I got mine in 5 min.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Ambiance: five stars. It's dark and bustling at souvla, with a wall of revolving roasting meats dripping their delicious nectar of melted fats as you watch and wish you were one among them in that rotisserie kingdom. Except alive and not a dead hunk of lamb.

Honestly I thought my lamb wrap was kind of dry. It was large, yes, but lamb was mainly too tough, and the rest were fairly standard Greek ingredients. The supposedly famous potatoes were disappointing. Generally just oily, they lacked both unique seasoning and any sort of desired texture beyond fluffy carbohydrates.

Maybe I'll try the Greek yogurt. Good casual place though.
author: Chia L.

description: This tasty restaurant opened up about a block from my office.  I love the place, the food is simple, perfectly prepared and delicious.  The ambiance is terrific.  They did a terrific build out of their space.
author: Allen W.

description:
i've never had a wrap taste so fresh and awesome. the ingredients used are top notch and their meats are super flavorful. my one qualm about the pork and the lamb i have is that they sure are greasy. when placed in a wrap, it's alright because the pita helps to soak it up some of the oil but when i've had it in a salad, the amount of oil slicking off of the lamb is just too much. it makes the greens soggy, heavy, and takes away from the lightness of the salad. 

the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is on a couple of "what to eat in SF" lists. i think it's pretty good but don't find it to be anything other than you would imagine.
author: Regina C.

description: Came here based on a recommendation while visiting San Francisco and was not at all disappointed!  I got the free-range chicken salad and it was so flavorful, crisp and fresh.  The ambiance was relaxed and intimate, perfect for a date or meeting with friends.  The Greek frozen yogurt was also amazing!
author: Shannon J.

description: I LOVE SOUVLA!!!!! Their chicken salad is to die for! It is delicious and tastes bette than any old salad you've ever had. Their wraps are delicious as well! They have a great selection of sides, such as their fries, which I order every time I go. Lastly, they have Greek yogurt as a dessert. And the best part about is that they put delicious baklava filling on top of your yogurt and it's basically my favorite dessert in Hayes Valley !
author: Chelsea S.

description:
Wanted to love this Greek sandwich/salad spot in Hayes Valley, but I only wound up liking it (in a "can we just be friends?" kind of way).
Don't get me wrong, it's a cool space in a fun neighborhood, with plenty of attractive hipster clientele. But something just seemed off to me.

My friend and I both ordered the Lamb Leg Sandwich (Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onion, Feta Cheese), and split an order of the Greek Fries (Olive Oil, Lemon Juice, Oregano, Mizithra Cheese). The sandwich was certainly generous in its portion size. However, it was surprisingly dry and bland. I guess I was expecting a little more burst of exotic flavors and juices (something more along the lines of a shwarma). But all that you could really taste with each bite was the dry lamb and the feta cheese. I kept pouring on the hot sauce just to mix up the flavor pattern. Maybe a few tomatoes and some spicy yogurt sauce would have added to the mix. As for the Greek Fries, they were a bit undercooked and under-seasoned for my taste. Next time, I think I'll order some extra yogurt sauce to dip them in. That being said, for $4 you'd think that they could throw in some sort of dipping sauce at no extra charge. It's like charging a diner for ketchup or aioli. 

For dessert, my friend indulged in the frozen Greek Yogurt (which she loved). 
Over all, the place was fine. The service was friendly, the atmosphere was cozy, the prices are affordable - so I'd definitely give it another shot. Though next time, I think I'll explore the rotisserie chicken and pork shoulder options.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Ingredients always taste super fresh every time I am in here.  No matter whether you go for the salad or sandwich for any meat option it's always delicious!  I had the breakfast sandwich for brunch recently which was also fantastic.  Quick counter pick up if you want it to be but lovely small ambiance if you want to sit down and eat with a decent little selection of wines and a passable greek lager.

Certainly no cheap compared to your standard gyro but you are paying up for much higher quality.  Not to miss when you are in Hayes Valley!
author: Jimmy E.

description: Amazingggg food!!! So fresh. Great flavors. Pretty healthy. I had the veggie salad and added chicken, the lemon soup and the Greek yogurt. Big portions. Great spot to come with friends or family. Great ambiance.
author: Danielle M.

description: Both Lamb and Pork are good. Definitely do the olive oil sea salt yogurt. Not good for dates, is more like fast food in and out type place.
author: Moto B.

description:
I used to dine here weekly... sometimes twice a week.

Came here after a three week break to find a 20 percent price increase on the pork salad. Plus about 30 percent less pork in my salad.

I am not motivated to return.
author: noflaps c.

description: The lamb salad and the frozen yogurt at the end were amazing! Very recommended.
author: Yoav G.

description:
Great Brunch! 
The YIANNI'S LOUKANIKO  was so good, going back soon!
author: Dawn C.

description:
Fantastic place for a relaxed, delicious dinner in Hayes Valley. Beautiful decor, lovely staff and super good. Very impressed!

We had the renowned Sweet Potato Salad but added pork for me and lamb for my friend. Just perfect :) 

Right balance between good ambience but not too loud to talk. Perfect for one on ones and groups. Great location. 

Couldn't have asked for a better experience, will definitely be going back to try other things!!!
author: Clare G.

description:
I particularly like the atmosphere, decoration and location of the place - and this new brunch offering in addition to its famous roast meats only makes it more perfect! Even though the choice is not huge (four meals and four beverages) everything they do is nicely presented, freshly made and simply delicious.

We chose the lamb sandwich and the greek toast. 

The lamb wrap comes with scrambled eggs, radish, tomato, onion, avogolemono, garlic yogurt and feta cheese. I looked around in the restaurants - the majority of people ordered this dish and everyone was quite obviously very happy about it. 

The greek toast (pieces of crispy sugar and cinnamon dusted pita bread) is served with sour cherry syrup and frozen Greek yogurt - I promise it is the best! Overall, I saw only empty plates going back to the kitchen - and that is always a good sign!

In comparison to other brunch places in California, the portions served here are relatively small so you can easily pick two dishes if you are very hungry or share three between two people. Prices rank between $9 and $13 and these are totally reasonable.

Also great about this place is that we only waited for 5 minutes to order and be seated at Souvla on a Saturday morning at 11am, which is really unique in San Francisco. Make sure to check it soon before the crowds hear about it!
author: Larissa S.

description: Souvla is the combination of so many things I love about food. Greek cuisine paired with fresh ingredients, unique flavor combinations, and quality meat makes for an amazing meal. I had the chicken sandwich, which is essentially a pita wrap, and it was one of the best Greek wraps I've ever had. The pita was toasted perfectly for a slight crunch on the edges, while still chewy and thick. The chicken was taken right off the rotisserie, and the grill flavor paired really well with the fennel and pickled onions. The mizithra cheese and the navel orange slices really pulled it all together, and it added an unexpected twist to the wrap that brought California flavors to traditional Greek food. Their Greek fries were also great, with a good portion of crispy, fat fries that were seasoned and drizzled with a little cheese. Without a doubt, Souvla has become one of my favorite spots in the city!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Souvla is a restaurant that makes me love living in San Francisco!!! I've been in maybe five or six times and had all three meats off the rotisserie.  Each better than the next.  
The potatoes in the drippings are so good. 
Fast simple food that tastes great. Tip... Sit at the bar and watch the meat spin... There needs to be a tv station of this rotisserie spinning.  
Bravo!
author: ari b.

description:
Lamb pita, hot sauce...
ex Thomas Keller alum.
Olive oil yogurt!
author: Nish N.

description:
Was not too keen on the idea of having Greek yogurt as a dessert but my friends were stoked so I decided to give it a try and I'm so glad I did!  The yogurt was sweet, creamy, and slightly tart--so simple yet so delicious.  We got the version with crumbled Baklava sprinkled over the top but I could've enjoyed it even without the extra toppings.  

I also tried the lamb gyro but was not too impressed by it.  It wasn't bad but the lamb was missing the charbroiled flavor I'm used to.
author: Ivy Z.

description: $15 for a chicken salad that was pretty good, but still $15. I guess that's San Francisco for ya. The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles is to die for. I would go back just for that. Again and again and again.
author: Andrea O.

description: Responsible meat at a very fair price. Everything I tried was amazing - wishing there was a location in Portland!
author: Sean K.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go to lunch. Although quite pricey for a everyday lunch location, it's impossible to fight the urge to come back. The best salad is the chicken, best sandwich is the lamb and best frozen yogurt is definitely the Baklava. The only suggestion is to decrease the prices so all students can afford to come here!
author: Sheridan L.

description:
Despite its steep prices, I appreciate that Souvla is a hipster casual spot with fresh ingredients. The high bar stool tables, natural lighting, and rotating racks of roasting meat create a bright, soothingly clean atmosphere. You order at the counter and take your number to your table (no waiter service).

- Pork Shoulder "Sandwich" ($10): Sandwich = wrap. Also, literally everyone else here ordered a salad and I felt the judgment as my unnecessary carbs arrived, but no regrets! The ingredients are incredibly fresh, and the standouts are actually the vegetable pairings (pickled onions, tomato, cucumber). The wrap itself was fluffy and seemed to be house-made.

- Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Flakes & Syrup ($5): I haven't had much baklava in my life, but the stuff here is delicious! There was just the right amount of syrup to top it off. The yogurt itself was unremarkable. It comes in the iconic "We are happy to serve you" Greek paper cup!

Souvla is a trendy spot for lunch in Hayes Valley and definitely worth a try even if you aren't a fan of Greek Food.
author: Jessica F.

description: Fresh, fresh, fresh ...tender spitfire roasted meats, cute nicely decorated cozy warm atmosphere ..so delicious! Outstanding flavors. I love this spot we needed an amazing Greek food place like this in SF. I hope they stay in business for years to come.
author: Noey G.

description:
Oh my goodness. We randomly picked this place when the bar we were planning on going to had a large line and we weren't patient enough. They were about to close but had no problem taking our order. We all ordered a gyro. I had the lamb, my fiancé had the pork. I've never been overly fond of lamb but this was the best lamb I have ever had, period. I could not get enough of it and wished they were still taking orders because I would have gotten a second one in a heartbeat. I also tried the pork and chicken gyro that we had at our table and they were all delicious. That tzatziki sauce they made was awesome and went really well with the fries and gyro. 

My only regret is this place isn't in Seattle.
author: Ayla W.

description:
Ordered the pork sandwich/gyro. Meh.

Pork was dry and not very flavorful. Gyro was horribly assembled with all the veggies at the top and then just a giant packed clump of meat for the remainder. Ingredients were fresh at least.

Cost $11+ tax, should have been ~$7 based on the quality.

Upshot: I've had far, far, far better gyros from food trucks and equivalent stalls. It's nice to have some variety in food options in the area, but this is not worth a second try IMO. Maybe their salads are better?
author: M G.

description:
Two words- feta. brine.

This place is truly a gem! pork & lamb sandwiches are great; chicken was phenomenal.

Baklava frozen Greek yogurt is intuitive but genius.

Price is right too, this is going to be on the regular.
author: J H.

description:
This place was surprisingly packed on a Tuesday night around 8pm and surprisingly trendy. I was not expecting that type of ambiance for a Greek restaurant, but I guess it is Hayes Valley after all. The restaurant is small so it's a little difficult to find a table; it's also pretty loud and dimly lit.

I liked that they have a simple menu consisting of 3 different meats (chicken, pork shoulder, lamb) and a veggie option in the form of a "sandwich" or salad and sides that include fries with olive oil, lemon juice and cheese, roasted potatoes, and Greek salad. They even have froyo - I really wanted to try the one with baklava crumbles! But I already planned to go to Smitten that night for my ice cream fix haha. I ordered the pork shoulder sandwich, which was delicious! I mean I was STARVING from the gym so that might have been part of the reason I was practically inhaling my food, but I still think it would have been really good. The meat was tender, the sauce was good, it had a perfect amount of cheese, and the bread was so soft. I'd definitely order it again! We also ordered the fries and salad, which were okay. The fries would've been better if the cheese was melted instead of just loose because most of it doesn't stick and ends up falling to the bottom. The salad was good, but had a bit too much olive oil. They also serve wine and beer here!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Consistent, great food and chill environment. The staff here is so friendly with no "new" Hayes Valley attitude (and I live on the block). I love the chicken sandwich it's so fresh and good flavors. Ordering on their website is a dream!!! Literally always ready in 10 mins or less and same quality. Get the granch w your order you won't be disappointed!
author: Brent T.

description: The Greek yogurt with baklava and syrup is God send! I wish they can add more baklava to the yogurt instead of just the top but either way, I was satisfied with my dessert. Must have when you're in the area!
author: Samantha S.

description: With four options that can be easily transformed from a pita wrapped sandwich to a salad bowl (for the gluten free crowd) everything is tasty
author: Brielle J.

description: New favorite Hayes Valley lunch spot. Cute, intimate and the menu is short, straight to the point and delicious. Cant wait to bring friends here with me very soon!!
author: Ashley G.

description:
I was disappointed in the lamb sandwich. It tasted like it was low fat. I think the lamb was too lean and it is possible that they are using very low fat yoghurt. In any case, the mouthfeel I expect to get with nice juicy lamb and the fat in the cream sauce was not there.  

I guess that's what you get when low rent ethnic food is upped in price and  sold to diet conscious yuppies.
author: C S.

description: Delicious and filling. I can usually get two meals out of their salads. They have veggie, rotisserie chicken, pork, and lamb options that you can have wrapped or in a salad. All the fixings pair with the meats well. They have perfectly seasoned fries with dipping sauces, Greek wine, and my favorite avgolemono soup. Save room for their frozen Greek yogurt. I love it with baklava crumbles and honey. It gets pretty busy so that seating is scarce during peak meal hours in which case we'd take our food to go and eat out in the pavilion.
author: Elaine W.

description: Only thing I hate is the smell of the copper tables. If u hate that smell you will hate to dine in here. Lol
author: N C.

description:
We have been back several times since and the salads have gotten a WHOLE  LOT better. Game stepped up! I'm super glad for this. There were a couple of times they were either a bit too wet/soggy from tasty warm meat juice or the kale was dry/not massaged. There is substantially more stuff in the bowl as well, which is very nice. 

I am still a little nervous to try the  lamb, however, the chicken salad is amazing deliciousness. I think I am going to give the lamb another shot on our next visit. 

If you are in the area and want a filling, delicious, satisfying meal I would totally recommend coming here. 

Also, use the hot sauce and get the sparkling water. :)
author: Natalie G.

description: Honestly, Souvla's shwarmas are terrible, and I don't understand the hype. The pita is too thick and dense, and the meat is unflavorful and tough. There is much better Mediterranean at other places in the city.
author: L. Y.

description:
The best med food I've had in the Bay Area. Lamb da which was juicy and flavorful. Fries are thick and of varied crunchiness. Granch dip is top notch.

I'll be making this a regular.
author: Jeff M.

description: I echo the recs for the free range chicken salad and the Greek fries.  Seating is probably easier during the afternoon - I can see how seating can be challenging at peak times.  Also, yeah, parking is terrible as everyone here says but it's Hayes Valley...
author: Emily L.

description:
If restaurants were like dates, Souvla would be the whole package.  Attractive, tasty, and charming to boot.

The superior farms lamb leg pita was by far my favorite -- such incredibly tender, flavorful morsels of perfectly sliced meat completely stole the show.  But also strong in my mind is the way the flavors of Rocky Jr. free-range chicken, navel orange, pea shoots, fennel, pickled red onion, and mizithra cheese came together to elevate the humble gyro to a new level.

Don't forget to try the wine.  If you've ever had Greek wine and perhaps been disappointed, now is the time to try again!  The selected rose and white offerings are delicious.

And yes, there is a dessert worth trying too:  frozen Greek yogurt.  The crazy thing was all of us each liked a different flavor.  I went for the indulgent Greek olive oil with flaky sea salt, while my companions swooned over the sour cherry syrup or baklava crumbles.  For once, something for everyone.

So I mentioned taste, but what makes Souvla the whole package is that it's also also got a great vibe and attentive, down-to-earth service.  In fact, I think this is the first time I've ever been comfortably seated in a place with artistic decor while eating a gyro.

In short - Souvla, this is just the beginning of a long relationship!
author: Tracy K.

description:
Ok I have to say I was skeptical at first but I really like this place. I am a sucker for lamb. I mean the cuter the animal, the more I want to cook it and serve it in a sandwich. And they do a good lamb shoulder. Tender cuts, deboned and well spiced. All the seasonings are great, nothing over the top (like it's not just covered in mayo or yogurt). I actually enjoyed my meal. Now the part that is sort of my weak spot ... the frozen greek yogurt. So far I have only had the baklava and the olive oil & sea salt. I have to see they are both great combos and depending on the mood decides which I get. Sadly I have been sick so I have been avoiding it. But it's tart and fatty and even though it's cold out I don't give a crap I am gonna have it. I think it's well priced for the area, and it's relatively quick for what it is. 

The people running it are really friendly. Like everyone has a smile on their face and it's like one of those places where you actually see that the people involved actually like working there. Like not just a forced fake smile.

Layout of the place is awesome too. Like the communal table, is a great idea. The outside & inside bar is awesome and nice looking. The only thing that's weird about the layout is ... where to wait to order or for your order. There are two places to order and people walk in and get confused because they are located at the entrance (where the indoor/outdoor bar is) and the other at the other end by the display of rotisserie chickens. I think I know what they are trying to go for, but I think people are not going to figure it out so they all sort of stutter by the entrance trying to figure out what to do.  I know it's new and I am sure they are figuring it out, but I mean so far that's it's only flaw. I am a fan.
author: Greg G.

description: Great pork shoulder salad! The friendly girl at the counter gave me a sample of the frozen Greek yogurt, which I can't wait to try with the crumbled baklava the next time I return!
author: Rachel C.

description: Really clean and simple menu items here. we ordered the pork salad and the chicken salad and they were both delicious. The pork was especially tender and juicy. You must try the baklava greek yogurt. It is perfection!
author: Ryan N.

description:
I am obsessed with their Lamb Salad! Best lamb I ever had in a period of 30 years hands down. Love yogurt dressing too. I now crave this salad all the time so we try to come in every week to demolish it. Mr usually gets Chicken salad with side of roasted potatoes (huge yum!)- and claims they are identical to what his Yiayia used to make for him back when he was cute Greek baby. 
There is always two guys working, I assume they are owners and may be siblings?- kiiinda  friendly but could come across a bit snobbish:) not exactly your loud Greek diner owner type of guy. 
Lovely interior too. Very trendy with cute rustic elements.
author: Liza B.

description:
We had a quick lunch here and was very impressed by the food, atmosphere and service.  The Lamb Souvalki was juicy and flavorful as well as very big.  The fries were top notch and I only wish we could have tried a few more items on the small but smart menu.
We'll be back to try a salad.
author: Rick S.

description:
Souvla!!!  How can one little restaurant transport me instantly back to my vacation in Santorini, even in cold/foggy San Francisco?!??  

I can't stop eating here, it's so easy and yummy!  My absolute favorite is the vegetarian option as a salad, I literally crave that white sweet potato.  It's amazing.  Top that off with a Greek fro yo with some baklava toppings and you literally can't go wrong.

Rumor has it that Souvla is a concept restaurant looking to open in additional markets.  Can you PRETTY PLEASE come to Burlingame??  Efharistó!
author: Kristen B.

description: Love this place, just what Hayes Valley needed.  I usually go for the chicken salad, decent portion size and the flavors are excellent.  The pork belly Gyro is also delicious, get it Greek style with french fries inside.
author: Brandon A.

description: Yummy affordable Greek food- simple and delicious and hits the spot. The froyo is fun too. The chicken soup is lemony and warms the soul!
author: Ron M.

description:
Drip drip drip.

One of the funniest things ever: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h5sX24usBvQ

One of the most disappointing things ever: Finding a huge and repulsive puddle of oil or grease or fat or whatever it was forming on my plate below my chicken wrap.

Trying not to be too picky or unreasonable asked my dining companion if she discovered the same thing and what her reaction was. Answer was yes and gross.

It's too bad. Rotisserie chicken had such promise and the wrap with orange accents was quite good. However no meal should leave you with regret. Especially an $11 lunch.

Returned to see if other things were better. "Rotisserie dripping" coated potatoes and the Strauss froyo with sour cherry syrup topping were good but guilty pleasures.

Irritating on the latter was the indifferent staff member made it well before my takeout order was ready which meant it melt quite a bit before leaving. Slight but important miss.

On a positive note the former Sebo is unrecognizable. Clean and airy redesign with the rotisserie focus was impressive.

Unfortunately the food was as much of a mess as R. Kelly.
author: Jason B.

description: I got the sweet  potato wrap being the only veggie  option, and it was disgusting! I couldn't eat past one bite. Maybe it's a flavor people can love or hate. The one star is for the frozen greek  yogurt with  baklava, which is pretty good. Never returning again!
author: Tanmayi S.

description: Wish I had taken a photo of my food! Met up with a mentor here for lunch. We both had the pork shoulder salad (super delicious!) while chatting about business. Great service, casual atmosphere, clean and nice decor, quick to get a table, reasonable price in the area. There are hooks under the tables for umbrellas and bags! What's there not to love? Can't wait to go back!
author: Joanne H.

description: Very cool trendy little spot with yummy greek wines on tap. The rotisserie chicken looked scrumptious. Nice servers too. We needed more Greek food in SF -- thank you!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Very solid spot. Fresh home cooking. Awesome fries (get it with the yogurt). The frozen yogurt with sour cherries was awesome.

Solid wine selection.

Airy, clean, and cute ambience.
author: Nicole M.

description:
So good! Came highly recommended and did not disappoint. 
Told the cashier it was our first time and he was very patient and nice. 
Ordered Chicken Wrap Greek Style (with fries inside!) & Lamb Salad. 

Both were great. 

He also gave us a free frozen greek yogurt on our way out which was amazing :)
author: Molly H.

description: I don't have words to describe how happy this place makes me. I drive an hour just to eat here twice a week (and dream about it the other five nights). Yeah - it's not what you would imagine as "traditional greek food", but you can get that at a gazillion other places in San Francisco. It's innovative and exciting! I always get the white sweet potato salad, but have tried almost everything on the menu and it's all incredible. The employees are always super duper friendly, and the food generally takes less than 5 mins to prepare (perks of having a simple menu!) Whenever I have guests come to visit, this is generally the first stop after the airport. Love,love love love love Souvla.
author: Bridget C.

description: I don't usually like Greek food that much but I have only wonderful things to say about Souvla's fare. They boast a delicious, fresh, and expertly simple menu. My partner and I were also delighted to discover that their meat options were pasture-raised. My only regret is that we didn't make it back for a second meal before leaving town.
author: Theora M.

description:
Just left from a delicious lunch here. I had the chicken salad and it was so tasty and the ingredients were so fresh.  My friend got the pork gyro - and while it was a bit messy, she ate every bite.  We also got the fries and got one of the dips. My only wish was that I still had room to try the greek frozen yogurt.

I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
author: Autumn B.

description:
Chicken sandwich: orange and chicken is a great combo! Dry though.

Lamb sandwich: overall pretty good. Had better. 

Pretty pricey for food that didn't blow my mind
author: Vi T.

description: Love the salad, fresh fixings with flavorful dressing. I was too full to try their frozen yogurt - but it looked great... I'll be back to try it!
author: Caitlin A.

description:
You know how it is when you have a taste for something specific, but you've tried just about every restaurant and haven't yet been satisfied? Well, today was my lucky day. As usual, I was scanning the screen looking for a place for the perfect gyro. What to you know? Up popped the name Souvla, a brand new Greek restaurant in S.F. Was this meant to be? 

Not quite understanding whether or not it had opened yet, I headed over. The Gods of food pointed me in the direction of Hayes Valley. Oh, no. not my lucky day. CLOSED for pre-opening party. Standing at the door, with my tongue hanging out, the owner Charles, welcomed me in to enjoy lunch on him. 

I was definitely not disappointed. I tried the lamb gyro. The meat was delicious...succulent and well seasoned, with a mix of crunchy veggies and sauce. The gyro was thick and toasted. A side of the Greek fries and I was hooked. Unfortunately,  it was lunchtime, so I didn't indulge in any of the great wines on the list. However, it would have been the perfect accompaniment. 

Yes, all the stars were perfectly aligned. All in all, everything about this place is great. Simple and to the point. Hopefully, there will be take out. The perfect grab and go if you don't have time to relax and enjoy.
author: Judith Z.

description:
Good portions but $$$. 

Other reviewers were right, poor crowd control staff and absent minded patrons sitting, chatting, sans food,  taking up space in a place that can not regulate their own 'system'. Because you have to wait for a table before you order, they up-sell you on a glass of wine, when may be you didn't even want one. Go either early 6 pm or 9 pm. Otherwise, forget it. 

Get TO GO and don't bother with the chaos. Although, there is another Mediterranean place just around the corner.

PS there is also NO protein on the only veggie salad.
author: Hez B.

description: It's very simple. I'm Greek, my grandfather made souvla and souvlaki every Sunday and the hole family of 20 was there ... This place takes me right back, its that delicious :)
author: Niko T.

description: The food was delicious! I love that they have a small menu which makes it a lot easier for indecisive people like me. Were ordered almost everything; the chicken salad, soup, lamb and pork sandwich, potatoes and fries and the best of all the Greek frozen yogurt w/ baklava and the one with olive oil and salt. The wait wasn't that bad but it was difficult to find seating. Definitely going there again when I visit SF!
author: Karan G.

description: Meh. Food wasn't bad, but wasn't memorable. I've had far better souvlaki/gyros elsewhere. There was a decent-sized line to order, but it moved quickly. The location and decor are both nice...kind of hipster casual.
author: Cameron N.

description:
4 Stars for food/2 stars for extremely incompetent service

Their food is relatively good.  The potatoes are to die for - if nothing else, go here for this.  The pork salad is decent - I didn't eat much because my order wasn't accurate.  I'll amend this review when I'm dragged to this place again.

I placed a to-go order.  My food wasn't ready for a while - acceptable.  It came out as a dine in order, was taken back to a to go.  Came home, found my salad doused in onions after I specifically and repeatedly asked for no onions (which my server confirmed when reading back my order).  Called to speak to someone about it - their phone number is completely automated. 

Definitely left a poor taste in my mouth (the onions didn't help).  Let's hope the next time is better.
author: Steve A.

description: The food is good but not remarkable. Felt the salad lacked any brightness... A twist of lemon would have helped immensely. Feels expensive for what you get.
author: Mark N.

description:
What a wonderful little spot. Haven't had a lamb gyro this good in years. Tons of meat. Seasonings were perfect. And the potatoes......like my grandmother's.
Friendly service, great food, and not too expensive. For those of you who complained about the price, I suggest you price a good leg of lamb someday, and then go buy another $15 hamburger.
Last...It's really immaculate. I'm no prude, and have had some great food in real greasy spoons, but eating in a nice clean place is still really enjoyable.
Gonna be a regular at this place.
author: Al M.

description: After trying this place 3 times, I can confidently say it is a 5 stars lunch spot! Delicious pork and chicken salads. Prices are reasonable considering the location and quality of food. It is now in my rotation of regular lunch spots!
author: Tracy L.

description: Best Salads and Greek Frozen Yogurt in San Francisco. The lines can be long at times but the wait is worth it.
author: Tamara D.

description: Nice, but overpriced. The lamb sandwich was $13. Nice little chunks of lamb and a decent balance of all the condiment w the meat, but I prefer my Greek food down and dirty NY style. A smaller wrap and cheaper price would suit me better. And much more rosemary on the lamb. That brings out the flavor. And this was a bit bland.
author: David A R.

description: Salads are delicious, especially when you add hot sauce, but sandwiches need a little more.
author: R D.

description: This is one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite in all of San Francisco. The food is unique and amazing. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Hayes Valley. The dining experience is great, although seating is a bit sparse. The food comes out so quickly (almost always under 5 mins), even though it's a little expensive. Really, at the end of the day, I highly recommend this place.
author: Blake S.

description: Rating strictly on the lamb salad since that's the only thing I ever order from Souvla. It's delicious! Quite a big salad done just right. Souvla has become my go to spot for my craving salad fixes. Don't be surprised if you see a line in the evenings and weekends.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Such a cool neighborhood, ambiance, and concept.  I walked here from my hotel in Japantown during a work trip.  While parts of the walk were a little sketchy being by myself, I never felt unsafe and was so excited to arrive to such an adorable neighborhood! 

Souvla was delish - I got the lamb salad (would probably get it in sandwich version if I go back) and also the roasted potatoes.  It was quite filling, slightly expensive, but definitely worth it!
author: Cat S.

description: Souvla is the best! I've been a fan since the day it opened. Highly recommend it if you're looking to get a casual lunch or dinner, even for a date. Very good lamb sandwiches, chicken salads, and Greek yogurt with baklava. My favorite sides are the French fries and potatoes. The orange Greek soda is very good too. Try it all! Very simple menu and awesome food. Excited for the new Souvla in Nopa. The city needs more Souvla!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This place is AMAZING! I've had almost everything on the menu and it is always good. 

Best thing to happen to Hayes Valley in awhile.
author: Alexa L.

description:
Delicious, fresh and speedy food complete with friendly, fast casual service. No complaints from my end. In addition to all of that, the interior is cute and beer and wine options are limited but good. 

Menu hack: there are four different salads (lamb, chicken, veggie and pork) and you can add any meat to any salad. My go to is the veggie salad with lamb. It has white sweet potatoes that are nothing short of spectacular.
author: Amy M.

description:
Souvla is an excellent lunch, snack, or casual dinner spot that has an open, airy vibe, in a great location in Hayes Valley. It is one of my favorite fast casual places anywhere. 

Souvla has a small storefront on one of the most popular streets in Hayes, yet it always seems that everyone can find a spot, and I always get my food within a few minutes of ordering! 

My Greek friend says the Avgolemono soup is just right, and I usually split the sweet potato and the lamb sandwich with my partner. The frozen Greek yogurt with sea salt, honey, and olive oil is also simple and perfect. 

Would like to see more wine options, but otherwise and all-together fantastic.
author: Marybeth B.

description:
The good: Terrific fries, pretty quick service after ordering, interesting flavors and ingredient combinations.

The okay: Chicken wrap was decent, but the meat was dry and a bit tasteless.

The bad: Limited seating, extremely busy (waited 30+ min. in line just to reach the counter - this was after 7 p.m. on a Tuesday night, mind you), a bit pricy (I know it's Hayes Valley, but $13 for a single, normal-sized wrap?).
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Charles, the owner, took the time on both the food and the design when he opened Souvla. All of the salads and pita wraps are juicy and delicious. I am personally a fan of the lamb with pita and the chicken as a salad. Greek yogurt is tangy and tasty as well. I had it with the cherry syrup. 

This is a wonderful addition to Hayes Valley.
author: Pilar P.

description: Consistently delicious - have tried most things on the menu at this point and Souvla doesn't disappoint.  I also love how straightforward and simple their options are...no agonizing over pages of variations here! Recently introduced to the Greek frozen yogurt - yummy treat!
author: Michel P.

description:
I'm only giving this place 3 stars because of the price. It is pretty overpriced for what you get in my opinion. I've had the chicken sandwich which is $11 by itself. No sides. Nothing. It's not exactly a tiny sandwich but it isn't $11 work. It is delicious though. Their potatoes are $5 as an add on and the portion size is laughable. They are also delicious.

The exception to this is the yogurt. $5 for cup which is actually larger than what Smitten sells for near the same price. It is also incredible.

Overall, if you want good food, you've come to the right place. If you're at all concerned with value and price then this isn't the place.

Some recommendations (if anyone from Souvla happens to read this):
- make small yogurt cup or potatoes add on to sandwich for $2.
- OR lower prices of sandwiches by $2-$3.
author: Travis B.

description: Love the food, location, and people working there. I go there often because I like their chicken wrap. They also have great ice tea. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to eat healthy delicious food on a budget.
author: Bob M.

description:
Overpriced but great-tasting food with excellent service. The place is very Hayes Valley. I recommend getting the "sandwich" version of any of the meals as the "salad" option is not filling. 

The yogurt with crumbled baklava and honey syrup is a delicious $5 treat.
author: Chad S.

description: Wonderful and generous lamb salad with greek cheese and interesting dark greens.  Really friendly staff and gorgeous ambience.  Thanks.
author: Brooke W.

description:
So far, everything I have had here had been AMAZING. And given that they pretty much have only three things: a gyro sandwich, a salad, and yogurt, that's saying A LOT!

With the slightly higher price tag ($10 for salad, $12 for sandwich) that may at first intimidate usual lunch grabbers, the quality of the meat and accessories is totally worth it. For the salad, they give you a HUGE BOWL of lightly dressed kale, lettuce, and assorted fresh vegetables with loads of your choice of meat. I have yet to finish the salad bowl in my past two visits. The sandwich may be on the more moderate side in terms of portion, so if quantity per price is what you are looking for, you could be disappointed.

I was especially pleasantly surprised by their frozen Greek yogurt. Even the most tart frozen yogurt at places like Easy Breezy and Yogurtland are TOO SUGARY for my taste. Not this place! Their frozen yogurt is softer, more watery, much less sugary, and tasted great with my choice topping of sour cherry syrup. 

Overall, I am super happy to have discovered Souvla. The salad + yogurt combo is going to have me keep coming back for more!


Good:
--- juicy, high-quality delicious meat (chicken, pork, lamb) and veggie
--- HUGE and healthy salad bowl portion
--- good fries
--- amazing frozen greek yogurt

Possible bad:
--- slightly higher $$
--- sandwich portion not big
--- line can sometimes be long and confusing
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I came here with a friend and was greeted by a bright, airy, cozy Hayes Valley cafe, that was crowded but didn't feel that way.
Super nice, helpful, good natured staff serving Greek wraps and salads as if it was haute cuisine (at least, fast casual lunch time haute cuisine) with a nod to the Greek Jersey diners of my past.
The wrap was great and so was my bottle of greek Iced Tea.

I will now be a regular here.
author: Ross S.

description: Charles (owner) has done an amazing job in creating a destination spot in SF. Everything on the menu is outstanding, the service makes you feel at home and decor is on point. I could actually eat the chicken salad everyday.
author: Tyler D.

description:
i honestly can't think of anything bad to say. because frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles is probably my favorite dessert of all time, i think i am a little biased. but objectively, it is still amazing. seriously, go try it.

what really attracts me to this place is the ambiance and the decor. it's a very classy, modern, breezy take on a traditional greek restaurant and i find it really appealing. i love the atmosphere and the feeling of being at an upscale greek restaurant without having to make a reservation and still being able to order similarly to how you would at a standard greek restaurant. 

however, these gyros are not standard. i love, love, love the flavors and the added ingredients. the gyros are filling but also have a lightness and a freshness to them. i love citrus in anything and i can get than in a gyro here! 

highly recommended. especially the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. go try it right now.
author: Elise B.

description:
Delicious lamb salad with pickled red onion, feta, radish and a yogurt dressing. Choose that over the chicken (husband had it, good but not as good). Greek rose a perfect accompaniment.
Great spot to pop into on the go or for a quick sit down.
author: Aimee K.

description: I love the chicken salad here! It's $13 but worth it for the freshness, huge quantity of meat and health value. I get it almost every week and always tell them no dressing and no cheese but that's just me.
author: Amy Y.

description: This might be the best food in SF!! Never a bad meal here. It's filling, soul nourishing, grounding, and scrumptious! Fast and friendly service. Must must must try the homemade Greek frozen yogurt desserts w toppings!
author: B. C.

description: I've been meaning to check out this place for some time now, and so glad I did a few weeks ago for dinner. It's super casual, yet there's still some ambiance as they dim the lighting and they offer wine. (It's a seat-yourself type of deal.) Be prepared to get a bit cozy with your company and neighbors, as it's a very small restaurant with limited seating. You won't have to wait for long though, as it's a place to just sit down for a quick meal (eat and get up within an hour). Perfect if you're already dressed down, and suitable for a quick bite before heading out somewhere. Salad was very fresh and well-portioned, though the pork was a little fatty. Next time, I'll have to go for the chicken or steak!
author: Diana K.

description:
Even though the restaurant is made to be casual, by ordering at the counter and picking up your food/drinks, it doesn't feel too casual. The atmosphere is dim-light, lively and tasteful.

The food is limited to 3 things, either as a wrap or as a bowl, a few apps and then desserts.

As vegetarians, we got the sweet potato falafel as both a kale salad bowl and wrap. The bowl was by far better, with a great dressing and less heavy than the wrap. We also got the garlic fries which were incredible and finally the baklava fro-yo which to our surprise, was not good! We had heard great things but it was very disappointing bc the sweetness of the baklava did not pair well with the tartness of the greek yogurt. It could have if they did something to better integrate ingredients but they just cut up baklava (too sweet) and stick it in the froyo (too tart).
author: So N.

description: Delicious sweet potato salad and Greek frozen yogurt. Pleasant service. First time I was there during the weekend your typical, new to SF douche tech yuck customers were filling the place to the brim but that's the new SF, not Souvla's fault. My weekday experience was more pleasant.
author: Lara O.

description: My wife and I ate here and loved it. Extremely friendly service, quick, great healthy food. Cool ambiance and plating.
author: Justin N.

description: Solid food. The lamb sandwich is perfect all the way around.  From bread to fixins. Yummy!
author: brian p.

description:
Have been here twice. First time was great. 

Chicken sandwich is a unique combination of savory and sweet: the mandarin oranges add zest to the sandwich, the chicken was soft and tender (mostly good meat - I'm picky about skin and tendons), and the fries are a nice compliment. 

The second time I ordered take out.  Fast and easy order and pickup. Unfortunately there were random pieces of skin, giblets, and bones in the sandwich. 

We'll probably still try it again at some point since it's such a tasty sandwich...we might just let them know to hold off on those unsavory parts of the chicken.
author: Cheester O.

description:
Decent but price point was kind of high for what you got. Interesting sandwich combos. 

Meal has a street food / food truck vibe -- not a bad thing. Interior was nice in an upscale burger joint kind of way -- not a bad thing either.  Essentially casual aesthetic.

But again, for $12/$14+ you could sit down at another restaurant in the area with table service and other amenities. 

This place would rock if the menu were $5 cheaper. Just my opinion.
author: Emit S.

description: Delightful add to the neighborhood!  Does what it is suppose to with simply wonderful food in a well thought out space. I had fries, lamb bowl, Greek Red and the baklava yogurt. I live up the street and will be back often:-)
author: Robert M.

description:
On a random, lazy Sunday afternoon in Hayes Valley, my car decided to not start, so luckily one of my good friends lives around the area. After walking about 1 mile there and back  to O ' Reillys to purchase jumper cables, my car was revived. 

After that road block, my friends and I decided to eat around area. 

It's a pretty small restaurant with some seating area outside. I got the pork shoulder and it was delish. The portions are huge so luckily my salad was fine for the next days lunch. The pork was chewy and flavorful. The greens were fresh and the feta cheese was on point. 

The service was OK. 

Will definitely come back if I'm around that area
author: Jessica Z.

description: Seriously good Greek food. And at an awesome price point. Cool and modern ambiance, with mostly communal seating. I had the Chicken sandwich. High quality ingredients and a tasty combination: Mary's free range chicken over the rotisserie, fennel, fresh mango...so good! Will be back more. Likely to become a habit!
author: Ori B.

description: A little underwhelming for all of the hype I've been hearing but it must be about the meat. We got two different sandos and Greek fries. The lamb and pork were cooked and seasoned perfectly and they give you a ton of meat but as for everything else inside I was a little disappointed. I got 4 little radish pieces and barely any sauce or other crunchy goodies inside. Not sure what I was expecting but something amazing I guess. They definitely know how to cook some great meat though so maybe next time I'll get something besides a sandwich
author: Lilia D.

description:
I love the food and the service here, but I just ordered a sandwich to go and it was less than half the size of every other sandwich I've gotten there.  Well, the bread was the same size but overall it was, for a $13 sandwich, pretty miserly.

I'm really hoping today was just a bad day to order a sando from this place and that they haven't decided to permanently skimp on their portions, because the food is incredible.  And expensive.
author: Susan V.

description:
Superb!  Be sure to save room for the frozen yogurt with baklava bits and syrup! 

Also small,dark space, with open seating but people are usually in and out pretty quick so it's not too hard to find a spot
author: Andrew L.

description:
Solid greek froyo with baklava crumbles. Not enough crunch but nice nutty taste. Good to tide you over during the wait for your food. Super crowded area with lots of small benches and stuff with dim lighting. 

Solid pork salad with kale! I loved the acidity of the tangy yogurt dressing.
author: Diana L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and am obsessed with this place. Their vegetarian salad is delicious, hearty, and healthy. I already have plans to bring friends there twice this week. Their greek frozen yogurt is also tasty. 
I visited athens last summer and ate plenty of greek salads and greek frozen yogurt -- this place surpassed my expectations. Love Souvla!
author: Megan F.

description: My favorite place for Greek food, second to my yiayia. Being half Greek, that means a lot! The food is authentic, great quality, and reasonably priced! Not the best menu for the vegetarians unless you're opting for brunch (in which case I dream about the Greek Toast)! They also have a great selection of wines from Greece. Sometimes I come just for a drink and the Greek Fries. It's a casual and pleasant place, great if you want to eat there or just for take out. Stop reading this review and try it now!
author: Eleni Y.

description: We stopped by and had a pork shoulder sandwich, fries, and a Greek yogurt with baklava.  All were very delicious and fresh.  Staff were friendly and courteous.  There is actually barstool / counter type seating in the back of the restaurant so it has more capacity than initially meets the eye.
author: Patrick J.

description:
I live right down the street, and this is my new go-to easy & delicious dinner spot. I'm actually there a little embarrassingly too often, but it's sooo yummy. 

You can tell the ingredients are really fresh, the pita homemade, all for a great price considering we're in Hayes Valley. So if you're hungry and craving meat the lamb and pork wraps are wonderful, if you're feeling like you need more greens in your life, go for the veggie salad. Seriously, it's hard to find a healthy, casual, and very yumtown dinner in these woods. This is exactly what Hayes Valley needed. THANK YOU!
author: Mosey S.

description: Seriously! How awesome can Greek casual get? Really good! Love pork on salad. So amaze. Simple super menu w best rotisserie & divine design in this cool affordable spot. Go go go. Greek!
author: heather s.

description: This place is CRAZY good! The only complaint I have is that if you don't get there early enough, you will NEVER get in! The Greek soft serve yogurt with Baklava topping is insanely good. Can't wait to go back!
author: Michael A.

description:
Souvla is proof that if you offer good food at a price that will not lead to bankruptcy every else falls by the wayside.   The restaurant itself is not much to speak of.  The silverware is basic.  The seating is basic.  The napkins are paper, albeit high-end paper.  But the food seems well-sourced.  And whoever puts their plates together knows a thing or two about tastes, textures, and food.  I would dare say that a chef is in house.  

Not knowing the size of their offerings I over ordered.  I started with free range chicken salad that came with fennel, orange segments, pea shoots, and cheese.  First the warm chicken was really good.  Next, the salad was not overdressed and the dressing was good.  A first class salad.

The leg of lamb wrap came with onion, feta cheese, radish, cucumber and harissa spiked yogurt.  The lamb was the real thing: lamb that tasted like lamb.  Everything else in the wrap was fresh and in balance.  

All in all a good meal at a good price in a good place.
author: David D.

description: Souvla delighted our taste buds today with a salad and wrap featuring rotisserie chicken and lamb respectively. The lamb and chicken were tender and very flavorful. I dare write that this is the best lamb I've tasted since leaving London and my beloved Ranoush where lamb is taken to a level of food perfection seldom achieved.. We will return, oh, we will return.
author: Jay D.

description: The restaurant is in a cute area, make sure to prepare to wait in line depending on the time you go. The menu was simple at first glance but each item has its own unique combination. It's a bit pricer than most casual restaurants but I'd say it's worth trying. I will go back again.
author: Ellie A.

description:
I was so excited to try this spot & get my Greek fix. I was disappointed in the end, but it wasn't all bad. 

The restaurant is small and has a very clean minimal look on the inside. You can see the meats roasting right when you walk in. Great lighting, simple menu. & yes they have retsina!!

Although this spot has a cool vibe and casual atmosphere, the food is mediocre. By no means is the food bad, it's just not up to standards flavor wise. I ordered the lamb leg sandwich, the lamb was dry and bland. All of the other ingredients in the sandwich came together to create a good sandwich, but the lamb itself was just ehhh. My friend ordered the greek fries, they were crispy & pretty tasty. 

I wasn't impressed with my first visit, but I'll be back to try the salad.
author: Jovani A.

description:
Lamb salad  was tender and had perfect seasoning.
Mary's  chicken salad is the best you can't go wrong.  The potatoes were
delicious. I will be back to try there sandwiches. 
Seating is limited so go early you won't regret it. 
Enjoy !!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sharon S.

description: Very proud that I ate here the day they opened! Souvla is a go to for me. The salads and wraps are always killer. Healthy, but rich enough to be filling and satiating. Go for the pork or lamb, and make it Greek style! (For either.)
author: Lauren D.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING for a quick lunch break or dinner if you're on the go in the neighborhood. They serve super quickly (like REALLY quickly) and the simple menu is so tasty. (They are on Postmates now too so my dream to have one of their sandwich at home on a hangover came true!)
author: Olivia M.

description: This place gave my boyfriend and I the worst food poisoning I've ever had in my life. I knew the chicken tasted a little funny but I didn't think too much of it. We were both sick for 1.5 weeks :(
author: Jaime M.

description:
You can get your dish in a wrap or a bowl. Sauces on the side are amazing!! 

I really like the place and the concept, but I wish you got a bit more food for the prices. Everything there was amazing- flavors were spot on. 

Family style seating and not great for large groups, but you can order togo and eat your wrap in the park :)
author: Tosca B.

description: I go here before/after yoga every week.  The salads and wraps are DE-LIC-IOUS!  The yogurt and greek wine are something you should consider too.  Everyone work works here is friendly and accommodating.  The only thing I would complain about is the cold metal stools...because after an hour and a half of yoga, no one wants to sit on a cold stool in thin wet yoga pants ;)  Other than that...THIS PLACE ROCKS!  I've eaten all over Hayes and this place is the fastest (sit-down) restaurant and the food is yummy every time!
author: Tara B.

description: Pretty good lamb souvlaki.   Fries are fine.  Small menu.  Want to try yogurt next time.
author: Michael E.

description:
I had the lamb sandwich and it was good. Also, they have great Greek wine. I got the red and enjoyed it. Also, I like the space, especially the open window. Service was fine, too. 

I'd give this place a solid 4 stars except that it is too loud. I was screaming at my date, and couldn't hear a word she was saying, even though we were barely apart (our knees were touching - I got as close as I could to her - so close that I was starting to creep her out, but really I was just trying to hear something - anything, she was saying) but still could not hear a word she was saying over all the noise. 

Partly, too many people. Partly, awful acoustics. But, the worst part was the blaring music at maximum volume. I liked the playlist. Great songs. But, damn it, if the place is so loud that you have to tear your throat apart to speak and can't hear no matter how hard you try, then do we really need to amplify the noise by 6x with loud music, too? 

People who run restaurants should learn to have basic situational awareness and adapt to make the best out of the situation.
author: Eater S.

description: this place is great- good food and laid back ambiance. I got the chicken wrap (thought it was really good but would like more sauce on it) and a side of fries- the fries were good but wish there was more cheese/other toppings on it- there was only a tiny bit. Finished the meal with the baklava greek yogurt...wow that is a must have! Will definitely go back (already craving another baklava yogurt) but will request more sauce on my wrap or on the side and won't get the fries again.
author: Kelli L.

description: This is one of our go-tos in San Francisco.  The food is always excellent, and the service is as well.  I love that you can get the the entrees as a salad or sandwich.  My favorites are the lamb and veg.  The baklava greek yogurt is heaven!
author: Marie C.

description:
Very excited that a souvlaki place was opening up. Boyfriend and I have traveled to Athens and had them for dinner half the time we were there and really miss it!

We split the lamb wrap, which was very good, but definitely not worth $13+. It wasn't similar at all to the souvlaki we had in Greece, but this was to be expected - we're in SF and this restaurant is way fancier than any of the late night cafes in Athens. The space is airy, light with stylish accents like dried olive branches. Staff was well groomed but a little haughty. 

Probably won't be back, there are plenty of other places that would've fed us both for $13+.
author: Emily H.

description:
This places runs so smooth. Food is quick, atmosphere is amazing and portions are large. It's a little expensive for what you're getting but the food is very fresh and you won't be disappointed. I recommend getting the salad with fries on it (Greek Style) and make sure to try the hot sauce it's incredible.

They also have some greek wine and beer that's worth a taste. Haven't tried their yogurt yet.

Their Square Order service is OUTSTANDING. You'll be in and out in a sec. While going to the restaurant is nice these guys do an incredible job with takeout so I'd recommend starting there.
author: Alex P.

description: Amazing.  Can't wait to make a return trip next time I'm in SF.  I had the lamb sandwich and will have to try the frozen Greek yogurt soon.  Super impressed.
author: David B.

description:
Came here on a weeknight with a party of 3 around 7PM. We had to hover a little to grab some seats at the bar, but it didn't take more than a few minutes. There are several 4-person high tables, a large communal table, and some bar seating throughout the space. I would suggest not coming with a large party unless you go early or are prepared to wait. 

The ambience was dim, with holiday lighting and decorations. It reminded me of a bar in lower East side of NYC. Definitely a nice spot for a date.

Onto the food: The menu is pretty straightforward - your choice of meat (chicken, lamb, pork) or veggie in the form of a bowl or wrap, plus some sides. We opted for two lamb wraps and a veggie wrap, plus a side of the fries with garlic yogurt dipping sauce, for around $15 per person total. I thought the lab wrap was great - lots of big pieces of lamb, some cheese, and some pickled onions and cucumbers. We did notice, though, that the lamb sandwich was very oily on the outside: it's wrapped once in foil and then in paper, but you still end up getting some oil on your hands when you eat it. My dinnermate also noted that the wrap was a little light on the veggies for his preference. We ended up skipping dessert (though the Greek froyo looked amazing) - will try it next time. 

Overall, a yummy spot for lunch when you're shopping in Hayes Valley or for a casual dinner date. I would definitely come back!
author: J L.

description: I love this place. Their food is delicious, their wine is reasonably priced, the service is excellent, they have wifi, and it's adorable inside. I come here every time I'm in Hayes Valley.
author: Emma F.

description: I love this place! If you like kale you'll love their salads. But if you're like me and prefer other types of greens they will easily swap it out. I love the lamb salad but all the others are also excellent.
author: Katie P.

description: This place is always packed, and now I see why.  I had the chicken sandwich "Greek style" (with fries inside), and it was delicious.  Cute place, great neighborhood, fast and easy.  I'll definitely be back to try the frozen yogurt!
author: ABBY D.

description: It's hard to rate after two years of gyros in NYC...I'm a bit spoiled. The Lamb was good but greasy. The Baklava froyo was enough to go back for in my opinion. If you want the full experience of fries (yum), gyro, and dessert, it gets expensive.
author: Carolyn I.

description: Absolutely love this place. Modern, clean and great natural light coming in during the day. I came for lunch and had the chicken salad. Wow! It was the best salad I have had. The servings were just right and it filled me up perfectly. Can't wait to return to try more of what is on their menu!
author: Megan B.

description:
I love the idea behind this place, but the quality just doesn't justify the $13 (after tax) I spent on a lamb salad.

The salad was over-dressed and soaked in lamb grease. Much of the lettuce and kale at the bottom of my salad was completely soaked in fat juice. Might sound delicious to you, but afternoon diarrhea isn't fun. I'd expect higher quality and greater attention to detail for something this expensive.

I'll only be back to try the Greek frozen yogurt, which I just couldn't bring myself to order on this visit for another $4.
author: Scott S.

description:
Ridiculously tasty! Lamb and chicken souvlaki are both amazing and potatoes dripping in rotisserie drippings.... Taste even better than they sound.

Casual dining, grab a seat quick service.

2xsouvlaki, 2xbeers 1xbeer =$50 including tip, worth every cent!
author: Will A.

description:
Since it's opened, I've literally walked down the the street twice trying to find it, looking up from my Yelp map to compare it to my surroundings. Yesterday we struck gold. Nestled between Patxi's Pizza and... some random store, is the clean and refreshing white tiled Souvla. Maybe I missed it because of the small sign right above the door, or the crowd of people waiting to get in that obscured my view, but I am glad we did.

FOOD:

Delicious. The menus is small and focused, you essentially pick your protein (or the veg option) and get it as a wrap or salad. I had the pork shoulder, she had the lamb. We both got salads. They were varied and delicious, just the right amount of dressing. The kale to lettuce ratio was a little high, but that's probably a personal preference. The price is a little high when you think about it as a $12 wrap instead though. It's funny how I imagine salads should cost more than sandwiches, but that's the world we live in I guess. 

SERVICE: 

Pretty minimal, you order at the counter and find a seat. Everyone was polite, young, hip. They had really nice aprons? Not much to say one way or another. 

ENVIRONMENT:

They've only been open a short time, but it's pretty typical Neu SF: Hip, line out the door, tech elite, fancy casual. Not bad, not good, just how it is. We sat in the indoor window seats, which is pretty nice, but the outdoor window seats face directly in towards you (Sort of like.. sitting on the inside of an "L" shaped table, and someone is sitting at the bottom side of the "L"). It made it feel a little bit like they were watching us eat, because, they were. A little weird when you have tzatziki sauce running down your chin, but not the worst in the world. 

Go, try it. It's a step up (and a $ up) from Hayes & Kebab anyway.
author: Patrick T.

description: Lovely place to get delicious, fresh, healthy Greek food. Great Greek beers and wine. Lively atmosphere. Top notch all around
author: John C.

description:
Soulva is one of the new additions to Hayes in thé last year that isn't totally worthles!! The last thing Hayes needed was another expensive lingerie store or another plaxe for rich people to buy ugly ass luggage. Soulva os a welcome friend!  The food is great and the staff is friendly. I got an amazing chicken salad with their house made take on ranch and it was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of dressing. 
The place can get loud in the evenings as the space is small and gets busy fast. It can be hard to find a seat and it's the kind of place where you order and then wait for your food. The interior is fine, nothing special or stand outish, but thé food is good quality. Hopefully it will last!
author: Elise H.

description: I only tried the frozen yogurt with baklava on it. It was pretty nasty and baklava was gross . I would like to try other menu items for which probably this place is more known for
author: Jay A.

description: Walked in right at 6pm to order one of their 6pm rotisserie chickens.  $20 is a lot to pay for 1 chicken but it was very delicious.  We also got two generous side salads, a lamb wrap (great meat!), potatoes with drippings and fries with aoli.  Great weeknight takeout.
author: e w.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for a while, but always got put off by the long lines. Don't know what the fuss is all about, since I was severely underwhelmed.  No flavor in the lamb wrap or the chicken wrap, heavy on the wrap and veggies and little meat, 3 wraps came to $42 which is okay if it was both satisfying and delicious. This place fell flat with both. Not even interested In going back for another try. If I only had enough money and will to open my own Greek place in the hood, I would, seeing the long lines this place gets for mediocrity, I could retire. Hey people go about a half a mile to truly Mediterranean for some real food and taste the difference. Night and day .
author: Matt A.

description: Not as tasty as the other options in Hayes Valley, but fast. Eat there or to go. Pita was were hard, flavors not assertive. Maybe it was an off night.
author: Dennis W.

description:
I can't see this playing staying open considering the value is not there and that the lamb sandwich we had was fairly dry and didn't have the right balance of flavors or textures.

The fries we had were also super underwhelming - but my preference is always thin crispy fries and not steak cut fries.

It's hard to justify paying almost $20 (after tax and tip) for a mediocre gyro and fries.

The only redeeming thing about this place is the greek yogurt with sea salt or balkava bits.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Went here for lunch. Verdict: Good place for quick relatively inexpensive (by SF standards) lunch. Good for your lunch break. Not a place to linger.

It's super crowded but I was able to find a seat quickly. Had the lamb salad and side of Greek potatoes. Salad very good, lettuce, kale, red onions, generous portion meat (but one big piece gristle, ugh), cheese, dressing. Potatoes OTOH were limp, greasy, and lukewarm. Not sure why others recommended them so highly! Sadly, they do not sell hot tea. I quite simply do not consider it a meal without my tea! Greek iced tea was too sweet and iced tea just does not taste like "real" tea to me. As addictions go, tea is pretty wimpy but I may have an addiction since I just can't do a meal without it.

Staff very friendly and considering how fast paced quite efficient.

Had frozen yogurt with honey. The cold turned the honey into something the consistency of fudge sauce. Interesting concept I may try at home. 

However, I went afterwards to Arlequin Cafe for a pot of tea!
author: Carol S.

description:
Grubbed: Lamb shoulder salad + drippings potatoes. 

A bit pricey as others have mentioned, but local lamb isn't an especially cheap protein. I was slightly disappointed there wasn't actually any meat on the spit when I popped in, but the lamb was tender and seasoned if lacking a bit of char. The potatoes were what you'd expect- a salty, fatty and creamy side dish. An altogether satisfying meal- I just don't know if I'll be rushing back for another $12 bowl of greens with a few cubes of lamb.
author: Anthony R.

description: $10 for a meh veggie sandwich? Please. And the squash/olive combo, while an interesting concept, just isn't that good.
author: Grant P.

description:
Food was tasty but a $13 lamb sandwich still left me hungry. Not a great value ... a few dollars too expensive to be a regular takeout or lunch option. Better for a casual dinner with friends. 

Though good to have new take out in the neighborhood. 

Restauranteurs: I'd sacrifice an arbitrary 5 restaurants on Hayes for a serviceable ramen shop.
author: Phil L.

description: Hayes Valley has some good spots to eat. This is a good option for a lower budget ($30 for a salad, a sandwich, and a side of potatoes). I had the pork shoulder sandwich--it was pretty good though the pork and pita a bit dry. Sauces were good. Roasted potatoes were good too but a bit soft and not very crispy. Overall this place gets 4 stars since it's good for the money, otherwise would've been 3.
author: Ian S.

description: Delicious, filling salads! It's always busy, so be prepared to wait in line or call ahead for takeout. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. Lovely ambiance.
author: Tessa H.

description: I like the way this little joint create delicate and tasty Greek food. I have had their chicken salad ones, their vegetarian sandwich several times and they frozen Greek yogurt as well. Usually you have to wait 10 minutes which isn't bad. Service is quick and normally you can easily get a spot where you can sit and eat if you wait for it. It's cheap for a restaurant and slightly expensive if you just want a sandwich. However, this is so delicious and I can highly recommend this place if you like or wanna try Greek food in San Francisco.
author: Rasmus E.

description: First thing I noticed about Souvla was the very long line extending from their entry way.  On a positive note, the long line means their food is very popular with the locals! This restaurant is really small so be prepared to just grab-n-go rather than dine-in. There is a park right across the street though so you can sit on the benches or tables there and enjoy your meal. I had the pork wrap which was essentially a gyro but was made burrito-style. I thought it was very flavorful and filling but the price was pretty steep, $11 ($13 for the salad version, wtf?!). I also tried the greek frozen yogurt with baklava topping and that was almost life changing. One cup was $3-4 so I had them split one order in half between two cups (for my sister and I). This ended up being a better idea than we had originally thought because they ended up being very generous with the "half" they put in each cup! The baklava topping was very tasty and I was surprised that I liked the yogurt part because I am not generally a fan of greek yogurt. So if you're okay with a 3/4 portion and go with a friend ask them to split an order in half ;) Great way to save money and get more than the usual single order. Another tip is for foodies going just for the yogurt. If you don't plan on ordering anything else, ask someone toward the front of the line if they don't mind ordering for you and give them the $3-4 to cover the cost. Unlike the other items on their menu the yogurt is served right away, whereas you get a number placard and have to wait for your hot food items or salad to be brought out. So if you only want yogurt, save yourself some time by avoiding the long line and see if one of the friendly patrons is willing to help you out! I would probably eat here again if I were in the area, but don't be mistaken, I am still unhappy about how high the prices are.
author: Alysia W.

description:
The Lamb sandwich is delicious.  Knocking off a star for a combination of three minor gripes; a little expensive, the sandwich portion is a little small and the seating is very limited and somewhat oddly configured.

Overall; a great lunch option.
author: Alex H.

description: Excellent and reasonably priced Greek food. Plus they have a pork salad... amazing.
author: Marc C.

description: Had the pork sandy. Enjoyed it. I will return. Was told the pita was made locally. Cool spot.
author: chris t.

description: Been here twice and I've only had the pork shoulder (once as a sandwich, once as a salad) and both times they were delicious. My husband got the lamb sandwich once and it was very dry. I also got the frozen Greek yogurt with honey once which was good, nothing amazing, but a big portion (I should hope so for $4). Overall, a nice stop for lunch when in neighborhood.
author: Stephanie D.

description: First off, I enjoyed my meal and the experience but still it was average. Food was Hayes Valley priced (over $16 for the lamb sandwich after tax and tip), no sides included. The lamb had a stronger flavor for those of you who are sensitive to it so it might have been better with a little more yogurt sauce. Chilli sauce at the table was not spicy. Bread was okay, between risen pita and the completely flat wrap kind. I understand that part of its value is free range meat and fresh ingredient which I liked (radish and cucumber in the lamb sandwich). But overall feel it is overhyped.
author: Christina H.

description: Inauthentic and overhyped. A living example of how you can't judge a place by the line out the door.
author: P T.

description: Souvla is as good as it gets! I adore Greek food and the fact that they're conveniently located in Hayes Valley and keep their menu simple and consistent makes it all the better. The atmosphere is trendy and great for a date or quick bite to eat - really enjoy everything about this restaurant and am so happy they are in the neighborhood! You can't go wrong with the sandwich or salad selection and I love that you can find a flavor you love and have it either in a salad or a gyro. The salads aren't your average salad, they're a huge portion and are so delicious. I always get the lamb or chicken and if it's a sandwich, I'll add extra kalamata and alwayssss extra feta, on everything, always, because feta is the best thing on earth. The Greek fries are a must and if you have room for dessert, or even if you don't, try a frozen Greek yogurt. The Greek olive oil & flaky sea salt is divine and the baklava crumbles with honey isn't too sweet - definitely worth trying! My review might be a bit biased since I could eat Greek food and feta everyday!
author: Frankie I.

description: I can only speak to the Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles, which was heavenly. Perfect combination of tart and sweetness, and an extremely generous serving! Will be back for dinner and dessert!
author: Abby B.

description: I love that the menu offers the option for patrons to get any main dish as a pita or a salad! The frozen yogurt was exceptional, and the feta cheese fries are heaven in a cone.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Delicious food with decent portions. The place is upscale cheap eats at upscale prices: 

Lamb souvla wrap
Chicken salad
1 cheap glass of Greek wine
$40

*You order at the counter and they bring your food out. They automatically added an 18% tip when you pay using their iPad. 

I felt guilty ordering fries since it broke my budget for the night. It wouldn't kill them to throw in a free frozen yogurt with your purchase.
author: Giselle B.

description: After seeing many of my friends post pics of their food from here on Instagram, I've def been dying to try cause the pics always looked good. For the lamb sandwich and the roasted potatoes made with the drippings. Also the frozen yoghurt. The sandwich was a pretty decent size and it was heavy. The problem was the lamb in mine was so chalky dry. Like large dried cubes of lamb. Hard to take bites out of cause the meat was tough to chew through.
