Offered my friend a bite, who has been there a few time, and she said that it was so dry. Disappointed :(. Maybe it was just that day, but it still made me sad. The potatoes were cooked well and a little greasy from the drippings, but that's to be expected and I was good with it. The yoghurt was good. Not a fan of the baklava one. It has this fake cinnamon taste(kinda like hot tamale candy) and turned me off. But the yogurt itself was good! I may not try it again but at least I did.
author: mel l.

description:
I wasn't too impressed by the food. I would have given it 2 stars if not for the very sweet staff and the fries. I got a a pork sandwich and my mother got a chicken salad. The salad would have been better without the chicken. The chicken was a bit dry and especially shredded up, the texture was not great. The pork sandwich was ok. The pita bread or wrap bread was dry and rather tough to bite off. The pork itself was alright, a bit on the dryer side and towards the end of my sandwich, I found myself picking out bits of meat and only eating the veggies and dry bread.
Now the fries were great. If I go again, the only thing I would order were the fries. Then I would walk out and eat the main course elsewhere. Anyway. Fries. Amazing. Yes. Crispy outside, fluffy inside, and nicely salted and seasoned.
Service was lovely. Very helpful in recommending food and very lively conversationalist. They're lovely people. This subpar rating does not reflect them.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Frozen Yogurt - OMG! However the lamb wrap was tasty but was a tad dry, fries were fluffy and crispy at the same time so yummy, red wine was scrumptious and salad was crunchy goodness ... the line goes oh so quick so deffo try it out once - would Noor come again? Yes but will try a different wrap than the lamb
author: Noor A.

description: Very friendly staff..really felt like dinner at a neighborhood joint, where I felt very comfortable with good service (and I don't live in the area). Food was enjoyable, perhaps just a step below memorable. I might not seek out going back but definitely wouldn't object and might try something different (I had the veggie bowl). Nice experience and good food.
author: J K.

description: The sandwiches were mediocre, the service was snippy.  The redeeming part of this experience was the yogurt.  The yogurt with cherry syrup was fantastic.  The yogurt with olive oil and salt would have been amazing if the salt had been about 1/4 of what it was.  I would definitely go back for the yogurt only, and make sure to ask for salt on the side in the future.
author: S. L.

description: Delicious, fast and easy ambiance! I like the Greek Style with fries in it...just as they do it in Greece!
author: taylor s.

description: I am thoroughly disappointed with Souvla. I'm hoping that it was the timing of my dining experience, around 9:30pm, but the food was barely mediocre. I tried both the lamb and pork, as a friend told me the chicken was really dry. The lamb was also dry, not to mention bland, and the pork was fatty and had a huge chunk of cartilage in the midst of it greasy goodlessness. I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone.
author: Joseph G.

description: Souvla makes really good Greek Mediterranean food, order at the counter and sit yourself kind of restaurant that won't break the bank. I enjoyed the salad, sandwich and French fries. My husband loves the frozen yogurt with the baklava but I honestly could do it without the baklava, cuz I'm not a big fan. Overall good place if you are looking for something quick, healthy, not too expensive, clean cute atmosphere.
author: J C.

description:
Nice place very hip. Sandwiches are delightful. Came here during a nice windy afternoon and my order was out quickly.

Only drawback was the musky flavor in
my chicken sandwich (ten dollars). Arguably I am foolish to try to avoid lamb in a Greek shop but I was hoping they would be cooked apart.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Yummy salad bowl with lambchops. I will head back there for chicken and the third time, for pork. Shhh, don't tell my wife. ;)

Cherry sparkling soda could use a little more oomph. 

Nice interior, very cool ambient.
author: Pepe W.

description: Absolutely delicious food. Friendly service and great vibe. Can't wait to try the desserts.
author: E E.

description:
This place has the BEST salads, so filling, flavorful, and healthy. They're all tasty, but my favorite is the lamb. One of the best entrees you can get for less than $15.  

If you're looking for something more artery clogging, try the sandwiches Greek Style. They put fries on them and they're delicious.
author: Kristen C.

description: The Chipoltle of "greek" food. The chicken soup was tasteless, the salad was nothing special - the typical romaine raw kale combo that I had yesterday at another overpriced blah joint. What is up with SF? People flock to bad food. My friend had the lamb which he thought was tasteless and tough. He thought it might have sat overnight in the fridge, but I asked the worker who said they cook it fresh everyday. Totally bummed I didn't spend my dollars at Ikaros in Grand Lake. That place rocks without the hipster chef bullshit.
author: cintra e.

description: The salads and wraps here are fair. Fresh and quality ingredients. Very filling. I've tried it a few times and it's good, but something is lacking in the flavors. I always feel like I need another sauce to add it my salad or wrap, even when I get the side of sauce. It helps but I always feel a little disappointed. I do like the option for the area, but it definitely is like a "healthy fast food" choice- the Greek version chipotle.
author: Piper W.

description:
I've been here 4 times and the food is really good.  I recommend the pork gyro -  meat is tender and flavorful (spiced with oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, lemon, and some other spices I can't quite place), Greek potatoes which have been roasted all day and flavored with the drippings from the meat on the spit or fries which are sprinkled with cheese.  If you get the fries order the side of dip.  
I did have the lamb gyro once and it was only ok.  The meat was cut up into chunks which is difficult to chew.  Lamb should be sliced for sandwiches.  

The place is small.  Restaurant is very airy, high ceilings and colors are muted grays and browns.  Beautiful space.

I gave a 4 star because the food really is good and the portion size is good however I give a 3 for price.  Everything is a la carte so except to have a $20 lunch if you get a sandwich, fries and a drink.  .
author: Melisa S.

description:
Had their Chicken Wrap and Greek Yogurt with crumbled baklava...Yummy!  The wrap was super oily which is odd considering it is made with Rotisserie chicken but the flavor was great!  I especially liked the tiny pieces of mandarin that provide a nice little touch of sweet into an otherwise tangy dish.

It an get really crowded at lunch making it next to impossible to eat there but grab it to go and cop a squat at the nearby park.
author: Keisha N.

description:
I came here one evening while hanging out with a group of friends in SF. I ordered a lamb sandwich and split an order of Greek fries with a friend. They have glass bottles of water and cups behind where you order, which I really appreciated after walking around in the city.

They brought all of our food out surprisingly quickly. The order of fries was pretty big, and I was definitely satisfied with just half of it. The fries themselves were also very large, but a bit bland.

The "sandwich" itself was a pita folded in half, filled with meat, onions, goat cheese, and spices, and wrapped in aluminum foil. There was a lot of greasy liquid inside, much of which dripped out through the side that wasn't wrapped shut and made the sandwich a bit difficult to eat. But despite this, the sandwich was excellent overall - the lamb was very tender and filled with flavor, and the other ingredients were mixed throughout the meat nicely.
author: Varun N.

description: We were passing by the place and there was a line, so we stood in it. Staff cool, service great. Food? Nehhh... The chicken and lamb were too dry and the gyros are too slippery! Ok, just kidding. I'm clumsy and dropped it in my boyfriend's lap. But I'm not lying about the dry meat, I swear!
author: Lea S.

description: I foolishly forgot to read my own review, so I had to frozen yogurt with sea salt and olive oil again. It was again overpowering.  next time I'm going to have that frozen yogurt with something sensible like cherry syrup.
author: Niniane W.

description: We came here for the frozen yogurt! I ordered the frozen yogurt with baklava and syrup, and it was the perfect sunny day treat. The frozen yogurt cup is big enough to share (or eat alone, of course) and there was just enough topping for the yogurt to be tart and not too sweet. I really enjoyed the real yogurt taste with honey and some crunch! This treat sets you back about $5.50, but it is well worth it.
author: Lauren G.

description: Not exactly traditional greek food. The greek salad has kale, and the pork sandwich was definitely not gyro (though in their defense they didn't say "gyro" anywhere on the menu, they just say "spit-fired"), it was more like unseasoned pulled pork, very lean and kinda flavorless.
author: Ashley M.

description: Your receptionist is a paradigm of white privilege and lack of communicative skills.  And we're not taking other languages.  She fails as a representative of your aim and product.
author: Dbl C.

description:
This place is the most disappointing restaurant outing I have had in San Francisco to date.
The food - Sub par
The Price - WTF crazy!
The people - hipster heaven.

I am tired on this San Francisco trend on expensive food meaning good food.
author: Max S.

description: Awesome grab and go Greek food, including wine and frozen Greek yogurt. I got a rotisserie chick Greek salad with fries and rosé, one of the best grab and go meals I've had in the city. Gotta try it!
author: Ashley R.

description: Went here for dinner on a Saturday night. Great food. Very simple menu. Very chill environment. Got our food very quickly. They don't have a huge selection of drinks but their Greek red wine was pretty good. Their Greek yogurt for dessert was amazing! Will definitely be back.
author: Drew S.

description: This place was not good! I had a salad and the Greek potatoes. The potatoes had no flavor and were very hard like they had not been cooked enough. The salad was ok but not great... The restaurant is very tiny and crowded so make sure to get there before rush times or plan on waiting for a bit. The plus side is they have outdoor seating which is nice and the location is convenient to many shops.
author: Mallory R.

description: This place is my jam!! I always order the Veg salad. The sweet potato is so delicious and it really compliments the pickled onions. Literally could eat this every day. So happy this place moved in the neighborhood. Can't wait to have more items on the menu.
author: Bri R.

description: Whenever I recommend this place to people I always add, "I'm not a salad person" so they understand that we're dealing with a totally new breed of healthy eating here. Souvla is as fresh as it is filling. I've tried everything on their menu and enjoyed it, but the pork is my favorite.
author: Nat V.

description: Choose the salad over the sandwich. The Greek French fries are fantastic and serve 2-3. The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was okay but wouldn't get again. All in all decent experience.
author: T K.

description:
Don't call your self Mediterranean please!!!! You are insulting me as a middle eastern and so as others . Trying to be different ???? Doesn't work . Yes menu was simple but not appealing at all . Way overpriced for salad that has a lot of lettuce and a couple of pieces of meat. The rest forget about it. Would I come back ? No.......
.
author: Sue K.

description: Sorry completely mediocre! I ordered the lamb pita. The pita was drenched in oil but the real disappointment was most definitely the lamb. It was devoid of any flavor! Just cubes of lamb that tasted as thought it was simply boiled in water. Maybe other items are good here but I won't be ordering again.
author: Susan V.

description: Great chicken sandwich. The line moves quickly. Frozen yogurt is amazing and unique. Staff quite friendly. Vibrant space well appointed.
author: Andrew P.

description: This place is, despite the reviews, pretty bland. It's fresh and not bad but the food should have more flavor. I ate the vegetarian sandwich which is fairly salty, in spite of the few olives in it, and lacked much to it other than some mushy sweet potato. I wound up taking out the sweet potato and that improved it vastly but then made the sandwich about half the size. The Greek fries taste like regular fries, and lack the richness Greek fries normally do. This would be a good lunch place for half the price. It's okay food at a highish price.
author: K S.

description: A handful of menu items, but what they do, they do very well. The avgolemono soup was soul warming, with clean flavors and had nice chunks of chicken, a meal in itself. The "juicy potatoes" aka lemon potatoes in most places, were spot on, creamy and flavorful. The french fries were crispy and hot.  I had the lamb sandwich and it delivered, tasty and meaty, a tad high on the salt, even for a sodium aficionado. The salads are generous. The white wine by the glass could be better, but overall it was nice meal and all in our party seemed to enjoy it. Order at the counter and have a seat. The service was quick and attentive. A solid spot for Greek fare though pricey for sure.
author: Dimitri S.

description: LOVED IT! Had the lamb salad and it was so delicous. The flavors were great, it was healthy and filling. Also great prices and nice ambiance that makes you feel like you're at a fancier restaurant. Also had the greek fro-yo - I go the olive oil and sea salt but it was just too much - It's literally drizzled olive oil and sea salt and the combo was just too bold and overpowering so they very nicely took it back and gave me the baklava one which was sooo goood!!! def coming back!
author: Ruby B.

description: Lamb gyro was insanely delicious. My wife's Chicken salad was as she said "off the hook".
author: Colin S.

description: I literally had dreams about the chicken sandwich (with lots of hot sauce). The sides were meh, but the chicken was so good it's still a 5 for me.
author: Josh C.

description: love all the staples, kale salad, chicken (best in the city!), lamb, greek fro-yo
author: Caroline L.

description: Maybe a little pricey for what you get and the long lines can be daunting but OMG they are doing something with their food that makes it absolutely irresistible. Moved into Hayes Valley 5 days ago and I think I have eaten there 3 times already.
author: Christopher S.

description: Very good Lamb sandwich. Not a formal restaurant. Your order at the register and sit. They bring you good food. Not loud. Great for chatting.
author: Gizz V.

description: Aw... the Sweet Potato Salad is now $2 more. Sigh, Hayes Valley.
author: Maria A.

description:
I eat here at least once a week and always get my modified Lamb salad.
this is some of the cleanest, most wonderful food in the city.
author: Nicole M.

description: The lamb sandwich is best thing on menu.  Delicious and hearty.
author: Toki M.

description: Practically prefect in every way. I live and work in the neighborhood, and this place is crucial. Highly suggest the chicken sandwich.
author: Christian S.

description: I've tried the chicken salad and lamb sandwich-both fabulous. These people KNOW how to prepare lamb. I'm not a frozen yogurt person, but theirs is excellent ! They're also very nice and friendly, despite being very busy.
author: Monica R B.

description: Clean, casual, awesome, hip spot.  Use Square Order app to skip line for either dine in or take out.  Epic chicken sandwich 'Greek style' with French fries inside... Reminded me of Santorini only fresher ingredients.
author: Ryan T.

description: Souvla was recommended to me as the neighborhood favorite. I am not sure why. Inside, the menu says Greek this and Greek that, but having been raised on traditional Greek food, the food here was a mystery to me. Not that it wasn't good; it was, especially the moist chicken in the salad. Speaking of, where's the traditional Greek salad? I had the fries, which reminded me of French fries, except with add ons that I couldn't really taste. Basically, the food didn't wow me. And the prices were way too much, especially the salad. Also, the man across from me got pita with his salad. Had I known that was a possibility, I would have ordered that, instead of the fries. I wish the staff had told me about it when I ordered or put it on the menu. If I returned, I might be tempted to get the yogurt, but that's a big if, since I'm lactose intolerant.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: I have been there 4 times.  Interesting place for quick  and affordable Greek food.  I would prefer the pork sandwich to crispier, less oily and spicy.  It is not the typical Greek gyros but a different version of homemade-style cooked pork in a sandwich.  The frozen yogurt with baklava is a pleasant way to finish your meal.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Yum! Great chicken and lamb salad. Had it delivered by Postmates on a cold night. Excellent dinner!
author: Janell H.

description:
Souvla is a high quality modern twist on your typical Gyro places in the city. I've been going to this place and have been meaning to review it. 

Here is a concise list of pros and cons for an easy read:

Pros:

Clean and Modern Decor
Easy Menu and Ordering Process
Very Tasty Lamb
Very Tasty Chicken
Fresh Veggies
Salads are a good portion.
Olive Oil Yogurt is excellent 

Cons:

Expensive 
No Free Sauces to go. 

Overall the place is very beautifully designed and makes a very tasty wrap/salad. The staff is friendly but the food is on the expensive side. The frozen yogurt is very high quality and the food comes out quickly. This place gets a 5 star rating because the food is that perfectly seasoned and tasty. If it weren't for that the place would be 4 stars.
author: Jorge N.

description: This is a sweet little gem of a place in charming Hayes Valley with wonderfully authentic Greek flavors albeit in slightly more modern food stylings. I ordered the lamb salad, with all of the traditional flavors you'd expect from Greek food but in a lighter meal. This salad was excellent. Filled with lots of lamb over not just lettuce but kale. Very healthy and filling, this salad had great balance. Adding to the charm of Souvla is the fact they serve Greek wines. After visiting Rhodes 7 years ago, I was delighted to be poured a glass of Retsina, a yummy pine wine that is a traditional Greek drink. While the line can run out the door, don't be discouraged. There is limited seating here and yet somehow a fairly quick turnaround to find a seat. The only reason this wasn't 5 starts for me? It was really loud inside, and I was hoping to have an easier time chatting with my dinner company. All in all, a great meal and environment. Efgharisto, Souvla!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Fresh, bright atmosphere. I had a tasty pork wrap and hubby had the chicken that was bursting with citrus. We both were quite happy and satisfied. Loved the Greek fries and their homemade spicy pepper sauce.
author: Marcy B.

description: I have a slight obsession and get cravings for the Greek yogurt with Baklava crumbles from Souvla!!! So so good!
author: Emilia R.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood with fantastic food. I've had both the lamb sandwich and pork salad, both were awesome! Good portion size with incredibly fresh ingredients! Also, we ordered a side of potatoes (don't remember what they were called), but they were absolutely fantastic. Super friendly staff - way more engaging and attentive than you would expect for an order at the counter type spot.

A couple areas for improvement, and not enough to knock  them down any stars but here they go.
1) place is hot, like I wanted to leave right when I was done with my meal hot.
2) the spot is too popular! I've tried to go there four times, only two successful attempts. It's a beautiful buildout, but unfortunately there just aren't that many tables. 
3) they use those tiny 4 oz water glasses. It's hot and I'm thirsty guys, larger glasses please!
author: N T.

description:
Awesome greek style sandwiches!!!( ok wraps to some of you).

Don't expect table service since you order at  the counter but that's what I call city living!!!

Will be back!!!
author: Jose F.

description: Lamb Salad is delicious - get an extra Garlic Yogurt for dressing.
author: Abeer S.

description: It's like Chipotle for Greek food! Minimalistic interior design, quick service, and the food is fantastic. We tried the lamb, the pork, and the chicken salads. All different, all great. The juicy potatoes are also a good pick.
author: Zee F.

description: Great place for a quick, great bite. The lamb sandwich and fries were delicious. Order a "Greek Cherry Soda". It's a delicious little 8oz sour cherry soda. Lots of natural light, clean, open dining room made it feel very convivial. Will definitely hit Souvla again while in Hayes Valley.
author: Exequiel S.

description:
OK I'll proudly take "1st to Review" because I attended the Opening Preview Party! 
We have known Charles Bililies, sole proprietor of this bomb establishment for years and he has always talked about his dream of opening his own place. That day has finally arrived. For those that don't know, Charles has worked side by side with some of the world's most famous culinary talents, including Thomas Keller himself and he's worked at Bouchon, RN74, Michael Mina and most recently at Kokkari (one of the highest rated restaurants in SF for years). In short, the man is ambitious, knows food and is now bringing it to you in his own concept. 
Souvla is a hip, unpretentious establishment. It's design is simple with a large community table and tables for smaller groups. It is tastefully done and beautiful to look at. It definitely makes you feel like you are in Greece, which is a welcome addition to the many cultural motifs throughout the city. With the exception of Kokkari there aren't many Greek places. As you walk in you'll see the Souvla oven by the front counter. Here is where the magic happens. Chicken, lamb, pork and sweet potatoes make their rounds over an open flame, slowly searing in juices and flavors. All of them are to die for. You get your pick and they are stuffed into a Gyro with amazing sauces and condiments that you won't find anywhere else. 
The menu is fairly simple but there is beauty in simplicity here. You won't agonize over choices and do not forget to get the Greek fries. They are utterly fantastic.
Souvla is perfect for the casual diner and even those looking for serious food without the fuss of a more formal restaurant. It's a perfect place to pick up a Gyro for the park close by or a night at home or a fun time in the restaurant. I'll see you there!
author: Matt H.

description: Ordered fries and side salad for lunch from Souvlasf. It was ready promptly in 15 minutes.The fries were perfect. Not too greasy, tangy with lemon and cheese and herbs, perfectly seasoned and CRISP. Salad was kale with feta, tomato, kalamata olives, red onions and lemon vinaigrette. Everything was seasoned just right. This place is a new mainstay. Best fries in the universe. Best small lunch in Civic Center. I am full in a good way.
author: Fe B.

description: Easy to miss if you're walking on the wrong side of Hayes but I guess it makes this place that much more of a hidden gem. Great service and food with a fresh spin on traditional Greek wraps and salads. Try the Greek fries and baclava, honey, and Greek yogurt.
author: Talton F.

description: The salads are refreshing and include everything you expect from a Mediterranean salad. However they could add more meat to the normal portions, so I'd definitely recommend to pay that little more for some extra meat. The pork was incredibly tender and perfectly seasoned, delicious. Don't leave without tasting the greek yochurt with baklava. In comparison to the meat, the portion of baklava is huge. Overall, the food is good but it is way overpriced for Greek fast food.
author: Patricia D.

description: Oh dear god save me. This is the only place I ever want to go. The most perfect and addictive salads ever created in the history of the world. That's all.
author: T S.

description: Disappointed! Had a $70 meal with 2 kids and wife and most all things ordered were sub par . Looking at those chickens in the rotisserie I expected tasty high quality white meat but got brown chicken scraps I'd throw to dogs to eat. The lettuce on the salads was browning and not dressed properly. Pita bread should be a great at a place like this but ours was bland and flavorless. I'd also expect some interesting yogurt dressings but none appeared. Lots of other great options in sf I'll pass on this next time
author: Robert S.

description:
Two stars is for clean and pleasant decor, and nice people. 

But food is really cause for disappointment. We tried Chicken, Lamb, and Pork sandwiches, and all three were mediocre. Lamb was over-cooked, dry, and tough. Chicken was bland, tasteless, and chewy, and pork was not much better.
Sandwiches are not too big, but we couldn't even finish half the food.
author: Masoud L.

description: A tasty meal consisting of simply cooked protein and vegetables can be surprisingly hard to find.  This place is pretty paleo friendly.  At least it was until I dove into my transformative Greek frozen yogurt dessert!  Hayes Valley is strangely light on healthy options so Souvla should clean up.
author: Olivia W.

description: I liked this but I feel I need to go again. I split a chicken gyro and the veggie salad (which is enormous and delicious) with two friends, as well as the fries. We could not even come close to finishing the salad among three. We also got some Greek beer, which is pretty much the equivalent of a budweiser, in my opinion. I was eyeing that frozen Greek yogurt with the baklava topping, however, and will be back for that.
author: Madeline S.

description:
Neat little place in Hayes Valley with a unique atmosphere. The people who work there are nice enough and the food comes in a pretty good amount of time. The place is fairly small, so it gets packed in there, but luckily Patricia's Green is right there, so you can head there to chow down.

The food itself wasn't that inspiring though. My girlfriend, mother, and I got what was recommended: the pork salad, pork gyro thing, and chicken salad. None of our meals were above average to any of us. Pretty bland, to be honest.
author: Alexander M.

description: Loved this place! Reasonably priced and great salads. We bought a bottle of rose and salads, sat outside and enjoyed the great San Francisco outdoors.
author: Alyssa T.

description: Holy cow.  YUM. ME.   Enjoyed the chicken wrap, greek fries, a glass of greek rosé, and a taste of my friend's frozen yogurt.    I hate to share how delicious it is but let's face it, word will get out regardless.   FRESH, FRESH, FRESH is the word here in every regard - the space, the personnel, the food - remarkably fresh, flavorful and delicious.  They've got it all down right:  friendly and personable staff, clean, stylish and well organized interior, simple uncomplicated menu.  Can't say enough about this wonderful new addition to HV.  Thank you Souvla, you have raised the bar for a quick bite to eat in HV!
author: Casey H.

description:
i've been in the neighborhood for a couple of years now, and it's been interesting to see how things have changed. recently, the businesses/restaurants have become more on the upscale side--we've always been lacking quick, affordable take-out options, and i feared that with all these new changes, any possibilities for that would quickly diminish. however, now that souvla has arrived, i couldn't be happier.

souvla offers a simple menu of gyros, bowls, greek yogurt, and a few other appetizers/drinks. i had the chicken gyro, which was ready in about 5 minutes; it was simple, fresh, and most importantly, delicious. the space and food fit perfectly within the transitioning "upscale" neighborhood of hayes valley, but at affordable prices. staff was also friendly.

actually looking forward to the next time when i'm low on groceries and need to do take-out, so i can try more of the menu items.
author: stefanie h.

description: I came after showing up too late for one last dinner-before-closedown at my beloved Hayes and Kebob. I was too hungry to leave the neighborhood without eating, so I stopped in to Souvla. Now, IT'S MY NEW FAVORITE PLACE!  Mmmm. The menu is basic- lamb, chicken,  pork, veg- and you choose one as a salad or a sandwich.  I chose the veg as a salad: white sweet potato,  pickled red onion, walnuts, rasins, pea shoots, lacinato kale (as opposed to lettuce? Yes, please!!), Mitizrah cheese and a yogurt dressing. There wasn't anything I would have changed. It was fantastic. Unreal. My husband had the chicken as a gyro,  which I tasted.  The chicken, which is done on a rotisserie,  was moist and tender. We shared some garlic fries with harrissa yogurt and minted yogurt,  and ended with Greek Frozen Yogurt with crumbled baklava (holy moly!!!). Satisfying,  fredh, delicious.  I will be back!!!
author: Elli F.

description: Great staff, great food, HUGE upgrade from what was there before. Good greek food fast! Gotta love it!
author: Alexis M.

description: oh dear finally a good greek//med place in the city where you can sit and chill. Grubbin, really good food. tasty and delish.
author: Sab V.

description: I think in 2016, it is important for restaurants to have a good, viable, proper vegetarian lunch option.  I don't need 3 choices; I don't even need 2.  But, I need one.  And the sweet potato wrap -- for $12! -- was just so meh.  No protein, just starch.  And a big, thick pita.  I was so sad, because I loved the fries at this place, and the delicious yogurt.  Thus, three stars.  Would love to see something better for lunch, like a chickpea/falafel type thing, or a veggie meat, something with beans . . . protein!  People need protein.  Thanks, Souvla!
author: S P.

description: The veggie salad is super yummy and filling.  Customer service has always been great.
author: Heather C.

description: Great wraps and must have frozen yogurt! Great competitor of smittens :)
author: M. N.

description: Move over Smitten. Never will I wait in line for my sugar high. Souvla's Greek style frozen yogurt is so light and refreshing!
author: Benjamin B.

description: I've eaten here over two dozen times since they opened. My girlfriend and I have tried everything on the menu. I've enjoyed every meal I've had here. It's ideal for a quick healthy and delicious dinner. The fact that they have frozen yogurt is a nice treat. I'm glad to have them in the neighborhood.
author: Andrew J.

description: Great spot! We had the lamb and pork dishes, with the Greek fries. All were tasty... Service was fast. Was also tried the Restina wine - very good choice. Especially if you like dry whites! All in all, a great neighborhood find for casual/quick dining.
author: Nick B.

description: Just tried this place last week and I can't believe that I haven't been here before! I got the chicken wrap and was in heaven. Perfectly moist and seasoned and really hit the spot. As I'm writing this review I'm getting ready to go back and try something new!!
author: Nick K.

description: This review is only for the party in your mouth that is the frozen Greek yogurt. Olive oil and sea salt was perfection!
author: J H.

description:
I had the chicken gyro and it was delicious. The pita was fresh and the chicken top-notch. It's so good that I plan on going for a second time this week! Service was friendly. Decor is clean, simple and elegant without being pretentious. 

Great lunch or after work spot for a high quality, low cost meal
author: Eva B.

description: As European I really miss good Mediterranean food. My juicy potatos were sitting on the counter for quite a while so the waitress offered me new ones and a free frozen yogurt on top. Amazing customer service.
author: Chris S.

description: I don't know why but I was pretty skeptical of this place when I walked in the door. I think I was just in a weird mood. The decor is very modern and clean. There is a pleasant aroma of rotisserie chicken with a hint of lemon and thyme. The menu ranges from pork, lamb to chicken or vegetarian. I opted for the sweet potato salad which was the bomb! It came with olives, baby kale, and an amazing dressing... I was so happy with my choice. I even tried a bit of the lamb sandwich (the sauce had a nice kick to it). Overall I had a good experience so I would not hesitate to come back here again.
author: Sueann W.

description: Get the garlic yogurt and Harissa sauce for your fries!! My lamb meat came out a bit cold but if it was hot, it's def on the mark. not salty or overseasoned. just right! the salad has lots of greens in it. def a healthy fulfilling salad.
author: David C.

description: I come here two to three times per week. The chicken salad is my reliable go-to but if I'm feeling bold I'll do chicken or pork or lamb in a sandwich. It's all so good!!! And the french fries, yummmm. The Greek yoghurt dessert are also super good, as is the Rosé or the Greek beer.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I'm in the neighborhood and my husband voted me down because he feels like something else, but I'm going to recreate my experience here-calorie free! This was quite seriously the best salad (lamb) I've ever consumed. It would have been perfection even vegetarian.                                         The kale was perfectly massaged, (yes that is a thing), the lamb was tender and melty. The feta was super-tangy and properly Greek-tasting; none of that wimpy mild feta, this stuff is sharp! Raw tomatoes are gross, but the ones that came in my friends' salad almost looked edible. The frozen yogurt is great; the $4 imported sodas? Meh. But totally understandable and on-par for the 'hood. But it's the only meh there at all. I can't wait to go back.
author: Uhmillion N.

description: I've been here three times and am writing this mid-sandwich with oily fingers because I was compelled to review this place. The wraps are absolutely incredible. The meat quality is super high, and the lamb is some of the best I've tasted. The yogurt they add gives it a great  and the cheese just tops it off (literally and figuratively). I got the side of "juicy potatoes", and they were served in a bowl, dripping with the the juices from the rotisserie meats, and yes they're as good as they sound.  Price is a bit high maybe, especially with extra meat and sauce (because why not?), but for the quality you get, it's totally worth it.
author: Eric L.

description: This place has an amazing ambiance, decor, great staff, and delicious food. I had the lamb sandwich, greek fries with minted Greek yogurt, and honey greek frozen yogurt for dessert. The greek frozen yogurt was out of this world. The lamb sandwich was great, admittedly not the best in my life (I usually like traditional gyro sliced meat, and this was in chunks, but it still was amazingly delicious) but still delicious! Everything at this place is fresh. Ingredients taste AMAZING. The staff was beyond friendly, felt like I was in the Mediterranean. Love this place and will be back!
author: Monica S.

description: My lamb sandwich was bone dry.  Not enough sauce.  But the lamb was tasty itself.  Service was pretty good and the place is well designed and run.  Chef just needs to learn about moisture.
author: Anon A.

description: This is a great casual place in the heart of Hayes Valley.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone interested in Mediterranean and Greek food.  Great food and service.
author: Nasrin N.

description: I work in Hayes Valley and it's now a regular hang for me on lunch breaks. Very well prepared food across the menu. And... Reasonably priced. Good ingredients don't come cheap (I know, I had a restaurant!), good staff doesn't come cheap, (see above), and as for Hayes Valley rents...? I'm actually impressed with how reasonable it actually is. This is food that has been prepared with care and attention to little details. I appreciate it! And as for the "drip, drip" comment in an earlier review? Please...it's meat!!!
author: Rob W.

description: Being someone who doesn't like lamb, they have a really tasty lamb sandwich.  Workers were nice and service was fast.
author: Christina S.

description: Excellent and healthy food options. Loved my chicken salad and greek fries! I plan to go back often.
author: T. C.

description:
Steller vegetarian wraps and bowls. 

Beautiful (busy, lively) space as well.

They are still figuring everything out and seem to be iterating quickly - becoming a standby already.
author: Noah J.

description:
This place is awesome! Seriously, I get cravings for their chicken salad on the regular. 
Prices are a little high, but you get a ton of food, and I'm never left starving. Try the frozen yoghurt with olive oil!!!
author: Jemma P.

description: The service, the food like the juicy potatoes, lamb wrap, chicken salad were all just too mouth watering.  Ambiance, beer cups, lighting all make the place very welcoming
author: Monica B.

description: We're at Souvla for lunch or brunch every other week or so, generally to carry out.  The menu is limited, but what they do, they do extremely well.  I adore the lamb salad with added pita and a side of hot sauce.  (Whatever you get at Souvla, spice it up with the delicious hot sauce.)  The food is absolutely fresh and healthy and you won't fall into a food coma after you eat it.  And try the frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherry sauce for dessert or a snack -- totally craveable and not your usual froyo.
author: June C.

description: Delicious salads.  We had the pork and the chicken and couldn't say which was better.  Very satisfying, especially with the frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherry syrup.  New favorite find.
author: S B.

description: There's something unassuming about this place from the outside. But once you've tasted your first bite and sipped a chilled mug of ice cold white wine, you realize you've discovered something unique and special. They've taken the beautiful blue and white of typical Greek decor and removed the kitsch allowing you to experience a delicious and savory Greek meal...one unlike any other. You've never tasted a Greek salad like this before!
author: Megan Z.

description: First day open. FANTASTIC!  Delicious, clean, open and airy.  Friendly owner was there.  I am just visiting SF for a few days.  Looking for an early lunch, I almost walked right by, but luckily noticed it.  I had the chicken gyro, which had pieces of orange in it, among many other tasty ingredients.  I finished with the frozen Greek yogurt to take with me, with cherry syrup (the other two choices for toppings were both enticing).  I don't write many reviews, but had to for this great place.
author: Scott P.

description: This place is incredible. The Greek style sandwiches are really great and the roasted chicken salad is perfect. Get there early before the lunch rush. It gets busy. My favorite is the olive oil and salt frozen Greek yogurt served in a Greek coffee cup like you get in New York.
author: Ken B.

description: This place has a refreshing take on Greek fast food and I am a big fan. We had the lamb and pork sandwiches and both were good, but the lamb was definitely the winner. Pork was a little salty. We also tried the chicken salad, which was de-lish. Get the greek yogurt with baklava for deseert and call it a night!
author: Ashley L.

description: One of the BEST salads i've ever eaten-- highly recommend the sweet potato salad.  My boyfriend also enjoyed his pork sandwich (gyro), but I don't think it was quite as special/unique.
author: Camille M.

description:
Greek fast food made fancy.

I was hesitant to try this place since Greek dishes like the ones they offer are usually really good at a lower price point but since they have meat from specialized farms I thought I would check it out.

I tried the lamb sandwich. All the ingredients that came with the sandwich were really fresh but the main event, the lamb, lacked flavor and tasted more boiled compared to the lamb glistening on the spit at the back of the restaurant. My bf had a breakfast lamb sandwich and it barely had any meat in it with the same flavor. The fries were well fried but I'd prefer them plain instead of the flavor they added.

I haven't tried the salads or the other meats but I wouldn't recommend the lamb unless it was just an off day.
author: Amy H.

description: My girlfriends and i tried something new yesterday, this place was amazing. I had the Greek salad. It was super light and very refreshing. I also had the Greek fries. Best fries ever. A must try.
author: Tania F.

description: Delicious. Ordered the lamb gyro to go along with the Greek fries. Sat in the park and ---gulp.  What happened to my sandwich?  Menu seems limited and pricey, but shoot that lamb was good.  Place is super cute!  Looking forward to going back.
author: R G.

description: Fast Casual.  Simple menu, nice portion size; great flavors. A welcome addition to the Hayes neighborhood!
author: M D.

description: We are from NYC and came to Souvla after receiving glowing recommendations from friends. Our lunch certainly did not disappoint. Loved the Greek fries and the white sweet potato sandwich!
author: LIly G.

description: Fantastic. Excellent lunch option. Fast, attentive, service and good for eating in or taking out. Salads and wraps were equally tasty. Had the chicken salad, pork wrap and Greek side salad but would be willing to try anything on the menu.
author: Stephen S.

description: Their pork salad is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the food comes out quick. A great new addition to Hayes Valley. Also, the frozen greek yogurt is quite tasty!
author: Cory L.

description: YUM! Located in a small, hipster, artsy neighborhood is this Greek joint. I ordered the chicken wrap and Greek fries with 2 sauces on the side and it was more than enough to share between 2 hungry people. Everything was super flavorful and the staff is very friendly!
author: Katia K.

description:
soup was good.
fries were alright.
tangy yogurt is refreshing.
space was tight.
author: Cheska Tangerina G.

description: About as good as it's going to get in San Francisco I would say. Gyros, despite being a relatively simple food, is notoriously bad outside Greece and I'm not sure why. This attempt is unconventional but very good. A bit pricey but to be expected given the location. Do not overlook the very nicely thought out Greek wine list, even rarer than gyros itself.
author: George L.

description: I had the chicken wrap and my friend got the chicken salad. The flavor was amazing, although my wrap seemed to have been extra extra oily, I usually don't mind but it started softening my pita which weirds me out lol. The food  came out QUICK! Not too costly! They also have beer & wine, which I didn't try but all looked appetizing. I will definitely be back , maybe try some gyro next time :)
author: Brenda E.

description:
Really enjoyed this place. Got the chicken sandwich and it was quick to order at the counter and delicious. There was an orange in there that have an extra flavor boost. 

Will definitely be interested in going back if I am in the neighborhood. Not cheap at $11-12 a sandwich but this is San Francisco
author: Ojus P.

description: Great food and interesting neighborhood! Just a little pricey for the amount of food. Service was great though.
author: Nicole G.

description: This place is fun and modern. A little pricey but you're paying for the atmosphere and  ingredients. Not the best Mediterranean food but it was good and I would return.
author: Kelly O.

description: The food is FRESH. not that many opptions and the place isnt that big but its very clean and the crew is really nice. also their frozen greek yogurt there is EVERYTHING.
author: V L.

description: Came here for lunch and had their vegetarian pita sandwich (sweet potatoes with some tzaziki sauce in a warm pita) and yummmmmmyyy. Very filling and everything tasted very fresh. I'll have to try one of their salads next time (I've heard great things!).
author: Christina C.

description: This review is strictly for the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava it was scrumptious! If you're into frozen yogurt and Greek yogurt I think you'll be pleasantly surprised :)
author: Josie C.

description: Great food, quick service. We ended up with one of each salad + fries + potatoes and liked everything. Skip the Greek beer, it's blah lager.  Downside is that the place is packed and not great for kids (no high chairs, no kids portions).
author: Trishan A.

description: You know, it was good. A nice alternative to pizza or a burger for that quick, casual dinner, but it didn't take me to the dizzying heights that I guess it takes others to. And, it's kind of expensive for what it is. Maybe I got spoiled on a trip to Greece last month where a $3 street souvlaki would leave you speechless with yumminess. I know this is very un-San Francisco, but Souvla's souvlaki had too many veggies, not enough meat and not enough grease.
author: Rick H.

description: The food here is awesome but the takeout is rather limited square order is really difficult to use and there are no options to find this restaurant off of square order therefore ordering takeout is next to impossible
author: Jesse J.

description: I've had both their Greek frozen yogurt and their vegetarian "sandwich", which are great. The sandwich includes sweet potatoes and olives wrapped in a pita. I will try the Greek fries they're known for next for sure.
author: a f.

description: Fresh. Tasty. Healthy. Lamb salad was huge. Juicy potatoes were fine. Great clean decor. A nice add to the street. Only complaint is that you must grab the flatware from a basket on each table that holds them tines-side up. Ensuring that other diners' dirty hands have touched your flatware.
author: Patrick S.

description: Amazing - the salads and wraps are great. Fries are killer and go really well with the garlic yogurt. Great option for delivery as it holds up really well (even the fries). A favorite that I could eat every weekend!
author: Brooke N.

description: Great casual lunch/dinner spot in the hayes valley and i think that was sort of an untapped area in the  'hood. I've been there for lunch and i am sure they have the lamb for dinner as well - it was delish & tender.
author: Beril Y.

description:
I oft rate places on yelp, and I am the biggest critic of people giving bad ratings because of the "service" until today.

Was the food good? Yes.  Could any other Greek restaurant make it? absolutely. Could the staff have been any more rude? Definitely not!

Save your money for another venue with similar food and WAY better service.
author: Rachelle H.

description: I ordered the lamb sandwich and the chicken sandwich. Good thing too because for $13/wrap that is one small wrap. I ate both and was still hungry. Both meats were on the dry side and tasted gamey. Very few of any other ingredients and the pita itself had the most flavor. Do yourself a favor and try a falafel wrap deluxe, with tabouli at places like Truly med. (in the mission). After the first bite there is a rush of flavor and after eating the wrap you will be full.
author: Neil W.

description: Love love love this place. It's healthy. It's fast and it has classic elements of the Greek cuisine. Most authentic Greek restaurants are sit down and pricey. So this is refreshing.  Love the salads just as much as their sandwiches. Their Greek frozen yogurt is delicious too. Happy this place opened
author: Xrysa Z.

description: crumbled baklava topping should be provided everywhere and anytime. loved it with the honey on top of the frozen greek yogurt!
author: Brandon P.

description: One of my favorites on Hayes. The 15 minute online ordering is easy and super efficient. I like the chicken salad and white sweet potato salad. The frozen yogurt with sour cherry is a simple and delicious dessert.
author: Sujata M.

description: Greasy. Extremely greasy. Heatlamp flavor. Both the salad and the sandwich were dripping with grease. The meat was dry and bland (and greasy--how??), the salad had way too much going on and mostly just tasted like salt and lemon juice. The place looks beautiful, but don't get your hopes up about the food.
author: Sam S.

description: I liked all their offerings but the lamb is great! I am not that fond of the space but even the Greek frozen yogurt is tasty.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Highly overrated folks! My lamb sandwich was flavorless and even the hot sauce I doused on it in an attempt to salvage the $12 meal was pathetic. Riddle me this: how can hot sauce taste like water? Also, my bf's chicken sandwich was "bland and unremarkable". One star for environment / music and another for the fries which were actually super yummy.
author: Megan P.

description: simple but darling interior. had the chicken sandwich and the Greek fries, both were delicious. I'd probably ask for extra sauce in the sandwich next time; it was a little dry. Adored how they served their frozen Greek yogurt in paper Greek coffee cups and the food in white and blue enamelware. long line out the door at lunch, but food was derived quickly! friendly staff!
author: L S.

description: I frequented neighborhood Greek delis back in my Boston and New York days, so I'm bummed they're not easy to find in the SF Bay Area. A gyro sandwich or souvlaki is comfort food to me. When I heard about Souvla I said to myself I have to go there. The place is really nice, modern and clean, and the service is great. Except that I wasn't really crazy about the food. Yelpers who give this place 5 Stars owe it to themselves and to Yelp viewers, especially, to go visit a real Greek deli. To be fair, what I found satisfying was the wine list. Love the Greek rose and the white. I'll probably come back to this place if I'm in the neighborhood, nibble on some fries and enjoy some more of their Greek wines.
author: Alex B.

description: The bread is amazing but the chicken and lamb are both very dry. The wrap is also super greasy.
author: Amin S.

description: This is the first time, in my fifteen years of visiting SF that I have gone to a restaurant where the food was not just good but was seriously, out of this world delicious. I swear every time, I have eaten at a restaurant in SF I leave disappointed. The food was so good, that as a joke I said to my husband mid bite, I wanted to come back the following day. The following day, we were out on a excursion and on the way back to our room he says, "so we are having dinner at Souvla right?" Hell yes! The first time, he had the chicken sandwich and I had the roasted vegetable salad and for dessert we had the frozen Greek yogurt and baklava; all absolutely delicious. I tried avgolemono for the first time *sigh* looove!! Oh my, seriously, just thinking about this place makes my mouth happy! Service is fast, and efficient, dining area is clean. Overall, the entire eating experience was fantastic. I would fly into SF just to have some soup and baklava and fly back home. Outstanding!!!
author: S A.

description: Unless you are a cow or a goat, you might have trouble eating as much tough, not finely chopped kale as is in these salads. I like kale, but not like this. Also, the meat seemed greasy, as some others have said. I went with great hope of a wonderful, affordable restaurant in our neighborhood but my experience was less than good. Perhaps they will make some adjustments. I hope so.  It's a nice clean place with excellent intentions.
author: Basya P.

description: I had the free range rotisserie chicken salad to-go.  It was busy and I only had to wait 5 min at most.  Great service and food for a fairly good price - definitely will be back.  A lot of the other customers recommended trying their frozen Greek yogurt as a side for next time.
author: Sean P.

description: I tried their pork sandwich and the Greek fries - both were very good, but it's hard to see where the high prices are coming from. I wish that the pita they used to wrap the sandwiches had a little more flavor and puffiness, but it was altogether pretty good. A sandwich will leave you more or less full, and it's a great cozy spot for a date.
author: Alex V.

description: The pork salad and juicy potatoes were delicious. I will definitely be ordering them again. The Greek yogurt with the Greek sour cherry syrup also hit the spot. I ordered on-line for pick-up. It was easy, and the food was ready on-time.
author: David A.

description: I absolutely loved this place. The food was fresh and flavorful. The atmosphere was friendly and social. This is definitely my new go-to Greek euro/sandwich place in the area. I highly recommend it!
author: Jesse D.

description: Got some take out items here today for lunch.  I ordered the lamb salad, vegetarian salad and the Greek fries.  My co-worker, who wanted the vegetarian salad, let me try a bite of this rather unusual dish with sweet potato as the star.  But it works!  Its sweetness is undercut by the Kalamata olives and their juice, creating a distinctive and complex flavor.  The lamb salad contains big cubes of very tender, moist meat.  The yogurt dressing works very well with the whole ensemble.  The salads are made up of more interesting greens, including kale and pea sprouts, than the tired old packaged-style mixed greens one ordinarily gets in a restaurant.  The fries are very crunchy, very likely twice-fried.  At $10, I think the vegetarian salad is overpriced.  Otherwise, I did like what I had and look forward to coming back!
author: Yvette F.

description: the avgolemono soup was great - the lamb sandwich and salad were both very good as well. next time would love to try the frozen yogurt. the staff was very nice. I just wish the woman at the register was a tad bit friendlier.
author: Greg T.

description: i haven't tried the sandwiches yet (altho they look really good), but the froyo here is amazing.  it's a pretty big portion, and we got it topped w/ baklava and syrup.  it was just the right amount of tang and sweetness.  i want to try it w/ the olive oil and sea salt next time.
author: Helen T.

description:
Tastey chicken gyro with interesting toppings but was dripping with  grease.  Also,  not as filling as I would have liked for the price.  So tried the potatoes too -  I'm not a fan; they were flavorless and soggy. 

Good restaurant set-up,  especially the open air bar.   

I would definitely give it another try.
author: MK D.

description:
I had dinner here last night.  I ordered the vegetable salad with a side of lamb and garlic yoghurt (about $15 inc t&t).  

The food was pretty tasty.  The salad was generously portioned and had a good mix of kale, romaine lettuce, olives, walnuts and greek hard cheese.  The slices of white sweet potato on top were very nice.  I'm not sure whether this is a 'true vegetarian' option because it would not surprise me if the sweet potato was basted in the rotisserie juices to make it so delicious.  

The side of lamb was ok - the flavour was fine but as numerous people have commented, the lamb comes in little bites that are quite chewy. I'd prefer shredded lamb shoulder. 

Overall - a pretty good, healthy-ish option in the Hayes Valley.  I like the choice between a wrap or a salad.  I'll definitely return when in the area.
author: Pig E.

description:
I read about this restaurant in San Francisco Magazine and thought I'd try the lamb souvlaki.

For $13.05 (including sales tax), you get a pita bread filled with cubes of yogurt-drenched lamb, some sliced radishes and cucumbers, pickled onions, and a generous sprinkling of feta cheese.

The pita bread was rather dry and rest of the "sandwich" (the guy who took my order called it a sandwich but it's more like a wrap) just didn't do it for me. A few of the chunks of meat were cartilage. Who wants to eat chunks of cartilage? "Not I," said this eater. Overall the souvlaki was okay, but it was definitely not worth $13. There are more delicious sandwiches in this city and I most likely will not eat here again.
author: Jolie S.

description: I stopped by Souvla this afternoon to grab a bite to eat before attending the Nutcracker SF ballet matinee. My plan was to enjoy a chicken sandwich but instead I tried the breakfast sandwich (scrambled eggs, lamb, feta cheese, and other tasty ingredients). It was delicious so I will definitely return again for the weekend brunch. My taste buds thank you for the expanded menu!
author: L H.

description:
I tried the chicken sandwich which was very tender and so filling, I couldn't make room for the yogurt. So, I'll be back again. 

It's clear that the restaurant uses the freshest, highest quality ingredients. For that and being located in Hayes Valley, I think the price is fair and reasonable. 

As the place gets more popular, the place may not be able to accommodate many more people. So, in the future, it may be easier to do take-out.

I wish Souvla best of luck for a long and prosperous business!
author: M H.

description: This is a nice little place that has good flavors. I had the SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG Sandwich and it was a good Sandwich. You can feel that they have high quality and fresh ingredients. I think it's a bit expensive and could be a bit bigger.
author: Petter B.

description: Very nice ambiance and friendly staff. Chicken was overly dry and hard to eat in the sandwich. Likely will not be returning.
author: jennifer m.

description: Food is delicious. But a gyro and fries costs $20 and there is no dipping sauce for the fries. You can buy a really good garlic yogurt sauce, but that's a dollar extra. Guess rent in Hayes Valley must be expensive. Hope they can find a sustainable solution
author: Charlie P.

description: I loved it! It is in a great location, delicious food and outstanding service. I really enjoyed the food. I had the chicken sandwich which wasn't dry at all because of the meat juice/drippings, potatoes, and fries. The seating outside is also really lovely. Will definitely come here again every time I'm in SF!
author: Lilly M.

description: So impressed.  This place looks simple and the menu is limited but it is perfect.  The food - especially the lamb salad is excellent.  I love this salad and could eat here everyday.   PLEASE OPEN ANOTHER LOCATION IN THE MISSION!!!!   We need you there.
author: JEFF B.

description: We live in the neighborhood and tried this place tonight for the first time.  The salmon kebab was AMAZING.  Even the kids wolfed it down.  The chicken was good too -- flavorful but a bit less tender.  The portions are good, the price is reasonable.  I think they're going to do well.
author: Rob S.

description:
I went to Souvla for the first time yesterday.  There were only four choices on the menu.  Only four.  The lamb salad was pretty good, but I didn't think I would crave it every week.  And with only four  choices on the menu, it didn't inspire me to think "I can't wait to try the chicken next time." And with only four choices, there isn't much variation to try next time anyhow.

 It doesn't seem to have a clear identity:  On the one hand, you look in, and it looks like a nice restaurant.  But then when you go in, it seems like a takeout place with wine and a nicer seating area.  You order at the check stand, and then go to your seat.  There are only a few tables, and the prices are under $15, so I am guessing that they will not be able to make enough money to last long in that high rent district.

Unless they reconsider and get some more choices I think that I will give it a "Meh".
author: Janet C.

description: Holy crap - how did we not discover this place earlier. The sandwiches (particularly the lamb) and the fries are the best. We usually get our sandwiches with extra cheese. The frozen yogurt is also divine. Try honey with sea salt (not on menu).
author: Sandra S.

description: I come to this place only when I need a quick bite, not because how delicious things are here. Recently, it took longer and longer to get your walk-in orders (because it listed itself in so many apps for preorders) , and the waitress has such an attitude! When I asked why I have to wait so long when the store was not full. She was like it's ONLY 10-15 minutes, what's the big deal. She then explained they have many online orders, although the store doesn't look full. Aren't you supposed to fulfill whoever is at door and waiting first? Ppl order online means they're not in a hurry! Besides, they haven't showed up yet! Plus, there are literally 4 things on the menu. How complicated it could be?
author: Dan Dan Y.

description: Very tasty. Portions are good, prices are ok. Tempted to give four stars, but they loose one for the stupid ipad tip gimmick. When I stop by for a $5 froyo, don't put my order up on the ipad screen with big "Add a giant tip" or "Be a penny-pinching %&#$" buttons. I bet it works on a lot of people, but it also makes me hate you.
author: Chris M.

description: Pretty poor. Loooong wait online even @ 2 in PM, since checkin guy wanted to try to score with a couple of girls. Ah, well. The food SEEMS like it should be good, meat roasting and spinning ahead, nice ideas. But, the lamb was uninteresting, overcooked and flavorless. What flavor it might have had was negated by the vinegar in the salad. Perhaps the wraps might have been better, but I wouldn't return. Fresh Choice level. Real disappointment. "Juicy potatoes" underdone and flavorless. Nice Rose, though.
author: bob o.

description: Okay so four stars for the quality of the food as well as the taste but I would say 2-3 stars for the value.  Everything in the bowl was super tasty and innovative but the portion size for the food is not there.  I could have easily eaten two bowls and I can't say I have a massive appetite.  I usually always have leftovers at restaurants but I cleaned out my chicken bowl and found myself longing for more food.  I will say the white wine was really good so I didn't mind the $10.  All in all I would maybe go back if they upped their portions.  Other people in my group got the fries which was somewhere around $4 and the portion size was ridiculously small.  If fries are $4 you're thinking its a heaping bowl for a table to share.  Also everything was so a la carte I felt nickeled and dimed.  Out the door with tax and tip for ordering at the register I spent around $30 for a chicken salad bowl and white wine.  I felt kinda hosed.  It's new though so hopefully this feedback helps.  I am not turned off enough to give it another try.
author: Kirsten M.

description: The food is fantastic. Try the roasted white sweet potato!
author: M L.

description: Nice place with alright food. I took the pork sandwich which was good but very oily. I liked how they roasted the meat in the oven in the restaurant, it was a nice feature. Also I liked the greek theme. The food might hit four stars if they would season it more and the meat needs to be a bit more "burnt" or grilled to taste authentic.
author: Julia S.

description: Awesome find for a lunch stop between meetings.  I had no idea I was walking in to a place less than 3 weeks old.  It felt much more established in Hayes Valley.  Busy, but not mobbed and people besides me seemed to know what they were doing (two ordering stations - one at the rotisserie and a second at the bar).  They have it down pat for being so new.  The chicken salad was absolutely delicious - fresh greens, perfectly cooked chicken, and the right amount of dressing.  It was so good I couldn't leave without also getting the greek yogurt with salt and olive oil.  Awesome.  All around a great restaurant.  I'll be back for dinner for sure.
author: Netsirk P.

description: Delicious chicken pita wrap! Good portions, fresh ingredients, delicious food! Also had the potatoes which were great! Definitely recommend this spot for a casual, quick dinner. The Greek frozen yogurt with baklava was also amazing!
author: Jen S.

description: Having grown up with Greek food back in the Northeast this place is both homey and familiar while also being exciting and new.  All done elegantly and tastefully but without any of what seems like growing self-congratulatory look at me posturing so many new places seem to bathe themselves in, like a pimpled teen with too much Axe Body Spray.  Loved the pork salad.
author: matt l.

description: Solid chicken salad.  Fun atmosphere.  It's both casual and nice.  Perfect for a summer evening.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: This resturant is awesome: tasty food and incredible service. We had 2 spit roasted  lamb salad dinners, lamb is organic, sustainably raised by northern California farmers, no hormones. Salad was crisp with a wonderful dressing including feta chese. Desert of Greek yogurt with bakalava and honey was an awesome bonus. The simple straightforward menu and excellent service made this a perfect evening. We will definitely be regular customers.
author: Kate R.

description: This is one of my new favorite spots in the city. The food is exceptional iv tried there wraps and salads and they are so good. But, what really hits it on the is their roasted greek chicken brined with feta cheese. Yeah, and make sure you satisfy you sweet tooth by trying their Greek yogurt topped with baklava, not only it made it to (the 2015 7x7 big list) , but because its heavenly.
author: Sulaiman B.

description: If you are on a quest to find the holy grail of lamb gyro, the lamb sandwich at Souvla isn't it.  Chunks of lamb were bland--some pieces chewy and some tender.  Restaurant is very nice looking though--makes me feel like one of the beautiful people.
author: benwa h.

description: I really like this place. The is great and this space is really well done. I'm a fan of the lamb both as a sandwich or as a salad. Reasonable prices and great food- I keep going back.
author: Tracy B.

description: Besides being juvenile, abundantly self-pitying, poorly-written and belying the writer's ignorance about how either any business or a restaurant functions, the interaction depicted in the review preceding mine is a malicious distortion of what actually transpired directly in front of me last night. The server was nothing but gracious, and the observably irascible customer's food took possibly 12-minutes to arrive. If that's too long to wait for healthy and delicious food -- if you need to be first in every line, every time -- perhaps choose less popular establishments to eat in.
author: J H.

description: Delicious food and great service. I love the chicken wrap and the chicken/rice soup.
author: Paige B.

description: yummy food, crazy crowded, very fast - bring it across the street to eat at Place Pigalle if no tables!
author: Sonya Z.

description: not a mind blowing Greek food experience , but the place is really clean and pretty , you just expect a little more flavor when you see such nice place , simple menu always a plus and faster for you to choose from .
author: NAEL K.

description: Delicious! Loved the vegie salad, huge and well dressed.  I'm a big fan.
author: Briana B.

description: From the delicious veg bowl, to the greek sparkling water, to the fresh greek frozen yogurt, to the beautiful aesthetics, this place is top notch and well priced. Will definitely be a regular.
author: Annie H.

description: Super happy to have a high quality 'fast casual' restaurant in the neighborhood. Love that I was able to order pick-up using Square Market too. Only bummer is the price... but my guess is that's b/c rent in Hayes isn't cheap.
author: Hanna L.

description: simple menu...great items..brilliant yogurt..minus one star for not having a lot of veggie variety i guess..decently prized..sweet potato wrap was excellent..
author: Sriganesh R.

description: Wanted to love this place. Most gyro spots here for some reason use lavash instead of pita so I decided to give this place a try when I saw that they used pita. $16 later (got extra minted yogurt sauce), I'm not impressed. Super salty and lamb texture was weird. The decor is nice but everything is self-service and doesn't warrant the price tag. Frankly, I prefer the delicious $7 gyro (in pita) from Locali in FiDi.
author: Mika S.

description: I had the lamb and it was delicious! Tender, juicy, and tasty are the three words that come to mind first.  It's a very small shop though so seating can be tricky. Other than that it is extremely quaint and a great option for lunch.
author: Taylor B.

description: Really happy about this quick & delightful lunch or dinner option in the 'hood. Friendly & helpful staff, quality ingredients & we really enjoyed everything we had: not cheap, but definitely worth it. Lamb & chicken gyros very tasty & the veggie daughter enjoyed the sweet potato & kalmata olive sandwich we brought home for her - her carnivore mother may get that one next time; LOVED the decadent roasted potatoes w/drippings; got turned on to some tasty Greek wine; and the coup de gras was the froyo w/baklava. Sat outside on a warm evening & had a great time.
author: Delene W.
